3j1yoNy90B2Y9_UDVc9u0A.text: This restaurant was amazing!! We got the all you can eat for $25.95 and it was way beyond worth it.  the dragon roll was sweet and crispy, and the fish tasted very fresh.  we were so stuffed after eating, and the dessert was really great! I would recommend this restaurant so much!! Sadly, we do not live near here, or I would come very often! The waiters and waitresses were so polite and nice, it made me feel very welcome. The meal left me so delighted. Everything was cooked perfectly.  this is a great restaurant, worthy of five stars.  I am lucky to eat at this restaurant!!

DCeFWisg23oGk2tu3iBfPg.text: Great food selection for sushi lovers and non-sushi lovers alike! Very fast, accurate service even on a busy Saturday night . We had several people doing the all-you-can-eat meals and some just ordering entrees. The entrees were bigger than expected and the food selection from the AYCE menu was huge! I haven't been to any sushi place before that offered so many options with appetizers, skewers, nigiri, rolls, dessert and more in the AYCE menu:) The fish was fresh and the everyone loved the flavor of their dishes! This is the 2nd time I've been here and it hasn't disappointed us yet!

-79lrm8qPE6siWBIWuzJrg.text: Asked several locals where to go for sushi while I was in town visiting. Umiya was most common top option espoused and was mentioned in some capacity by nearly all I inquired of. Ayce is fantastic value. Staff was very well spoken. Loved my dining experience there.

63yCRRgmHScbIZ8egtKTlw.text: This is the best all you eat Sushi in Vegas, good selection, some of the more expense item sweet shrimp (ami ebi) are limited to 2 per customer.  But good fresh sushi.  Can't beat for just $26.95 for all you can eat good sushi

76lfdio8jWdZ5scuFDoN5A.text: First impressions are important. And right as I walked in, the atmosphere was great. Sleek, modern look with a Japanese twist. Now, for the food and menu. AYCE dinner is $27. Couple bucks more than the typical sushi place. But well worth it. Variety and size of the menu is more than enough. There's plenty of fun rolls and also a excellent selection of the more traditional nigiri style. I've been here more than once and each time is does not disappoint. I def recommend this place to everyone. This place has never been a let down.

igqYzTO8qHqGKhZ3KvfRKw.text: 90 minutes AYCE. 5 min from the strip. Good sushi. They do charge for leftovers so just be judicial when ordering.

jDDShlhMXUqMbte8HrsYPg.text: Umiya is fantastic!!! Been here twice in one week for lunch.This has quickly become our new favorite sushi hangout in Las Vegas. We have tried several places, and Umiya is definately a step above the rest. The interior is warm and inviting. You are immediately greeted by the friendly hostess and sushi chef. There is seating either at the sushi bar, or traditional table seating for large groups, there is also tables available for couples. The AYCE option is the best value. Lunch is $22.95. The menu has a wide variety to choose from including lunch specials you can find their menu on usmenuguide.com/umiya-la.... We have had different salads and starters such as Cucumber salad, Poke, Edamame(spicy or garlic spicy), Gyoza, Rib-eye steak, Japanese steak, paired with an excellent steak/teriyaki sauce, Bacon wrapped scallop skewers, marinated pork belly, and New Zealand green mussels. The Nigiri is very good, the fish is super fresh with just the right amount of sushi rice. The Rolls are simply the best I've had, because of how they are made. The rice they use is japanese sushi grade, and the chef uses just the right amount. They are rolled tight and never fall apart in your soy sauce as has been the case at other establishments. The sauces are a whole other story. Simply the best I've ever had. They are flavorful, not drenched just the right amount of sauce to compliments the roll, and use different sauces for each roll, complex in flavor and taste. Just makes you want to try everything on the menu. The food comes out fast and with excellent service. You also have 90 minutes to eat the AYCE. Most AYCE sushi restaurants only allow 45 minutes to an hour for lunchtime. Looking forward to also trying their AYCE dinner menu and sake and saketini cocktails which we haven't gotten around to yet. Do yourself a favor and give this place a try, you'll be glad you did.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Had to order another Salmon lovers it was melt in your mouth goodness!!
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy tataki roll and Salmon lovers
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye steak with sauce

dgw1h2GitXd7twp9a961zA.text: I really dont like trying out new sushi places especially if the group going is in the double digit numbers. For one too many people make a lot of issues with the wait staff as well as the kitchen. Sushi is a made to order type of dining experience and is best with just a handful of people. So far off the top of my head there's one place *cough*GOYEMON*cough that can handle an entire private room full of diners and not miss a single order as well as another *cough*KOMA*cough* where the waitress will go out of her way to remind and boss the sushi chefs to push the orders and correct mistakes.   So this was Chad's UYE and he threw up a whole bunch of recommendations on what we should all try out with the AYCE menu. Sure this sounds great and all but....  Problem is i didnt receive over half of the initial order i put in the beginning, eventually one out of many came but it was so late in the game i didnt really care about it any more. As for the others such as the oysters and the baby octopus...i guess they've gone through the doorway into Narnia out to take the one ring to Mt Doom before the Death Star blows up the planet because they sure as hell weren't anywhere in front of me or anywhere near me...  Service was...typical of any Asian restaurant. For being known as a hard working people, servers are fucking lazy...When we tell you in the beginning we want SEPARATE CHECKS it doesn't mean put everything one bill and let us play the 'oh well on the back of the receipt we put our names and how much we want charged to the card. oh wait we dont know how to divide up the service charge, the tax and everyone's individual drinks...oh my god this is getting complicated'. Server offered to split everything up and brought us back SEPARATE checks with all the tax and mandatory 18% all split up. Wow thanks bro you brought us what we originally asked for after you determined what a pain in the ass it was bringing an undivided check...Stupid of us to ASK for SEPARATE checks in the BEGINNING.   Drinks were okay, I had 3 Sakeinis which our server assured me was on the buy two get one free deal and they were. The best tasting was the Lychee one. Perfectly balanced between booze and Lychee flavor. The Peach and Pineapple were so bland and tasteless i might as well been drinking a bud lite. Not to say that both these drinks tasted like bud lite, i just mean there was no harmony no balance between the natural or artificial flavors of the fruit to match or complement the flavored sake they used.  As far as everything else food-wise i dont know i just dont know at all. Over half the things i ordered never got delivered. Most of dining experience was grabbing bits and pieces from others around me. Noticeably the spicy yellowtail hand roll was absolutely amazing when i first ordered it. They did it Goyemon style where it was chunks of yellowtail with spicy sauce drizzled all over it. It was so good or i havent had one in so long what ever it was pretty damn good so i decided to order another which was on par with the first as well as a spicy tuna hand roll. Wow the tuna was an epic fail in my opinion. Both the yellow tail and tuna were ordered as hand rolls, both were ordered spicy...yet two VERY different things were delivered other than the type of fish. As stated before the yellowtail was cubed and had sauce poured on top. The tuna was...minced into a paste with hot sauce and visible chunks of chilies in the mix. Totally not what i was expecting and was a bit spicier than i was willing to put up with. Good thing LJ was around...Big up to LJ!!  For the most part a lot of the nigiri was decently fresh especially the yellowtail.  Overall...i dont know I wanna give this place another chance by coming back with a considerably smaller group...but...i know other places that do a considerably better job.   Oh and dont get drunk here or try to get drunk here you might die of massive liver failure.   Yelp 100 - 012 of 100 Sorry Chad...

KB9APIvdfjvjFNSlY2IAaA.text: They were absolutely amazing, there service was absolutely awesome. They were so helpful and patient. They made sure you had food in front of you and also made sure your food got to you quickly. The food was absolutely delicious

kVLml47_geZbk-q6MqLCSA.text: Had lunch. All you can eat is only 20.95 and the quality is really good. The salmon is AWESOME here. Their other sushi is good too. Their riceless sushi have a nice refreshing flavor. They have great number of options outside of sushi too! Their appetizers are really good - it's a good place for people who want to have AYCE sushi and have friends who aren't into sushi.

u5r8t1_l42Ynka9ROs3xmg.text: Service is normally great, but it goes down drastically with large groups. Baked rolls where cold, some rolls were sloppy & fell apart, I asked to pay my bill so I could leave & gave server a $100 who didn't return for 25 minute and I had to remind him to get my change.

cU8zpVcBYjAKIJ9DKVArQA.text: Always stop by Umiya every time we're at Las Vegas. A must restaurant to visit when in Vegas. Great place for fresh sushi with great service. Staff are always helpful and smiling. Love the place. Can never get enough of the place.

FW0ebgp8e1r4xDEWA4mpKQ.text: This was formally known as Kan / Kaizen Sushi. It's about $30 for dinner AYCE including tax. The hot tea is $2 each but during their Happy Hour it's buy two drinks get one free, so with four people it came down to $1.25 per. It's located on Flamingo and Arville in the plaza by the Starbucks.   My friends got here before I did, so they got us all a table, while of course waiting for me. It's a real nice place inside, loved the decor, very simple, elegant, and modern. There weren't that many people there when we were there, maybe around 20-ish people there including us. Service started promising, but as soon as the place started to fill up with only two servers, the service just went downhill. I didn't understand why they didn't have more servers on a Saturday evening during a dinner service. I was a little baffled by that.   Not sure if this matters, but this place is run by Koreans as is most sushi places in Vegas it seems. Started with the usual, tuna, salmon, and yellowtail. The quality was mediocre, it wasn't that bad but it wasn't good either, they weren't really fresh in my opinion. The tamago and masago were okay as well, the tamago was definitely better than any of the fish. The Ikura, well didn't really look like regular Ikura to me, it was much smaller than normal, and the color was a bit off to me, which goes back to the question of freshness, it wasn't really fresh, as it tasted different from what I'm used to (and I usually order about 20 pieces of Ikura). What really got me was ordering the sweet shrimp, I nearly gagged on this and really felt nauseous eating it. That's a huge no no for me, they poured Ponzu sauce on it what seemed to me they were trying to mask the age of the fish, it was NOT fresh at all. One friend ordered Uni and well the presentation of it was bad, it looked horrible to say the least, and he was very skeptical of tasting it after my reaction with the sweet shrimp.   My friend got the rib eye and pork belly. They weren't bad according to him and for the pork belly though, it was dripping in oil. Like the plate was saturated with it. Looked good at least, but I wouldn't touch it without at least dabbing it down with a napkin. We also got a first kiss roll since it sounded it, it wasn't too bad, but I'm not usually a fan of rolls in general.  At the end we ordered dessert, two tempura ice cream and two ice cream, one order per person, and waited close to 15 minutes for it, before we cancelled and just left. I don't know what was going on in the kitchen, but it seemed under staffed all around for a Saturday evening.   The only real good thing I would say on the menu is everything else but the nigiri. They have an extensive AYCE menu, but it'll be a very long time before I come back here, if ever. It's worth a try, and I hope the experience of others are better than mine, but I do have high standards for sushi restaurant in general. It's worth a try if you cannot tell the difference in quality or freshness of fish as some of my friends cannot, but if you get easy queasy from bad fish, I would avoid it at least for now.

lTcYIgUBAPLa2yDz_4f-0A.text: Quick seating and amazing AYCA.  The waiter was responsive with our needs.  The serving sizes were full and well money spent.

bygX90ApcV5F1tkrlOFakg.text: Umiya has a great atmosphere and has the freshest fish in town! Chef Alex picks out the fish everyday himself to ensure the finest quality!  Chef ALEX is the very best!!!!  He creates new sushi rolls all the time and keeps things healthy and fun!!!  I have followed ALEX to every Sushi restaurant, and now since he is owner of Umiya it is my very favorite!!!  It is a place you can trust and will completely enjoy!!!!  lots of love to chef Alex, chef Erik and the gang!!!

d2GwxGNaR-O1YNmJKuWqQQ.text: Just came from here and the customer service earns it 4 stars from me.  Alex, the sushi, chef was very nice and engaging.  He asked me my name and where I was from and honestly made it seem like he would like my repeat business.  I felt very welcome and he seemed genuine. When I come back to town this will be the first AYCE sushi place that I will hit.  The waiter and waitresses were nice, some of the kitchen items came out slow, but I was kept entertained.  Alex explained to me and another customer some of the ins and outs of fish mongering.  He also fixed us two special nagiris. I am now a fan of the Ono!  If you read this, thank you Alex and staff for a wonderful meal experience.

jvqmU46YzGfToRq9PSBHVg.text: I love this place! All of the staff are walking around and attending to everyone so you don't have to wait for your server to come around if you need anything, you could ask anyone.  We opted for the AYCE dinner which has a good sized menu to choose from (4 pages) plus dessert, came out to $60 for two people. Great price for great quality food.  I rarely ever eat raw food besides tuna, and even then I can't stomach too much of it. However, this place changed my mind. I started with their spicy tuna salad (delicious!) and got hooked. Pretty much everything I ordered after that had spicy tuna in it!  We also ordered crunchy lobster roll, oysters, tuna naruto, red mountain, baby octopus, shrimp tempura, crispy rice with spicy tuna, and king of the ocean. Everything tasted great, no complaints from me or my boyfriend, we loved everything.  TIP: most rolls can be ordered half sized so that you don't get full from one roll and you can try a variety of menu items. (5 or 6 piece rolls and the whole deep fried rolls can't be half sized)  Overall, great experience and will definitely return when I'm in town! If only they would open a location closer to home (;

wmAzc8c1_9UPb23qrvuPjA.text: I was staying at Gold Coast and was craving AYCE sushi.  Goyemon always has a bit of a line, and my old locals spot Naka was too far a drive.  Yelp rated Umiya well so I thought I'd give it a shot.  The layout of this place is amazing, and it should fit a lot of people even if it gets popular.  Here's hoping this place picks up, because it was dead when I went.  No complaints about the AYCE really, other than the limitations on quantity of certain items.  They even had similar unique appetizers to Goyemon, including crispy rice spicy tuna and pork belly.  My friend was a non-sushi eater and seemed pleased with the steak options on the AYCE menu, so that's also a major plus.  Oh, and this is probably the closest AYCE to the strip, which can be a HUGE plus.  I'll be back.

yRbo-ax_Ww7m7PHu53340Q.text: This is a very good Japanese all you can eat sushi ....you order off the menu and certain items are limited to one per person.  It's good because they are open late.  I have gone here several times in the quality and service is always good.

oWjClxkUOk_HKYtw-a3kag.text: This location used to be Kaizen and they changed ownership some while ago.  I'll come her for late night sushi and do a la carte sometimes instead of the ayce.  The ayce is standard like most other places in Las Vegas and reasonably priced.  Pretty good selection of appetizers, rolls and nigiri for the ayce will make sure you get full.  Must haves include the salmon belly, Yuzu yellowtail and whatever specials they have for the day which is written on the wall board.  The restaurant is quite spacious and the picnic bench style tables are great for groups.  Usually I'll sit at the bar or one of the tables that are more private.  Ambience is very casual and energetic with music videos playing on a projector screen centered in the restaurant.  TVs located behind the sushi bar usually show sports center which is great to eat sushi and watch sports to me.

X6pyzJTSgAKFZkWLS0PoTQ.text: I've been craving AYCE sushi for a while now and decided to try this place out after work because it was open late night and had high reviews on Yelp.  I'm surprised that this sushi restaurant has such high reviews because compared to other AYCE sushi restaurants like Sakana and Yama Sushi, this is by far the worst AYCE sushi restaurant I've been to in the Las Vegas area.  First off, the server was extremely rude and rushed us to order right after we sat down and my boyfriend and I didn't even have time to look at the menu. After ordering once, we had to wave for a server to take our orders even though there were only four other parties in the restaurant at the time.  As for the sushi, the sushi rice was soggy and too wet. It wasn't even the sauce that made it soggy, the rice was probably just cooked with too much water. The salmon nigiri tasted chewy and did not taste fresh at as if it's been frozen for a long time.  We could tell that the restaurant was very unorganized because we kept receiving appetizers after we received our sushi rolls, which was really weird.  The only great thing about this restaurant is the amount of items in the menu, there's a lot to choose from ranging from appetizers, soups, salads, poke, and sushi rolls, however everything that my boyfriend and I ordered did not taste as good as we were expecting. I believe it was the bad sushi rice that ruined the sushi rolls for us.

8Mg0kvodXwm-0Z3lmgqBQA.text: You must eat here! All you can eat sushi... So impressed with this place.. And I'm part Asian so that's gotta have some weight, right!?

FbyLr86q70h0gxlhpe-gkw.text: I loooooove this place. Best rolls, fresh fish, good service. It's definitely a hidden gem. Love love love it. I tell everyone about this place.

T0z82gdyGvQRlmHKZLzJ0g.text: Came here on a Friday night and there was no wait which was great! The service is one of the best i've ever had throughout my meal.  I'm not sure if this is just a Socal thing which is where I am from, but usually for AYCE sushi they limit you to the number of rounds you can order sushi but at this restaurant there were no limits for number of rounds which was great because it took off the pressure for what to order.  There was a variety of things to chose from other than sushi like tempura, udon, chicken, etc.  All the food tasted very fresh and I like that it comes in small portions as well.  You can also order the rolls in half rolls if you want to be able to try more rolls without getting full as quickly.  Would definitively recommend to anyone looking to satisfy their sushi craving and its nice that it's so close to the strip!

2QtBU7ELz5ow9ymn9yWe0Q.text: This. Place. ROCKS!   The little known secret about AYCE sushi joints in Vegas is that most of them have marginal sushi. Maybe that's why they don't care how much you eat because they aren't spending for the best quality or hiring great sushi chefs. So I was a little skeptical when I left the gym and decided that if there was ever a time to give it a shot it was when I was carb depleted and starving. :)   One fantastic thing about Umiya is that they let you order half rolls which gives you a chance to try a lot of different options. Let's just say that I took full advantage of this option! The big winners for me were AJ Tuna (unreal!), Orange Blossom (love the sauce), Yum Yum Crab Roll (perfectly named), Spicy Tataki Roll, Vegas Lasagna and Crunch Lobster Roll.   Another thing that led to the 5 Stars was the service. Friendly, prompt and they kept the food coming without much of a wait at all. Some AYCE waiters/waitresses act like you are stealing food from their children's mouths every time you order another item (OK, maybe only like they have to pay for it personally but you get the point). Not this place. They would have just kept it coming but everyone has their limit and I tapped out full, satisfied and happy that I found this place. And all for $26! Cannot beat that price for the quality of this food, volume of choices and awesome service. Bring your appetite but leave your AMEX Black Card at home!

On75aJ6thws-wvd0T0mfhw.text: Decor and service was good but the sushi didn't blow me away. Rice was a bit too hard and cold. Bummer. Also super tiny rolls and nigiri.  Also another bummer was that a lot of the good pieces on the menu were only one per person on the all you can eat... Kind of defeats the purpose.  DONT USE THE SAUCE THAT COMES WITH THE STEAK! Very ill tasting... Up to you if you want to try it but man... That did not sit well in my mouth.

Xx2gFsydpeLDHJux0_O5fA.text: THIS IS MY FAVORITE SUSHI PLACE IN LAS VEGAS. I've tried almost all of the AYCE sushi places in Vegas and NOTHING beats this place. I don't even have anything else to say except for the fact that I am left speechless (and pregnant with a food baby) after every meal here.

IPTOsTFDH5kk3J2Cg7qqdg.text: Really quick service. Food variety is decent and flavor is good. My favorite are unagi nigiri, baked mussels and rib eye steak. Also, it's the cheapest sushi buffet ever!

h-Qe0K7XTq3FHCy_nhT_zQ.text: Just went here for lunch and it was amazing! Good prices, sushi was delicious, and they had mochi dessert!

qnOwbKcdOky4ZNoyyCrE3g.text: My favorite sushi place here in las vegas!!' they have the best sushi in town! You all should try it!!

_Xpv_-IUqssAvhck-kcxjA.text: This is probably one of my favorite AYCE spots in Vegas and I have tried almost all there is to offer. It's open til late, they have half-orders (which I think is AWESOME) amazing service and great music. The place being as popular and busy as it is, it surprises me every time that our food always gets to us so efficiently. I'm talking about ALL of your food on your table in less than 10 mins after you order kind of efficient. Empty plates are always cleared away, drinks refilled without you even knowing. This is what you call attentiveness! I don't know how they do it!! Sushi Chef Lee was amazing! Thank you Umiya for bringing great sushi to Vegas!

GRkTPhNQzF-oBHyh47ch0Q.text: Such a weird dining experience. Within two minutes of being seated, my boyfriend went to the bathroom and the waitress came over to ask if I was ready to order. I told her I was not and my boyfriend was in the bathroom so she went away and came back another 2 times in the next 2 minutes while I was still sitting by myself. The second my boyfriend came back, before he even cracked the menu, there they were again! Seriously we felt like they were trying to rush us right out.  Once we ordered, they brought the rolls before the edamame so we told them to skip it since we were already half way done with our sushi anyways and they seemed to not understand why we wouldn't want to eat an appetizer after the main course. The sushi was ok but the pieces of cucumber in the rolls were big chunks, which is weird to me.  The icing on the cake is when they gave us the check and told us to "take our time." Really? After all that?

dtMBJoYQUgHrhySoHn0G5A.text: Yes!! AYCE!!!   After a weekend of destroying my body, I usually crave for something healthy and fresh! After a few orders of nigiri, we dive in for the fried stuff. Anything soft shell crab is delicious! There are so many rolls to choose from but if you want variety, ORDER HALF ORDERS!!! HALF ORDERS!!!!! We were pretty much able to try everything on the menu! Most of the rolls can be half orders which come out with 4 cuts instead of 8!   Save room for dessert! I was too full to try the tempura ice cream:( NEXT TIME! Definitely will be a next time.

ImrGhkoEpYGYUPcppd1wtg.text: One of the best sushi restaurants in Las Vegas! The service is impeccable, our server was super friendly and quick. We ordered the "French kiss" roll, it was so good that we ordered it again! We also ordered "no money honey" which also tasty. I will definitely recommend this place to everyone! This is for sure my favorite sushi restaurant in LV.

Iuq0AdF8-dO-xAbqRUutcQ.text: Love this place!! I don't typically enjoy eating at all you can eat sushi spots because of the quality of sushi they serve, but this place is the max! The quality is amazing, the flavors are on point, service is speedy, ambiance is trendy, and the price is perfect. I highly recommend.

LoQUh0RDbN3lK4xuEAztFQ.text: What a place great service. Nice people awesome food. All you can eat was fantastic. Jenny was awesome.

rQTARbKfpwDGKnCRbvtEtw.text: Umiya has set the bar on ayce for us in sushi. THIS IS THE BEST AYCE SUSHI OFF THE STRIP. We come here every time we want to dine out for sushi. Get the salmon and monkey brain right away. Their nigiri is a good cut and their poke is one of the best in town.

BKqZB4oAvZj2Sl2Qpt_n0Q.text: If your looking for a great all you can eat sushi restaurant. Then look no further! This place is hands down my favorite. They're really fast with their survive and has great customer service. Food is delicious!!! Enjoy!

oOOudb3FA911B9lsHtt7bQ.text: Fresh sushi.   Can I say more.   You will get your money's worth for $27 with the All You Can Eat.    It is an extensive menu.  We were more than pleased with the quality of the fish for their Nigiri.  Their hot items were as equally delicious.  Tasty secret sauces made certain sushi and hot dishes even more appealing to the palette.    Arrived early for dinner on Valentine's Day so it was still rather quiet.  Servers were pleasant and attentive.  Sushi owner and chefs were a ham.

atHGpBa7WfHzg813um2hXQ.text: This is a wonderful establishment for a Japanese AYCE restaurant.  The staff here were not only quick with all the orders but they were also very warm and welcoming. This is my first review of a restaurant. I felt that it needed to be recognized for the great service.   The food is made freshly  as you order. I normally do not like eating at an AYCE restaurant but I was in Vegas so we had to check one out. I was curious but reluctant at first however I was pleasantly surprised when the first orders of food came out.  If you're in town and have a big appetite for good Japanese food then drop on by whether it is in the middle of the day or late into the night. Highly recommend it!

y419huxg1TCT4qmo-L1y2g.text: My favorite Japanese All You Can Eat sushi.   Great service.  Portion is great.  Nice selection of limited items like sweet shrimp, urchin.

0g8nTLf2OVvt8CsbZJLD5Q.text: Amazing food! Usual sushi places quality finished as time passes, but this place is doing good and maintaining their high quality food! Love them! Must try!

LJkoA-XicSoCFnua6SVScg.text: Food was like every other sushi spot nothing special. The reason why I gave it a one star is because the service was extremely bad. We literally had to wait 40min to put in a order. Waiters passed us by multiple times. Customer service hands down one of the worst I've ever had. I actually liked this spot until today.

GtUXDI9wqvMuZmInjUc5cA.text: Great atmosphere and energy. Food is just fantastic. There seriously wasnt a single thing which I didn't think was above par. Even the draft Ashai was perfectly chilled. Will come here everything in town.

IvQFTr032nWOqK0q9_CeqA.text: Was in town for the weekend and took my friends here. I was raving about place to my friends and was disappointed with portion and quality today. Very sad.

3Jh_Y-Aez2m7uPZvH33lMQ.text: Went to have lunch here with a friend and it was my first time doing ayce don't know what she ordered but it was all good

HiLnGhsveDs8yhOp4IN3Cw.text: My boyfriend and I always come here for sushi. It is hands down the best sushi place in all of Vegas.  The AYCE is a must, and for under $30, it is a steal. Everything is so good, but my favorite rolls are the ORANGE BLOSSOM, RED ROCK, and SNOW WHITE. You MUST try these.  Alex (the owner) came up with all of the sauces for the rolls by himself so the sushi is different than all other places. Umiya serves such high quality fresh fish. Just try the sashimi salads and seared ahi tuna with AJ sauce to see what I mean.   We went last night for a birthday, and Alex and his crew made it an amazing night. They went out of their way to make a special roll and carved fruit sculptures for the birthday boy.  Not only is the food beyond delicious, the people are just so genuine. They make you feel like family right when you walk in. Give it a shot and I guarantee it'll be your new sushi spot.

zFKA1cNx_3qLbSyPwv7XyQ.text: Wow, this place was amazing.  The servers were super nice, and they check on you every minute or so, so no wait time on service.  The appetizers, sushi, and dessert were delicious.  This was one of the highlights of our Vegas trip.  Can't recommend highly enough.

kWHp572LnxjEBDGyR7MhHg.text: Hidden gem!! Will definitely be back. Service was great and the all you can eat was off the charts.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy rice and tuna
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ah yes, the Oysters are GONE! Yummy!

F9Sh35CMOLZhmaWaSJ3g-w.text: This place has become my favorite sushi spot in Las Vegas. It is close to the palms and the rio. The seared tuna sashimi in AJ sauce is a must have. The staff is friendly and always make good recommendations based on what you like. Its a good place to grab a few drinks and have some awesome  sushi.

xtjznbEeZVQf3TqZ6tn2QA.text: Food was ok but service was horrible we waited 40 minutes to get a sushi roll. We also ordered a scallop hand roll and it was mostly rice, imitation crab and 2 or 3 scallops

GykTb-NNdvnVhscKOtFxWA.text: Best sushi I've had in a long while. Rule of thumb usually is that sushi from a land locked state is a no go, but this place beats most sushi places I've been to in Cali. Maybe I was lucky and I had a fresh batch but this place deserves the full 5 stars. My advice, the items listed on the menu for only one order for AYCE is there for a reason so try it out. Seared tuna with AJ sauce and the yuzu hamachi were the favorites

6azLUNVHzMcq5rHxfPfoUA.text: I only have two complaints - we came in about 8pm and it was busy but not slammed, about 50%.  It took them 8 minutes to even acknowledge us.  They might have been understaffed.  Also, the Ice Cream was hard as a rock.  With that out of the way, the servers were friendly and the SUSHI was FREAKING INCREDIBLE.  Go for the all you can eat.  Everything was top notch and came out fast.  I WILL BE BACK!!  Thanks team Umiya!  Fyi the referral came from a cashier at Frys.

nN_OdejT0RL_CJQB5OjWLQ.text: My fiance and I happened to stop by this place near by Palms Casino. We did not think much about it and just wanted a quick sushi meal. The price was pretty decent (around $8-$15 per dish) but we had to go for an all you can eat deal since it would be a better deal for us and it sure was! The server was very friendly and provided us with a great service with a big smile on his face. He recommended us with all these great dishes that were on the menu. The food were incredibly awesome!! The chef is a truly master chef! Every dish that came out was a piece of art! He greatly dedicated his time and his master sushi chef skills in making our food looks to pretty and artsy. We were blown away by his creativity and his fast cooking skills.  Conclusion: At the end I would definitely recommend all my friends and family to try out this new all you can eat sushi restaurant. It is a great bang for the buck$$!  All you can deal  $25-29.99 (forgot the price) but it is for sure under $30 add $10 more for all you can drink (sake, beers)

-ttIp9TPIyPnjahqjr25Ng.text: For regular sushi standards, the fish is not the freshest you'll ever have. But for ayce purposes, it gets the job done. This place gets PACKED during peak dinner times so I would call to make a reservation if you can. The good thing is that this place is open till 2 am every night so if you want, you can come after dinner time to avoid the crowds.   We had a big group so it took us a while to get seated. But once we got seated, our orders came out really quickly. We pretty much ordered everything on the menu and they all tasted pretty average except for the salmon skin. The salmon skin was burnt and we had to send it back. Avoid that if you can! Other than that, the fish to rice ratio was pretty good. It's nice when the piece of sushi hides the rice underneath it. There's a limit on the more expensive items such as sweet shrimp and uni (typical for ayce sushi spots).  Umiya is serviceable for ayce sushi but there are definitely better options out there.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ayce sushi

4An-3Arg-RNpvAXqNk40-g.text: Great all you can eat place! Even better is that the ice cream (except the mochi limit is one) is all you can eat too! Pretty good service and the food comes out fairly quickly. Just be careful with children because they have music videos playing and a few contained dancing that was... not exactly child friendly but decent enough that it's technically okay?

GH94ZI0VXQNCzc9QCAsO8g.text: Overall it's not a bad place for sushi. Food quality was decent. Food came out looking well and pretty promptly. But overall I don't think I'd ever go back. Yes I did give this place three stars. Only on food quality and variety but the biggest issue here is service. Service is not something I overlook regardless of the food. Seating is a nightmare. Empty tables covered in food remained for almost twenty minutes. Waitresses are overworked and do not come around often enough. Drinks stayed empty while we were forced to order large quantities to avoid a long wait. The kicker was we waited over an hour to be seated. While on large table parties of two were seated. While we watched smaller two people tables remain empty. So yeah foods fine but on a weekday the wait is not worth what you get.

MRvXEeHbWWke2qRZePolQA.text: try the AYCE dinner the array of selection is just amazing  I visited this place with 2.5.7 yrs old kids on my holiday to Vegas . Even though the kids didn't eat raw fish they had plenty of food to enjoy such as grilled squid , fish and chix cutlet ,marinated beef and the list goes on. staff are very prompt .empty plates are gone and your drinks are filled before you know it. Especially the waitress who took care of our table - In-Sun  was a Star.  We loved all the dishes she recommended and she  knew excatly what we need for kids . really enjoyed the night and the food .

ySLVoxb347z0ddFEQn08Cw.text: *YELP CHECK IN FOR A FREE SODA (I got a hot tea instead)  Excellent dinner.   Secret is...come at 4pm, because at 4:05pm (okay, after 5pm) it starts to get crowded pretty quickly. And when that happens, you don't get your food as fast since they have to serve everyone else.   80% of the menu is good! Did not like the ribeye (one per person) since it was overcooked and tough. My girl loved the pork belly (sizzling oh yeahh) and thankfully it was nicely thin.   The ceviche was refreshing, the uni NOT good (not sweet/fresh), all the rolls great but beware,  they are filling and you will have leftovers that you must force down. The oysters were also a bit meh.   A must get also is the soft shell crab! we got more than we should have.   Great place to dine with a large party (just make a reservation early which they will call to confirm again).

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood dynamite (appetizers) takes a while but it&#39;s delicious!
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xyHPuRuP4sJs-WNLqo-2Fw.text: I initially blew off Umiya due to the location. It's so close to the Strip, I figured half the high ratings were due to tourists from landlocked midwestern cities trying AYCE sushi for the first time without any frame of reference. A friend pulled me aside and told me to check myself, and insisted I go try it ASAP.  And the reviews are right, this place is awesome. I'm happy to eat my words, along with a large assortment of apps, small plates, grilled items, skewers, nigiri, rolls, and desserts. The menu has nearly anything you could ask for, and everything was done well from the baby octopus skewers to the macaron desserts and all the sushi rolls in between. The rolls, and particularly the sauces, are where they stand above the crowd of other options in Vegas- try anything with the unique tangy sauce. Favorite rolls include the King of the Ocean and the Orange Blossom.  The tasty food comes with funky izakaya style decor and incredibly attentive service: they use a team approach, so anyone nearby will ask if you want to add any orders. Dishes were whisked away within seconds of the food atop them being consumed, drinks never got less than a two thirds full, sushi came out within a couple of minutes of being ordered, and everyone had a great attitude and a smile.   In a city with so many sushi options that come and go or vary based on who is working behind the counter, Umiya is my new go-to. Whether you are going with traditionalists who order nigiri exclusively or those who love rolls or even one of those weirdos who don't like sushi at all, this spot will satisfy them all.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baby octopus skewer
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amebi includes fried heads
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy rice spicy tuna

46hA1UCK1ONikedDXnT96w.text: Been here couple of times before. It's definitely not what it used to be.  The good: For AYCE, the selection is decent. They fill your water without you having to flag someone down.  The bad: Fish to rice ratio; thin and narrow slices of fish on large pieces of rice. Some of my order not to show up. Received random food that I did not order. Service slowed down by 3rd round. Uni was brown and not fresh. Ordered ice cream for dessert and it came out rock hard.  Will not be back. It's obvious they want you to fill up on rice.

Qa3WAKQrvVk9-Z7ExWKnGQ.text: Good and will definitely be back! This is a native hot spot, GO HUNGRY for ALL U CAN EAT SUSHI   The restaurant is busy, wait time around 7pm was about 40-45 minutes. They move tables pretty quickly and staff is on point with service. The food, ok. They fill you up with rice  and imitation  crabmeat. Overall, great value for the price. Will be back. Ask for easy on rice and crabmeat.

jaqf09xb1AU69V9ZhIlGZw.text: The combination of quality and value offered here is  absolutely ridiculous.  The all-you-can-eat special ($25.99 at dinner) offers an extensive selection of everything from appetizers, soups, and salads to noodles, entrees, and *dozens* of different sushi rolls.   A few of the selections may only be ordered once.  However, most sushi rolls can be ordered as a half portion, (4 pieces) if you're looking to try as many as possible.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunch Lobster Roll (half)
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Tataki Roll (half)
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Poke

2AmAP1Lib72MD41dTR6vAg.text: I used to love this place until I had an issue with the hostess who made me wait 20 min to sit me next the the door which was freezing . And I had already told her I did not want to sit near the door . Then to my dismay after then receiving a terrible attitude from my server whom I say her gossiping with I found a giant hair in my miso soup I'd already been eating ! This was so intentional and absolutely disgusting ! No place is worth finding dirty hair in my food !

QAB2_TdH5ndLlT1tH1pwPQ.text: Let me just start off by saying: I got food poisoning here.  I came on Tuesday afternoon right at opening for their all you can eat lunch special. I ordered a bunch of different Nigiri, two raw oysters, soft shell crab, a baked avocado mayo dish and miso soup. The nigiri fish cuts were wimpy and there was way too much rice. But overall the food tasted decently good and the service was great.   But unfortunately...About 24 hours later I started feeling super nauseous and threw up throughout the afternoon and evening. I could barely sleep that night.   You've been warned.

pPT6aiihDMqepCF9ZKvI6A.text: Incredible service and great food! We had our wedding reception with 55 people on a Saturday afternoon. They were well prepared and food was amazing. We had a few people that had never had sushi before and now they are converts.  Service, speed, friendliness..... it was an impressive show of great training and desire to serve the customer.   The great service was not exclusive to the reception, we had dinner there twice prior as a way to "interview" them. Every time was the same with the same fast, great service.   Thank you for a job well done.

NZ9U3Tir04J7EouE1SJeJQ.text: This place is more like 4.5 stars, which is well worth a visit every time I crave sushi when I'm in Vegas!  Came here last week with a bachelorette party of 8. They seated half of the party that showed up first so I guess you don't need everyone to be there to get seated (and I think we had reservations). 3 out of 8 girls did not get the AYCE (1.5hr time limit) and those girls regretted big time! I was definitely NOT one of the 3 girls. It was an easy pick to do AYCE sushi for the price (about $30/person including a drink, tax, and tip) which was a good deal to me!   What's better is the selection of food. You honestly want to eat so much from their menu, but you can't because your belly won't be able to take it. Choose wisely also because they supposedly charge you for any leftover food. In terms of taste, everything was tasty. I don't think I was disappointed with any of the items and when sharing with 4 other girls I honestly got to try so many food choices! After paying I totally remember that desserts come with AYCE, but the girls and I were ready to leave so we asked for our green tea ice cream in cups and the staff absolutely accommodated us and even gave us big scoops of ice cream! Yay!   The only reason this establishment did not get a perfect rating from me was because after we got our drinks, our initial waitress never came back to us. It took 10-15 minutes to actually flag down another waitress just to start our first order of AYCE. The second waitress was helpful though. Overall, great choice for AYCE sushi! Will be back when I visit sin city again which I hope will be soon! =D

53YWaybu9Xc2uJLouDp6zA.text: AYCE sushi places have four criteria that I judge them on: their appetizers, their nigiri, their rolls, and how good their servers are. I don't have a favorite place, but I do have places I like to go depending on what I'm craving. This is definitely an appetizer place for me. That means their rolls and nigiri were just like everyone else, but they had a lot of unique appetizers that I liked that they carried or that I RE-ordered. I have to say that their uni was an honorable mention though.  So Umiya is right off the strip and just south of China Town so it's a pretty popular place. They have bar seating, some booths, and communal looking seats in the middle.   Most sushi places like this are gunna be very similar so I won't go into much detail. Price was just like everywhere else give or take a buck.   My main draw here was I loved how fast service was here. There are multiple servers bringing by orders and taking away plates. I eat a lot and my bar area never seemed too crowded because the servers were around constantly. Also many AYCE sushi places seem to come around less after an order or two, but they were constantly asking if we wanted to order more.  The space was nice, everything we ordered was good, and the staff was nice. Couldn't complain one bit.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poke
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of the nigiri: eel, uni, garlic tuna, salmon, sweet shrimp
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters

tLgVAXKnkr724OSQb5tLlA.text: This was the first time I walked into a sushi spot where we didn't get no "irrashaimase", sushi chefs all looking down, host's back facing us. When he did turn around it was to ask how many in our party. I normally don't prefer taking the whole crew out for an AYCE sushi, but on this night we did. It wasn't as busy when we entered in comparison to when we left. We were able to get seated pretty quick. The tables are more of picnic style seating where their tables are connected so be prepared to share another end with another couple/family.  Since the whole crew was present, that meant a highchair was needed. I quickly made a mental note to never bring the babies with me when coming here because the highchair is seated at the end of the table where they have this button system...which of course any curious toddler/baby turn into gumby just to press those buttons. Which....gets pretty annoying because the button isn't something you can move off. Therefore, you have to scootch the highchair more towards the corner of the table giving your kid an awkward seating and the potential to slam his/her face on that corner because he/she is throwing a fit over not being able to reach the button. Sigh.  Anyway, they have quite a selection for their AYCE. I found Umiya to be pretty good. I loved how their rolls/nigiris weren't rice/sauce overloaded. No fishy flavors which is a great thing! I personally ordered/tried their garlic tuna nigiri, crispy rice with spicy tuna, salmon lovers roll, vegetable tempura (a brocolli, zucchini, carrot), spicy garlic edamame (which wasn't spicy at all), spicy tuna toll, and their ribeye steak (which is like 4slices of steak served alone). The only thing I didn't really care for was their garlic edamame. I love edamame, didn't love it here.   The husband had uni, ebi, fried shrimp heads, salmon belly, yuzu yellowtail, unagi, tuna, salmon, and aji. Don't even get me started on the quantities. Lol. He thought they were all pretty good. Typical.  Anyway, they clearly have a system. Water was quickly refilled, plates were quickly cleaned off, service wasn't neglectful at all...out of all the sushi spots we have ever been to...I swear it felt like 5mins after we ordered...we were getting our orders. I connected my eyebrows a few times upon getting our orders because the turn around was ridiculously quick! At this point...it was busy so getting our orders quick and it being busy...that was quite impressive. I looked back at the chefs a couple times convinced there was an octopus working.   Even though we didn't get the greeting upon entering, my husband never getting his masago and me having to remind the waitress of an order and reminding one of the wait helps of the fork he was supposed to bring...we gave it a 4 because despite it all...thought our experience was pretty deserving of a 4.   We'd come here again but I don't think this place is as kid-friendly especially if you have one needing to be in a high chair and that damn button system thing. Okay, so the button is to call your waiter over, red button is for your check, and I completely forgot what the other colored button was for but I believe it's for drinks.   Definitely worth a try if you are looking to try a new spot. I'd say slip bringing the kids in so you can thoroughly bask in the ambiance and enjoy. But if you do bring the kids...highchairs have working buckles! For AYCE...kids ages 3-7 are 12.95 (half-off). Children 8 and up are full price. For desserts...their ice cream are unlimited except for the mochi. 1 each per person.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried shrimp heads.
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail, aji (basically a mackerel), salmon belly, and garlic tuna nigiri
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special

iO7N6Kpnhk1cvfVwPUpUZA.text: I'm a big fan of sushi and I'm always looking for the best spot with great food and a great atmosphere. I'm surprised I waiting this long to review because Umiya has been my favorite place for at least 5 years. I love the music videos they play and their all you can eat lunch and dinner. They also make a few excellent rolls like the Baked Salmon Roll. Mmmmmmm!

vCN17n4T4LwXcqJ9p_1-_Q.text: We will definitely be going back to Umiya for more sushi! There was a lot to choose from,most everything we ordered was really good, i wasn't a fan of the octopus (but that's just not my thing, atleast i tried it), the staff were friendly and it was clean.Overall a great sushi spot!

PLgzEcybpBl8pXBb__eEpg.text: Fresh food. Great service. We came at 10:30pm. There was no crowd. It started filling up by 11pm. The service is great. Will definitely visit again next time.

2rZf8HjYIw9p6xr1uOEiHg.text: All you can eat $26. Came in at 8 on Monday night. Waited 15 minutes and was seated at a nice table to ourselves. There are big tables where they seat 2 parties of 2 people and separate ends though. So call ahead if you do not want this to happen. Seared tuna sashimi is a must. Oysters, baby octopus skewer and crispy rice were okay. Salmon belly sashimi is great. Uni wasn't my favorite. We got half orders on all our rolls, which is an awesome option! King of the ocean and kiss of fire were my partners favorite. I liked the salsa dancing and salmon lover rolls. Dessert was tempura green tea ice cream and coffee/red bean  mochi, delicious!   Overall it was a decent dinner. For the price and the quality of the food I liked it and would recommend to people that are staying at Rio, Palms or if you are looking for sushi off the strip to avoid strip prices.

UNVmHrVJ1H1ujlRInsInXQ.text: This is definitely my favorite AYCE sushi spot. If it were a little closer to home I would be here more often! The garlic tuna nigiri is delicious the fish to rice ratio is perfect. If there's anything you should take from this review, get the yum yum crab roll! We could order four of these in one sitting.

IDo9kysY23WczG5j_K66kw.text: Not bad for $28/person with tax and tip included. We came here right before leaving Vegas for lunch. You cannot order just sashimi though. Just order several orders of the Poke and you can skip the rice! Food came fast and service was good!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JjB_2WEWsXxiKl7cBmHaMA.text: I went here with some friends for dinner since we were craving for some sushi and thought this would be a good place for that. Out of the few times I have been here for dinner, there has always been a wait so I guess that just shows how popular the place is.   We ordered a bunch of items, but I would recommend getting the Yuzu Hamachi and the garlic tuna nigiri! Both are really flavorful and delicious. I ended up eating like 4 pieces of each lol! In terms of rolls I would recommend trying the orange blossom roll (it is my favorite at the moment). I really like the citrusy taste along with the crunch from the tempura. I also got to try the ribeye appetizer along with the soft shell crab. My friend got ramen (IDK why he did that), but it tasted okay. I'm pretty sure the vast selection of appetizers you can pick from is just there to bait you, so I would recommend just trying 1 or 2 and focusing most of your energy and stomach space on the sushi! I would also get the 2 cucumber wrapped rolls (I think one is called the Naruto and I forgot the other, but they are listed next to each other). I have always wanted to try the chicken katsu, but I think that would fill me up relatively fast.   You can also order more than 1 dessert item here so I would recommend the red bean and green tea ice cream scoop.   I would recommend checking this place out if you want a sushi place that has a decent selection of items that goes beyond sushi. I would give this place 3.5 stars, but since I can't do that, I will be generous and give them 4 stars lol!

QQRKtAWlTHEBzzYAninzWA.text: Awesome! The service was super fast and we had 5 people in our group constantly ordering sushi.  The nigiri was decent in fish to rice ratio.  The Lisa Lisa roll was sooo good!  The skewers were my favorite along with the seared tuna sashimi with Aj sauce! Order those and you won't be disappointed!  I strongly disliked the banana roll, but my boyfriend loved it. Didn't like sharing our table with strangers... that I would prefer not to do again.... But, I'll be back :)

X_DjRq1SrZfrjUcTLdrVyQ.text: I didn't go for the all-you-can eat but had the yellowtail ponzu with jalapenos; lemon tako; Uni and masago sushi and two yakatori skewers for $60. For what it was it was pricey and the yakatori was weak. Over-cooked and smeared in teriyaki sauce to make it palatable.   I have to admit I expected better or more affordable. If you got the dough to blow for mediocre sushi then go for it. It was my bad. I was in a bind and needed to eat ASAP.   I probably would either go to a more affordable place or go high-end. This middle of the road gets you crushed.

9UqysJ7kPtxfsSRS6Lbrfg.text: This place has a great value for lunchtime AYCE sushi, however the service we got was horrible and took away from the entire experience (their food was pretty good too). They have a 90 min limit for AYCE but it took almost 30 mins to get our first order. To make matters worse, after placing our second order, the server forgot to input it into their system and checked up on us 30 mins later asking if we ever got our order. All in all, we ended up being there for over 2 hours and waited for long increments during our visit. Maybe if the service improves, this place would be worth rating higher.

N-pvAxTQg7HLApIu9mkRxg.text: It's Friday, 5:43PM and I hope management sees this, and has a serious conversation with their employees. Rude and arrogant customer service coming in from a Hispanic girl at the front pushed us to leave. We were loyal customers and it is my LAST time here. came in and was not greeted properly, but simply asked "how many?", asked for a table for 3, and was told it was a 25 minute wait when there was no line and many tables available, asked if able to sit at the bar, and this pathetic woman simply shook her head no. She then proceed to say if we wanted to sit at the bar it had to be separate seats, we told her there was three seats together, she says we couldn't push them together from the few feet away they were. We left with a great DISGUST feeling about this place.  Zakana is better. Friendly, welcoming service and better. AYCE sushi selection.

YC1z8aDY0TiDq5guXF9kPQ.text: Take your chances, service was disrespectful.  I saw that this place is rated pretty high on yelp, but I didn't even get a chance to eat there. I called in for a party of 5 at 5:00pm, and the host said that there were a few open tables if we came now.  My party arrived within 15 minutes and we had to wait over 35 minutes due to the place being full already. They have a bar there and the bar seating was completely open, yet they sat 1 and 1-2 people parties at the 6 seater tables.  Since the NBA game was on, I went to the bar to order a beer and the guy asked if I'm waiting for a table. I replied yes and he said I can't sit at the bar. Really? Why not? I told him I would stand or get up when the 1st customer arrives, but he said in a Korean accent no.  Japanese food is not only the taste, but the top-notch service that goes with it. Avoid this place if you want authentic Japanese food.    I could only imagine the sushi is low grade that cats wouldn't eat.

oDOkUPBc10Fn1e0aZLra8A.text: Really yummy sushi options and good happy hour prices! I will update this review further after a second visit.

YnRmiMZc_3OFkvHdx8QnbA.text: So I actually want to give this place 3.5 stars...but alas I have no such option.  Why?! Do you the...oh so inquisitive minds, observantly inquire...well...something fishy going on with the rice. (Pardon the pun...I know, I know...corny)  Sushi rice is supposed to be big round sticky pressed vinegared grains of rice...well specifically Japanese White rice AKA "Shari or Sushi-Meshi"...basically something that specifically complements Sashimi turning it into Nigiri. (Can you tell I really, really, really like Sushi?) I'm not sure what this place uses...but the rice turns out strange.   The cuts of fish over the Nigiri are actually very good...fresh, perfectly proportioned over small servings of rice. But the rice itself is either not done correctly or it is not the right type of grain. I just tastes odd...like an inexperienced Sushi chef made it. One of the other mishaps here was the Rib-Eye I ordered. i requested medium rare, but got it medium...to well. There was nothing rare about it...no pink at all.   Other that that...hands down this is one of the better AYCE places I had the pleasure of dining at. I ordered a fairly long list of items...a bit tedious to list here, so I will only put what I thought was outstanding...but feel free to take a look at a pic of the bill I posted. The Sweet shrimp was very impressive! One of the best I had, considering this is coming from an AYCE restaurant. Succulent, meaty and actually sweet. They even asked me if i wanted the heads fried separately...bonus points!   The service here was very good, I was frequently checked upon, my Tea was refilled regularly and the waitresses were polite and courteous without being overbearing. I came here on a late afternoon, around 4:15, so I might have beaten the crowds...well actually I did, because there were only five other people in the restaurant...so maybe that might have been a factor to consider. All the food came out rather quickly. I was impressed at the promptness my orders were filled.  I will return to try this place again...

hod8CctntlODsRAvASOYsg.text: Was in LV recently on business and did not visit a buffet (Bacchanal, Wicked spoon etc) for the first time ever. I'm giving this a coveted 5 star rating because: Service (5 stars + )  was spectacular-  Best service I've had at a sushi restaurant EVER.  Menu (5 stars) - Lots of options for rolls and nigiri for AYCE.  Taste (4.25 stars) - Was very good not spectacular, but the service and price (only $25 for AYCE)  Ambiance (5 stars) - Super cool/chill venue with sports on and friendly waiters.

H94SeaihbScPRFUKso1lTw.text: I was really looking forward to trying this place, but it was a disappointment. The fish wasn't fresh at all honestly, and the rice and fish ratio is way off. I did like the udon from the AYCE, but I'm coming here for the fish not the side dishes.   Also our waitress left and no one checked on us for 20 minutes. When someone finally came we ordered our dessert, I got a strawberry mochi. I asked the waitress if I could have a pair scissor to cut it and she told me they don't have scissors... ok.

Zg940jN87SexKtq6OK5uOw.text: This is my favorite sushi spot we have probably come a 100 times every roll is so fresh and delicious. The staff is incredibly nice and on top of everything for you to have a nice relaxing meal. Great price as well a little gem.

xaqmSlyeX3w3erPtsP3K_g.text: I must to come here like 80time with my girls place is super cute it's one of those places that makes you feel like your in Japan so cute always pack wait time is always like 20min but worth your time.

WAQ0emifIG8WSmzvW89mJQ.text: Went here for lunch.  The food was good, the prices were fantastic and the serving size was perfect. We were in a rush and I wished I had more time.  I ordered the Korean BBQ ribs Bento lunch, and I loved everything except the ribs.  The table also ordered Beef Teriyaki, California Rolls, Chicken fried rice, and one other roll.  The staff are pleasant, helpful and very attentive.  I can hardly wait till next year to go back and try all you can eat $20 for 90 min.

EIiZ_tY0i7rJq5la-n5HAg.text: Excellent service and food. We have eaten here before but it's been a while. When we found out our usual place had closed, I made reservations here for a party of 6. Even though they were busy, they got us right in. Our server gave us suggestions and was quick and on the ball. We all had the all you can eat for 26 bucks a piece. Everything was fresh and delicious.  They have several unique rolls but the banana roll has to be my favorite. It is a little sweet so we had it for dessert.

X8dQ3X9BSZavj2BeVun9dw.text: So all in all this place is some bullsh*t. Now I have to come all the way to Vegas from Orange County to get good sushi. Absolutely amazing service the entire time, and food to match. Ordered damn near one of everything on the sushi and nigiri menu and it was ALL amazing. The picnic-table-style tables are an amazing touch, great ambiance, wonderful vibes, really just a gorgeous experience, I will absolutely be bringing friends and family back here on every Vegas run I make from here on out.

-0r8kCR67atbruaFDqN5XA.text: The best place to get your sushi fix! definitely check this place out. The AYCE is worth it.

BYsLlSOLM9hB36oqvooVFQ.text: So I've been essentially going to "I love Sushi", for 13 years. I do go some other places but "I Love Sushi" has been my go to place. I just started using "Bite Squad" for food delivery and I Love Sushi isn't a part of it. So based on good reviews I tried Umiya. I am very satisfied with the quality and taste of their food. It is excellent. It is much better than most sushi places around. They are obviously professionals and they know what they are doing. Looks like I have a new Sushi place when ordering delivery. Everything was very good. I ordered $150 worth of sushi and every dish was well prepared even for carry out. I knew nothing of this restaurant until seeing them on the Bite Squad app. I'm sure they do a good business there. I've been a sushi connoisseur for 30 years and this Umiya definitely passes the test.   Update. I ordered a second and third. I wasn't as impressed. The food was good. I did go to another sushi place called SAI in Anthem Vilage. The food at SAI was excellent. I will give Umiya a rest. I don't believe the food was consistently excellent.

GEeWvbnRq-XGJDoV6RKVWQ.text: One of my favorite sushi places. Staff is very friendly, the food is amazing, and the prices are really good! I recommend everyone to come here to satisfy their sushi craving.

LO5ZfvmucAMdkaPDg3cidA.text: Umiya is great and has a variety of AYCE options!!! My favorite is the tempura ice cream, spicy garlic edamane, orange blossom and snow white roll! Also our waiter was hilarious and awesome.

PZivb3ceh5Z3fcctRIOM5A.text: This is by far the best sushi restaurant I've been too. I just stuck to this one & forgot the rest! I love their AYCE menu. Spicy tuna salad is my ultimate favorite, even if it's hard to pick out what's the best tasting, Everything you order from here is delicious. They are friendly & service faster than most places. Place is spacious & clean, It's not crowded packed as some places, & easy parking. Me & my husband always leave happy & satisfied with this place.
