uLxVE61BEYFfEFhoB7yUzw.text: My friends and I read the yelp reviews so we were so eager to try it.  We went last night with hungry stomachs and boy, were we disappointed or what? I don't know if we went in on a bad day or what happened. Most of their nigiri were unbelievable bad. Tuna, salmon, super white tuna, sweet shrimp and uni. None of them I would eat another piece. I refused to eat the uni because the color was brownish looking, very scary. I mentioned that to the waiter and explained it to her the reason I could not eat it. Another waiter came and explained to me the head chef has told him that's how the uni looking like recently. He came and showed me the entire piece to prove that they weren't giving me the old ones. I appreciated they took time and explained. However, I would still not eat it since it looked really awful.  However their rolls and cooked stuff were not so bad. The only thing I would eat from the place is hamachi kama( the yellowtail collar) , that was pretty good and most of the ayce places don't include that.  The service was not bad considered we had 11 people and that's the reason I gave two stars. If it weren't for the service, I would have given one star. Won't be returning anytime soon.

rnmFHCMQSxOJHAsIinG76Q.text: The food is amazing just like I said before but the service is horrible they need to get all new staff or else it will close I keep coming back because of the food. Sumo sushi there second location and it so much better.

b4k6VUv2Do65PM6hIyyNMg.text: I am having the worst diarrhea ever, still having health problems after I had dinner with friends!   I heard the freshness is not good here, I did not want to go here because the reputations but friend's birthday made me eat there! However I  almost got killed here eating their bad quality sea food here.  Watch what you put in your mouse always, don't become a sick person like me!!!!!!

7Fa5V-OEBRbANPfyK9IjHg.text: I found this place a bit ago and after my second trip I am now getting to reviewing it!  I used to think I wasn't into AYCE sushi but more and more good places are opening up, it is no longer sushi waiting too long sitting in the little fridge by the unfriendly guys in front getting old before it's served sushi.  So I guess with this, yet another good AYCE, I'm into it!   When you walk in you are greeted with the usual loud "Konnichiwa!!!"  They have a nice area with tables in a kind of tented areas off to the sides, a large bar to watch the chefs and lots and lots of a picnic kind of tables all throughout.  Both times we were here there were men from Japan drinking their butts off hanging in the restaurant so if from the fish capital of the world love it why can't we?!   The AYCE menu is huge, the first trip we came with his mom and dad who were in town.  She eats nothing raw, so I put my preferences aside and we order cooked food.  In most cases I am left with the everlasting want for sushi until we head back to one, in this case I left happy and satisfied.  All of the cooked rolls and food were nummy!  Next trip was with people who eat it all, so we did.  As mentioned earlier they have a 90 minute limit ( I was done way before, but for you men or heavy eaters out there! ) My boyfriend and his friends enjoyed it all, no I truly mean it all! ;) lol  The staff was nice and fast the entire time and even though the guys ate a TON of food they never made us feel bad.    The quality of fish:  Good, in lines with some of the other top AYCE places in town, not as good as some of the best non AYCE places in town but what can you expect.  Next AYCE night I will be back great service and great food!

emQmNA3DikCCihdwdZDeWw.text: Excellent food and superb service! The O'Roll was deeeelicious  and our server was super attentive and kind!

z33SBBuLCOZuyGZVS6r02g.text: The best AYCE I have experienced. Fresh, flavorful, great service, choices, and cost.  Also easy to park which is a bonus.  If you love sushi you must get here immediately!

s5-VnlWxzSI8g3DFy8y0ig.text: I dunno why people kept come in and it has such high rank. Honestly I didn't been to too much sushi place but I still can taste what good and bad is. Unfortunately I didn't taste anything in this place can makes me a way back except the tempera ice cream which I had for years in Manhattan. Otherwise everything I ordered tasted just not the way it should. The place style kind like American style not authentic sushi house.

t37ljDEMWTlPtKTsWr7xPg.text: Found this place for dinner via Yelp during my recent trip to Vegas. I ordered the AYCE option at a value of $25. My daughter had Yakisoba Udon. Sushi is very small but again, it's AYCE so you just have to order more. They let you do one order of Poke (and some other specialties). Atmosphere was cool. Will be back!

T-qNt3eeW79VfV-EqpY2nQ.text: Let me preface by saying that I am not a sushi snob. I have been to dozens of sushi spots, and only one has been disappointing in terms of actual taste. Most sushi places tastes the same to me. So my criterion for good sushi is predicated heavily on atmosphere, service, and deals. On that note, this place was up to par with all three of my criteria.   It's a pretty place; modern, open, and stylish. It was dinner time and there weren't many people in there -- although, it was a Tuesday night. I like a social atmosphere, so being one of the few groups there was a downer.   The service was great, outgoing, and very accommodating. They even let us order one last roll out of the 90-minute AYCE limitation. One of the best parts of Umiya is the full bar, a rarity in sushi places.   The deals were the best part. Very competitive AYCE prices. Also, there were great sake deals with buy two, get one free (we had nine in total).   All in all, Umiya was a solid place which was perfect for a date.

5v3sLvNBswh1afUlmvCyDg.text: Very good food And very nice servers :). Definitely not one of those places that jip you on toppings either!  When you order for example lobster rolls it isnt like 1 tiny piece  they do you good.

3in5Uqsu_Z9R_P1wCow9jw.text: I had a blast devouring fresh sushi at this place. With their creative sushi preparation style and impeccable service, no doubt locals frequent here.

o_N-uZYBvBrw7yvxPmOdyQ.text: Great service and reasonable price sushi tasted fresh and rice wasn't hard have came here plenty of times and will continue the trend :)

UVSP6-fsb9aeAq7QfM86Lw.text: Great atmosphere! Has good deals for lunch and dinner. Fast servers and great sushi chefs. Everything was tasty with fresh fish and appetizers.

MhwWykOXmG2uF3pLLVMSpg.text: The food was so good!! And the servers were speedy and attentive. All you can eat sushi and for a good price!! This place cant be beat, i will definitely be back!

aq1J0c44Chqt7b9GL1GPjg.text: I love sushi, but unable to find a great place until I found this place. The is not just another AYCE, this is the best one with good prices. I have been here several times and every time has been great. I have brought several different friends and they too have loved this place. The cook is also the owner and he takes great pride in his food.I always leave very full and happy. This is a must do AYCE. I will try to upload some pic's next time.

tA6QSBGn1N7lAAOgeSR9Mw.text: Awesome shrimp lovers and shrimp tempura...touch down roll was also very good.  Slightly expensive but still worth it.

y_xbRZjiv8pu6x4SccoMMA.text: love the all u can eat here,  freash made when we ordered......recommend everyone stop by when u here in vegas!!

nHA-MNUMgvaVLLMqpw8sYw.text: My favorite sushi place in Vegas. Good price, wide variety of items for all you can eat. I usually order, Nigiri (2 piece) salmon, tuna, garlic tuna, super white tuna, pepper seared tuna, yellowtail; and 3-4 rolls. They also have an entire menu for snack items for AYCE, get the AJ, it's seared tuna sashimi that is marinated, very good. 25$ AYCE dinner price. They also have deep fried ice cream for AYCE. love this place, and the friendly staff.

6YtV7ODT5wVNTeD80nGecg.text: Food was amazing!!! Great service!!! Huge menu variety on the AYCE Menu. Highly recommended. We will definitely be back.

BSvek-DECHS6fInzZPxXMg.text: First time ever coming here with a friend's recommendation. Have to say I'm not a fan. Came in with my boyfriend and his friends. There are basically 3 rules when eating here. 1) if you have all you can eat you can ONLY share with people who eat all you can eat.  2) if you don't finish they will charge you extra.  3) if there is a (1) next to the food you can't share it.   The food- not the greatest sushi I have had. It was decent. Had the caterpillar and it was complete mush. Any sushi roll we tried picking up with the chop sticks came apart instantly.   The service- everyone seems like they are in a rush here. They sit you down and rush you to get out. When they drop off the food they say it completely fast and literally run off. The WORST of it was the MANAGER. Her name is ASHLEY! She was completely RUDE. Any time she reached over she would elbow you in the face and walk off. She hit our friend twice in the face hard. When she dropped the food off she said everything fast and tried to run off. When we stopped her to repeat thinking it wasn't out food she says it again and laughs at us in a mocking way. We asked our server who the manager was and he said that Ashely was. We were shocked and in disbelief. We couldn't believe a manager would treat us like this.  I wanted to give this place a rating of 0 but our server TAYLOR changed my mind. He was friendly and made us all laugh and took his time with us when we were having problems deciding what we wanted to eat. We all hoped he was the manager or we want him to be promoted because he was professional and caring.   All and all I would never come back here again. I would recommend going to Oyshi on Sahara and Tenaya instead if you want good sushi and better service.

lTch4C1Qmxf6In2SP83dKg.text: Best sushi in town in my opinion. I tried a lot of places but Umiya has more of a selection for their AYCE. Service is okay, can be improved but the food makes up for it. Their baked sushi is by far one of the best in town. Try the japanese roll next time you guys stop by, deinitely one of my favorites.

Jt8eQ_eBzN9zmATYUwqTgw.text: Orange blossom roll and super white tuna nigiri was sooo good! Came during lunch, not too many people. Only 20$! But didn't come with uni. They're pretty strict about not finishing your food unlike Sushimon or SushiKaya. They play music videos on a projection and I thought that was pretty cool.

YuNqEFk8pecI9XFpdiBBlQ.text: great sushi..really fresh and peapole are nice.   we are regulars here all the time.       try the lobster crunch roll! (:

aqS-6-_O8PU03ucdk5r05Q.text: My wife and I were looking for a good sushi place to have dinner. Using Yelp we found Umiya near our hotel. We decided to give this place a try based on the reviews.  The place was not very busy for dinner during the weeknight. Jay and Krystal was our servers that night and they did a wonderful job of taking our orders and refilling our drinks. We never had to ask for refills they just knew when we needed it. They are very friendly and accommodating.  We went for all you can eat buffet style. For dinner it was 26.95 per person vs. 22.95 for lunch. The only difference is that for dinner you can order one Uni, sweet shrimp, and some tuna dish. But honestly not worth the extra four dollars you have to pay unless you can not make it for lunch or you love Uni. The food for a buffet was good and reasonable fresh. (I mean we are out in a dessert LOL). We enjoyed all the dishes except for Uni (not a fan of the slimmy sea creature=P_) and the Ginkgo (some kind of fried beans). The rolls were big and very filling. I would recommend to order one roll at a time and try lots of appetizers and udon/ ramen dish. This way you will not fill up on the rolls without getting the chance to try the other dishes. I would recommend this place.

SdKAR4JabZUkd9Zx3JYmdg.text: We came yesterday afternoon ate all you can eat sushi, this wasnt the first time we came and that time i came with 4 yrs old daughter, i didnt ask what the server name but the server was a women, SHE WAS RUDE!!!! My daughter doesnt eat much for 4 yrs old so she ask if we want make her pay all you can eat or just regular , we decided just regular entree , she mention 3 times , she will charge extra if she see my daughter take a bite of sushi, and we said its ok, because we know she wont eat, and she took our order and guess what our order never come out correctly we missed our fried rice 4 order, yakisoba, miso soup, our sushi, and we kept asking and asking where is our foods but never came out . And the server just watching and stand around our table make sure my daughter didnt touch the sushi orders. At the end we still had 1 tray sushi . We were not done yet, we still eating and talking and she came again at our table and said she will charge us full price for what ever we dont finish it and we told her this isnt the first time we eat at all you can eat sushi and we aware about that and we arent finish. We still talking and eating. At the end we order ice cream 2 vanilla and 1 green tea, when the ice cream came my daughter touch the ice cream and she grabbed the ice cream and she said she will charge because my daughter not pay for all you can eat and we had to tell her she wont eat that ice cream because she has stomach problem thats why we dont pay for her, we just order tonkatsu soup for her. We really disappointed with the service and we disnt get the food we order. And that wasnt the first time every time we came there our food never completed

ZG5NSuGzdhTiefIOio8low.text: Food was fresh and good but i tried to order at least 5 things that they told me were not available?? And most dished that u see in the picks are not included in the AYCE, go to Sushi kaya way better!!!!!!!!

d_kC9PcpQ2HqMhJE9cR7Pw.text: Good sushi considering it is in the desert. The all you can eat sushi is a must try if you are a big eater and a fan of sushi

jM4HTLpkIxoGxyxXIn1BaQ.text: First time here and we will be coming back soon! All you can eat menu has a ton of options. Portions were great and quality was superb!

IMhKHwtnyTtZo2QV9hnwaw.text: Excellent quality and variety including nigiri sushi, rolls, soups (udon, ramen, etc. as well), skewers, steak and chicken.  They have the most diverse AYCE menu out of all of the sushi spots I've been to in Vegas.  However, they do have a lot of rules such as only one half-roll order per person, one dessert, and a number of menu options that are restricted to one order.  Their service was also friendly and excellent.  Overall a great place for AYCE that is clean, has plenty of seating, modern / trendy, and open late as well.

x25e2Z2GhCodoYT0BeYGOg.text: excellent food excellent selections, many which do not appear even on LA menus and especially for all you can eat. the price cant be beat. 25 for dinner. even have mochi and tempura ice cream options too. It has been years since I have actually fell in love with a restaurant... quick game. test your servers memory. we oredered about 10 things at a time and with no paper and pen they all managed to remember and bring us the proper food. coming back for life.

i0ItTAA5sk3QNsod_ZdYgA.text: I hesitated to come here for the AYCE sushi, because usually AYCE is average sushi at best. But I've got to say, the sushi here was wonderful. Service was great also.

cJURKPAf2_6kKV043KJ1KA.text: Absolutely great sushi restaurant!!! We eat A LOT of sushi, from small crappy sushi joints to fine dining sushi, and, this place was perfect.  Not fine dining, but great atmosphere. Lots of great rolls and a really good all you can eat menu. Best sushi for the money we've had in a long time!.  If you don't want to pay the outrageous prices of the casino joints, come here.

ZA3v_yN2ENkB7G260KHymw.text: it is very great place. nice atmosphere and people.  Food of freshness is a great too.  people must try snow white and also a la carte special meun !!

O0wXGsxev8Q4L8O1rnmX3g.text: Good AYCE. No complaints nice variety of items on the menu.

IJ2LEgMaOMsGoe1WQLVigw.text: Best all you can eat sushi in town! The staff are super nice and on point with everything. This is my new favorite spot in Vegas and deff will be back.

TPBHcGuzjnuJtJbytciLZA.text: Amazing service and such good variety and food!  So fun too as it was our Dad's 70th and the Mochi balls were delish!

SNnZYfZo8ZFEDpDBNS3qDw.text: I'm a fan. I've been here a few times and more often than not, all the food I get is pretty good, if not great (at least for an AYCE place). Their AYCE menu is fairly large. The dinner price is $26.95 and for kids it's about $13.  Most of the nigiri I've tried was good, with standouts being the tuna, super white tuna, sea bream, yellowtail and eel. Other items on their menu that I'm a fan of include their gyoza, the yellowtail lover roll, and crispy rice with spicy tuna. Their oysters and pork belly are decent and worth ordering again.  I wasn't a fan of the seared tuna in AJ sauce or the Hawaiian roll.  The interior is cool with the long communal tables and benches. It also seems to be easier to get a seat than other AYCE places around town. The times I went I've never had to wait, which is perfect when my patience is running low, I'm hungry, and all I want to do is stuff my face.

PWw1PgF2S_Dr3_1Z22NHbw.text: This is probably my favorite sushi in town. I'm always here! If you are looking for a good place to eat a good food and enjoy with friends here is the place!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi time

n9_JwcvGGP74KIxvoN-ERA.text: Best sushi I have eaten in years!  We ordered many items.  I eat mostly veggies.  Son and DIL eat everything.   We all loved it.   Delicious, beautifully prepared food.  Busy place but great service.  Make sure you come here if you're in Las Vegas.

kC4RBLmvppvJ3GarRfunxA.text: All you can eat sushi ! I like the size of the  Nigiri Sushi. Just like the same size in Japan. It won't be too big. Fish is fresh. You can order Sea Urchin and fresh Oyster (limited 1 per person). They have tempura ice cream and Michu ice creams as well. I will come back here again when I come to visit LV next time! Also great customer service! (Note: Time limit is 90 minutes) You can get a free soda when you check in from Yelps. $$25.95/person @ dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ehuQtBv65nPgdLle69Sa5A.text: I went here for dinner with a friend and we decided to do the All You Can Eat. It's a great deal for only $26! If you are planning on getting more than 2 things, you might as well go do it.  We were seated immediately because it was just the two of us and the service was fast and friendly! My friend was so excited at the large fish portions in some of the hand rolls. They also have no-rice rolls if you're watching your carb intake. In addition, I'm gluten free because I have Celiac disease and while I'm not sure if they have Tamari available (I usually bring my own anyway, just in case), there were enough gluten free options available to fill me up!! If I'm ever in this area of town again while in the mood for sushi, I will definitely visit Umiya!

fLJcQX4ulld53Em2ZrPzAw.text: Worth two visits on latest trip to Vegas because of the value!  Feels slightly overstaffed in the service department as it felt like we were getting waited on by the entire staff all at once (not a bad thing).  All you can eat at $26 included uni, soft shell crab, oysters, lobster roll, amoebi nigiri, and all came out at a la carte quality.  Only the baby octopus skewer came out a little overcooked and rubbery, and the ice cream was on the chalky side.  Casual, happy staff, good vibe.

rE5cPym2QAA36HDAQ2wVGw.text: It's Friday, 5:43PM and I hope management sees this, and has a serious conversation with their employees. Rude and arrogant customer service coming in from a Hispanic girl at the front pushed us to leave. We were loyal customers and it is my LAST time here. came in and was not greeted properly, but simply asked "how many?", asked for a table for 3, and was told it was a 25 minute wait when there was no line and many tables available, asked if able to sit at the bar, and this pathetic woman simply shook her head no.She then proceed to say if we wanted to sit at the bar it had to be separate seats, we told her there was three seats together, she says we couldn't avoid them together. We left with a great DISGUST feeling about this place.

aOejpnqBwvnK4dr6J6DJKg.text: This is my absolute favorite sushi location. The Baked Salmon is delicious i always have at least two rolls. I make a visit here at least once a month sometimes more.  And the servers are always friendly. Yes they have mochi icecream! GREEN TEA AND RED BEAN!  I love this place!

McBqCe_VrigF3zKBzGYL-Q.text: Best deal ever! Way better than any other all-you-can-eat sushi spot I have been to. Go after 3 pm to spend $5 more and get a few dinner-only items. We went on a Tuesday at 3:30 and it was empty - our orders went in and came out quickly.  We had 2 large Sapporos and kept it under $80 with tax and tip. Crazy deal in a city where a Casino hamburger in $16.

vaAO5gs6xduAmeNnZoi2hw.text: This was my first time at this place on the night of 11/29/16. And I must say this place was outstanding. The service was great and fast and staff was friendly. Our server was named RON. He was excellent. This place ended up being the best all you can eat sushi ive ever had. Ron was very friendly, courteous and knew the menu very well. I asked him some recommendations on some sushi that was spicy. He recommended several dishes, and every one was great. He kept checking in on our table to see if we needed anything or wanted to order more dishes. This guy was the best server ive ever had at a sushi restaurant. Every dish I had was good. I was not disappointed with any of my food or service that we got. I will definitely visit this place again. I think I found my favorite sushi... and that is Umiya

5ZnTX_CCPfkoUJ7B4BwhnQ.text: The AYCE menu is pretty dope. I highly recommend urchin sushi. Fresh, buttery and tasty!

3OlLZM9XmmxRuZdYM34rHQ.text: This place is great! They have the best Laguna Rolls and Miso soup.  The staff is extremely friendly and welcoming. The atmosphere is nice.

UhIV3I9vYAtz0kjBDFhu3w.text: Poor service. Bad Attitudes. Waste of time. No good. Terrible ambience. Came here because of the yelp page, but it's not up to standard.

75MQe5uD3ov5Ia9lRjRVuA.text: This is one of the best AYCE sushi places I've ever been to! They have good customer service and the place is really kid friendly. All of our dishes were above our expectations and their sushi was super fresh! The prices were fair for all the food and dessert we got. The place is authentic, yet very hip and plays good music. I really recommend coming here!

LThRQm8wa4csuOGos3IVeA.text: Umiya is the best sushi place in Las Vegas! It has great atmosphere and every staffs are so nice! I highly recommend this place.

WjQDgllzRFX85hgTZ5gAcg.text: Good Food BUT BAD Service!!!! It's called unlimited so let me finish my order however long it maybe...don't interrupt me and give me attitude! Very rude and unprofessional! Also, slow service for a busy place!!! Need to learn to keep up with the flow and don't freaking be all flustered! Meaning wrong place to work at!!! Also when I'm following up on my order nicely...don't give me attitude and tell me that it's coming in a freaking rude way! Again ppl here gets flustered on a busy night!!!!!

28ckthtVGiP_fT-qCw3qqA.text: This restaurant is the best AYCE I would go in Vegas.  Who says you need to pay $50+ and wait 2+ hrs in line to get a decent meal!?

frsndwnS57dlmjvTGUAa8Q.text: Went here with my sis and got sick from the food. Should've known when we got the nigiri, It was not fresh at all. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this place. Plus a lot of the workers seem to not know what they are doing(too many of them handling one table therefore there was many errors with food coming out . Shrimp skewer was overlooked and dry, tonkutsu ramen was bland(I knew that it would be because it's not a ramen place).

TT5JpDNUj65I_1iLXakIhg.text: OMG!!! This place is super AWESOME!! Get more bang for your buck! I would say this buffet experience was better than the buffet on the strip. You must make reservation for a big group of people and arrive early!! We got lucky they had some spots at the bar so we didn't have to wait.  Umiya wasn't stingy with their food and it came out fast!! Seafood was fresh, good qualit and there were so many things to choose from on the menu.  Would go back again and again.

XNT6zMxxhwXdAJao9r3x9A.text: The ALCE deal is phenomenal. I came here with 3 other people for a quick sushi dinner before a show and ended up sitting down to a sumptuous feast. Some items are limited to one order per person, including: poke, raw oysters on the half shell (deliciously seasoned), seared tuna, fried shrimp lollipop, amaebi nigiri, uni nigiri, and fried ice cream, but the rest is unlimited!! We left very satisfied with the quality of service and food, and were delighted by the casual but clean atmosphere. Absolutely what I was hoping for and will definitely be back next time I'm in Last Vegas.   RECOMMEND.

RdUln2QSkh5tGuvwY6rdCQ.text: Umiya has been one of those really nice sushi places I would always look forward to going. I have been to Umiya probably about close to 10 times so far. However, given the recent service I encountered here, I will not be coming back again. Given that it's my dad's favorite sushi places, I still won't go. Their quality seems to have gone down from years before and everytime I come it is always so crowded and takes forever to wait for a table. It's not a very spacious restaurant,  and with so many customers it really sucks having to wait inside shoulder to shoulder sometimes.   My recent experience with them was probably one of the worst. They had my family (all 5 of us) sit with a couple of loud and noisy people who I believed sat there at least longer than an hour already. They did not give us much room and the person next to me had THE LOUDEST voice EVER! I was getting a headache and my ears were starting to actually hurt from his voice. I eventually had to switch seats, but that didnt stop them from continuing. Eventually more of their friends came and sat down making for even less room to sit. I couldn't take it anymore and had to ask one of the workers there to move. Looking around, I saw larger spacious tables with only two or three people sitting there while my family had to sit with 8+ people in a small crowded table. That was unacceptable and unfair! Good thing I spotted an empty table behind us where the workers there eventually allowed us to move to. At first they were hesitant to even let us move, which I had no idea why. After we moved, the extremely loud group doubled in size as more of their friends came and joined them.   However, being able to accommodate us in that is why I gave them another star.   The service being as they were so busy that night, was pretty quick surprisingly. Umiya really never disappoints in that area, which is a good thing. However, they do forget some of your orders so you have to remind them a few times. By that time, you're already full and it's not worth it to bother them anymore. Maybe that's their strategy?? A way to slow down the workflow a bit?    The sushi was good, but the quality like I mentioned has gone down. It is not as high quality as it was before (maybe a year or two ago). The seasoning and flavors did not mend well together with the fishes. The rolls seemed messy at times and did not show effort in making the sushi. However, I will say it is still better quality than other sushi places I've gone too, so Umiya is not all THAT bad if you're a first timer there, or do not mind those little things.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hMOznfJfvSBjiu0tNL2MxA.text: I have this place a 4 Star because of the food quality. They also have an all you can eat sushi & more menu that's a "good deal" for Las Vegas.   The problem I have with this place is it is not accommodating for single people. They have a "bar" you can sit at but every woman by herself knows when you sit at a bar you will have creepy guys come to try to sit next to you and hit on you. They don't have single tables, instead they have these very long 15 foot tables that you see at summer camp. I don't want to come to a restaurant to eat and be forced to sit next to some creeper. The last time I did sit at the bar I ordered the all you can eat menu and only got 2 1/2 small plate dishes in the 90 minutes I was there because the service was so slow. They also sat me next to the middle of the bar where the cooks were handing things to the waitresses so I had people reaching over me the entire time I was there.  Edit: literally 2 minutes after I posted this review some guy came up to try to sit with me and get my phone number. I came here to eat and not get picked up.

IRgo_m-pUSSrYQXzmKZOxg.text: Love this AYCE sushi joint! I've been looking for a new place for all you can eat, since I feel a lot of other spots I usually go to aren't what they used to be. Umiya did not disappoint!   The service here was great and very quick. Everyone we self with was very nice and extremely efficient. The place was full and we our drinks were never empty and our orders came out like lightening.   Everything we had varied from good to amazing, so not one bad plate here. Some of our favs were the baked mussels, red rock roll, poke salad and the rattle snake roll.

9DsC05PsVm40JdWGjUd0MA.text: After reading reading lots of reviews about service, I will have to disagree. Perhaps it's case by case. Yes this place is busy however they have a system where instead of writing your name down for your table, you give them your name and number and they will TEXT you when you table is ready! Super convenient and save you from waiting at the door or Incase your table is done before the estimate time. Our service was excellent. Everything from our server (Curtis D)to how fast our food came out and how fast they remove your plates I was impressed. As soon as you are done with your plate they removed it almost immediately. Food was very delicious I tried a lot of things on the A.Y.C.E. menu and everything tasted fresh to me especially the nigiri. I even tried the oysters and they were delicious! I've never been to a place where they have fresh oysters on the menu even tho it's only 1 order per person. Loved that they have udon and ramen! Can't wait to come back and try both! This will now be my go to spot for A.Y.C.E.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh oysters! Only 1 order per person!
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xBrH8QwKOX0Fk5GlGXtZlQ.text: Probably the best AYCE sushi spot in Las Vegas and I've been to most of them. Also open late night which is a big plus! Sushi is fresh and the appetizers are great especially the marinated pork belly. We hit this place up every time we are in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wE-mZ72_f8keWMMowe9ffA.text: In most AYCE sushi restaurants, the quality of the fish can be sub-par. I admit I was skeptical at first but Umiya came highly recommended from a foodie and it blew my mind!  I don't know if I have any favorite dishes since everything was so good! The albacore melts in my mouth, the oysters were refreshing, the unagi was decadent.   The yuzu drink was wonderful too!  Lunch was $21 and dinner is $26. SUCH A STEAL! Will definitely be returning on an empty stomach.

-L-YLDtY70qX2Lef0akO3w.text: Decent AYCE sushi! With the tons of reviews, we were expecting an over the top experience but it was honestly just average. The rolls were OK but nothing I left being blown away by or remembering.   Ambiance is good inside, but the hostess was quite possibly the rudest person I've met in a restaurant. She wouldn't even look up when we walked in and once I said something, she acted like we were bothering her... and we had a reservation!

1HzTANfTVC3kyxzBaUqhQQ.text: The best part of their AYCE sushi is that nothing is forbidden like certain sushi places. It's a free-for-all with a few "one item per customer" which was reasonable.  I'm not a big fan of rolls but their banana roll was amusing. I believe it is my had avocado, shrimp tempura, and a sweet piece of banana on top. And the usual sushi rice of course.  Their oysters were alright, not too bad but definitely need more lemon and sauce. Some were a little bit fishy though. Bigger than regular oysters FYI.  Poke salad was pretty good, but the cerviche was okay. Nothing to write home about. People were also raving about the seared sashimi but I thought it was alright.   To end the night, the pineapple sherbet and pistachio almond ice cream were the best finishing touches on a quite satisfying meal.  The staff was also super nice, fast, and hard-working. Bless them cuz it was packed on Christmas day. About an hour wait at 6:30 pm. Would definitely recommend when you need that sushi fix.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food

FFOONMXtb-VMBbCxLTpFjQ.text: Best Japanese ayce ever ! Get more bang for your buck any any other sushi places.  This AYCE is only $26!!  We spent $44 (even with travelzoo deal) at Koi on the strip for set course meal (normally $70 a person). and this AYCE hands down beats KOI on the strip.  This AYCE experience is better than buffets on the strip and we came in at 3pm sharp to make sure there is no line on a Saturday. But there weren't any lines at all throughout dinner.   There was so much on the menu! They were generous with portions and food items came out fast, yet still delicious.  Food 9/10  Service 9/10  Atmosphere 7/10  Presentation 8/10

_rHxY4mgDEODeaWzYtI3SA.text: Every time we come here, we're never disappointed. Fast service and great sushi. The servers are always walking around removing dishes from your table and getting you refills. They are the True meaning of service.  I usually order a lot for the rounds because they are a bit slow on the delivery so if you initially order a lot it's starts come at right times. The only thing that slightly annoys me is that the appetizers usually take longer than the food to get to you. On one occasion they didn't bring me 2 appetizers but it was fine I was full by the time I realized and didn't complain. Servers are attentive and quick to take orders. King of the ocean and volcano roll and lobster crunch are always a must here. Great service and great atmosphere.

B9zvSW-AJsD1-Ba8mTq6-g.text: This place is too busy for the staff to handle.  They have a bunch of staff running all over the place!  I don't think they can keep up. There needs to be some organization.     Takes long to get ordered food, sometimes they forget, then they remember an hour later.     Lastly, the raw fish was not fresh.  Stick to the cooked items.  Better yet try another ayce sushi place.    One star for menu variety.  Creative items that have the potential to be yummy.

LKuV50PvxQ4vg8kgRajrNQ.text: I came here on a Sunday evening and it wasn't too crowded.   I like how there's a regular menu and also an ayce. I wasn't super hungry so I ordered the Katsu plate and whatever salad dressing they use it's amazing!! The Katsu was good and had a decent amount of meat. Other places it's all breading. My friends were able to get the ayce which was nice because they were really hungry.   We got seated immediately and the ayce plates came out really fast! Everything looked so good I was really tempted to try, but I abided by the rules. I asked my friends and they said the quality was really good, but they use a lot of rice. I saw the nigiri and they do use a lot of rice compared to other ayce places (so be careful when ordering too much).   I definitely want to come back to try the ayce since they had a huge selection of appetizers and rolls.

Q5ietf9h9fMn204IiiU76g.text: Great spot with many options. Quick survive, with very attentive staff though at times too quick! Thank you, will definitely be back

Ce588Euc-vUtLeZXCOJXDA.text: To start, we had to wait 20 minutes for a table, even though we saw three open tables and zero other guests waiting for a table. But I understand there may have been reservations, so oh well.  The food was actually VERY good and I thought the prices were decent for an AYCE sushi.  The servers, however, barely came to the table. There are like they had triple the amount of bussers and runners compared to the servers. Which would explain why the servers barely make it to the table.  In the end, it's not uncommon to experience these same issues at most sushi places, so since the food was great and the food is most certainly the star of the show, I still give it 4 stars.

D3O6pJB0NSiCQHDw6_NccQ.text: I normally look forward eating here. Tonight was my 4th experience ever. Never had an issue but tonight really disappointed. Service was pretty bad as we would order our food and would take so long that we had forgotten our order then 20-30min later the waiter would drop our food off which we no longer felt the urge for. As for food the UNI was SPOILED! Worst uni ever tasted wouldn't risk ordering again.   Recommend giving your complete order to your waiter right away otherwise you'll be waiting 15 - 20min between meals.

7pZH4vOwk6cT9o1IRj4GPQ.text: Hands down the best sushi restaurant in Vegas!!!! So so so impressed with the quality of foods and their amazing customer service!! Guys, this is it. This is gonna be your favorite sushi restaurant in town

Il8RtQu4G5LEOiT4TJIRXw.text: The food was very fresh and packaged amazing for delivery plenty of extra sauces ginger etc. all of our custom orders were done perfectly very delicious would recommend to anyone

bf9m2iZ7FxYwvbEwDVR7IQ.text: One of the best sushi places in Vegas. The sushi chefs are actually Japanese, which you almost never see.

9HZ2WVetm7j74y439KV-Zg.text: Probably somewhere between 3.5 to 4 stars.    Its located off the strip, but you could uber/lyft here as its just a few miles away.    For a AYCE place, its relatively small, mostly long benches in the middle, and some smaller seating around the sides of the restaurant.    Price for AYCE is very reasonable at $26, considering its triple that price in vegas buffets i would say the price is excellent.    In terms of food selection, its pretty deep in addition to sushi, there is grilled skewers, fresh seafood, and good dessert options.    Overall quality of the food was good to excellent.  We enjoyed everything we tried and the staff was very attentive and friendly.    If your looking for a place off the strip at a good value, this place is worth checking out.  It gets pretty busy at night though so you may wait for a little.  Would definitely recommend this place.

huzpaA0-wGCBT5izo8iPlA.text: I recently went to Vegas for vacation and tell me why my local friends all wanted to eat here. If theres one thing you can count on is that Vegas locals know their sushi. I ate at Umiya Sushi Twice!   Umiya has a great AYCE sushi menu and is open late. Everything i ordered was amazing! Its located off the strip so i would say its decently priced, Dinner $25.95 (3pm -closing)  Its awesome because if you do a Yelp Check in you can even receive a Free Gift- an umiya sushi mug.  Must trys: Lycheetini  Monkey brain Japanese lasagna

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño yellowtail
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lycheetini

vV-ZPRB3HNwXPwMROPfN3Q.text: Arrived here at 12:30 AM & starving. Last call for their all you can eat sushi was 1:30 AM and an hour was more than enough time to get our sushi craving satisfied. They played catchy pop music both in English & Japanese and that was fun. Their decor was what interest me the most as it wasn't the typical sushi restaurant with basic seating. You just gotta see it for yourself. Awesome! We were able to order half rolls on ALMOST everything on the menu, which gave us the opportunity to try basically everything. We ordered 3-4 rolls at a time to keep a steady pace, and we received our orders within 5 minutes. I'm only giving 4 stars simply because we also ordered soup midway into our visit & we asked for it probably 3 times. They just kept forgetting about it. All in all though, I would come again.

6FeCyCYR1OaYAA4F2BlPmg.text: I would have given this place 5 stars but I had to stop at 4  because the bathroom was totally disgusting.   Other than that the food was very impressive and the calamari was to die for.   The food and the service were both fast we didn't have any problems the whole night.  We ate tons of sushi and it all tasted fresh there was really nothing to complain about other than the bathroom.   I would definitely recommend this place

h4T0hZaeSoYD8AxIhY-J3A.text: Yesterday was my third time visiting Umiya, and I enjoy it every time. The servers are really attentive whether I sit at the table or the bar.   I love the Lobster Crunch roll, vegetable tempura, soft shell crab, and so much more!  For two people, the bill came out to 68 bucks including tax and tip for all you can eat.   Orders come very fast as you order them. Some special items you can order only once. Besides rolls and nigiri there is a selection of hot and cold apps, skewers, entrees, and noodles.  Overall I really enjoy this place and would come back if I'm super hungry and craving sushi.

5GLKCjmecnBoj00CyADbYA.text: Review number 1000 for Umiya woohoo!  I've been here twice now, and I gotta say that overall this is my second favorite ayce sushi place in Vegas (Sushi-mon on Sahara still being number one on my list). Most ayce sushi places that I know of have a 1 hour time limit, but the time limit here is a generous 90 minutes. $20.95 for lunch (11AM-3PM) and $25.95 for dinner (3PM-Close). They have a broad selection of items from ramen/udon noodles, to grilled skewers, ribeye steak (1 order per person), miso marinated pork belly, and a vast array of nigiri and rolls. Their fish is pretty fresh, and I like how they don't put a lot of rice in their nigiri. However, the service was a bit inconsistent today. One of the servers was really accommodating and on top of our orders, but it seemed like some of the other servers there were trying to rush us out. My buddy was eating his ramen, and even though he wasn't done, they kept trying to take it away lol. Also, he literally asked for his salad like 5 times before it finally came out. Not sure what happened there...  I would say that coming here for lunch is definitely a bargain at $20.95. Even if you're not a huge fan of sushi, they have enough non-sushi items that will compensate for that price.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Wq3NKCfIB-HRQDnFChmR0Q.text: Went here last night with a group of friends for a going away dinner for a coworker. The moment we sat down the servers assisted us right away considering that it was busy. Do keep in mind that they will not seat any party that is incomplete, everyone in your party needs to be present upon being seated.   This review is a combination of my last visit a year ago and recently. Both times I came here was in a group of friends/coworkers. The cool thing about this place is the communial seating arrangement with outdoor picnic tables and chairs with an industrial like ceiling. Great when dinning with a group of friends because they are able to accommodate sizable groups. One group had 14ppl, another table had 12ppl and there was a mixed amount of 6-8ppl at other tables during our visit.  Our small group of 4ppl went with the AYCE menu with the exception of 1, who opted to order individual items. This place is a good option to introduce someone who is not to familiar with AYCE and Japanese food.  Some of the few items we enjoyed: -Baked Green Mussels-Fresh and seasoned just right with the a good amount of cheese. "Oceany" taste according to two of my friends.  -Hawaiian & Firecracker roll was really good and left a lasting impression, considering a few of us who don't do Nigiri.  -Tempura Ice Cream & Mochi Ice Cream was good.  In my personal opinion, I would given this place 3.5 stars because their Nigiri didn't have a fresh consistent taste with a few a bit dry ones but there were times it was good. Since Im biased with Nigiri opposed to rolls.  The reason for my 4 star rating is based on the attentive service, because there isn't really a set server. More of a group of servers working as a team. We had a few order takers, food runners, bussers and the manager occasionally checking up on us. The great thing our group appreciated was that they were able to split the check in 4 individual checks, which made it easier to pay with less confusion. This option is not common in many Asian restaraunts.

4ECCN80ZTa-op5H2X2yH6A.text: Just waiting for our food. Told it will be 10 minutes. Still waiting with no update. Foods been sitting there for about ten minutes. Updates would be nice also employee drinks are visible and should not be on the counter. Health department issue as well as unprofessional.

q7lhDzBuyo6gW8G1c4Iztw.text: Wow. Just wow.  AYCE sushi, and lots more. Their AYCE menu is enormous. The sushi is phenomenal. The staff is courteous and attentive. It is rare to find a gem this nice.   Literally everything I tried was amazing. You cannot go wrong by stopping in here for lunch or dinner. The atmosphere is very chill, and slightly upscale, so perfect for a night out with the significant (or insignificant) other.

vh6PVo7B17pZY9wAExWJxQ.text: My husband, 11 year old daughter and I had been told this was the best in town and I am sad to say I disagree. We ordered ala cart instead of the AYCA option because we didn't figure we would eat $75 worth. Maybe if a person was there for quantity instead of quality rolls I would have given it more stars.  Our server did a good job checking on us. The fish was not very fresh tasting and everything had  a strong rice vinegar taste to it. The only spice I really tasted with sriracha. There was nothing "fancy" such as sesame seeds on top of the spicy tuna etc. I felt it was a pump it out and get it to the table kind of place.

p48NRFwVKYlUFw-oxAbR_w.text: We went at around 5pm, there was no wait we were seated right away and the restaurant is very clean, dark lighting.  All the servers and workers greeted us coming in. The whole service experience was excellent ! It wasn't like other AYCE places I have been where we had to wait a long time between every order.  The server came to check on us very often, and the sushi rolls are served just few minutes every time after we ordered.   The nigiri rolls were sliced thinner than other places but the fish is definitely very fresh.. and not a lot of rice either!  The special rolls are very delicious too!    Not as many appetizer choices though...  overall one of the best AYCE sushi places I have been!

KtLp29vNOGpW01FjJLZrog.text: Service is good and fast. Nigiri is mediocre but fish portions are small. The oyster was okay. One order per person. Uni was good. The miso is good too-not too salty. Michu is included so a plus. The soft shell crab was good so was the seared ahi with AJ sauce. Overall, not bad.

hlY3vG2sd6jYipcpT7GDzA.text: AMAZING! Must go place when I'm in town, varieties of food, drink and others.

u5V1in_Bg0LFnl75R1nnFA.text: I definitely got my money's worth here for $26.95 AYCE it is totally worth it here! A couple friends and I wanted to check this place out for dinner-- and we were ALL glad we did.   As everyone has been saying, they do have a large selection of appetizers, BUT I feel like most AYCE sushi restaurants do now-a-days, such as Oyishi  What I can say that stood out was the fact that they had skewers in their AYCE and man did we order a bunch of the bacon wrapped scallop skewers. They were A-MAAZING. They put a little too much eel sauce on it, but I got over that quickly.   We also ordered the ** seared tuna sashimi with AJ sauce** totally recommend this. So zesty with flavor. Too bad it's only 1 order per person, but that's the reason why. womp womp womp.   Baked mussels were alright, when they reached us, they weren't super hot.  I didn't like the fresh oysters we got, they tasted really fishy and straight from the ocean. But hooray they are included in the AYCE.   I really like crispy rice, the texture is so chewy and crisp, I love it. They have a crispy rice tuna appetizer, which I loved so much, that we ordered 2 orders of it.   We ordered a TON of sushi rolls. They were all made to perfection. Baked rolls were  baked perfectly and delivered hot. While the regular rolls weren't wrapped with too much sushi and were bite size and they looked like they were delicately rolled.   I recommend getting the **snow white roll** and the **orange blossom roll**   I also ordered a mackerel at the end of all of our sushi roll rounds which was a mistake because it was a hearty portion. They give you the WHOLE mackerel.   Dessert option is kinda bleh, as you only get ONE from the entire dessert list. It's your average dessert list from sushi restaurants (ie: tempura ice cream, mochi, etc)

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh oysters included in AYCE

xWywXpaXFjALSd9Eey1v7g.text: Fantastic service! They barely let your plate or cup get empty before they take it away. You don't need to ask for refills, they will top you off before you even think of it. The food is pretty good. I like the hand rolls the most. They were loaded with fish and a fair amount of rice (good ratio). I also liked the fried rice with spicy tuna. $30 is not bad for all you can eat dinner. They had good variety of rolls and even steak for those of that don't want all raw fish. Good sized picnic like tables hold a lot of the dishes as they come flying out of the sushi bar. I was impressed at the speed of the orders coming out. All freshly made. The rice was still warm in the hand rolls.  I would give more like 3-3.5 stars for the taste of the food. But the service really makes this place hard to dislike.

h7FIVmDuIE8tvTfJORtsRg.text: Totally worth the price, and really fresh Nigiri. The special rolls were unique and delicious and the service was great. I'd definitely eat here again!

9PX11gmTj2OvKnHiE1wxLw.text: one of my favorite All you can eat sushi place. My husband loves raw fishes but I don't eat anything raw. This place have plenty of both. Many selections and they have specials often. Today I have a free soda and they're also giving free mug with Yelp review. Yippee! We're ordering Oysters, soft shell crabs, yummy pork belly, mini octopus and so much more. They also have ribeye steak (small portion) as part of all you can and we haven't even got to dessert. Nom nom nom $25.95 for AYCE dinner. hubby is going for super white tuna and sweet shrimp.

4MLoIX0oljAjFMqtwsLoxA.text: It was really weird but when we walked in there were a lot of servers and open tables but we were informed it would be about a 15 minute wait. About 20 minutes later when other couple started comin in, they all of the sudden starting rushing people to get seated.   After that everything was amazing! The servers were quick and all of our food came really fast! They were constantly checking on us and making sure we had everything we wanted.   They have a huge menu selection of yummy rolls and appetizers! The inside is very clean and has a nice modern warehouse look. Great all you can eat pricing especially for being near the strip.  I would defiantly come back here again!

h3NyOfoYRVkAQrJcTpsJJw.text: Best sushi on the strip!!! You cannot beat this price for aces! Their ace menu is almost identical to their reg menu! It is so awesome. There is such a variety. The tables are family style... and the waiters are not set to any specific table! They all help which makes for a super fast service and is super efficient. The sushi is delicious as is there other food. They have a great desert choice. This is a MUST stop whenever we go to Vegas. It's about a mile off the strip, they have great hours, and definitely needs to be on your list of places to eat at when in the area!

cQPASRn9FJnI-2W9JNZOaQ.text: The food is exceptional along with the service! Didn't really know what was good so just asked the waiters to serve what they recommend and wasn't disappointed. dzxTlsMM47UbVd1sHUMu_g.text: Pretty good AYCE sushi off Rainbow. In a sketch parking lot, but inside it is busy and full of yummy life. Sushi was pretty good, but my boyfriend and I got full fast. Service was quick and friendly, and we sat at the bar so the orders kept coming in nonstop. Loved how they had half-roll options so you could try a lot of rolls. I was really surprised by the quality and flavor of the actual fish that night. Great place!

bVZZcryPNeO1WxPTLkwFmA.text: I had heard about Umiya Sushi and wanted to go. After finally seeing lives videos and pictures from my friends SnapChats I thought is was best to go ASAP!!!  I dragged my boyfriend from his comfy nest and persuaded him to join. He and I both have great places we enjoy sushi and Kaya is one of them. (One of the best in Las Vegas) After trying Umiya it has immediately become my favorite. Although the service and dining experience as a whole is very very fast, I enjoyed the food and the attentive service. The types of rolls were damn near specialty and all looked so amazing!!! You know when you try "All You Can Eat" just to try bits and pieces everything and share? Well, we ordered doubles of the same thing and literally stuff our faces! And everything was unique and tasty! It was a taste bud overload! I don't remember much of the names of rolls but my favorite was the roll with the lightly fried banana on top. Like, who thinks of that?! It was delicious!!! I ordered it twice!!! From now on I will recommend Umiya over Kaya, but both are unique in their own ways. I lean more towards Umiya since they have an edge. A very sharp one atm.

6vkWasbI5ZhbCY5qU2pieQ.text: Great place, would definitely come again. AYCE can't beat it for lunch! Very fresh quality sushi! Even though they don't do half rolls, it is not one of those places they try to fill you up with rice.   In the beginning, we waited a noticeable amount if time, but the owner made up for it by his charming and comical personality. The O salad was amazing. Eric also made us a special roll just for us with fried onions, tuna, and shrimp tempura. Overall, very pleased. I'm surprised the place was so empty at a prime lunch hour.

MU1TjSIFK7LgilLnbzntoQ.text: Sushi Fix and GO!  I've been to a few sushi places here in Vegas and this place is the best so far!  Staff is on top of tables,they fill water and drinks without having to be asked or looked for!  There is nothing worse then being a thirsty guest, especially in Las Vegas. Our staff was also friendly and continued to check on us throughout our meal.  Most places I've been to wont allow someone in a group of  AYCE menu goers to just order off the the regular menu.  Umiya Sushi does and it was great.  Everyone got exactly what they wanted and the food just kept coming.  Full of flavor, sweet rice, fresh ingredients and all of the staff were in complete harmony with each other.  No hiccups, no worries and an overall great dinning experience.     We will all be back!  Thank you for a wonderful time and feeding the bodybuilders in our group!    - Cara

No1LpQpk-QnnY1qqvX7EBQ.text: As far as AYCE sushi goes, I've never had better! I just wish this place was in the OC!   My party of 10 seemed to really enjoy the food and the servers were nice even if they did forget a few things. The caterpillar roll, rainbow roll, crunchy rice roll, samurai roll were all decent. We enjoyed the seaweed salad a lot, along with salmon skin hand rolls, tempura, and multiple desserts of mochi and ice cream. :)

All you can eat sushi for $25. Can't beat that!!! Definitely check this place out when you are in town. Right across the street from the Palms Hotel.

8fVSQv97GADEZOWYiPDBJw.text: I find myself eating at a lot of different sushi places this one was actually surprising I was expecting one star but they deserve 5 from the experience that I have I would recommend at least give this place a try because not all the time it could be bad

u-kNuQYyyCzksplk9asl6A.text: Amazing sushi place , great prices, great food and fast services. Located next to the palms, open until 2am , this place is really great . Best local sushis if you ask me . very affordable and quick to bring the food . I eat there one s a week . there fish is always fresh and food always taste great . A must go in vegas . 5 stars in my book

GTtXXwb2CLsLcywUyTsFNQ.text: Can I start out by saying that it's been a long time since I left a restaurant feeling more than satisfied about their customer service game?  This wait staff is COMPLETELY on point.   You have one designated waiter/waitress that is incredibly attentive as to when you need to order, what you need, etc.  But you also have the ENTIRE wait staff coming to check up on you to make sure everything is going well.  I don't think I've gone more than 5 minutes without someone asking me if I need a refill, need to order anything, or if everything is good so far.  It might sound annoying, but it really isn't.  They do it so casually, it doesn't even bother your meal.  I am completely loyal to this place now specifically because of how AMAZING their staff is.  Also!  My waitress was incredibly knowledgeable about the menu.  She picked out two great rolls for me when I asked which one she thinks I should get.  She took her time to go through all of the options for me and made sure that I would love it.       Food portion:  I really LOVE their meal portion for AYCE.  You get one complete roll, but the rolls aren't fat.  They're cute size.  So you don't feel overwhelmed with one roll.  This is great with AYCE, that means you can order a lot more rolls and still be able to eat them all.  There isn't a lot of rice on their sushi, which gives you room to eat a lot more.    If you see my past Sushi reviews, I tend to lose loyalty if the service is terrible.  Needless to say, this place has gotten my loyalty and I will definitely be back.  How I know that this service isn't a fluke:  I overheard an experienced waiter teach a new waiter to make sure to always be attentive to all of the tables.  Not just his, but all of them.  I heard him go over how if you see a dirty plate, you take it away immediately.  You make sure you go around and ask if everyone is doing okay.  Refill their drinks, etc.  That's how I know that they take their customer service serious and that this isn't a once in a full moon service.  This is type of service that they strive for.  And they're damn great at it.

ZfwtEgabpF9trDRqstPGaQ.text: I love this place!! This is the only sushi place I would go to for all you can eat sushi in Las Vegas. The waiter and waitresses are always super friendly. The menu isn't overwhelming and has lots of pictures! It is all you can eat! It is timed from the time you put in your order. You get 90 minutes to order all you can eat. Best thing about this place is that you can order half rolls. I totally take advantage of this because I get to try every roll on the menu. They have some very unique sushi, And they even have steak to order (one order of steak per person).   This place has a dim light ambience. Great date place. Also great for a group of friends!   It is $20.95 for all you can eat lunch. (From open til 3 pm), and $25.95 for all you can eat for dinner. (From 3 pm til closing).

wgBr2MmP1TSz49OSSTR8Tg.text: We went here for the All You Can Eat (AYCE) Sushi and it was delicious. They were uber attentive to us, but it wasn't packed that night so I can't judge if this is how it is every night.  The rolls were delicious, we also had some hot garlic edamame and nigiri. Very fresh.  The rolls were quite intricate and I wish I had a bigger stomach to try more, but alas, AYCE sushi always ends.  I did check in on Yelp for the free sake, totally worth it.  The ambiance was great, fun music with the music videos but they also had the football game on.  I loved the interior and it felt more modern than some of the other AYCE places and also more open. Although I wasn't a large group this time, this place is a much better fit for a large group than other places I've eaten at.

q5xIhdvQU54FHiIXVPa6JQ.text: I am a newb in the sushi world, but my fiance and his best friend are experts. We have a usual AYCE sushi place, but by complete accident, we found this place.  They have entree stuff listed with the AYCE menu such as steak and chicken, which is great. Also, they have ramen.  The appetizers included in the AYCE are more than the typical gyoza. I had a "Who's Your Daddy", a fried ball of shrimp and other stuff. Delicious. The spicy rice cake on a skewer? Must have for anyone that likes spice.  The huge negative here? The kitchen time is absolutely horrible. Throughout the whole time, the food coming out was pretty slow. But towards the end, I ordered one last order of tempura shrimp and a spicy rice cake skewer. Our friend ordered dessert, and my fiance wanted to wait for me to get my order before placing our dessert order. For the scoops of ice cream that our friend ordered, it took at least 20-25 minutes. My food never came out. We asked about it, and they apologized and said the kitchen claims it's coming. We had to be somewhere in the next 20 minutes, so we left without my last order. Our friend did let us try some of her plum wine ice cream, though, and it is a MUST. I don't care if you hate plums or wine. You have to try this.

5krGoPe7jgPkl1SKGl0qqw.text: Service is on point. Food is hot and fast and for ayce great portions, not too filling. Will come back for more!

rTw1heznxdJS6KZ8hGVM_w.text: I have been here 5 times and always has it been perfect ^^p. Great food and Great customer service ~   I always come here with friends and always they come back again~ All sushi here is yummy but my favorite is orange blossom and new fav drink pink lychee splash. Come here when your craving flavorful colorful sushi and definitely do ayce!!! ^^

ePXZGD7RfkGrPSea0kVLIw.text: Not as good as I expected. Too many rice on the rolls  it'll make you feel full a lot faster

9dBNyN9qX2_UCmbnenJM2g.text: Hands down the best sushi experience I've had in Vegas. This is the place I've been looking for! The AACE was amazing. The service was SO fast - the miso soup came before we even finished our first order. They put a little buzzer on the table so you can ring them when you want more. Many times though, they'd notice us looking at the menu again and would come over before we even needed to hit the buzzer. Everyone was extremely attentive and friendly. I will definitely be back and will recommend this place to all of my friends.

uBzr0cm0cm0qlpBac5rFdA.text: Came here several times and this restaurant was always good but tonight I don't know wtf happened with the rice

3cesjk0Pp58B2NX3p4KvQw.text: Pretty delicious ! Adorable little small plates ! Fast and friendly ! Took my cousin and she goes like once a week now lol. Don't order more than you can eat or your ass will get charged extra lol and no you can't have a box !!! Jk but reaLly it's great fresh sushi and I love the appetizers .

QpSooYxyDmgdZjFLmkrfQw.text: This place is great!   Great sushi!   It seems most people get the all you can eat sushi.  They do have al a carte.   The sushi is delicious and fresh.  The grilled squid was great.  Grilled Mackerel was to die for...I like the atmosphere fun and bench seating.  Great service and all of them are helpful!   I will definitely come again!

BBzfDrMsYjK6xJB-jeHoXQ.text: I seldom give good reviews but I must say Umiya is great for AYCE sushi. They have both AYCE sushi and a la carte style. We did the AYCE sushi. They have a great selection of sushi rolls, appetizers and small dishes. Their sushi is pretty fresh and delicious. I like the ambience and the decor. Service was good. Jay and Krystal who serves us was accommodating and attentive.   If you check in using Yelp or Facebook you get a free soda. =)  However you are only limit to one dessert each. =(  Overall, I would recommend them.

vkzE8d7VC7Fnk_OeZ42RiA.text: Best SUSHI SERVICE around. My family all had the AYCE and from start to finish AWESOME.

Ynp5FIO9uLRJiR4gnwlCjA.text: My favorite sushi place to go! They have a lot of options and you won't be disappointed. All the staff there are very friendly and they all acknowledge you and make you feel welcomed. The price for all you can eat is very reasonable. My favorites are the Shrimp Killer & the Rattlesnake Roll. I recommend coming here for sushi. This is the only place I'll go

T8DfggU1mrm0tC4ZkpD--g.text: The best all you can eat sushi in town. 2 hours for $25. The fish is fresh and the chefs are creative. The ambience is laid back. You can beat this place for its price and quality. It's my go to spot in Vegas.

tahxkQg2DPh48m-CsJfyUQ.text: The buffet ("all you can eat") here is ok. Just ok, not great. Tons of sushi... and it's deceptively filling. They also have some one order items like raw oysters that you can get with the "all you can eat" deal.   The highlight here... and what you wouldn't expect... is the fried rice. Yes, the fried rice. The chicken fried rice was really really delicious. Great flavor, and the chicken was fried on the outside. I cannot express how delicious the fried rice is. It makes no sense but it just is.   I also would have to point out that this place is most likely not run by Japanese people. They hand you the bill before all the food on the table is gone which is less than cordial. No Japanese restaurant run by actual Japanese people would ever think of treating a customer that way.

MgSWmr5gDigwKj0-Qi_Dkg.text: I can say best ayce sushi place. I tried every ayce sushi, but only here makes me satisfied. People are nice n fresh food always. Also free drink when u check in.

_4FioIJr9vOakUJOPn4p2w.text: Everything was awesome! White tuna, hamachi, salmon, al tuna, salmon Kama, soft shell crab, salmon skin salad, pork belly, agedashi tofu, rib eye steak, fresh oyster,...the list goes on and on!   The restaurant is nicely put together...very modern and clean.  Service was very very good.  Friendly and attentive.  We were so impressed that we happily tipped 25 %.    The only thing that has room for improvement was the grilled hamachi but it was still edible.  The thing I wish would be different is that they would stop charging for hot tea and soft drinks... :-/  Regardless of the minor things I mentioned here.  Umiya blows Yama and Kaya away, BIG TIME!!!!   Unlike these two...The service here at Umiya is excellent!  I would def go back!   Keep up the good work!

Hk8BjSeW_oxbNGuQVnOONg.text: Great sushi to go with the price. Also service was amazing with the sushi coming out quickly and efficiently. The servers also were very attentive. The all you can eat includes all you can eat dessert (minus mochi limited to one per person.

Ti3TcXnau7R39l4f6koTrA.text: One of the best AYCE in town. Lots and lots of choices. Very high quality sushi. Salad and Grilled section are awesome. Grilled squid is a must. Seared tuna with AJ sauce is too die for. Modern and upbeat environment. Service is fast and friendly. Free drink with a check in. Highly recommend.

Very spacious and the food is more than bomb. The Lisa Lisa roll is a must! I would definitely eat here again esp since I visit monthly.

uTZIRQigdnABJ2V5A_XGrQ.text: One of the few times I've returned to a restaurant while on vacation. Absolutely delicious.

AP1xf6cTXjeTZcocTSJ6AQ.text: Everything was delicious! The place has a great ambiance and the chef/owner is really nice!  Definitely coming back!

gzG19JaRzSB6nmjM11Zf_w.text: I'm a believer, the price is very reasonable and the quality of the food is very good.  My one negative comment is they only had two waitresses when we were there so it's a bit hard to get your follow up orders in but other than that it's a place worth going back to.

cHDoez9GxvWR-GkA27rRDw.text: This place is so so for the food. I just went here for lunch, and it was about 23 dollars for AYCE.  If you like rolls and nigiri for AYCE, it's just ok, not that great. For nigiri, a couple of my tuna and albacore orders didn't look that fresh. They don't have a huge selection of rolls, but they're still ok.  If you like AYCE for the non sushi selection, they have pretty good stuff. I really like their grilled salmon and this tofu dish. I actually really enjoyed the tuna poke. I did like that they had more variety for their ice cream mochis than other sushi restaurants.  As for the ambiance and the customer service, It was pretty good! The decor is pleasant and modern looking. Our waitress was very nice, polite, and attentive too.   Overall, this place is alright, but it's not my favorite. The good thing about this place, though, is if you check in on yelp, you get a free soda or small sake!

zZEdXobZarVw2r1QTLNg_g.text: We were here on a Monday night without a reservation for 8, luckily we got seated within 5 minutes, it was still early, near 6pm.  The hostess was friendly and nice.  We ordered ala carte for the 4 kids (not worth the money having kids doing the AYCE).  They enjoyed their favorite rolls.  The 4 adults ordered AYCE and it was delicious! The menu had more than just sushi, but beef steak (very petite and juicy, which was perfect), raw oysters, baked mussels, soft shell crabs, desserts, and more.  Our waitress, young Asian lady, was efficient; we did not need to flag her down; she always know when to come by our tables to take more orders.  We will definitely come back when we are in Vegas and we have recommended this place to our friends and families.

pNtWg2haSq6TMK-lCjx6wA.text: Delicious food, great service and affordable price. The kids LOVED it! This is officially our new favorite sushi place in Vegas.

jkh8HjXl5JImMNyHfu4GYA.text: First time trying Umiya and it was a hit and miss in one seating. I would say the best thing would be their appetizers because they're all so yummy ! I really liked their baked mussels and their bacon wrapped scallops. Also their tuna poke is probably the best around since I'm really picky about what I like ! I tried their oysters and they're really fresh and taste so good !  Moving onto the main course, the AYCE sushi ! I love love love sushi, but it was just alright to me. I had really high expectations, but I was disappointed /: everything tasted so bland and simple, not much flavor to them. And although they had a wide selection, I didn't find anything interesting to try out. Probably the good ones were the spicy rolls, but I didn't try since I wasn't feeling something HOT. Ohwells.... Oh ! And they burnt my rice when making their baked rolls, so be aware !!!!  Overall, I love their appetizer selection. The AYCE was fresh, but not enough flavor to satisfy. And dessert was good, but their tempura part of the tempura ice cream was not good at all for me.   Not sure if I'll come back /: sorry, I'll be taking my money elsewhere.

D9ohSY5PK1MnV2vGoOdPNg.text: For the price it's ok but the quality of the food is below average.  Rolls size is more like kids menu items.  More rice than anything and filled with fake crab.  Prompt service though.

RYBZmAkZn5_tSAJOPdUZ4Q.text: We came ere for my wife's birthday for the first time and loved it.  What impressed us te most is the variety of food options with AYCE.  Skewers and fresh oyster to ramen.  We will be back again.

OGssNBiXD6gtprswuw45eA.text: Really? What is up with all these reviews? Food was below average service not really good, was super slow. I did not enjoy eating here at all. Will not be coming back.

QYDfOkAesGM6Cx_trQ8_rA.text: Excellent food and excellent staff! We went on a Friday night and had their All You Can Eat special - and believe me its worth it! Fish was fresh, great variety of sushi rolls, and the service was prompt. The staff had great personalities and funny. Looking forward to coming back!

mBJ7PEJ0CcWPramFQMH56g.text: Always consistent and service friendly. If you're a local wait to go until after a holiday. Super busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Busy holiday weekend

cRlDgxdDE4wf_LCP7SRtlQ.text: They have up their game this time! Service was awesome, very patient and good vibes. One disappointing fact is that their sushi rice is so hard, like regular rice..instead of vinegar+salt+sugar=sushi rice.

VVz7QDXy9qGOh6vuQBhE1g.text: Honestly the sushi here is not that great compared to other AYCE places in Vegas. Sushi twister is still my go to spot, but its a bit far from the strip, about 20 minutes out. Ive been here 3 times now and sadly the best part of this place is their hot dishes. Bacon scallops are delicious, even though they are the sizs of a nickle. The sushi was a huge disappointment my last visit a couple of days ago. Like alot of other reviews say, the fish just doesnt taste that fresh like its been sitting at room temp for too long. And the unagi is a bit on the rubbery side compared to good fresh and properly grilled unagi that is flaky and delicious. The salmon belly honestly had a sour aftertaste which totally ruined my appetite for raw fish from this place. The salmon roe is way saltier and fishier than at sushi twister. Probably wont be back for a while. I also find it funny that all the employees yell japanese greetings even though they are all korean but thats beside the point. All the sushi chefs are young korean dudes, and you can tell they dont put enough pride into their sushi here.. the taste just isnt nearly as good as the competition.

grMj5_7eua9K_8jFsesXgQ.text: Not as good as I remember it the first time we came. My brother-in-law & his wife took us here a couple years back when we were visiting. I remembered a short wait time, excellent service & fresh & delicious food. This time we had a lengthy wait time, less than mediocre service & food & sushi especially did not seem as fresh. For a party of 9 we were forced to cram onto a small table & had to wait over 30 mins. to use an additional table even though one was available the whole time. It seemed like the waiters were definitely consumed in the busyness of what was going on in the restaurant & we definitely felt it as we were very rushed. They forgot some of our items toward the end of our night & then ended up bringing them out with our check. They also cleared off the rice & miso soup my niece was working on when she went to the bathroom without asking the remaining party if she was done. Not sure if we'll go again on our next visit to Vegas but good thing Vegas has a wide variety of AYCE sushi spots.

UXx2uuau6Nxb_DIStZuWsg.text: We yelp to look for a Sushi place and here we are ... w 800 plus reviews and more than 1,200 pics ... Oh yeah we are coming.  Food was delicious, salsa roll and Las Vegas roll really good. Plus the mochi  dessert is a must. We are coming back with friends.

-E7urGplHQhiBkrUJore5A.text: Great place for some sushi! Only 26$ per person for all you can eat! The vibe here is great! Highly recommended

BefuoAAJc1GuKYjLzHWN0w.text: Went when I was in Vegas. Omg the eel sauce on one of he rolls I ordered was amazing !!! The environment is super relaxed overall a really great spot !

SkkS0U7hU1kJF7-3L59qiQ.text: $26.95 for dinner. Hot tea is $2. There's buy two drinks get one free during their 4pm-2am happy hour.   Service seemed promising at first but as soon as they got busy for the dinner rush, it went downhill FAST. They should have staffed better on a Saturday evening, and dinner for that matter.   The place is run by Koreans by the looks of it (if it matters to any of you). The tuna, salmon, and yellowtail were actually pretty good, IMO. Uni and sweet shrimp were pretty awful.  I didn't try the sweet shrimp nor uni personally but my friend wanted to gag on the sweet shrimp. I liked the tamago and masago. For dessert, they have tempura ice cream, regular ice cream, mochi ice cream, and banana split. Didn't get my spicy tuna salad either :(.  It took awhile to order when it got busy so it also took awhile to get our orders. We even ordered dessert (1 item per person) but never ended up getting them cause it took too long so we just left. We had already paid by then.  To sum it all up, for the price and my first experience, I will most likely not be coming back. I didn't try any of the rolls personally since I can only eat so much in one sitting. I think the sushi itself wasn't too shabby (for the ones that I tried) but the overall experience was just bleh. Hence the 3 stars as opposed to 2.  Their AYCE menu is pretty extensive, though. So if you can eat a lot, you can try a whole bunch of shiznits. Like pork belly, ribs, skewers, and salads among other things. I wouldn't say to not give it a chance, but just saying my first experience didn't make me keen on going back.

xkb_eHSfrK3dooMn_dFmQw.text: Food is good & reasonably priced. I have good times & not so good times here. Sometimes service is amazing & I get my orders quickly, but others, the servers don't even come & my orders get messed up. But I will still give them four stars cause the food is good

9My4ctbVBJfNw6PkwFS-ew.text: Yeaaaa!!!! We accidentally ran across this place while trying to find another sushi place down the street. We were so tired of looking and we were famished so stopped in here for AYCE. Great choice!!! Fresh, huge rolls. I told sushi chef I like yellowtail and he made me a special sashimi plate, YEAAAA!!! Everything was delicious, great service. Definitely will be back.

wL0Hig6IrjkycifYcj7bUQ.text: Fresh and fast! Came here on a whim and I'm so glad I did.  The food was delicious. Everyone was helpful and friendly.

tNPFUFQsxcwhxyWOVvfVcw.text: Great late night spot or whenever. Very reasonable prices and fresh seafood. Loved it & will be back again.

Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots of space and very clean. Living this place so far! :)

muHI3acYo2d-IdKpysoR_w.text: Great sushi joint! We came during a lucky time as there were fewer than usual people at the restaurant (just right when the dinner hours began). Our orders came by really quick.   I really liked the yuzu seafood ceviche, baby octopus, lobster roll, jalapeno poppers, seared Tuna Sashimi, and the Lisa Lisa roll. There was a large variety of seafood, nigiri, ramen, poke, desserts, and rolls included in the buffet deal. The menu also specifies what's in the rolls and which items are raw for conscience eaters.  Disclaimer: make sure to order what you can eat. They charge extra for leftovers.  I highly recommend this place. There's both quality and quantity for a good price. I'm definitely coming back the next time I'm in Vegas.
