bNrSeVa1Pm5hZ8KCPMwi1A.text: This is one of the best sushi places in town! The service is great, they work really fast and everyone is friendly. The price for AYCE lunch is about $20, AYCE dinner is about $26 per person. Food is really fresh and it's all around a wonderful dining experience! This is definitely something I recommend trying if you're in town!

WbJIYjkX0s8pwUObcVNEEw.text: Good all you can eat sushi place. Service could be faster but not horrible. The new renovations made the place a bit nicer and they have a full bar now. Many good rolls here!!!

vMiyFPn3CWdwYMdnvrq0kw.text: Service was outstanding. Food was above average and for AYCE, it was very good.  We had a reservation for 18 and there was no wait at all for us, even though the place was packed. They had 3 long tables waiting for us. Awesome.   Our waiter Tony took control right away and sectioned us into 3 groups of 6. He started getting orders for each group and he did not miss one order.   We ordered do much food, these are the highlights: The Best: *Tsubu Gai (giant clams) super tender and clean tasting. *Yuzu Hamachi - Yuzu definitely elevated the freshness of the hamachi.  *Salmon Belly - yum *Uni - creamy goodness.  *Fresh Oyster - I had 6 of these by myself YUM!  *Bacon & Scallop Skewer - small, but wow was it good.   The Good: *Tuna Poke *Marinated Pork Belly *Rib Eye Steak *Baked Mussels *Tempura Green Tea Ice Cream   The Bad: None  Price was reasonable. Comparable to other AYCE I've been to.   Tip: free soda with Yelp Check in.   Our last family dinner on this LV trip turned out to be the best. They accommodated a big group and provided good food and excellent service. Go try them out, it's definitely worth a visit =)

0wdM9BhtsRs3jfL0EbErVA.text: Been here twice .. Love the food , love the servers .. Today I ate at the sushi bar .. The sushi chefs are awesome !!!!! A reason why I gave it 4 stars .. I felt rushed . I've never felt like that at any other AYCE restaurant . They kept asking me if I wanted dessert when I still had sushi in front of me .   OTHER THAN THAT.. Food comes out quick. Sushi chefs and servers were attentive .

VHBrzzD4YC_VXfPNP4H0Ug.text: Don't go here... RUN HERE!!! Literally and figuratively! Run to make room for all the amazing sushi, and run to get here as quickly as you can because this is truly a gem just off the strip.   Located a block from Palms, this place is homey, contemporary, and above all really focused on your best experience!   The staff was super attentive, the service was FAST, and the quality of fish was second to none!  Thanks for proving once again that someone can enjoy a variety of sushi in Vegas without having to take out a loan!!!

0BIVB2kcyBToRfVR6dCpEg.text: This place is one of the best sushi I've ever had. I will make sure to come back to this place every time we are in town.  Camila was very attentive, nice and friendly.

HM5qszHZa3w8e7LcKW01zg.text: When you go to an AYCE sushi place, its almost impossible to go to one that's horrible. In this case, this place is phenomenal. There are so many choices ranging from noodles, nigiri, special rolls, soups, appetizers and desserts. The rice to nigiri portion is A-ok! There is not much rice to it. My favorite is usually the Tamago (egg), and Masago (fish egg).   The service is ok. They sometimes forget to give you the rest of the order in which you just order it again. The restrooms are kind of ghetto....... Yeah. Let's leave it like that. When you own a restaurant or business, best to make sure the restroom is presentable and smells good. Thats the one place we as customers need to go when nature calls.   I do hope to make a return!!!

8ztfNSStjFBTbO8rVUGS-A.text: I went to Las Vegas many time and bored at the buffets in the casino.  My friend told me about this place, so we went there and tried.  Food and price are good.  Honestly, we had the best meal here at Umiya Sushi for the whole trip.  Kids was enjoying the food too.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great place
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VzZF6reEjgRwpJg5dZlakQ.text: Never realized that there was a hidden gem down the street from my house! Plenty of parking in the plaza, but it has few street lights and looks kind of sketchy from the outside. But never judged a book by its cover because the insides atmosphere is sort of like a club! Good music and dim lighting! I felt super rushed eating because I felt that all the servers were running around. Food came out quickly and dirty plates were taken away promptly.   I like the appetizer options here as they offered a lot of things you wouldn't normally see in other sushi restaurants, at least none of the ones I have been to! My friends gobbled a plate of shishito peppers (limit one order per person), the plate had quite a few peppers on them. I did not try them but my friends said they're good, and taste like bell peppers.  THE GOOD:  - oysters (limit one order per person). Quite meaty and clean! I didn't have a mouthful of sand or bits of sand in my mouth after eating it. We were all surprised at how big the oysters were. - baby octopus skewers. They literally give you a tiny one - soft shell crab. I was surprised at how good this was! You can literally eat the entire thing without having to spit anything out. We wanted to order more since it's limit one per person I think, but we were saving room for our rolls.   THE EHH - chicken skewers look nothing like the picture on the menu. There were hardly any vegetables on the skewer. Maybe one piece of onion or bell pepper to separate the chicken pieces.  - Ginkgo has a lot of Heath benefits and it came in a bowl with about 10 or so. Tasted sort of like boiled peanuts - bacon scallops. They gave us 2 pieces and the bacon was too crispy/overdone.   I'D SKIP - mussels were overcooked and a bit too chewy IMO.  - yuzu ceviche (limit one per person): I would not order this again. The fish pieces tasted really off and they were kind of mushy.  - ribeye was very small. We got 4 small slices and it was over cooked.   You can't go wrong with any of their rolls but the nigiri had way too much rice. I'm used to 1/3 of the rice they out in the nigiri but the quality of the fish wasn't bad. Our favorite was the eel and salmon belly.   Their dessert options are kind of limited. They offer tempura ice cream (green tea or vanilla) which is a single scoop of ice cream. It's not very big, so I would recommend not sharing! They also offer different mochi ice cream flavors including red bean, green tea, strawberry and others. And, ice cream scoops as well.   If the rice ratio is a big deal for you then I wouldn't recommend coming here. But the upside is that they do offer a variety of appetizers and the food comes out super quick! Plus service is great.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KMpouxSfG2NqLEhqlzxCjQ.text: All you can eat. Off the strip.   All you can eat option for $26 a person, with terms. You have to eat the rice, or you will be charged. You have to eat everything you order, or you will be charged. There are items that can only be ordered one per person. Sashimi is not available.   The all you can eat menu is large, lots of appetizer, nigiri and roll options. The menu goes beyond sushi, we did not look at that part. Nigiri pieces are small. Tuna poke is good. We enjoyed all of the rolls we ordered, trying a variety.   Communal large tables and benches where you share the table with others. Makes it very accommodating for large parties of people.   Service is fantastic. There are plenty of servers working, walking around refilling water and clearing plates. Not once was our section of the table cluttered. We had more than one server taking our order as well. The food comes out fast.

zkMzoAvMZNj4zauFs3vANg.text: When I saw a 4.5 rated AYCE sushi restaurant right across the street from our hotel, Palms, I knew my family and I had to go.  On weekends they open at 12, so my parents and I made it by 12:10. Good thing we came early, because this place gets PACKED! At 12:10, there was half of the room already full with more people flooding on in. There were only 2 servers during opening which made service really slow at first, however, once more servers started their shift, it got more consistent. One thing to keep in mind is that all the servers work together, you're not just assigned one. We totally kept trying to get the attention of the first person who took our drink orders before eventually realizing that every server attends to every table. Wooooopsss!! Don't make this mistake y'all, you'll save yourself a lot of frustration lmao.  $21 all you can eat sushi, yes plz. My parents and I ordered an assortment of items from both the sushi bar and the kitchen. There are some items that they only let each person order one of, but a majority of the stuff is free for all. Although the pieces weren't super fat, I was honestly impressed by the quality of the nigiri to the point were the slice size didn't bother me, especially since you could just order more. The salmon (sake) was extremely fatty which made it all the more delicious! DEFINITELY skip the seared albacore though. This was the one dish that I was very disappointed in. Other things I would recommend getting include the poke!! The tuna chunks were really thick and seasoned very well. I also really liked the grilled mackerel and grilled squid from the kitchen. Polished off our palettes with some yummy green tea ice cream too.  Overall, I really like Umiya. Except for the seared albacore, everything was fresh! Meats weren't as impressive (we got rib eye and pork belly), but it's always nice to have that option if you're craving a little bite of meat. There are tons of AYCE sushi options in Vegas, but I definitely feel like Umiya is one of the best, hands down. My only major comment would but that I feel like they should get at least ONE more server per lunch/dinner rush though. The servers are constantly running around and I feel bad for them!! They're working hard for sure.

VbJZlMJK-Uw2nGNZ-fRMqQ.text: It was my first time going here and the AYCE selection was delicious! Definitely worth going back to in the near future!

VOi54Ps4fdKZKtyX_1WJJA.text: I made reservations for 10 people on Easter not knowing how this place was and being here for Viva we were ready for some yummy food. We absolutely love the experience we sat in the corner table in the front which is perfect for our group most of us utilize the all-you-can-eat sushi for the $25 which was an amazing deal. It was such a huge selection and small portions which actually allowed people to try multiple things.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poke and a half roll all part of the all you can eat menu
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half orders @ small portions on the all you can eat very very delightful

hv76_orGplxdTZk1wtmBzQ.text: I come here every time I visit and it's always consistent with their quality of fish and other dishes. I was in a party of 4 and had sat right away on a Friday afternoon.   Their AYCE menu has a really good selection of rolls, appetizers, and grilled food. They also have a good selection of alcohol from sake to soju, and to your hard liquors like Jameson and Makers Mark.    The service was fast and came to check on us every now and then to ask if everything was good. Would love to give my experience 5 stars but I felt a little unwelcomed when I was being served. I did not care so much for the underwhelming service because I was hungry. it was ending lunch when we had come in so I assumed they were all ending their shifts so they must have been tired. Not sure if their call button was working at the time or if was slow enough to be ignored by the staff, but they had no problem helping us when we flagged them down.   Other than that, it was great! Quick, pretty good quality, sushi & appetizers & other options for AYCE for a good price. Definitely recommend when in town

l9Xyhk8ieP5HUx2MAkhxWw.text: Another great experience at this all you can eat sushi place. A little over a mile from our hotel, this little place off the strip is a hidden gem. Very few limitations on the menu for the all you can eat, so you can keep ordering as much of anything if you want. They also offer half rolls, so you're not stuck with a full portion.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorry. That&#39;s all that&#39;s left.

fj9JsIKQf_1MFt93VM0PbA.text: This place is amazing! If you are craving all you can eat sushi that's good quality AND have hot dishes, this is your place! It's not too far from the strip.  No need for a long review for this one, just come try this place out :) I can't even list out everything I've tried but they were all delicious, especially for the price! I really enjoyed their grilled squid and def will be back.

UtoDlBY2vQjV9saPbDB7Ig.text: This is one of the most amazing sushi buffets that I've ever been to.   The menu has a huge variety of sushi (maki, nigiri,and special rolls) as well as other japanese appetizers and entrees (udon, ramen, and meats). You order everything off of the menu and it's freshly made at the bar and brought out to you. The 2 hour time limit seems a little rushed, but we came at a late hour (around 11:00pm on a weekday) and the waiters were very attentive in taking orders and food came out almost instantly. There are a few items marked on the menu that you can only order one serving of, but everything else is fair game for as many orders as you want. If you're feeling overwhelmed by the size of the menu, I'd recommend focusing on these marked items first - I tried almost all of them and they were unusual and among the best stuff I ate all night.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Naruto cucumber roll - delicious!
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled mini octopus&#39;

rkKU5_AtjRVnZxB8o2g_Nw.text: One of my Favorites with a huge menu. Great options to choose from. Baked green mussels , and hot night roll are always a must

jWCfDr0v5VFA7MHhrzcsZg.text: Umiya sushi is a moderately sized restaurant with a dark and gloomy interior. There is a sushi menu for all you can eat and a regular menu. I will post photos for both menus later...   Outside, it is on a barren road. There is a parking lot and several other Japanese restaurants nearby. Parking should not be a problem. There are plenty of spaces to park.   Inside, it is dark. It feels like it is nighttime once you enter. There is a bar to the right and sushi station. The tables are wooden in the middle and have wooden benches. On the sides are small regular tables and chairs surrounded by willow, tree-like strands. To the left of the entrance is an Asahi alcoholic station. I'm not much into alcoholic drinks, but people would probably like it. There are restrooms in the back and no free wifi.    The service was pretty bad to be honest. The servers were bored and never smiled while serving me. But, the service came by at about the 5-10 minute mark.    The food is very good,  high quality and fresh. I felt it was one of the best I have ever eaten. We happened to order the all you can eat. I felt it was expensive but, you get what you pay for here. The all you can eat for adults at dinner time which is after 3pm-2am everyday costs us $25.95 a person. The lunch was cheaper at about $20.95, this option is only open from 11am-3pm. The rules are: no leftovers or you pay extra, you only get 90 minutes to eat and no sharing. I found this out the hard way at another sushi restaurant. This is standard for most, if not all sushi places.    The prices are high for majority of their items on the regular menu. At least for the good entree items, it ranges from $12 and up. Overall, my experience here was great. I felt that the service let me down and all you can eat prices were a little on the rough side, but felt it was worth the try.I

TFChC3JiOn4MiqbLpWHvaQ.text: Me and a friend came here for lunch. Their AYCE price is actually 1 dollar cheaper than most joints. For examples 20.95 for lunch and 25.95 for dinner compared to 21.95 and 26.95 at other places. Environment wise, I like spacing of the tables as well as the option of being in a bar. Food wise, they offer the usual like sushi rolls, nigiri sushi and appetizers. But I wanna talk about the stuff that makes them special. For example, they don't only offer 1 yakitori, they also offer other good stuff like the bacon wrapped scallop skewer. For entrees, they don't only offer simple teriyaki stuff, they also have grilled mackerel and octopus which was decent. Last but not least they have fresh oysters, not fried oysters like the other joints. Overall, their price was really good, the environment felt welcoming and their food selection is better than most AYCE Japanese places. There were a few bad things; like they don't have enough waiters and desserts is limited to 1.

U83h_F5-QuxVZtJ4ldteng.text: I feel the server was rude as hell had hard time explaining menu to customers i been there before was nice experience why i suggested going back for my bday which i did whole crew had same thoughts i feel like i should have picked a better place to go to that we all can enjoy my bday at now i will never come Back because i work in customer service and never had someone be so fiesty with us i mean i get she was overwhelmed but atleast have patience

l_leENE-5wiEuL7fjKclog.text: Another AYCE sushi buffet in Las Vegas.  Once you try a handful of them, you start seeing the qualities that are different from the rest.    First of all, the location of the restaurant is very convenient and it's in a good area, near the Palms Casino on Flamingo only a 10 minute drive from the Strip.  Secondly, the service is very fast and efficient.  The Manager is constantly walking around to make sure that all of your orders are completed.  He even followed up on a few orders that was missed and heard him in the radio to his staff to hurry up the order (in Korean, watching Korean soap operas are paying off).  Third of all, the restaurant is spacious and has feels even bigger with very high ceilings.  The tables are quite large, enough to hold all of the food you will soon order.   The sushi is not bad, nothing really stands out from other AYCE sushi places and are pretty much on par in terms of quality and selection.  Definitely one of the AYCE sushi places to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poke and seaweed salad

tebd0mvKNH3L86O06tQLIw.text: Family just went out for all you can eat sushi at Umiya.  Amazing selection and it included everything on the menu. Even dessert.  My two grandsons also came and they had plenty of options and finished off with a banana split.  Doesn't get much better than that.    Service was outstanding and food was brought out very fast.  They had sushi bar seating, a small bar in another corner and plenty of tables.  Seemed like larger parties similar to our 6 people.    Give it a try.  You won't go away hungry!

iLTqyQ0TeLY7ui-fzVRzWg.text: This place is such a gem. I have been in many sushi restaurants in Europe and US and this restaurant on the top of my list for daily sushi meal. It's not upscale fancy-shmancy restaurant but this is affordable decent place for casual sushi.  First I want to point that sushi doesn't fall apart! This is important because many sushi restaurants think that clients are idiots and don't care about that. Quality of rice and preparation is important. And also to eat whole sushi that doesn't fall apart much convenient.  Second they have big menu and my favorite sushi with unagi which is rare. Fish is really fresh there and it's great fusion of American-Japanese sushi.

0fLrIW8cYeCYvKIg0GUNrA.text: What the heck happened to this place????   This rarely happens, but we left super disappointed and barely ate a thing. Usually, we're down to get down. Today was a different story. One small round of rolls; a king of the ocean, half and Alaska and half a veggie roll. And one round of nigiri that included tuna, salmon, seared salmon, smoked salmon (which we never got), mackerel and ikura. We also ordered oysters.   The rice and all of the fish were just off. It wasn't fresh. The temperature was borderline warm. That was very apparent in the oysters and nigiri. The rice was very mealy and had way too much vinegar in it.  Service was decent. Nothing to write home about. We sat at the sushi bar as usual and just happened to have the pleasure of watching an employee wrap a bunch of tuna without any gloves-- grabbing pieces of Saran Wrap and touching fish over and over. Another thing that bothered me was watching the sushi chefs bring rolls in the back for deep frying. I caught a few glimpses here and there and it definitely made me uneasy and wasn't enticing me to order those any time soon.  Umiya, we had a nice run but we're breaking up for good. There's no way I can give you another go after what we saw and tasted today. Womp womp.

The only reason I am giving 3 stars and not 1 is because he manager was very accommodating.  I am very shocked on how today went.

IKdwHhBu8djuHnxdXj3ItQ.text: When I heard all you can eat, I was already game. But when I heard all you can eat sushi, I was even more intrigued. As my first time visiting the city of excess, I was super stoked to eat to excess from one of Vegas' many bountiful buffets. But what's this you say?! There's actually a restaurant that lets you eat as much sushi to heart's content at a capped cost? Don't mind if I do!  Not only was the service eager to please and friendly, but the options were as plentiful as the portions. I tried some grilled peppers, tempura jalapeno peppers with cream cheese and tuna, wonderful, spicy yellow tail roll, and melt-in-your mouth yellow tail sushi nigiri. The most unique element was that you had the option to roll your sushi in brown rice instead of white - not healthier but a whole new texture, too!

cSuxoqKIwUKRqg1agitQ0A.text: This place was amazing. Excellent food, impeccable service and super fun environment! Price was great too! We will definitely be back.

hg5AD2ONVoORiYzj7Rbx3Q.text: Super great Sushi place with all you can eat option. Reasonably priced. Seems everything in the menu is available. Everything we ate was fabulous. Went on New Year's Day so it was very busy. Anxious to return when it is less busy.

CnmUjZ5wTTlUVPRVzsMIww.text: Walking into this place I see "all you can eat" signs and then am presented with an "all you can eat menu" and a la carte. Looking at both menus ,most everything I would've tried on the a la carte was on the "all you can eat" so I went for it. And boy was I not disappointed. They have rules about the "all you can eat" menu. Some are 1 order person, some are one piece, etc. we orders the tuna poke, excellent , fresh and succulent , nicely spiced. Followed by oysters - fresh and tasty. Then onto the hamachi- 2 stars, Saba -3 stars and unagi-4 stars. For hot plates, we had the grilled Mackerel -5 stars and chicken skewers- 3 stars. We also orders the baked mussels which was meh. We ended this meal with plum ice cream -3 stars and mango mochi- 4 stars. All this was $21. Spectacular! We also got some hot sake to compliment the meal.  The service was excellent. Once u order, they leave a call button on your table and the servers were very responsive.  Will definitely come back here. It's off the strip about a 6 min cab ride.

Everything is awesome!  When I think of sushi this is the first name that comes to mind. Please don't waste your money on other mediocre sushi places.  This one wins.

Never will we return and I will warn everyone I care about to NEVERA Come here, unless they want to be harassed and SCOLDED for leaving rice. it wasn't even that frkn much. those a**hole staff for calling us out like that. OH! Did I mention that the sushi chef especially told us it's because we're KOREAN and he expected us to do that.

NTTTPr5KOOadjjgOiOWT6g.text: We were looking for great sushi in Vegas but everything was either too expensive, or a chintzy sushi buffet. We found Umiya and decided to give it a try and it knocked our socks off. This was the freshest and most delicious sushi ever, and for a ridiculously low price of $26.95 we ordered the all you can eat menu. Appetizers were amazing with a fresh tuna salad, delicious steak and seared tuna. The fresh made sushi rolls were among the best I have ever had, no crazy sauce just great flavor and so good. We ordered tuna hand rolls, ramen...you name it. We were stuffed and all agreed this was the absolute best meal we had in Vegas. Service was incredibly fast, even the hot tea and green tea ice cream were great. I could not recommend a sushi restaurant any more highly than Umiya. I cannot wait to go there again. A+++++

1RimIOzf-AJlTSTXg9L9Mw.text: Surprisingly good AYCE sushi hole-in-the-wall. Very accommodating service. Nice selection and very fresh tasting fish. The meat dishes I tried were not nearly as good as the seafood though. Stick with the fish.

3QWXTQ5outZ58-SAaQmX1A.text: This is a different AYCE experience.  We went for dinner and the menu was interesting.  Mini orders of ribeye, katsu, and ramen are available, as well as some specials.  The prices are the same as Goyemon, so if it's crowded there you could hop over here.  I enjoyed the tempura, salmon nigiri, ribeye, katsu, and grilled fish very much.  I was sad that crabmeat (the shredded crab in the california rolls) wasn't available on the nigiri menu.  It is a great stop for AYCE and some other dishes.  I'll be back.

Yeh8ZeUGU4HVfmP6ndMRrg.text: One word, spectacular! The all you can eat sushi might be the best deal in America let alone Las Vegas. If you are hungry head down to Umiya and you will not regret it, guaranteed.

87AYqQlIYEdDeh3vNmioTg.text: Umiya has always been one of my go to spots for great sushi within the area. Never really had any complaints except for my last experience. They were short staffed, didn't check in with us very often, and from time to time they would forget a couple orders. Even though these acts are forgivable due to past experiences, I feel that if you set a specific standard through each and every visit, you should always follow through with that high standard. I will in the future give Umiya another shot, but hopefully my next experience will be better than my last.

niFAnnvYG-H7HoTljGGxbg.text: This place is awesome! My family and I went for AYCA sushi on Mother's Day. The service was some of the best I've ever had at any restaurant. We were seated immediately with no wait. Our server Ron was awesome and took our order right away. We ordered roll by roll until we've had our fill. All the sushi came quick and was very fresh! I will for sure come back to this place, for the service alone. Ask for Ron he's a great server!

kRVzv-3TerTsr0XT2GwiPA.text: One of my favorite all you can eat sushi joints! The service is always top notch, and the food is fresh to death. I feel like not enough people know about this place. I always recommend it (:

d8udkwOOYz0tsjxNx7uzVw.text: Fresh food, awesome service. Best AYCE sushi I ever had. Wish we had this in Cali. Even the kids loved it! Definitely recommend.

nxUXwb3hRpQuupXiNAq__w.text: We were in Vegas for a weekend and ended up coming here twice! Fantastic service, delicious food, and a lot of variety for a great price. It's definitely worth the quick drive from the strip!

8PNfUEI0ge31Oo_yfiOXPg.text: Finding this place was very refreshing!  Food was great compared to any other sushi I have had in Vegas. Favorites are first kiss, Orange blossom and snow white. I love how you can order half rolls to see what you like. Sgreat experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster crunch, orange blossom, snow white and shrimp lover.
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg rolls. Wasnt a fan of these.
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goyza

-3JPEZAqCw5bs1_gYlXHrw.text: This is my NEW go to sushi joint :) I love this place. If I could change anything, I would make the "screaming O salad" not 1 per order in AYCE. This salad is one of the reasons I started coming here! Also, I would put some Cajun albacore nigiri on the menu. But hey, I love this place the way it is. It's sometimes crowded which is a good thing because it means other people like it too. Most of the time it's not crowded which is awesome too because...NO WAIT WOOOO! The service is awesome, they're always on top of things and the guys behind the sushi bar are funny. It's a pretty clean environment from what I've seen and they have all "A" grades from the health department posted up front. That means a lot to me! Awesome. Keep it up umiya :)

D4WWogKXT2hm8wqXv-aPpQ.text: I give them credit for how diligent the crew was and how accommodating towards our big party, but I did not really enjoy the food. Our group ordered a plethora of items and came across a few that even caught our attention. I prefer to stick to nigiri, but had a few pieces of the rolls.   If based on service alone, it would have been a four star experience even with all of the chaos. The whole group works in a restaurant and know how strenuous a group of twenty can be. They were great on that end.

K7FT7XDzgGn0r5sjyV35ZQ.text: 20 bucks for all you can eat sushi! Why not! There's so many food options in the all you can eat menu other than the normal nigiri and rolls. Lunch time is slow which means the service is great!

0ylN5YuCG7J49mtsObT8GQ.text: Ayce sushi served during both lunch and dinner. Totally worth the price. They have a pretty big selection of sushi and appetizers to choose from. Definitely will visit again.

HOygz65PY2MCBX8A_zw6wg.text: One of the best experiences that you will get. You are treated like a special guest there. The chef created beautiful art pieces for us from his training from over a decade. His artworks were carved with great details and the food was amazing. It is hard to believe that it is an AYCE place because the experience is actually better than most a-la-carte places.

kIAiQp-NwyV1aWX6K7RwrA.text: On our last visit to Vegas, we knew we had to stop by Umiya yet again and this time we were pleasantly surprised to learn they they offer half rolls... !!! Which greatly comes in handy if you get the "All You Can Eat " option, and want to try a variety of rolls, without worrying about getting too full to finish them all..

qvXU5D2U0nGmySR4AQW5WA.text: All you can eat Sushi, seriously? How can you pass this place up. Umiya is delicious and the interior of this place is fun and upbeat!! They bring the food out fast, presentation is beautiful and mmmmm!!! The banana roll is the best treat!! Great sushi restaurant. Definitely recommend.

r4pomB6ATGf2WUsv847yhA.text: Last two times we went service has gotten really poor and portions are less with more rice percentage. Music was too loud and staff appeared more concerned about each other (continuously gathering together) laughing, talking, difficult to get their attention but great they all are so happy to get paid to have fun together. Used to think was a pretty good place, but last time one of the sushi servings the fish was clearly spoiled (strong ammonia smell and slimy) we returned it and no one even said sorry or offered any accommodation for that. Serving spoiled raw fish at a sushi restaurant is very serious, disappointing the staff does not realize that.

_yVDHUmj9ZT0QsaOztdLSA.text: The all you can eat lunch was solid! Good quality Japanese food and prices. Just a 5 minute walk from the Palms.

2CnZMlaroeh7fJkvb8Fdqg.text: I have to say for $27 I was not expecting what I got. I am an Executive Chef and I was really impressed by the freshness of the Sushi. We went on a Wednesday nite and everyone knows that the WEEKENDS are the best times to eat fresh Sushi.  We sat right at the counter and I can spot fresh gleaming fish when I see it . After I saw a few orders of fresh fish go out and they looked delicious, I decided to give it a try.  I started with the halibut, next the tuna, then the salmon, then the albacore. I really was totally impressed and the place wasn't that busy.  Then I went for the kill, pork belly, rib-eye steak,  squid,baby octopus,fresh oysters. I downed a bottle of saki and some beer, took a little breather.  For my final finally I had bacon wrapped scallops,flamingo rolls. I had the lobster roll and it had nice chunks of lobster that you could really taste.  I wanted to try some of the nice desserts that I saw, but I was just to full, and I don't believe in wasting good food.  I am very picky about what I eat and I have to say everything was great. overall this is a great place and I hope they do well. I left a good tip also.  I will be back next week and so will my friends Anyone who complains about this place for the price and variety, are just some unhappy souls. I looked at some of the stupid remarks of others and for some reason they don't realize what their getting for $27.00 . On the strip I would have paid $150 or more for all this.  So for all the cheap complainers, don't expect Wagyu Filet and Australian Lobster when your paying McDonalds prices.  Some of these people think they are Anthony Bourdain. Learn to enjoy life , eat drink , be merry , leave a nice tip, and don't sweat the small stuff. Most small businesses really bust their but to survive. So be nice and be fair, before you go on a bashing mission.

ihMnUXMa8Xgt2g4kn-KAnA.text: RUDE STAFF. FUNKY FOOD. UNORGANIZED.   Right when I saw "Free mug for a Yelp review" I knew this place was a fake trap.   When we came in, we were not noticed for a good 5 minutes. Just standing waiting for anyone to help us.   When we were finally seated at the bar, we sat and waited for anybody to take orders for us. I asked the sushi chef if we order from him and he rudely told me he'll ask for the server. The staff were very RUDE and cold. Every time we tried to order, the guy would slam his notepad and say what do you want. They were so disorganized that they came up to us 5 times with food that wasn't ours.   The nigiri was paper thin with a huge chunk of rice. The rice itself was so dry and tasted very off. The oysters were disgusting. I almost threw up trying to swallow it. With as much lemon and ponzu on the oysters, nothing can hide that foul dead ocean taste. The seafood ceviche was even weird tasting like it was old. There was random pieces of fish from idk what part of fish. The ribeye was JOKE! It was so dry and thin that it couldn't been ribeye. It had to be some cheap meat on sale at Smiths.  THE BEST PART. I ordered tuna roll and it was literally 5 percent fish and 95 percent rice. I couldn't help but laugh because I've never seen a roll like this in any sushi place in my life!!   I also tried their ramen which was INSTANT RAMEN. I wish it said that or else I would of never ordered it. It's okay though, I used the ramen to hide my pitty tuna rolls in.   I was so disappointed at this place that I didn't even brother with a second round of nigiri. Save your money and go else where NOW!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free mug for a review. No wonder this place is so highly rated.
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

34sloZdpkIM8O6PpKuB3cQ.text: This place actually surprised me. I usually go to a different sushi spot all the time but decided to try something different. The atmosphere is amazing and it's not too hot. It's pretty spacious. They make your orders pretty quick and the Sushi is put together really nicely. Most spots get sloppy when they make rolls towards the end but this place was really good from start to finish. There are many different choices to choose from and that is the main reason it's so much better than other places. I will definitely come back!!

a86xZj6My3CR8Ve9Ogi9Xw.text: I heard very good reviews of this place and I have tried several AYCE sushi restaurants in the area. But I can say this was a sub average overall experience.  I stopped by for lunch and the place was less than 1/2 full.  Our first order of soup and salad took a few minutes to arrive.  The miso soup was cloudy and didn't seem fresh. The cucumber and seaweed salad were good.  The worst part of our experience was that our orders were messed up a couple of times and that it took over 20 minutes to receive several different orders. We noticed other tables seemingly receive food before us and were attended to more frequently.  I usually eat the nigiri and overall is was average and didn't seem that fresh.  The rice seemed to easily fall apart when dipping the sushi into the soy sauce.  The texture and overall taste of the rice didn't seem right.  We tried the chicken katsu, yakisoba and ramen and these were overall good.  The place was never over 1/2 full and with several people working there we expected the staff to be more attentive to us.

1qviVOqKRg5bwvnyq4BIOQ.text: Felt little expensive for a lunch, but when I think about the quality, it should be the way it is. If there were $10 half all you can eat, that would be even better. (It is just my idea.) Except that, everything from the parking to the service to the taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OyepXxzNIqsMj-423grwZQ.text: Unbelievable customer service and the staff is really friendly. Great price and atmosphere. Can't wait to go back to Vegas and eat here again.

7HStawkodkp4epAdaY5ieg.text: All you can eat in ninety minutes, oh the choices!!!  The portions are amazing for under $26!!! The hours are amazing too especially since you may not realize how late it is!!! Our server was very pleasant and offered up delicious choices! The entire crew worked constantly without overwhelming you with their presence.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The logo

cYu7L4YMURv65qtER0iMAA.text: Recommended this wonderful AYCE sushi joint by a resident friend. It's located in a small strip mall, but don't let that deter you from the quality inside. This little place ranks up there with some of the best AYCE I have encountered anywhere...and the $26/p is ridiculously cheap for the quality.   The menu was very extensive, the quality was exceptional and the food came fast...like 3-minutes from ordering to your table fast! Plus their waiters were very attentive and would constantly check in on you if your plates were getting empty.   I don't give 5-Stars often, but this place deserves it! Check them out!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of my best AYCE sushi experiences. Great quality, price and service!

jD3JD1TLkr7vmegyWJFsfQ.text: Best Sushi Place in town at the moment on 06/15/17.  This location has the fastest service with almost never a wait.  It has the freshest fish off the strip right now!  The open seating is great and I love the large wooden tables here.    The AYCE dinner menu is awesome and often includes salmon belly and other great bites.   The Garlic Ponzu sauce here is to die for and I use it on almost all my rolls.   The baked green muscles are great and all the fish comes out at the right temperature which is not always the case here in Las Vegas because it is a desert!    The fast service here and water refills really separate this place apart from the rest!  Keep up the good work!  Notes:  This location actually gives you a receipt with every item you ate even if it's AYCE.  I enjoy this because I can look back and see if it was worth the AYCE and I can see what we enjoy eating the most!  It's really amazing sushi.  The last time I was here I ate around 120$ if I was to eat a la cart!  * Update 01/15/18:  This location remains my favorite Las Vegas Sushi Restaurant!

-7-PDCVj1pNMgagQ_ve9iQ.text: I have already told every single soul I know about this place - I wouldn't say the fish was the freshest that I have ever had, or that the quality was too good to be True, BUT for the price of $26 pp, the food they delivered was definitely worth the price.  We were a party of 6, got to make reservation and was seated right when we got there.  Service was quite swift , we were very cooperative by writing down all we wanted in the first round, and the food came with no problem.  The second round took a bit more effort, we did the same and ordered with a piece of paper that we had written down but the food never came, and then with a bit of struggle, we got a little more than half of what we ordered. We were full by that time, so didn't even bother asking about it anyways.  Uni was good, amaebi was quite fresh, and best of all - they didn't make mega-sushi like a lot of the other sushi joints in US.  Most of the food was pretty good, the rice was decently made, not bad.   I think I will definitely come back again, and try the dishes that we ordered but never came..lol

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Carpaccio
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus

mlz53pLBTFQR5KRMJdCvRw.text: The sushi is kind of out of shape. The outside and inside ingredients are okay, but, the rice is sticky, which makes the sushi tastes weird in your mouth. I like the fried soft shell crab by the way.

2QNlpZ9Ees6W2QVo6xV-Zw.text: Arrice at the restaurant around 11:30pm(July 2,2017) and leave around 12:50am on July 3 2017!!!  Worst service (water and ice tea was never REFILLED, constantly keep on reminding the server where is our order)  and food preparation (everything tasted horrible and take minimum 20mins per order!!!) Soft shell crab roll was oily and shaggy, seafood dynamite scallop taste BAD, other sushi rolls we ordered wasn't up to standard all taste old, not fresh and also our rolls order keep taking forever to get to our table we keep on reminding the several different servers about our food order.   SIMPLY THE WORST EXPERIENCE I EVER HAD DINING HERE AT UMIYA!!!  Came back the next few hours later around 7pm (on July 3 2017) talked to the manager he took me to the back and I explain everything and he simply said I will talk to the owner and send me off my way. He took down my phone number and name but the manager or the owner never called me back with the follow!!!   I WILL NEVER EVER EAT HERE EVER AGAIN THE WORST EXPERIENCE I EVER HAD THIS IS SIMPLY RIDICILIOUS!!!

gAy4oUddFcUVKZ0X0NZKTQ.text: We tried this place for the first time no realizing they had all you can eat. So we tried the all you can eat for I think $24.95. The sushi was fresh and the rolls were yummy. They even had oysters in the half shell on the all you can eat.

-2OiuN3tUbOeoqkQKR2p6w.text: We arrived around 6:30pm and were immediately greeted and seated upon arrival. We chose to sit at the sushi bar. The customer service is exceptional! They are very attentive and friendly. The service and food is very fast. The fish is fresh. Best dish is the tuna tataki with AJ sauce. The Bunny blueberry sake is delicious. They do charge additional for fresh wasabi, but it is well worth it. Thank you Umiya! We will definitely return! New fav sushi restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon belly nigiri, Garlic tuna nigiri, Seared tuna sashimi with AJ sauce.

gS5PJ3XtqqHbX6Fgt9F6iA.text: I came here all the time and eat no rice roll "tuna naruto " I always change the cucumber to rice paper, this time the chef decide to bring me The same roll just to add there rice when I don't eat rice and without even telling me!!! When I told them that I don't eat rice and I always change the roll like that and always get it, this On my way! He decided that he can't make it so what kind of chef is it that can't make it. Besides that I order miso soup but they always forget to bring it!! Very bed service!!!!!

HDW1G5cWDJ1NSha_uE6Ksg.text: Sushi rolls were old and bland.  Nigiri were ok. I dont know how people rated this place so high. Our waiters were nice and fast with our order tho.

NBetfAp9ts3eXqycVZX4gw.text: Horrible! Went for lunch and spent the afternoon regretting it!  Bench style seating (sore back), some dinner only items on all you can eat, yellowtail tasted off as did some of the rolls. Much better options are local places away from strip to eat.

2KdZGzc5WKl-fT24r8toYQ.text: We've tried jjanga and tomo, and Umiya is our favorite out of the three. They have the best tuna and Uni, which are two of our favorite dishes.  They don't have as much as Korean food as tomo, and you have to get nigiri instead of sashimi. But the quality of the dishes (baby octopus, hot appetizers, the tuna and uni mentioned above) are definitely tops in this game.  One other really amazing thing is the speed - waiters are literally flying around and we got our food super fast.  They give you 90min instead of Jjanga's 60min so that's a win too!

PjxnREqx8i2-EVJrNO_HfA.text: I thought I found my favorite sushi restaurant in Vegas until we came across Umiya Sushi. This AYCE sushi place has it all. Well almost... Let me start with the positive factors first. They have a LARGE selection of specialty rolls, appetizers, entrees, and dessert. There were at least 4 staff that came to us filling our drinks, taking our orders, bussing our table, and simply just checking on us. We sat at the sushi bar so even the sushi chefs were catering to us. I love that because in my opinion, the best dining experience doesnt only mean good food but more importantly getting superior customer service. Everything tasted great! My favorite were the fresh and fried oysters, soft shell crab, and baked lobster roll. The only thing I wished were part of the ayce is the hamachi kama. That would just make this place hands down the best AYCE sushi place! The music was a lil' loud but it was just part of the fun vibe this place has to offer. I would definitely come back here! Keep up the great service and amazing food!

3WduE5CsCvMtzUxLdOIJ_A.text: Well my 2nd visit here was much different than my first visit.  This time around our service was pathetic!  Extremely slow!  The employees were border line rude.  We had to ask several times, to three different employees, about where our food was.  As it was taking so long to come out.  We waited literally 20 min just to get our appetizer of edamame.  And mind you the place was almost empty.  We were there around 2pm.  The food did not taste or look fresh at all.    I don't see myself coming back here anytime soon.

kv22L-lzXoD7mHiNVmmuwA.text: Plenty of sushi rolls to choose from and sashimi seemed pretty fresh. Some ordered lunch special and one ordered from the AYCE menu which has everything from sushi, appetizers, grilled items, desserts and drinks (90min time limit which is good as they take a while at times to fulfill your order). Good for groups with plenty parking.

cRsiwdXHbarjCxjKVinv9g.text: I honestly read all these reviews but I have to say I really enjoyed this place! I had by far the best service by I forgot his name but he has THUG tattooed on his arm. Sit with him at the sushi bar he takes amazing care of you! I hope I don't get food poisoning here next time I come but I didn't have any problems just a week ago!

bMq4X6wOK6KKsRjGlk7r0w.text: One of the best sushi in town. Great location, if you want to experience the China town, great price, for $35 you get awesome, awesome food. The trouble with sushi is, once you taste the good ones, you simply can't go back! Get in early, the place is always packed, I would say make it at 6!

P-g4NrNY3iRPabXobSf6Jg.text: We just had the worst experience of AYCE sushi ever. We were there for lunch today.  We planned to have sushi lunch for me and one of our group's birthday. We had been picking a sushi place for the whole week. One of my friends picked this place ad I was here last month for dinner. I told my friends I liked the interior this place. So we ended up here.  There were only 3 tables were seated when we got there. Our table had 6 asian girls with one baby. We got water all set up. Oh good. A server came right when everyone got there " are you ready to order?" well we hadn't even looked at the menu yet. We were discussing about paying dinner price to get sweet shrimp and sea urchin. then we ordered salmon nigari to start and the question we got was "so are you gonna pay lunch or dinner?" I replied "start with salmon nigari. it is in both lunch and dinner. and we will decide in a couple minutes" I got a little annoyed. We decided to just have lunch because some of us don't eat sweet shrimp and sea urchin.  Once we started ordering, one of the servers said "make sure you guys read all the rules" the rules are pretty much the same as the other AYCE sushi restaurant. No rice left, no sharing with non-AYCE, and so on. We all got annoyed. I understand the waitress was doing her job by informing us. but we all know the rules.  Food is good. We got our orders pretty fast. There were some confusion but we ignored it. There were two waitresses. on we got too many orders of grilled mackerels, and i told them "don't worry about it. I will eat them."   Here come the worst parts. They got more customers coming. There were only two waitresses. Our water and hot tea was empty. We had to call them and asked for refills. One time my friend pulled out her dr.peppers bottle to drink, the server came right at her "no outside food or drink in here" or now they were more observant with outside drink than our glasses of water that were empty. awesome job ladies! Morever, in the middle of the meal, the server came and told us "you have to finish all the rice" We know. and we were still working on our food. We were eating and having a great conversation. Our meal started to be ruined by. Another server came and picked the spoon in my miso soup bowl and said "you have to finish rice in the soup too" oh this is so RUDE. You can talk to me but you don't touch my spoon in my food that is right in front of me! I said "I eat my soup with rice" she said "oh ok because someone tries to hide rice in soup" I got so pissed. They spoke to us with attitude. honey, let me tell you here. If we cheat about rice, we make sure you can't catch me hiding all the rice somewhere.  Our group decided to not tip them because this was so bad of dinning experience, but the server dropped the check and said gratuity had been added. We still gotta pay them without gratuity anyway.  Lucky for the server that I saw a gentleman walking in and out the restaurant for a while. I decided to call him and asked "are you a manager?" he said "I am the owner" Bingo! We told him the food was great but the service was really bad. He said "talk to me, tell me everything" We told him everything. He said "they are trying to protect me" but they didn't try to have a good service to protect you from the bad review. We asked if he could take the gratuity out because there is no law to add gratuity in vegas anymore. he said it was in the system, then he handed us $20 to be a part of the gratuity we had to pay. The owner is really nice guy. One of our friends told him to the point "we are not cheap. When we tip, we tip a lot. We are in service industrial too. We know what is good what is bad service." We gave him his $20 back. Then he gave us a couple 20% discount cards and told us to come back. We felt like we could let this go and we wouldn't review anything, but we won't come back.   Unfortunately, the server wouldn't let us go. We put all the money in. Of course we are pain in the ass when someone is a B to us. We paid the check with all $1 bills. she said "Oh my god" why? it is the money too!!!! we tipped you! because your employer is nice to us and he protects his employees! I told her "we already talked to the owner"   ****GUESS WHAT SHE TOLD US? SHE SAID "it's ok. He is not the owner"****  They need to fire this girl. I feel bad for the owner or whoever he is. He could be a partner/a manager but he is her employer. He tried to protect her and took the money out of his pocket to help us pay for gratuity, but obviously she didn't protect him.  NOT done yet, we all were still sitting and eating after we gave her money. Only one of us had to stand up to hold her baby because she started crying. That server said to me "everyone has to finish the rice" more like yelled at me. I couldn't stand this anymore so I yelled back "I AM STILL WORKING ON IT!" god damn it! I didn't wanna finish my mackerel and rice anymore. We just walked out right after. 2 bites of rice left they can finish it.

OQQFh_L7eZwyJGeHEUZHBQ.text: This place kicks ass! There are a lot of hidden gems throughout Las Vegas that serve great food off-the-strip. This is one of my favorites.  Although it's AYCE, you order a la carte instead of going down a buffet line. The price is reasonable and the selection is very large.  One of the best deals in Vegas.   Getting there from the strip: If you don't want to pay for a tax, get on the Gold Coast shuttle from Bally's to Gold Coast. The restaurant is  a 1/3 mile walk down W Flamingo.

bzjes-J9lHmM0Nn2_oKdjg.text: We tried this place for lunch, we are from Arizona but try to get to Vegas a few times a year, mainly for the sushi! This place is our new favorite! Great atmosphere and nice and roomy. The menu is huge and easy to read, so many options! Their rolls are all delicious and appetizers and salads rock! They have awesome sauces that aren't too overpowering but still really delicious! You don't find these great sauces at a lot of other places! Nigiri is on the smaller side but we decided that might be a good thing so you can try more stuff and eat less rice! Their white tuna was to die for! Overall this place is a 10!! We will be back, and dream about this sushi for the next 6 months!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry mochi... I can&#39;t get enough of this stuff!
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy salmon hand roll... A little big and the salmon was kinda rough, but still tasted ok
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño poppers with spicy tuna, delicious and the peppers weren&#39;t too spicy!

67OhYGk_8BR39KbGm4VXMA.text: If no star was an option, I would defiantly put that instead. The ordering was very unorganized. The staff was pretty friendly and tried to help out as much as they could but still only seemed to be trainees. One female staff with black hair and chubby cheeks was extremely rude and neglected every request that was made. Even after the total negative vibe from chubby, she had the nerve to ask us to tip her even though it's an option. An older woman who seemed to be the manager was very friendly but all in all, I'll never come back.

wQN6QcQAebiH44PESchTPg.text: This is one our favorite places to eat when we come to Las Vegas. I was stationed in Japan, and this is the best Japanese food I've had since I left. I have not had a bad meal here. The sushi is great and there is plenty of variety. But my favorite is the yakisoba. My wife loves the teriyaki. We even brought our kids here once when driving through, and those two picky eaters loved it. I don't get to say that often.

dV9Xhis-UUACBDTkIJxJBA.text: Been here several times.  Each time, the service, food selection, and inclusion of desert make this place a great place for AYCE sushi.  Includes my favorite uni, soda, and dessert.  Don't come here if you are on a diet or trying to avoid carbs.  Heaven for AYCE searchers.

OH1vSgXg871HiXaquIWkyg.text: Seafood dynamite is the bomb!!! A mix up with my order of the snow corn roll, waitress brought me snow white, which was good but spicy & not for me. Finally the snow corn roll arrived and it was so worth it, the lightest, yummiest morsel on the menu imo. A few other rolls filled our bellies until we were stuffed. Had green tea ice cream for dessert then left. Yummy time!

8xcqKlIrjCSMNhy0pEeJQg.text: I have had a lot of ayce, and boy this one hit the mark. Everything is good except the ono not fresh at all. I ate a whole rack of baked mussels though. Lol. O would come back for more when I'm in town.

KzqxuXzNqJL3Zh0FjADOjg.text: Food is GREAT!! But SERVICE IS HORRIBLE!! We specifically asked for udon noodles without anything just noodles and broth, and we got just broth. I think the lady that took the order doesn't seem to understand English very much, and after we told her it was the wrong order she had a bad attitude like it was our fault that she didn't understand english! I love this place but that lady with attitude is ruining this restaurant reputation. Other servers are great! But except for her. She had long hair with bangs, didn't catch her name but I wish I did.

GaTCo-E00UOcn8Q14Rd_6Q.text: Fast, friendly service. Sushi was fresh and delicious. Bring your appetite for all you can eat sushi. Will definitely visit again when we return to Vegas.

YvcIxLt7ZpqSZMOGME1PQw.text: The food is really good in there ,even can't explain how everything taste with words. The service is excellent!!!!!! They really care about each of the customers , this is my favorite all u can eat restaurant in the whole Vegas!!!!! Umiya is the best!!!!!

u1gILTT7sv0VezyV0N2EsA.text: Best sushi I've ever had. Also the ice-cream included in the all-you-can-eat stuff is the perfect finish for a nice dinner.

aB12YCI6hksHvgcWKiGTIg.text: Went here to get away from main Vegas traffic and prices.....this sushi place is not rated accurately. Should be $$$ because of the pricing...probably to pay for all of the staff working. Basic philly roll was $9 and small glass of plum wine was $8.50....not a good value and the portion/quality was average.

sjdqGNdVD8F_IGp4ZWl09A.text: Great Sushi for a Great Price. Loved the Yellowtail Sashimi with jalapenos and the Peter Pan roll. Highly recommend and will be back.

wzjbeUdxPRIfFcFvN0sqrQ.text: I must say, the service is terrible. We were a party of 7 but one of us was a baby. So we bought 6 ayce lunches. The quality of the food is average but the service fell far below average. We would wait 15-20 minutes in between each order and they only refilled our drinks once throughout the whole meal. At the end, they included the tip for our 6 meals. I was alright with the included tip, but usually included tips for casual dining places like this establishment only charge like 12%. 18% included tip for fine dining. But this place had an included tip of 20% for 6 people! I believe they counted the baby. And they didn't specify it anywhere, or not anywhere convenient. I left feeling ripped off, especially for the service. Highly doubt I would return and I wouldn't recommend.

t-zchd5gS7xlw83HxR3Ldw.text: Umiya Sushi offers a good selection of All You Can Eat Japanese style dishes cooked to appeal to the American palate (and, given the AYCE option, American meal sizes, too.) Dimwits who deign to dine here with the expectation of "real sushi, like you get in Japan" are doomed to some much-deserved disappointment. This humble, happy restaurant offers fast and friendly service with a good selection of dishes prepared both quickly and well. We're glad we found it, and would happily return if we found ourselves in the area again.

N4QnfZzf0K2h9v1wFy8z8g.text: Best all you can eat in town.  All the sushi and the rolls made with easy rice, taste amazing, house special sauces are unique, good presentation,  a lot of items to choose from. I am definitely going back.

h_ItcDepqyg8rPWxtGuyoA.text: The ayce price is on par with other ayce places.  The uni and sweet shrimp were very fresh and good.  Oysters were tasty but only one order per person.  The salads tasted great lived the salmon skin and spicy seafood for the salads.  Pork belly is prepared korean style and tasted good.  The king of the ocean roll has lobster but the sauce used on it wasnt good.  For dessert they have plum wine ice cream definitely a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First time to umiya very friendly staff got the ayce.

UybC9flnS4VLlWE3CXp6uw.text: Started off with getting yelled at for the food that was handed to me. Was accused and wrongfully blamed for cheating their no share rules with the "All you can eat". I felt uncomfortable. I couldn't even offer an egg roll of my own plate. We tried to make it simple by asking them to put us all on all you can eat... and it took her 5 minutes to say yes... even when it's not disclosed in their rules that you can't change your mind later... I was humiliated in front of the whole restaurant...   I gave this a 2 star because the food was GREAT.

vs68SQsvR3r5W2L5PFpIHA.text: It is our first time visiting this AYCE Sushi restaurant on a friend's recommendation and based on service alone, I would have rated 1-star but gave it 2-stars for the average sushi.  The sushi nigiri is decent with good ratio between rice and fish (the fish were a tad dry, but I'll stop nitpicking). Miso soup is something I usually order FIRST from sushi restos but would totally avoid it here -- instant miso packets bought from a supermarket tastes way better! And the sad part is it's the first thing we ordered but had to keep asking for its whereabouts a few times before it was delivered. We also tried their tuna poke and fresh oysters which were excellent but then let down by the heavily breaded soft shell crab and sour-tasting calamari. And don't get me started on how awful the spicy tuna roll is, it's a simple dish that should be the least hardest to screw up on.  The service we received was sub par to put it kindly. Maybe we arrived after lunch rush hour and everyone is dead tired but I'm making excuses to understand why the wait staff sucked. Our inattentive waitresses (yes that's plural) often neglected us and kept "forgetting" simple requests like napkins, soy sauce, wasabi and then (almost) tossing in orders on our table as they flew by.  On a larger scale, it became increasingly annoying when we kept getting wrong orders and repeatedly had to ask for and follow up our sushi orders which we eventually gave up on and decided to move on and just pay our bill. In Las Vegas where there's lots of choices, including good AYCE sushi joints, Umiya will not be one of them.  I can overlook mediocre food, even bad food, but crappy service is unforgivable especially if the price point is higher than better places. At least I can tell my friend we tried the place and it was 'okay' at best.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna poke

77ptEyRzOsOTkxazYSIIyA.text: This was a great AYCE sushi place! Loved that I could order half rolls at the sushi bar! Great quality of sushi! I will be back!

QFJ4e3xOdatdkzjw0N59cg.text: Well to start we absolutely loved the food it was delicious, we have been here 3 times now and the first 2 times were overall good experiences,  this last time 8/12/18 was terrible.   Again though the chef's and food were great. but our service was the worst I've seen in a long time. we had a server at 430 when we got there,  she was great and helped us happily, around 5 we saw her walk out of the restaurant out of uniform assumingly on her was home after her shift. from that point on we got no service, no introduction to a new server, nothing. there was a least 6 other employees roaming around grabbing plates and occasionally the left over plates we had from before,  but never asked if we would like more food or how we were doing. I asked for a cup of water 3 times to 3 different people before asking for the manager. He simply said sorry and filled it.but still no further service. after receiving my check they spotted our table for 30 minutes again while I waited for water, and the would walk by and eye the check.but never fill the empty cups sitting in front of it.   food is a definite 5/5 service was a 1/5  paid 75 dollars for 3 people and received fast food style service .

6wOuNccNyD3t2ILKP0cZkQ.text: FOOD POISONING ALERT! Wish I would've read all the other reviews about food poisoning from this place before going!!  We were a party of 5 (first timers) and tried a variety of things. Mind you the service was really bad. But besides the point, one by one we ALL got food poisoning from this place. If we all got food poisoning, it gives you an idea of just how hazardous this food was. We went Sunday 07/29 at 4 pm and that same night my sister got diarrhea around 11pm and I woke up at 6 am running to the bathroom to vomit. Next thing you know I hear from everyone else in our group that they had vigorous food poisoning and one of us even went to the hospital (Doctor said it was food poisoning from the sushi.) I call 4 times before getting ahold of the manager through out the day and finally get ahold of him letting him know what happened and he said there's nothing he can do without all 5 of us going in person with doctor's notes and MAYBE he could process a refund. (As if hospital care is cheap and all this just for a $27 refund.) That if we had claimed the food poisoning RIGHT after the meal he could've given us a refund but since it wasn't exactly after the meal he has to "go through insurance to process a refund but only with paperwork stating the exact bacteria that came the exact fish they serve to conclude it was indeed their food" ALL OF THIS FOR A REFUND. Which in my opinion is the LEAST they could do for what we went through. (Btw Who gets sick RIGHT after you're done eating to begin with!?!) I was obviously pissed and told him well if you need us to all go through so much JUST for a refund then why don't your customers receive their own paperwork stating that your fish has parasitic microbes before feeding us and getting us sick in the first place? And this guy really said "because it's such a high volume of people, we cannot let everyone know of the circumstances we are under at all moments." Idk what he meant with that but sounds to me like he was admitting to knowing the food really is a problem. Well, to conclude we got nowhere but so far, two dreadful days of vomiting, diarrhea, fever, chills, dizziness, and muscle/bone pain. Horrifying.   Beware.. you are warned.

5Zqce6ULIwYiBDFB5Nqopw.text: Wide selection of appetizers but the sushi itself falls a little bit short... ambiance, decor, and speed is awesome... but the overall experience was just ok... but it's way better than yama

oTiJyxfDlN5z17qiv3oGGA.text: Food 8/10 Service 9/10 Atmosphere 6.5/10 Presentation 8/10 I can say that this is the best all you can eat Japanese restaurant so far.

M5K5Pwu0mrnikIOQLMnoMw.text: The all you can eat option is such a steal! Everything was really fresh, and not over stuffed with rice or fillers. I would skip the monkey brain appetizer and albacore nigiri. Everything else was pretty yummy! I also loved that they gave 1/2 roll options so you could try more with out wasting.

rOqx0tAfJfhKhQXcz2XORw.text: Food is great here.. Love the environment and great service. However I did all you can eat, one thing  i just don't like there is limited one per order for baked muscle, When everywhere else is all you can eat. I can understand if it's like ebi shrimp or yellow tails collar but baked muscle really..

PFyxk9cj-87nA89jJmFLRg.text: AYCE sushi a little off strip but it was surprisingly not bad.  We stumbled upon this place on yelp.  The only drawback is you actually have to verbally tell your serve instead of marking it on paper which can be trouble if you want to order a lot. For my case, I am too embarrass to say I would love 10 order of unagi LOL You can have up to 3 round and they offer green tea ice cream as part of the AYCE dessert.

ao5U6NpfnE8ay8kXU9R6VQ.text: The nigiri is definitely better than the rolls! This is good news in that the fish quality is adequate, but for $20 AYCE we were a bit disappointed. The servers were very friendly and helpful though, and we really appreciated the staff. The environment was good as well, but I wouldn't really recommend this to anyone as a "must eat" location.

cieI3MiMSNmDFWkLKpxj6g.text: Worst service you could imagine I walked in and took 5 to 10 minutes to sit at a almost empty place they only took my drink order never came back to check up on me and it took a long time for my food to get ready while I'm sitting at the sushi bar looking at them. food was OK but customer service was zero.

6_svcNMsyXuZ-4clXsu2zw.text: The all you can eat is one of the best deals in Vegas.  At 26.95 for dinner it was one of the best choices we made.   There's no limit to what you can order at one time, but several highest quality things are indeed limited to one per paying customer.  We had about twenty different dishes and all were good.    The quality of the food was spectacular for the price point.  Sushi was well done.  We wish we had a strategy going into it as we talked and ate then talked some more and missed out as the 1 1/2 hour time limit slipped by.  We kicked ourselves afterwards for not ordering more nigiri as we easily could have inhaled those morsels.    Located a few miles off the strip it did not disappoint.    Our strategy next time: 1. Look carefully at the specials and ask what the portion size is. (Example: the salmon kama was HUGE, whereas the yuzu hamachi could be thrown into your mouth with one-bite ease)  2. Anything limited, like the toro, max it out for the total of paying people.  Do the same for the fresh oysters and a few others.   3. While it's nice to have garnish dishes like agedashi tofu or edamame, we came here to eat, so don't bother unless you are a nibbler and want variety.   Caveat: they do charge for waste so don't go over board.    Service was excellent.  They work in tandem between bussing, table drops, and ordering.  Our guy was like the newest Spider-Man, "Tom Holland" was attentive, gave great recommendations and did everything asked of from a server.

9B6AGrN_orW2IinZLmGfOA.text: Usually this is my go to AYCE sushi spot, but the service has definitely gone down from the multiple times i've been here. My party and I ordered around 12:45pm ((and keep in mind that this is not the usual busy hours)), they brought out all the appetizers after 40+ minutes and we just wondered why our nigiri and rolls didn't come out shortly after. Come to find out that our server didn't put in our order, which she didn't apologize or even try to compensate for our forgotten order that we had to wait 40 minutes for. Instead another server decided to charge us for not eating a small portion of rice.  On top of that, usually when ordering nigiri the rice is half the size of the fish but it seems that they're choosing to up the size of the rice so that you get full faster :(  You definitely won't catch me eating AYCE sushi anymore, Island Sushi is the move!

_5_NzktPQp9QBHGUUMN6gw.text: One of the more solid AYCE sushi restaurants close to the Vegas strip. A block away from the Palms Hotel & Casino.   Their spicy edamame is one the best in town! Everything on the menu is up to par. From all the rolls to the house salad to the fish katsu. The people there are pretty friendly & very prompt with their service.

Rc9vRw-37ZbD5SHE_es1rg.text: If you're hangry af & need sushi fix, this is the place to be! It will overfill your stomachs with the good good :)  PRICE: - $25.95 for dinner AYCE - Half price for children up to 7 yo  FOOD: - They have pretty much every type of fish available including uni & fresh oysters. But for items like these there is a limit to your order (ex.1 order of uni per person) - Plenty of appetizers available including miso soup, ceviche, baked mussels, seaweed salad, gyoza, spicy tuna on crispy rice & soft shell crab - Full 2 pages of rolls if you're not much of a sushi person - Wrap up your raw meal with some meat (teriyaki, rib-eye) and noodles (udon, ramen)  - And don't forget... ICE CREAM! From tempura ice cream to mochi ice cream (1 per person) like o m g pls don't miss out on this!  - Some of my favorites were fresh oysters, soft shell crab, garlic tuna, uni, eel, mackerel, and mochi ice cream!  SERVICE/ETC: - I wouldn't say the staff is welcoming/nice, but they're quick and do what needs to be done. - No limit on "rounds" just keep ordering!  - Love the ambience inside: open & modern space with slightly dim lights. And there's a full bar!  As you already know, AYCE doesn't offer the best quality of food. But for such cheap price, food here is not bad AT ALL! I was surprised at how fresh some of the fish were. Definitely coming back on my next visit!

VLN_81-QVAVUVbM2QoHCIQ.text: Delicious food, service here is really really good compared to other ayce sushi restaurants.

QwNhQlCUtvScpSdg1151qg.text: Never judge a book by its cover! This place has delicious food and great service! Dinner is the best bang for you buck, arrive early or call ahead if possible. This place can get crowded on the weekend! Also they have great music!

g9tdtV4MkclCuocFeHh4Kw.text: Excellent sushi. My wife and I had AYCE. We ordered  our favorites- pork belly, fried salmon skin, baked green mussels and then we went down different roads. I ordered one of my favorites- a rainbow roll and also tiger roll. Everything was made with top grade sushi. It was melt in your mouth delicious. The service was good the place was packed. Definitely a must try for any sushi lover.

FHS2kdBe-X8Zlqvz1JFnLA.text: Pretty good.  .  Located off of flamingo, it is convenient to that too, and right next door to a Japanese mini mart! The Ambiance is nice, welcoming and very busy. I can see why they're all you can eat sushi menu is deep, and cheap. Lots of different choices, and I believe it was only $25 for dinner. The sushi was good nothing blew my mind, to be honest my favorite part about my meal was the Yuzu lemonade. Yum! I would be back for sure, but with all the competing sushi places in town, it might not be for a while.
