_XsZtdRIArTl1Akw5_MVUg.text: Umiya never makes you disappointed!! I love their appetizers.  Not only sushi but also other side dishes are very delicious~~~ So~~good!!!

R7wIMWEWL1fTSHuCHEdxlA.text: LOVE this place !!! They're my new go to whenever I'm craving sushi ! Food is always so fresh and yummy. And the staff is friendly. My favorite is the crazy boy roll :)

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. :)

OIwO-q4Wl2BjV4f4D6AZ3A.text: This place has good sushi but I mainly come for their appetizers. I usually come for the all you can eat (AYCE) for 25.95 after 3pm. They have a good selection of rolls, but I don't think they are to die for. A lot of their rolls come with the sauce on the side instead which would make them taste a little better. I feel that more often than not, I feel unsatisfied after ordering roll than I do at other places. The service is great though and they are always quick and respectful. I like the ahi tuna selections and the dynamite is my favorite appetizer.

e3qs-xkaMZI694e7m-EirQ.text: Really good sushi for ayce n the srvc here is very quick n friendly. Def will come back for sure

An0_SN7BMkV45AygACSTKg.text: First time coming to umiya and went solely based off of yelp reviews. Boy am I glad that I ate here! Service was quick and excellent! The choices were endless and the food was extremely delicious. Set and setting was extremely spacious with medium to loud noise. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone that is or isn't even in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice little perk for customers that leave yelp reviews!

EJ3mDgD78-onBXuHRrDUtA.text: AYCE or e la carts sushi with rolls drowned with toppings and/or sauces. If you want authentic and delicate style where you eat from the best fish downwards (i.e. Otoro) ... Skip it.   What Japanese restaurant serves soft shell crab with sweet potato puree?! Oil needs a change.   Least the Uni is good and service is fast.  Lastly, my fault for not reading the reviews, and based the choice on ratings alone (damn you law of averages). Had we known, we would've went elsewhere.

MZIAwhpWjfesYVkiO-JZUw.text: Great place. All you can eat and a great menu. Service outstanding. We sat at the bar and ate like there was no tomorrow.

AwFYL0VaN_CT3t63Jd4pHg.text: This place is beautiful!   I loved the ambiance!  Love the long tables with benches & the sushi bar!  We came for AYCE sushi with our local friends as this is their fave spot.  It's located about 1 mile from the Strip & easy to find in the strip mall.   The food was fresh & yummy!   I normally don't like cream cheese in my rolls,  but the Japanese Lasagna was pretty good!  The portions are good sized.  We ordered lots of different types of food, shrimp tempura, grilled squid, sushi rolls, hand rolls, nigiri & oysters.   The Snow White roll,  soft shell crab with ono was delish.   Yellowtail hand rolls were amazing with nigiri sized fish with minimal rice.   It was $22.95 for lunch & $26.95 for dinner.   You only get a few extra items for the dinner menu such as 1 order of amaebi, 1 order of uni & a few other things I forgot.   The service was great as there werent too many people when we were there.   Music included today's pop along with the videos.   Check in offer: free soda!  We'll be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail &amp; Salmon handrolls!

N_rM86xxs5JsG9MovOY-iA.text: Best sushi in Vegas!!! Very authentic food, atmosphere is very chill, prices are decent. Currently my go to spot for sushi. The rattle snake roll is the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp fried rice is perfect!
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yaaaaas energy roll!!!

sjLYqIlhxvCbEyTCpkkegw.text: First time here!  We love it! Why you ask???  Food - abundant choices! I love an AYCE with choices in every category...sushi, appetizers, skewers, salads and even dessert!  (ps...my ramen was piping hot and that's a deal breaker for me)  Service - very attentive and polite. Staff is very welcoming.  Totally worth $26! So come hungry people!

7gNnPAblDlFRZgdSkvqIwg.text: After searching around for an all you can eat place I settled on Umiya after reading the reviews. Came here with my family right at opening and was promptly greeted than seated by the staff.   Service was excellent and friendly with food being made and presented in a timely fashion.   My parents had the assorted sashimi lunch and the chicken katsu bento while my brother and I went with AYCE. Needless to say we are happy and stuffed.   AYCE order:  Ika Yaki (grilled squid)  Unagi (fresh water eel)  Rainbow roll Hawaiian roll Dragon roll Shrimp tempura roll Chicken and veggie skewer (yakitori)  Red snapper  Yellow tail Ono (white tuna)  Miso soup

WbQ0UqtovlS4OAx5xDMzYg.text: Second time here..and hands down the best all you can eat sushi! it's great they have a special board that you can order (one time) definitely recommend this place after you're hungry for late night sushi!

hQ92Rkp7GPvrGb3-HlJgTA.text: I would give this restaurant 0 star if I can! Bad bad bad service. none of the food really stood out....we  3 girls went to eat. The YOUNG manager charged us 10 dollars with 3 rice left over. If only 3 dollars we would pay. ALSO he had really bad attitude and threaten us that he would call police if we don't pay the 10 dollars....... At the end he throw the check on the table. We were really scare that he would punch us to face at the moment..... Never come bk to this place...

cplOaI_0VRJEE13WUpkQhQ.text: Best service ever!! They seemed to rotate their servers, which I liked. They never missed a beat. All you can eat is the way to go! Phenomenal

n0JiiwGV50BFgCoVb2wkZw.text: Tonight was my first night having dinner at Umiya which my friend brought me to who is a regular there. The food was amazing!!!! Such good quality and great miso soup. They had the best sushi rolls I've ever had at an all you can eat. But due to the lack of customer service Amy had I will not be dining there again if she serves me. I will make sure she does not serve me. Everyone else who serves there is beyond nice and welcoming and accommodating. I don't know what Amy's deal was but I was very bothered and disturbed by her service. I did not take it up with a manager but next time I will.  3 stars because Amy is rude. Would of been 5.

aet17p8JZ_07lPg_k8KHAw.text: Food is acceptable but the Japanese steak tastes like the dinner box I can purchase at Walmart with 2 bucks and the service is bad. One waitress barely speak English, and the whole staff spoke in Korean at the bar where I was sitting during my whole visit made me kinda uncomfortable.   The bright side is one waiter was really attentive so I tipped him but not sure that he would get the tip.

zcLAvpZdONm3Qwx1Cn1KIg.text: Bomb! Soooooo good! And all you can eat? Wow. I loved it here. Definitely will come again next time I'm out that way! So yummy and fresh!

RuXVGk56nTRpjII83huhig.text: This please has a great atmosphere and really good sushi!  The service here is amazing and the staff are super nice. The orders comes out decently fast and they don't disappoint. The location is a walking distance away from The Palms so if you have a movie date or have friends in town you got some place to go before/after.  I would have given them 5 stars, but the only thing that brought it down was the ice cream~ they have them already pre-scooped and frozen into the bowl so it was a bit of a struggle to scoop out (my daughter is still young, she couldn't dig her spoon in without the bowl flying). Adults will be able to serve themselves but it's still stiff. Put the bowl upside down and gravity will be on its side.   So... Get the mochi!   Other than that! I will definitely come back again!   **Updated** I came back here and their ice cream is way fresher now! Thank you Umiya!!

g5NWw_BG-hLt6j8FuU8D4g.text: I will admit that all these reviews lured me to this place. And I should've expected that ayce means that the sushi is decent not amazing. I was disappointed with the rice to fish ratio for the nigiri. Too much rice! Also the rice was hard and cold! The different pieces of fish itself were perfect, soft, room temp and delicious.  Some packed with explosions of flavors, but that rice killed it for me and my bf.  The baked mussels were yummy. Lots of mayo, the way I like it. You can still taste the mussels too. Some places make it so that the sauce drowns out the flavor.  Their other dishes that aren't sushi related were amazing though. That rib eye steak, the soft shell crab, chicken katsu and tonkotsu ramen were delicious. Service was really good and overall, my bf and I had our fill and left satisfied.

EKk2Ogwop-8SpB_l_PEY5Q.text: Went here for dinner with wife and kids.  Both of us got food poisoning (kids are fine because they didn't eat raw fish).  Even before getting sick the food was not very good.  Everything tasted weird and unappetizing.  We stopped short of ordering our fill and left with a larger than expected bill.  Wish we had just ate at the hotel.

cSf8pqRInQAx20w6E0mBdA.text: Came here with three other people at like 2pm on a Saturday. We were seated pretty quickly after like 15 minutes of waiting. Once we got seated, my boyfriend and I checked in on Yelp with the waitress to get our free sodas but our 2 other friends were still logging into their accounts.   They apparently switched waitresses on our table and another girl came; with whom my other 2 friends showed their Yelp checkin. My boyfriend and I told our new waitress that we had already checked in with a different waitress. No big deal.   However, halfway through our meal, our waitress came back and gave us problems for not checking in with her on Yelp and asked who we had checked in with and whatnot.   ...it's a free soda...it's not a big deal...relax lady.   Anyways, staff was overall a little rude and unhappy the whole time. The food was okay but the service could definitely be better.

dlhwId9s3_9pNlShVkj-Jw.text: I been to umiya for second time already and this place never disappoints me. This restaurant serves the most freshest uni nigiri in town. To stand corrected all the nigiri fish are fresh here !!! I love the location of this place Becuase it's close to my house. Customer service is always  great to us would definetly visit again with a whole group of friends and recommend this place. Also it's a plus here when you write a review you get a free mug !!!! There you go yelpers.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iVd9SJ5spwLKMNYfiRKt_w.text: This was me and my wife's first time here. We yelped it. We came here cause they had 4 1/2 stars. This was a great choice I made. We will come again. Place is clean and vibrant. Service was fast and friendly servers. Food was great!!

EzmnA-wavb9z_JbrOoldnQ.text: I ordered to go. The sashimi platter which was $19.99, hamachi lover $12.99 and Agedashi tofu $5.49 maybe?   The sushi value is the worst I have ever seen in my sushi eating career.  The sashimi is probably about half of the thickness of what it should be, they are so thin that they seem to be transparent. The Hamachi lover roll is super tiny.  The only good thing is probably the agedashi tofu, which has decent quality.  I never had their all you can eat, but I don't think I will be back for anything.

RYcr1P-52Cn2OOvNb1jvOg.text: Let me start off by my experience was pleasant until the end.  Service and employees where attentive and prompt. Food was not the greatest but definitely delicious (4 stars when it comes to food)  My experience changed when I was treating my guest to dinner. 199 to be exact.  I left my card with the server and waited to receive my receipt. This is when one of the employees comes back to the table and ask "who does this card belong to" capturing everyone's attention. That's when the employee said loudly "your card is declined." I was speechless and felt uneasy because of how it made me look really bad. It seemed like the employee was happy to say it was declined.   I called my bank and they said they did not receive a decline and to have them try again. So I went up to clear up the situation and fix what happened. I saw with my eyes the card declined and had to use another card.   Anyway, I asked for a manager which seemed like a young kid compared to the gentlemen that embarrassed me. When I explained what happened he told me in a calm not really caring voice sorry. He said he will talk to the employee. I felt like no justice was being served so I mentioned I will just leave a Yelp review about my experience. He just smiled and continued with business.  So I went back to my table to ease my guest and let them know the bill was paid. As we were leaving the young manager tried to apologize and made up an excuse to say his English was "bad" and that he will have a discussion with the staff. The employee even used broken English to say sorry.... here the crazy part. The same employee that was using broken English was pronouncing "who does this card belong to" and the word "decline" in perfect English. Maybe dropping the YELP hint changed his heart to make discipline sound more serious. It was too late after giving you the first opportunity to fix it.   I would have given this establishment a 5 start rating until what happened at the end.   All my friends agreed that this place was great until the employee changed the whole mood.   I'm definitely not coming back to this establishment.

jFSNYQEANczJjletSspCZw.text: Everything is amazing.  I ate till I could eat no more.  Thanks Curtis!  Awesome waiter.

jZv_EyB8edpv1eSWwsILcQ.text: I would say this is a decent AYCE sushi place. The fish was mediocre. There were some that did not taste as freah. The ono definitely did not taste like ono. There was too much rice on the nigiri. Overall decent, definitely have had better.

PcFQNfUZ7G3GPu5y1dEmCQ.text: Dangggg it's hard to believe I didn't rate this place last time I was here!   I love AYCE, but then again who doesn't!? They have a little bit of everything here! Rooks, nigiri, ramen, hot and cold appetizers and some entrees and dessert! But of course I didn't have any room for desserts....  This place is clean, hip and the staff is super friendly! Unfortunately at AYCE places, service is generally not that great.... but this place isn't one of those places. Our waitress was super cute and friendly and pretty much knew what we wanted lol. Then there was a male waiter that was almost too much. He was funny and was having a blast at his job which is alway awesome to see!  They have certain items that are only available with the dinner AYCE so we just decided to get that. I mean $5 more to get uni, salmon belly, tsubugai and much much more? Why wouldn't you!? The only sad part was that the amaebi didn't come with the fried head... but I can over look that the quality and variety that umiya had to offer!

The sushi was 4/5 but the service was above and beyond spectacular, 6/5! So many staff members checking on you and your drinks. Keep the Asahi coming.   As for the speed of the food coming to your table, wow, blazing fast! Ok, we orders A LOT OF food and thought it would take a while. Nope. Super fast. Thank goodness because the wait was about 40 mins. Well worth it. Talk about hard to find good AYCE sushi places. None exist in Seattle. Sorry Todai but you weren't that good even when you were open. So, next time I'm in Vegas and craving sushi, here we come Umiya!

Z-wcd4oqqrfPCeUoHJePqw.text: 4.5-star?  Either I went on the wrong night or Umiya Sushi isn't as good as it's advertised on here.  I ordered an assortment of sushi and non-sushi items and I can't say any one of them stood out.  Everything did have a common theme and it's that NOTHING was fresh.  The white tuna and the sweet shrimp had this fishy (old) odor emanating from them and the other fish were sticky, kind of like when you sweat and it dries on your skin.  Overall, not worth the price or the quality.  I understand that Las Vegas isn't exactly near the ocean so the fish is probably sent in frozen but everything just tasted like it was on the verge of going rotten.  The staff kept messing up our order and the table next to us had to tell the waiter/waitress several times that they didn't order something that they brought over.  Not to mention, the staff were a bit rude in trying to rush us out after less than 1 hour into our meal just because people were waiting and we weren't even close to reaching their self imposed 2 hour limit.  When they start suggesting that you order ice cream, that their hint for you to GTFO.   Needless to say, I'm definitely not coming back.

ZsKaIvm1ocOyrOgtZd9QJw.text: Overall a great place to eat but very average. Not one menu item blew me away. This is much more a case of quantity over quality. I would probably go back but there's far better sushi places around such as sen of Japan.

8_ZE77DfXivudmCIFjzAPw.text: (Read all the way to the end! Saved the best for last!)  We visited Umiya for a late lunch AYCE, Tues. around 2:30 and there was only one other group seated, so virtually we had the whole huge open place to ourselves. (Liked that!) Once seated, it took her about ten minutes to come by and take our first order. I'll say only one thing about the service and that it was chilly but businesslike: take order, bring order, clear plates, take order, bring order -no eye contact, no smile, and no re-filling of beverages unless we requested. It is what it is. I can usually warm up any chilly server, but not this one! Might try sitting at the bar next time so as to not be 100% reliant on the server.   Nonetheless, the food was pretty spectacular. If you're familiar with the AYCE sushi scene in Vegas, you get a little hard to impress after a short time. This was a happy surprise and I'm delighted to be impressed after so long...   The menu was indeed very extensive. I'm sure you could visit many multiple times and never duplicate, yet leave full and happily satisfied. Since it was our trial run, I took some tips from previous yelpers...  1. Screaming O salad: did not like this - it was like a mayonaise soup. Steer clear if you don't like a heavy-handed dose of the stuff. 90% mayo, coating of thick mayo on top, three thin slices of ahi underneath, and some lettuce swimming in the watery mayo soup at the bottom of the bowl. Now we know... 2. The snow white roll and orange blossom roll were FRIKKIN AMAZING. Snow white roll -each individual piece of the roll is ever so slightly grilled, so it has a whisp of a smokey flavor. My little tastebuds were freaking out. Insanely good, and so different! Orange blossom roll was also enjoyably different. 3. Red Rock roll - kind of forgettable, but I do remember thinking, "ugh, more mayonaise?" 4. Rib eye steak - was just ok.  5. Now, there's one thing on the menu we discovered this day I would place in the "EXQUISITE" category. The bacon wrapped scallop skewer. O. M. G. These tiny little gems come two (ONLY TWO?) to a skewer. Just trust me -you're going to want a few of these. I popped the first one in my mouth, and just had to sit there for a moment-what was this? Sweet, salty, chewy, fluffy... what? I just stared at my pal across the table. No words. Eyeballs scanned the restaurant for next closest waitress/server. "Yes, another one of these, please?" I forced my now-stuffed table-mate to try one because they are that good. Crack. Bacon-wrapped-scallop CRACK.  6. Mango mochi for dessert. Couldn't hold a candle to the sweet candied bacon wrapped goodness I just described.  Few little notes: - I could imagine a full house, with such a big open space and all hard surfaces would get pretty obnoxiously loud. Prepare, and time your dining session if that would bother you.   -They charge $2 for green tea. This really chapped the hide of my dining partner. He was personally affronted -like they were charging for breathing air. Again, so now you know.  - Service with a little charm doesn't cost anything, but apparently its not a priority here. Ok, got it. (The food outshines this aspect of Umiya.)  Overall: excellent and delightfully impressed, will be back, again at an "off" hour.  (Let me know if you like those bacon-crack-skewers, too!)

PdQZnWcLT24woLITv7F0IQ.text: This is place is so good, it has delicious and great quality food. It's my favorite sushi place. The service here is amazing and the staff are friendly. The AYCE is the best. 5 stars!

ODReRRw2bXV-eOHZftX0Yw.text: Ate here in Sept 2014, all you can eat was really good and I didn't really feel that it was overloaded with rice. I ate 5 rolls to get my money's worth and the rolls were awesome. Wish there was something similar out here.

rUII-Eq0mHM20ASpZDGzUw.text: Yuuuuum!  This is our go-to place for sushi every time we visit Vegas. The seafood is always fresh. Love the Uni and the oysters. Too bad there's only one order per person.  Can't beat the price for the quality of AYCE sushi you get here.  Make sure you make reservations and a yelp check in gives you a free soda.

fs51n6gDQenHRHujwxBtzA.text: I came here after my friends and I realized how long the line was at Goyemon. That was no problem at all for Umiya since they had no wait!! We were seated promptly and got straight to ordering. The food was excellent but the customer service was subpar due to the fact that our orders got lost constantly. We had to keep reordering the same dishes. Also, our waitress took awhile to get back to us in between orders. Other than that, good food + no wait will keep me as a repeat customer.

VY4yAURoSO19FTg3LkSaSw.text: Great Japanese sushi only issue is the drinks aren't unlimited but its something stupid

Pj8WDs2LOPS0yQstAJPB_g.text: Came here with my friend cause she was craving sushi...staff was pretty nice..I liked my salmon avocado roll, but I don't think my friend liked hers too much...but mine was fine...it was a really chill place. Close to the Las Vegas Strip

IsG3vYuQvCNBuXJW9OaWWw.text: we just keep coming back... fresh and tasty sushi, nice crew and chefs makes this place top 1 on my AYCE sushi in town!

sYmFhRjdvPYV9NBxVXWTZQ.text: I come here often and I am never disappointed, whether it be for the ALL YOU CAN EAT or just a salad and a roll they always meet my expectations. The rolls seem pricey, but they are quite big with lots of fish "stuffing." My favorite roll and I recommend this to anyone who loves avocado, spicy tuna or will try just about anything, has got to be the AVOCADO TRAIN. It isn't on the AYCE menu so I'm always torn between my options, either I go with the Roll and salad option or if I want to fish out and do the AYCE. My fave salad is the Spicy Tuna Salad, They add chunks of fresh tuna on a bed of greens with a tangy dressing, quite satisfying and not too heavy. All in all I highly recommend this place. It is small, quite, the staff are friendly and if you get bored with your companionship they have music videos playing on a big screen ;)

3XlgnthK4W06uLJTp0To6g.text: This place is delicious, sweet shrimp, super white tuna, uni, sea bream, scallop, octopus.... SOLD!u

KSCzmpW8R1gtqKju9vbv7w.text: Love this place!!! Best all you can eat Japanese restaurant I have ever had! Foods are really delicate and servers are friendly.

45oAUh3tOwYcDNDuyQXbxw.text: I've been knowing Alex(the head chef) for 5years now and following him as he transfers from locations to locations! Usually when i go to ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI, i kinda give up on quality of food. However with Alex, you still and always  meet the perfection!  Last night I was at Umiya with my friends and we were doing al la carte ( i usually do all u can eat) since we were not that starving. As soon as i sat at the bar, i ordered an order of uni sushi which is $8.50. Seconds later Alex came up and gave me an apology saying they actually do have uni today but it's not worth the money since it's not that fresh. Then he recommended salmon sushi which was only $5. I was so impressed!! He could have served the uni and took it off from the bill only if and after customer complains about it! But he is always honest with the food he serves.  Try their AYCE SUSHI! It's cheap and you still get variety Japanese food! I will absolutely go back to this place!

m2hGoL_8U7XkYRzhT6kC5g.text: Best ayce sushi restaurant in town ! chef alex makes the best sushi, I dont even have to order. He already knows what I like and prepares it for me when he sees me walking in. 5 stars all the way

reSloFbtnV3CKO4yiuA9wg.text: In a city where all-you-can-eat sushi is at nearly every corner, it's hard to be the best but somehow Umiya has done it. The past two years I have eaten here at least two dozen times and have even celebrated my last two birthdays here. The atmosphere and sushi is great, and the menu offers something for everyone (even those that don't like sushi). I have never had a bad experience here and even my sushi-snob friends have become Umiya proponents. If you want the best sushi and service in town, Umiya is where to go.

IdSw3SIJgPE2Gq5UZMDdfg.text: Really good food and service was great. Would definitely recommend this place to my friends that come up to Vegas from Hawaii. I really enjoyed the poke. It had a lot more flavor than some of the poke back in Hawaii

27VS5f6pFK_JceqsTIOW8g.text: Hands down the besttt all you can eat Sushi Spot in Vegas!! My bf and I are HUGE foodies. We eat out all the time and this has become our new favorite spot. We've tried 3 other ayce places and this place wins by a longshot. We come here a few times a week now. The Screaming O Tuna salad is amazing. So are their oysters. Favorite rolls are the Japanese lasagna, Vegas Lasagna, and Lobster crunch rolls.

Mo8Tm3Uz6Fqi1nEGScnAqw.text: One of the best AYCE sushi restaurants. Loved the halibut, ebi, and fried soft shell crab. We especially liked the coffee mochi ice cream.

-Ntw9LB2JcoP0G5hZDa88w.text: Delicious sushi. ALL YOU CAN EAT is the way to go. Friendly staff, clean dinning area,descent prices, nice settings and yum, yum, yum!

3Cm-qEt5A7iM2OJt9lhhQg.text: High quality, delicious sushi. Easily among the best in town, plus an optional all you can eat menu that doesn't sacrifice quality means this place cannot be beaten, in my opinion.

zJbQxxAr5lH1eECKnRcvIw.text: Great find! My boyfriend and I were looking for some sushi spots around that weren't over priced and then we found this hidden gem! We got soooo many rolls, they have an all you can eat for 27 bucks and all you can drink for$10 more. Let's just say that just because it was all you can eat, it doesn't mean the food sucks. food is fresh, owner Alex is so fun to talk to and everyone is so attentive to you without sour attitudes. Menu has many options so I was happy, just don't order more than you can eat! Will defintely be back!

giemABEMqE9weA80Cbmmqg.text: This place is awesome !!  We came in for lunch and they had a all you can eat option !  We did that and had appetizers and rolls !  They even had miso Rommen included in the all you can eat option for lunch !  The service was spectacular ! The best service Iv ever had at a sushi restaurant !!

1-yncjf8Td_qqOCdcuANXw.text: I took my friend here for his birthday and its GREAT!!  The vibe is nice, KPOP music videos projected on a big wall and nice lighting overall. Their noise level was loud but I don't personally care. They shouted a lot to each other in Japanese so if you don't like random shouting, don't come here haha  Staff was very attentive, constantly refilling drinks, taking orders often (good for AYCE, because you can keep asking for more and not worry about time!!).   The food came out fast, tasted amazing, and they didn't even charge us for leftovers like at a usual AYCE. I had never experienced much sushi beyond a few basic Cali-rolls and I think this was a game changer on my opinion of seafood!!  My suggestion is that they get Ramune!! I was sad to see none on a Japanese menu :( also to pick up the random litter in the bathroom!!!

VBkANRNnwy1MQdt1YGl-Tw.text: I can understand a lot of the reviews here. As far as my experience is concerned, I think 3 stars is fair. But, I'm leaning more towards 2.5 stars.  This place used to be the old sushi Kaizen. Never been to that one so I would have nothing to compare it too.  Came here with a pretty large group, and suffice to say, the service was excellent. The server did a great job taking the orders and made sure that each person got the correct dish, even while she was taking care of other tables as well. I also liked how we were able to order from the runners and bussers when she was busy.  Food wise, everything was mediocre to OK. One thing I had to mention was that the rice wasn't really good, it tasted like it had been refrigerated or undercooked. It was weird. The fish quality tasted average at best. As many of people have mentioned, they make the rolls and nigiri pretty fast here, but presentation isn't really their strong suit. And, they are pretty heavy handed with the sauces. I did like the chicken katsu roll, something that I have never had before. But, don't be fooled by the miso or tonkatsu ramen that is on the menu. It isn't late night Goyemon's. I ordered the miso ramen and it was their regular miso soup with instant ramen noodles LOL.  I definitely like trying new AYCE sushi spots. But at this place, I would have to probably have to put it in my mid to lower range spots.

etT5pZylOFG_qzfPzfIMfw.text: This is the review for AYCE. If you go there for AYCE, I would say it's totally worth the bank of the buck. Food is ok. This is the place I will go for quantity not quality.

hNPCQS3vVcSSp63JMbcJlA.text: This is your average sushi place. The quality of the food is okay although certain items are good, like the fish nigiri. The order of the food that comes out can be drastically improved. For example, I ordered a miso soup and a salad and they both came almost near the end. If you go during peak hours, expect to wait with slow service.

znKsg1yHWX0MkQI2C22PCw.text: I have dined at Umiya many times. Seems as if every time I come back the quality of the food gets worse and worse. Last night, the rolls that came out were inedible and contained none of the ingredients listed, ALL RICE!!! There are a lot of amazing Japanese restaurants, I do not recommend dining here. Definitely left a sour taste in my mouth after last nights experience!

jCsUlAOOPsrT2SNDLhB_HQ.text: First of all this place has great food and quality. My family enjoyed their food a lot. But,   They have horrible service. When we came around 6:30, they told me that it was going to take an hour and 40 minutes. But when my mom asked again around 6:50, they told us that it was only going to take 20-30 minutes. It was dinner time and we were all hungry. My mom got up to just look at the waiting list to see when our turn was and the waitress who was in front of my mom gave my mom an unpleasant look and started talking to the waiter next to her saying "That lady won't just sit down and she keeps wandering in front of us" like my mom was some annoying person who's just randomly annoying her. First of all, my mother is not just "that lady". She is your customer and despite the fact that we are in a restaurant, isn't it just straight up rude giving someone who you don't know at all a nasty look and talking about them? I was just so mad and shocked about how they treated my mother.   It was just my mom, my brother, and I who went to eat. As I was eating, I can see and hear with my two eyes and ears that the servers were asking around "How was the food?" or "How is it going so far?",yet all we got was "Are you guys done eating?" like they wanted to kick us out and bring in new customers. I know. Dinner time is very busy and they had a lot in their minds but they were treating us like we weren't going to pay and just take off or like we've been staying there for hours which none of it is True. Those services just started to make me think "Is it because they see my mother as a single mom or something?" or because it's just two weak women and some 7 years old kid.   Eating dinner outside with your family means having a meaningful time outside with your family by spending money. I am not sure what my mom did to deserve this kind of service but it was terrible and I was just so furious.

aTA2ZuhW51QlUI0-XuAjJg.text: Went on a Sunday afternoon and got seated right away. The staff was very attentive and got most if not all of my orders correctly. The food was amazing and they even do lunch prices on a weekend. So for $20 AYCE sushi, can't really complain about that :)

jsmuSEnYJEcHuom9cT9S6Q.text: Worst service ever. The fish is NOT fresh, okay some places aren't fresh but AT LEAST THEY TASTE GOOD.  LOTS AND LOTS OF RICE in their sushi. The servers don't want to be there and don't know how to handle large groups. Overall, I would never return.

N7J-wpqI-jo1yY1PrNsKZA.text: Ate here for the first time recently, and was so impressed! The food was great, and the service was amazing. Someone was constantly ready to take our next AYCE order, and everything came out super fast and yummy!  Will definitely be back :)

ZSv9uZoxPsAdADTCPEj7_A.text: "LISTEN" UP! Why do we use Yelp??  To find the best food/deal/experience...right?!  Simply put...This is THE PLACE. Ignore the bad reviews.  Haters are always haters.    Atmosphere: Big screen TVs, good music, upscale (not typical home in the wall place...very nice "nightlife" decor).   The comments about attentive, awesome service....CORRECT  Food/Fish/Portions Quality: Outstanding (Try the Lobster Roll, Las Vegas, Baked Mussels, Octopus, Salmon & if course...the Tuna) BTW...The chef dropped me a few pieces of Toro just to show how legit everything really is.    Poke is BANGIN & Seaweed Salad is fresh.    Sake & Beer: About 10-12 solid brands (sake) & all Asia beers.   I humbly consider myself a sushi expert with 400-500 sittings globally (yeah..avg 2x month x 20 years), as well as the son of a famous chef....(growing up in a kitchen has its benefits...later in life)   If you've read this much....stop & start driving to Umiya.  You'll be writing a review after you recover from the awesome meal your about to experience.    Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Tataki Roll with the rockin Star Wars chop sticks.
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Tuna Hand Roll with Baked Mussels (custom order baby)!

PGLQQePzouSxiQFu2kNH3A.text: First of all, sushi chef greeted us once we came in which is always a good sign. The waitress forwarded us to a good seating area in the back. Nice lighting.   The shrimp tempura my gf ordered was really tasty and it was crunchy just how I like it.  I ordered the baked salmon roll and it was so good! A little too much on the sour cream though, which was alright. I had also ordered baked mussels which I can't get enough of. Definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp tempura roll

jK_T8KPLiBm7tWjFqrXZ3w.text: I have no idea where all these good reviews come from because we had a shitty experience. When we first walked in we were not greeted nor asked if we can sign up. 3 people saw us just standing there and would not acknowledge us. Interior was beyond sloppy and their restroom was so dirty. We asked to be seated at the bar and it sucked because you weren't even allowed to order sushi from the chefs. Completely defeats the whole purpose and the bar is so high you can't even see how they make your food. Sushi was good but not great. I mean honestly nothing was great here. Then to put the cherry on top, my boyfriend order ramen before we closed out and it never came. We asked for it twice and nothing. Talk about waiting for over 20 minutes. We paid and left. Never coming back here ever again.

k9rJWuuK-7iRqr6Jm_C19Q.text: Def not as good as expected, low quality fish and weird combos in rolls. The only thing I liked was the monkey brains (fried tuna stuffed avocado)

XQjmldq4YzPf2T4OQ7cUCw.text: VIP Service.  Freshest Seafood & Sushi, Friendly & Fast Service. Sake is so yummy & smooth:) Everything is Reasonable priced, 5 Stars:) Everyone was pleasant & attentive:) Valentina R.

HCjS2k8ank-3b6IGWPoq2w.text: Sat at the sushi bar one night and the chef was spitting mucous over and over in the sink and he didn't wash his hands after! Food tastes great but this is horribly unsanitary around RAW fish! Will never return.

wN7As_mEeIKm03DE0xtZow.text: I am a huge sushi fan and this place is great. There's a huge selection of rolls. There's also a lunch time special where u get 2 rolls for the price of one, can't beat that. The service was good. We were seated promptly and we were asked if someone had taken our order about three times after it was taken which shows there is efficiency. Food didn't take long and the bill was reasonable.

g-YPhv_4GrUlfFx7PpBxFw.text: Amazing amazing fast servers! This is my favorite sushi spot in Vegas. Such an amazing vibe in this place! You feel like royalty with how many people serve you! Great food and very well decorated! Came here on my birthday and had a blast! Thanks Umiya! Xo

JQjVNHguvDci7Eh8SCVexg.text: Best sushi selection and service in LasVegas, by far. All produce are fresh and tasty. All the staff is super nice and intelligent. All this at a great, all you can eat price. Simply the best!

tojDjthDYW-6d3L0vtCg2w.text: The BEST place to go to for sushi in Vegas. Service was great and food was delicious. Definitely coming back!!

iUjf8g6iIbUUXlJP93Ry9Q.text: great service!  very fast service and the waiters were consistently asking if everything was alright. definitely recommend!

0bm1XvysbISBgUA3NI3xrg.text: I've had really terrible sushi before and coming from SF where the city prides itself on it's culinary skills I thoroughly enjoyed this place. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. I've done a couple of all you can eat places in Vegas but they're all relatively the same. This was awesome because if was purely sushi and fish. We checked in through yelp and got a free beverage (non alcoholic)! The garlic tuna nigiri was tasty. We also had the orange blossom, salmon killer and cinch lobster roll. Sooooo good. We also had the spicy seafood salad to start. Again, delicious. It also comes with dessert. I had the tempura green tea ice cream. Definitely going to come back next time I'm in LV.

-Y7GxJT5QTUKMsuBZCBCvw.text: You can't go wrong here!! Near the strip, the food is great, and Alex the owner is funny and entertaining!!

xANHBz-VNewyrB4HPBDBMw.text: Eh. What can I say? Just a sub par AYCE sushi restaurant. Everything that was ordered seemed rushed and slop. Nigiri- maguro, hamachi, ono were all cut thinly and uneven, as if cut with an old knife. The tako was clearly over boiled and fishy which suggests it was cooked, frozen, then thawed again. All skewers were overly sauced taking out any flavor of being grilled. Miso soup was warm by the time we got it and lacked any seaweed or tofu. We did order one maki, a cucumber wrap instead of nori. That roll actually turned out to be quite refreshing and fun.  The wait staff seemed like they wanted us out quickly as they insisted on picking up the bill 3 times prior to us finishing our rock hard mochi ice cream. Pretty persistent on us leaving considering there was only 3 tables dining at 930pm on a Sunday night.  I don't know if I'd come back here. Though I'm not a fan of most AYCE sushi joints, I'd suggest Oyshi over here any day.

Ef1lyEl7PwBELuDzKxvibA.text: So if you read my previous review of Goyemon, this is where we came in place of the crowded. It was my first time and my sister thought I'd the place better. She was right as usual. Umiya was located in a small Japanese plaza right next to a starbucks. As soon as I walked in, the cool ambience and decor already began to soothe my hangry (hungry  angry) mood. Our server Jay was polite and got us our drinks quickly. He took our orders promptly and our first dish came out in less than 10mins! Every dish we tried was very good. Although, we didn't order many rolls because we thought it would fill us quickly, between the three of us, we ordered a lot of food. I felt like I was at an expensive course menu restaurant. I ended up having 5 courses in total with a tempura ice cream dessert. Jay probably refilled my diet coke 10 times which I appreciated as it was a seperate cost (even though with a check-in on yelp you get a free soda!). All in all, this is the evolution of Las Vegas buffets. All you can eat Japanese buffets have been popping up and all I could think was..how could the owner afford to keep this place? The quality of the food was outstanding, everything came out cooked-to-order, and service was 5 stars. The establishment was clean, the ambience would be great for a date, and also suitable for business meetings or hangover cures in the low light tents they have set up. Excellent Gem of a restaurant. I really don't understand why this joint wasn't busy while Goyemon was packed. Umiya is a few minutes from the strip and an absolute must eat in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our final damage. Came out to about $70 for 3 + $15 tip. Definitely worth every penny.
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yakitori Baby Octopus (must try/1 per person) and Fried spicy rice cake

9_tJ6FuJE222VFdYeMMVYA.text: We had all you can eat sushi we don't live in this town decided to eat before a concert engagement sushi chefs not hands on the food was good my husband had tempura which was delicious. The rice was different and good price was a little pricey ok the atmosphere was good

VMNugIhkL-3_B5FEJzkSKA.text: Found this little hidden gem a few weeks ago and glad I did. Their all you can eat lunch special is one of the best in town and the fish is always fresh. Service is always prompt and genuine. The place isn't large but they make due with the space by using nice polished picnic tables. The only thing I don't care for is the awful Pop music videos they play.

qkDEgFCe0PB8cfPB2ZDVFA.text: Good sushi! Was in vegas last weekend to visit friends and the year before these friends took me to Goyemon Sushi and i loved it. This time around they insisted i try Umiya and compare it. Was not disappointed! The calamari tempura roll was my favorite. We tried a lot of the sushi on the menu as we were a big party, and needless to say we left pretty satisfied. I'm not saying Umiya is better than Goyemon, i think they are both great. It's just good to be able to try a new place in vegas that serves high quality sushi. Will be back!

TJ3lPbySAxwVSyLBL7hbSg.text: Did the all you can eat and was able to try a bunch of things off their menu. Great selection. Service was okay, but I think it was our fault (they have a button on the end of the table and we never used it). Will go back next time we're in Vegas

kpBdxD2KCIelTE8m1_Fo4Q.text: Wow.  I have never been treated so badly at a restaurant.  I showed up with two guests.  Half the restaurant was empty but we singed up for a waiting list and told it would be 40-45 minutes.  We went and grabbed a drink and came back 30 minutes later and when I asked about the status of our table I was told it was going to be another 40 to 50 minutes.   What a joke!

Adxb2E1YMLN21EnYPuOVgw.text: Stumbled upon this place since we had a two hour wait at Kaya and needed to eat ASAP! Definitely RECOMMEND this place for beginners to advanced sushi lovers!

R_QN22dW0hKHxAI1feNj5w.text: First timer. Prompt and good service. Enjoyed the large tables to fit all our orders. Recommend salmon belly, yuzu hamachi, and garlic tuna.

H2Hqvw5fnV58PpLYbagijA.text: We came here with a group of 9. A few of us had maybe 2 spoon fulls of left overs when we were done eating the "all you can eat sushi." 3 people had 2 bites of salad. One had a bite of rice left. One person had a spoon full of soup at the bottom of her bowl. When we were done the server came over & told us if we didn't finish those last bites of our food they would have to charge extra to the whole table. Really? What if we didn't like the food? You would still make us eat it? Then the server didn't know how to ring up the bill & tried charging us extra anyway. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone! It's like a prison camp where they are constantly watching us eat and checking our plates as they take each one away! Not a good way to keep customers coming back. Oh and they put extra rice in every sushi roll to get you full faster...

WK7VjCHSnZCZeM3GQjN_WQ.text: Can you say yum! Great service and a wonderful place to try sushi for the first time. It's reasonably priced and people friendly! Love this place!

X3Xlf9_sgj-WQlX9jT6SNw.text: The ambiance was very nice. Although they were playing Korean music in a Japanese establishment which I thought was a little weird.  The food was very good. My daughter had a Philadelphia roll and a fried shrimp appetizer. They were both very good, however the salad dressing on both salads was not very palatable.  The service was good, they offer specials during the day ends late night. We went in on a Sunday night that turned into a Monday morning at midnight and they were unwilling to honor their Monday through Thursday, bonus. This was due fact( as they said it) it's still Sunday to us. Ok but to the rest of the world it's now Monday.  Anyways the service, ambiance and entree items made up for the music and awful salad dressing. 50/50 on return since it's far from us.

O81oD1ucNfprNTwwNdR-XQ.text: This is our go to sushi spot. It is all you can eat and delivers in quality and freshness. The staff is very friendly and can accommodate small parties to very large parties--we have dined with both types and they service stays consistent. The rolls are very well-made and have a good ratio between rice and fish. The appetizers are also really good and are included in the all you can eat. They offer a big array of sides and apps that you can order from if one isn't up to sushi. The uni is also always fresh which is hard to find in a AYCE place. So happy we found this place check them out!

mvUF9tV4luVUbsnx8ackzw.text: We landed in Vegas Saturday afternoon and had some time to kill before checking in to our house for a party. We wanted to stay off the strip and Umiya checked all the boxes we were searching for (off the strip, good reviews, sit down restaurant style, full bar) ... we hoped in our Uber and headed over.  Upon arriving, umiya is in a strip mall which was a bit disappointing for me initially, but I suppose most places in Vegas are strip malls. I'm from San Francisco where we don't have many at all. Once inside we were pleasantly surprised with the open, chill, modern, laid back decor. We were greeted by a friendly hostess and sat within minutes.  We ordered a couple appetizers and 3 rolls.  The egg rolls were just kinda gross, which I don't usually say about food. They tasted more like mashed potatoes than egg rolls, just mushy and flavorless, and a texture that no egg roll should have. I had a salmon roll (I forgot the name) it had crab inside and salmon / avocado on top. The crab was imitation, which wasn't labeled on the menu, or I would have asked for real crab, overall it was tasty but the sweet sauce they put on the plate, and then put the roll on was not good. It also came with tobiko which was not listed on the menu, or I would have asked for no tobiko. My guy enjoyed everything he had except the egg rolls & miso.   We still had an hour to kill when we finished eating and felt very rushed by the staff. We asked if it was fine to just order some drinks and chill, it was Saturday afternoon and there were still a ton of empty tables. They were fine with that, but the "attentive" service seemed a bit like they wanted us to just finish and leave, so we did.. after being asked several times if we wanted anything else, and let them know we'd catch their attention when ready for another drink.   Overall  Ambiance- surprisingly very nice. Bathrooms are a bit dingy, but not bad!  Service- friendly, fast, attentive   Food- great salmon & tuna, bad egg rolls & miso

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg rolls. I&#39;d pass, they were very mushy. More like mashed potatoes
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California roll (right) and a spicy tuna &amp; avocado roll. Was told they were both delicious!!
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Imitation crab inside, salmon and avocado on top -very tasty, but I did not like the sweet sauce.

QKoiV-7qdWCAJo7lVZkL8Q.text: My friends who live here took me here in December 2018/ & January this year 2019 ... loved it... food was great large variety... of tasty food all the plates we ate.., staff good no bad attitudes or vibes.. So..,we are going tomorrow July 14,2019.... cant wait

jgf7-iAkwipoMqwoYaKS8Q.text: Umiya Sushi is definitely a must if you're in Vegas!!   The AYCE sushi was reasonably priced and had amazing options. From speciality rolls to regular nigiri and temaki, for an AYCE place they did it well and right! The sushi tasted amazing and all plates were cleared at my table somehow!!  Being mixed Japanese the quality was good but the rice to fish ratio on a few rolls weren't the best for some of the specialty and cut rolls. But for an AYCE sushi place you aren't going for perfection of the roll, but just the food itself. As I said before, the taste was amazing!  What I love most about Umiya was that they had such an amazing menu apart from the impressive sushi menu. From salads, to oysters, to fried appetizers, to soups, to even things such as ramen and udon!  If you're in the mood for a lot of food and for an understandable price in Vegas, go to Umiya!

YIH8uyoct84iPLX2PwfSlg.text: So good! 4 adults, 12 rolls, 2 orders of gyoza, an order of edamame, chicken teriyaki, 4 saki and 2 beers $144. That is unheard of for such a good sushi place. Super friendly staff and the food was really good. Smaller rolls but very tasty! Glad we ventured off of the strip (a few bucks by Uber) to try this place as it was recommended by a friend. Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Edamame Fried Gyoza Sexy Roll Spicy Rainbow Roll Shrimp Lover Roll Lobster Tail Tempura Roll Las Vegas Roll No Money No Honey Roll

CYMbaX2fvAwrlWb0-1SVQQ.text: It's okay.   I've been with my friends to h20 a few times. It's got a much smaller menu than umiya but it actually has more stuff I care to order over and over again.   The orange blossom is still must order here, but every other item just wasn't as satisfying. It's still an okay place but it'll be a long time before I try it out. I'll either check out somewhere new or hit up the new old reliable.

blQFtt26GzBgBH7gaC_L2g.text: underwhelming. The 2 stars are for the service received . The waitresses were very pleasant although a bit uninformed it seemed . We purchased the buffet and left hungry ... HOW Didn't like the sushi at all.  The super white tuna was the best . Don't go if you have high expectations for authentic sushi . The fish katsu was dressed in a sauce ? Fish Katsu is amazing & they managed to ruin it .

2-y_4Lt-5kaYy0Kl0AFO9Q.text: This is one of the best sushi places in town in my opinion! Every time i go i do the all you can eat sushi (because why not lol). Their garlic edamame and gyoza is my favorite and honestly i could eat those alone and i would be happy. Their sushi is always good too! All of their sushi that i have gotten has been fresh and super tasty. The only reason i had to give it 4 stars was because the last couple times we've been there, we've had the same server and she is extremely rude. She kept rushing us and cutting off our orders. The girls at the front also didn't even greet us or make eye contact with us until someone from a party behind us raised their voice. Other than the service if you're looking for good food you won't be disappointed!

3STggMy1wzPFII5Q2ornVA.text: Probably closer to a 3.5 stars because the sushi was fresh but the appetizers were pretty mediocre.  Lunch price was $20.95, which is still a good deal since I usually just order nigiri and apps and skip out on the rolls.  I ordered unagi, seared salmon, yuzu yellowtail, salmon belly nigiri and my favorites were the unagi and salmon belly.  Make sure to check the specials board - that's usually where the good stuff is listed. I was a little baffled my the seared salmon - it was only seared on the edges and not the top like most places.  It seemed like just regular salmon because of the minimal sear.  I did like that the pieces of fish were big compared to the amount of rice.  I ordered the bacon/scallop skewer - this was also sad because it's like tiny bay scallops wrapped in bacon.  The whole thing was probably the size of my finger tip.  The "sausage" was literally sausage, like polish or kieblasa....=(  I was thinking kurobuta sausage for some reason, so definitely skip this, not worth your time.  The breaded shrimp was good - think shrimp ball but fried but of course limited to one order.  Overall, not bad, but also not the best AYCE sushi place in town.  Super busy, I went at 2pm on a Sunday and the place was packed with people waiting.  Korean owned establishment.

vsGe8iLy627jtp79XuWiCQ.text: So I have a favorite sushi spot but my friend said this was suppose to be one of the best places around. While I still think my fav spot is the best these guys gave them a run for their money for sure. We order this roll called the orange blossom that was to die for. The fish was fresh and the portions were good ( no tiny all you can eat pieces). They do have an all you can eat menu but we only ordered to regular rolls. The atmosphere was fun. They played lively music and the crowd was boisterous. Service was average but nothing to complain about. If your in area and want sushi this isn't a bad spot to check out .

JXroa4zotoSj-zXoVlRKCQ.text: This is another sushi restaurant with all you can eat options. If you go during lunch time you can get this for just $20, the only problem is that some dishes are very limited.  I usually order sashimi with salmon, tuna and yellowtail. Unfortunately, the fish had a very fishy after taste (u know what I mean). There were some decent sushi rolls like the Lobster roll, but in general the quality of the fish was not as good as some other places. The customer service was very good. The server was friendly and very attentive.  Overall, another average all you can eat!

7RdiuDih7XwPEnJ1IWvq6Q.text: Q: It's Black Friday and you're with your family of 16 and you need to find a dinner spot cause you're not gonna eat another crowded buffet... Where can you go?   Rest assure friends. This was definitely the highlight of our Thanksgiving day 2018 family trip.   It's a Korean owned Sushi spot. My favorite. It's pretty good. Get the AYCE menu.   They have great options from rolls to non-rolls.   My family totally enjoyed it and big ups to the owner for busting our the fresh Kim-chi.... Who knew they had this?   JY

OS00XGIa_VJbR2zk_Hgu6g.text: Tried a different sushi place with my wife from our usual sushi spot and it did not disappoint us. Umiya Sushi is really good, it's clean and the staff is friendly. The waitress even gave us a sample of their import sake. There was a lot to choose from the menu and the food was delicious we were very satisfied.   We sat at the bar and boy it had space compared to the usual bar tables where everybody touched elbows. I felt closer to the sushi making experience and had room for all my orders. It was not overcrowded at all here and easy to get around.  The vibe was great, good lighting and the music wasn't too loud and overbearing. My wife and I had a great time.   Service was super fast and We got our orders right on time ! Excellent service from the staff I give this place  Two thumbs up

zPHTf1GTLcHbWkjIP_hBnA.text: Tried the AYCE for a lunch on a recent trip.  Sitting at the sushi bar, I did find it a bit strange that I needed to place my orders with the waitstaff rather than the sushi chef  Sushi was pretty good, it wasn't soaked in sauce and to portion sizes were pretty good for AYCE  For what it is, and where it is - I might try it again

diU-yjHynXupru_yzb0HtQ.text: OMG.  I've found my sushi spot!!!  Walked in on a whim with a friend.. I happened to be starving and they happened to have "all you can eat".. the cost of 2 good rolls would of been the same, so we got the ayce.  We sampled the egg rolls, edamame, tempura shrimp/calamari/veggies, chicken satay, a fried softshell crab, and a shit load of rolls!!!  I love that they allow half orders (4 pieces) so that we could sample different ones!!  The attached photo doesn't even include all the food we ate!!  It was all sooo good and the service was great!!  Only issues is that 90% of seating is hard benches with no back, which is awful on my back.  Next time I'll wait or call to reserve one of the 4 tables with normal chairs.

fMtvmK6AilKlwrgImaCGtg.text: Not my favorite spot in town for AYCE Sushi...but the one I frequent the most due to the combination of service, quality, and AVAILABILITY! Umiya has been consistent across several visits the last couple years, so when the topic of AYCE Sushi comes up these days, it tends to be our go-to option. My love and I are fans of nigiri, while our girls also like to mix it up with rolls. Umiya serves a good enough quality of fish with their nigiri that the adults are content, while the huge selection of rolls means everyone is pleased. And while sushi is our mainstay, we will venture into other types of food. There are certainly enough options that a non-sushi eater **pausing to sigh and shed a tear at the sad plight that some endure** could easily fill up on noodles, skewers, tempura, katsu, etc. without straining for options.  You don't tend to go to AYCE Sushi for the ambiance and Umiya doesn't really buck the trend. It's not that Umiya is bad by any means...mostly a large open dining room full of several long tables with bench seating...and as such things can get loud during their dinner rush. That being said, the tables are large enough that you have your own space.   I love that you can call ahead for reservations. Umiya goes on a wait wist during peak dinning options, but when we've made reservations...or even just called ahead 30-45 mins before we arrived, a table has been ready for us. This could just be our luck, but after more than a handful of visits here the last couple of years, I'd like to believe that it's the norm.  As a nigiri eater, the most import thing I can leave you with is a note on the specials board. There are a couple of wax marker boards hanging in the dinning room, and another at the sushi bar itself, that list some special that are in that day. These typically include some premium items that have a limit on how many you can order, and my favorite items of the night are typically listed here...such as salmon belly and madai. Make a point to check it out!  AYCE Sushi is a category all to itself. I'm a fan of Umiya. For me they are a very strong 3 stars or a weak 4 stars, but I have to lean to 4 stars.

wRdVDg7oskOTbKUvV4BPBA.text: Umiya sushi was very tasty. The service was slow. There were to many servers and bussers but not enough chefs to make the orders. Their selections were good.Overall this ayce sushi place will get another visit from me.  P.S. call early and make reservations for a table to avoid The long wait.

irroFUXSmxuU3cnCXLdRZQ.text: My boyfriend and I were looking up sushi places back at the hotel and decided to go to this one because of the high reviews. I've never been to an all you can eat sushi place before, but I've had some real good high quality sushi and a lot of yelpers said they have fresh sushi; so I had to give them a try.  It was near midnight and there were a few groups. We didn't have to wait, we sat at the sushi bar. I was real excited for the AYCE menu. We ordered a variety of sushi and sushi rolls. The sushi didn't taste fresh and the rice was hard and dry. It tasted as if they used regular rice instead of sushi rice. The sushi rolls were nothing spectacular. They were very simple and was not worth it.  I don't think I do very well at AYCEs. I was expecting really fresh fish, but they didn't deliver on quality. I'm beginning to think Las Vegas restaurants are overhyped. I've been to a few with high reviews, but they've only disappointed.  For the same price I could eat a simpler, but fresher sushi meal elsewhere. Our server was friendly and attentive, but the sushi chefs looked arrogant and rude. They didn't talk to us much and we ordered some sushi rolls from them, but they didn't seem happy and even frowned as us.   For some reason, I don't usually give second chances if my experience was horrible, but I want to come back when I'm in town; so I can see what this place has to offer. Perhaps it was a mishap, perhaps they do suck. Only a second visit will tell.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Leo36O39c8sqLiDZIjlrGA.text: Not sure whether if they changed ownership since the last visit, the fish on the sushi's order gotten smaller otherwise, it's similar to last time.

vwN7yxs3cee9jKgrM4OoCg.text: The place stinks ... right when you walk in the fish smell hits you ... we could not stay.  A group of 4 decided to leave.  Can't comment on the quality of the food

otq2RxrLLC0bb-8vWJi3Og.text: Never again. I used to come here all the time. We live here locally. Now all of a sudden they are taking appointments of the phone as "reservations."  It's a joke. You walk in and you the only person waiting with Multiple tables available and your told a 45 min wait. You are there tables are ready and they are holding them for people who aren't even there. They just. Lost me repeat business for good. Frustrating!!! By the way hostess was too busy taking a phone call reservations and ignored us while we just stood there.

VsXARYPWyPIDuUkA0HkMdQ.text: The West coast does sushi different lol but its good. Great selection and that all you can eat was BUMPIN. If your going during dinner time you might have to wait that place is popular but it's worth it. Sushi maaaad good.

JpoYu6IJgYo30SQicVtCbw.text: Sorry after eating at many many of the all you can eat sushi places in town, I feel like this place is just not as good.   Came on a weekday night and the restaurant was not very busy so we got a seat right away. I do have to say that the service is very good and at any point when our drinks were low they would come refill it without us asking. That is always nice and a change from most of the other sushi joint.   There were a few creative appetizer items such as the monkey bring, which was decent but over fried. We did order a bunch of nigiri sushi and for the most part the rice was huge and the piece of fish was very small. Generally I would say the ratio is terrible compared to many of the other places in town. I do like that they have a variety of other items on the menu there appetizer menu is quite extensive, and they have 5 different skewers as well. The quality of fish was decent, but we did order the salmon belly special item and it tasted very weird.  I would say overall a decent experience, but the rice ratio really made this place rather disappointing.

vnrJLmdCTLW7wpWX-S6YUA.text: So yummy. I always fill up on the soup and veggies, but Umiya is our date night ! I love the AYCE sushi. The service can be slow sometimes , but always friendly and anyone will help you, not just your server. Now I'm craving sushi!

7KsCu0u0GE2ZMrj08TnPjA.text: We consider ourselves sushi snobs. This place is fantastic!! We always do all you can eat. The food comes lightening fast and it is ALWAYS good. This is one of the most consistent sushi restaurants we have ever been too. The food is always great and fresh. The staff is always so sweet and friendly. They clean off plates right away and refill drinks very quickly. We never have to ask for a refill which is rare now-a-days! The restaurant is always very clean and organized. It's not too far off the strip and it is definitly a must to stop in. We go every single time we visit Vegas... sometimes even twice!

PVr9NznTVYRgS4JEA02HvQ.text: My number 1 spot for All You Can Eat. You cannot go wrong with Umiya. Everything I've had te here is really good. My must haves are the Orange Blossom rolls, Sashimi in AJ sauce and the ceviche, and that's just naming a few.

Znvvh11QWEmhDZYDrav0Kw.text: A popular recent discussion in Yelp Talk of Las Vegas has been about overrated businesses. Well, count me in as puzzled at the 4.5 star average rating of this restaurant.  I first tried Umiya Sushi back when I was frequently exploring different all-you-can-eat sushi restaurants. Although I did have a positive impression at the time, it ended up being a one-and-done visit until tonight because it wasn't nearly as good as other AYCE sushi spots. My group's options were more limited late at night though, and we settled on one of the closer ones.  There are certainly some positives this meal. Some of the highlights from my first visit were also standouts on this trip. I enjoyed the tuna sashimi with AJ sauce and the baked New Zealand mussels as much as any AYCE appetizer. The oysters were pretty fresh and decently sized. The fish katsu was a surprise hit with tender fish, a crunchy fried exterior, and just the right amount of sauce.  Tsubugai (whelk) was on the one-per-person specials menu. It was a first-time nigiri for me, and the flavor and chewiness was great. Unagi was spectacular, with a bit of extra caramelization than usual that gave texture and flavor. Yuzu hamachi (yelllowtail with citrus) and garlic tuna (albeit more sweet than garlicky) were also nice. The uni was above average in an AYCE context and had little of that "dirty seawater" issue that often plagues AYCE uni.  The rolls that I tasted weren't too bad either. Yellowtail Lovers with hamachi and spicy hamachi, and both of the no-rice rolls. I would have gone for more, but we were all getting pretty full  The list of letdowns is too long though. Soft-shell crab was fine, especially with soy sauce, but the shell was just a bit too hard and persisted while chewing (note: photo omitted due to low quality). Salmon was bland in all versions: salmon nigiri, salmon belly nigiri, and salmon kama. The kama was overcooked and dry as well. We have not been AYCE friends for a little bit too long, sadly. Screaming o salad was actually nice, but I only found three relatively thin slices of tuna in the huge bed of salad. You can't skimp like that on a one-per-person order.  Super white tuna nigiri was also boring. I do prefer unsauced ono, but this version was bland. I think this was also the nigiri that had a few hard grains of rice, which is rarely ever seen even with the lower standards of AYCE sushi. Amaebi (sweet shrimp) had the right texture but was also bland. The crispy rice with spicy tuna was one of the more boring versions that I've had. The grilled mackerel was also on the dry side. And both the green tea and plum wine ice cream scoops were a little icy and just seemed like another off-balance way to end the dinner (although the mango mochi was fine, probably because it's the standard packaged stuff).  The biggest lowlight was the mixed karai. My friend's bowl looked tempting with its assortment of fish, but I got the impression that my bowl was made wholly of thin discarded pieces and/or low-quality cuts. It was a chore to eat it, especially one of the big chunks of tuna. I found myself dipping the fish in soy sauce or leftover sauce from one of the no-rice rolls. I can't remember having a worse mixed seafood salad in town.  Service issues were again present. They somehow missed giving us the uni on the first order and we had to re-request it. Perhaps they gave it to another table? The servers seemed to constantly bring out superfluous items, forcing us to tell them that we hadn't ordered whatever it was. I just don't run into these issues with table dining at another AYCE sushi restaurants, so it's telling that it's happened 2 out of 2 times here.  Umiya is a passable AYCE sushi restaurant if your options are limited or if you're hanging out in the vicinity (such as the Strip or one of the Flamingo Rd casinos), but I really wouldn't mind staying away for another three years. There are simply far better options in the genre.

Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni was pretty good considering that it&#39;s an AYCE sushi place

52zvYI7jRc98p_mUlSEx-A.text: If this were any other sushi restaurant I would say it has good sushi. But for an AYCE sushi place, it is friggin amazing! Everything I had was very good. And for the price, I hope they have good alcohol sales because it seems like they're giving away the sushi. I look forward to my next trip to Vegas and will definitely return.

B_8jpHGuRpBY2nCAMvXWQQ.text: It's all you can eat, but you have to read the fine print. There are certain items you can only eat 1 order of, and some of them only available at dinner. The rolls are pretty good, but they will definitely fill you up. I rarely even dipped the rolls in soy sauce since they already put their special sauces all over. I thought the appetizers were actually the best thing on the menu. Poke, seafood ceviche, seared tuna, oysters, and the fried soft shell crab were my favorites on the dinner menu. Don't forget to eat dessert! They have mochi ice cream, which can be kind of hard. Maybe they could defrost it a little? Overall pretty great.
