KLK0iqETnKaMM-w3B0t3_Q.text: Our table of 9 was..... disappointed.   So we checked in at 7:17p and we didn't have a table until about 8-8:10p.  See, that's not usually a problem since we understand that we're a large party arriving at dinner time so yes, we expected to wait quite a while. But after 40 minutes, we decided to sit inside the restaurant. we noticed that the hostesses has absolutely no idea of seating or planning. An entire table that could comfortably sit 10-12 people were occupied by a couple. One couple. They actually sat one couple down at a table that could easily fit ours.   Moving on. We ordered (ordering is already a pain since it seems like there's certain people only available to take orders and they seem to disappear as soon as you hold a menu in your hand). throughout our night, the food kept coming out like, in spurts. Like 4 dishes would come out. Then 15 minutes of nothing would come. I ordered nigiri and after 20 minutes, i accepted that it wasn't put in. So I ordered the same thing again and explained the situation to the waitress. After another 20 minutes, it still didn't come. Towards the very end of our meal, all of the nigiri came. Like really?   Annoyed, My sister's fiance actually asked a waitress if they have some sort of system or list that they cross off as the food is delivered to our table. She actually said no. Which explains the unpredictable timing of food, delay of food, and just ... it was chaos.   The food itself was, alright. My sister literally broke out in hives after eating at Umiya. The drive to find an open pharmacy was intense (they all seem to close at 11p by our house). For all parents with a child breaking out in hives: GET BENADRYL. it works faster! Today my sister's doctor said that the food might not have been fresh or the oil clean.   Our waitress saw 2 little rice pieces of rice (from the nigiri) and she immediately prompted us with a speech about how left over rice will be an extra charge. Wouldn't be a better idea to prompt us towards the END of our meal? Because my dad planned on eating the sushi rice with his soft shell crab...   I understand that we are a big party. And we always loved coming to Umiya. But the quality and service has been going downhill steadily. It hasn't actually affected us until now.

oAxceq5QZcypb9qUl7bVTA.text: We tried this place cause it was recommended and also, it had good reviews. This review is for the AYCE. The fish was sub par on the warm side.  The handrolls were 85% rice with very little fish.  The cutrolls were doused in sauce and had very little fish.  They were definitely trying to get you full on the rice. To top it off, one of our servers chided us for leaving some rice in one of the handrolls. The same server came back and asked if we were going to finish what is on our table. We had to tell her we were still working on it. She was acting like the rice police...  Another server "Hj L" from the receipt, charged us adult price for our kid and when we corrected him since we told him the correct age from the start, he said I told him our kid was over the age. Why would I do that? He had the nerve to come back and tell me we got free oysters earlier because he thought my child was being charged the adult price.  Did he really need to cone back and tell me that? All in all a very bad experience.  The only plus was service provided by the 2 non-asian servers.  They were great! I'm Asian btw so I can say this. Definitely not coming back here.

4E5M57RrSyxAFVZNWLq8Fw.text: Service was pretty bad. Both our first time today, only 2 tables filled at 11:05 when we arrived, took way too long to be greeted and asked for drinks to where we almost just left..Pros though food arrived quick and was Excellent! The oysters were perfect, each order was awesome.   Cons Server asked multiple times in a 10 minute window if everything's ok which was unnecessary, but then was Unseen the rest of the 25 minutes..we both needed refills, waited forever not wanting to press their Call-button on the table but decided to..made eye contact tried to get attention few times,..still nothing..waited pressed again..5 mins, nothing. Finally came up asked if ready for more or desserts said no we wanted drinks while back and rang the button thing twice in 10 mins dont think ours works. They got our check and card fast though! Probably wont return

E1UrgN-QjhILnxSvR5V6CA.text: My friends and I came here celebrating my friends 21st birthday. They are open late at night. We ate here around midnight.  When you walk in the atmosphere is a very Japanese semi outdoor picnic feel. The lighting is dim and the decorations makes it feel you're really in japan. The tables are very large and enough to order plenty of food.  I started with their spicy tuna salad and it had a lot of flavor and different types of fishes mix with it. My friends and I ordered several specials orders such as the Hawaiian roll, firecracker and all the dishes was delicious.  The staff was very friendly and the sushi chefs surprisingly made our food very fast even if though it was busy.  Thank you and we will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front of their cute Japanese sushi menu

DogqzuFvYOhla5gJaOthAg.text: Been here once a couple of years and thought the food and service was outstanding! For an AYCE place, the food was brought out as quickly as we ordered them.   Was so happy to come back again and fill my belly with delicious sushi. This time around, the food was still really good and didn't take too long to get to our tables after we ordered. Service was different this time around.. Seemed like our server's mind was somewhere else because we had to repeat our orders several times for her to hear us and write it down. Everybody that dropped off our dishes was really friendly and helpful.   The restaurant itself is really spacious, so it makes it ideal for larger groups and there are plenty of regular tables for smaller parties.

hUDxjmexNqlszNRZf0M3TQ.text: The value sucks here for to-go.  Do not come here unless you are coming for AYCE sushi (All you can eat)  We got a few things togo since we were too tired to eat AYCE - 10 Piece Sashimi $19.99 - These were the slimmest "sashimi" pieces of fish I have ever had and the worst value. - Yellowtail Lower $12.99 - This was the smallest saddest looking roll I have ever had in the $10+ range rolls  On a friday night, they had plenty of seats open (half the restaurant was open), but weren't seating the people waiting probably due to not having enough sushi chefs.  Do not order togo from this place.  The value is horrible and I can't believe we drove off the strip for this.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $12.99 for this.  Please look at the soy sauce pack for comparison.
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It looks like a lot, but these were so slim.  This for $20.

NaJfGMx5xJORdNViLYC_KQ.text: Been here two sundays in a row and I loved it every time. All the food was delicious, fast and fresh. All servers are very friendly and I love that the place is open super late. We order a huge yard long of beer, so refreshing and fun to share with friends. Will be back probably next sunday again!

vCIw6GSvnEZMuXbzXXhc2A.text: Great restaurant experience. The atmosphere is fun and energetic. They have tables that can accommodate large parties. When I've gone on a Friday or Saturday night, they usually give an estimation of 30-45 minute wait; however, I've never waited more than 20 minutes or so. The all you can eat is a great deal. From my experience, it has the most appetizer items available as part of the AYCE menu. The udon soup is one of my favorites! As for the sushi and nigiri, it is absolutely delicious. I love how for most of their rolls, the sauce comes on the side, allowing you to decide how much to add to your roll rather than it being served smothered in sauce.  This is our go to place. Consistent and great every time.

x_3KPUR-3--S9K_hUMaKEg.text: Umiya wasn't the best AYCE I've ever had, but it satisfied my sushi cravings!   Nigiri: A majority of what I order at AYCE is nigiri. Most of it was pretty fresh! The yellowtail was subpar, but the ika, halibut, uni, salmon, surf clams, sweet shrimp, and tuna tasted fresh. The oysters are especially fresh! The one thing that I didn't like at all was the rice. It's overcooked and doesn't go well with the fish. I've noticed that many Korean-owned sushi places don't get the sushi rice quite right.   Rolls: The roll that stood out was the Kiss of Fire roll, which is great if you're a fan of spice.   Appetizers: The bacon-wrapped scallop and octopus skewers were pretty good! The poke was really underwhelming, but I did just get back from Hawaii.   Entrees: The udon is pretty good, but the ramen and yakisoba are really disappointing. Both lacked flavor and the necessary consistency.   Service: What bumped up my review from three to four stars! They're really attentive and friendly! They constantly check up on you and don't avoid you like they do at mos AYCE sushi places I've been to.   Overall, I'm not ever really a fan of AYCE. I would rather just go to a good quality place and order a reasonable amount of food, but I enjoyed my experience at Umiya. I think it's worth trying out.

w6uCoqSfksgToZ6FzYp_Gw.text: Hands down best AYCE sushi I ever had. And I'm from socal, we got literally thousands of sushi joints.

XgbWv8ZhfL-mtirDtj4VWg.text: Not as disappointed or frustrated as last time, but still not on close to my go to for sushi.   Highlights- Baked Mussels Lobster on Sushi  Low lights  Sushi still fell apart 1 Nochi   Freshness was average, which really is not saying much since I went on a Friday afternoon after lunch rush. Should have been really fresh. This place does have some different select on the appetizer portion of the menu, but like some of my faves from other place on the roll side.   Last but not least service was really attentive. But I was one of like 3 people in the place so you should expect that.   Middle of the road at best in my opinion. I won't automatically so no the next time someone brings this page up but will still try to go someone where else if possible.

E56KjEGYV9G8bKidsIReRQ.text: I came here for the all you can eat sushi lunch one time. It wasn't super busy which is nice cause sometimes then it's hard to get service if it's to busy. Sucks that some of the menu items are you can only have one per person, and then can't order anymore like the oysters, and some of the other items on the menu. Next time I think I will come with another person, or only get the smaller items cause some of the main rolls you could not get a half order and I was like dang it, almost to much. Mostly cause I usually just want 2 pieces of something then I want to try something else. Unless it was really good then I want to get more. My fav thing I tried here was... the raw oysters, and the baby scallops. I didn't get to find any of the main rolls that I liked alot cause some of the rolls I ordered where the ones you can't order half order with.

3LswotwVerhByTjx483jgQ.text: The rolls are so good! we did the ala carte option and it was a better deal than all you can eat. Definitely check it out.

FGSP5q75y0oRvYcg_14W0A.text: I guess I'll save a 1 star sushi review for when I walk out of a place projectile vomiting but Umiya was as close to the bottom as you can get.  Sat at the bar and the workers were nonstop talking to each other in Korean which is cool, but they completely ignored us the entire time and I felt like I was annoying them  to interject an order. It was like we weren't even there.  Now to the food. TOO MUCH SAUCE!  My first roll came drenched in this oily sauce where I couldn't even pick up a piece of the roll without it crumbling. The rice was cold and hard and just horrible. My girlfriend tried one piece and didn't even want to finish it with me.  I ordered another roll after that and asked the guy if he could put the sauce on the side.  He called the order out to someone else and the thing came drenched in this oily nasty sauce AGAIN where you can't even taste what fish you are having...couldn't tell if it was red snapper or tuna or salmon.   Pissed me off that he totally ignored my request for sauce on the side.  I ordered another roll...told him PLEASE NO SAUCE.  He calls out the order to have one of his friends make it...and how does it come?  COMPLETELY SOAKED in sauce a third time. My girlfriend who hated the sauce, just ate ramen and was disgusted by the whole experience.  I've been to many AYCE joints that try to pull a little fusion with these different sauces, some creamy, some spicy, some whatever in an attempt to try and compliment the roll (so I'm not a total sauce Nazi)...but this place DESTROYS it's sushi with this nasty oily sauce that doesn't compliment the sushi whatsoever and makes it unbearable to finish.   This was my worst AYCE sushi experience in Vegas to date.   Get your act together, listen to your customers...and give a shit about their requests.   Your sauce is effing gross. I didn't come to eat half a bottle of oil based Ken's salad dressing.

IzXndecxAVg-gHc2iKFb3w.text: This place was delicious! If you're looking for a great sushi spot in Vegas, this is the place to go, and it's not far from the strip at all. We did the all you can eat for just 25.95 each and got the salmon killer (spicy!), the firecracker, sea food volcano roll (so good!), and the red mountain. They were delicious I would come here again for sure. The staff was gracious and charming :) thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red bean, and mocha mochi
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon killer (left), firecracker(middle), sea food volcano (right), and at the bottom was red mountain

OHNvQ4hHp4WW8NKi8x6WSg.text: My sister and I crave sushi like every week and our normal go to spots are Goyemon or Sushi Mon on Maryland parkway depending on where we are. A friend of mine recommended this place so we checked it out. My sister said she liked it better than our regular spots. Prices are similar, we eat more nigiri than anything. It was fresh and the rice proportion is good. The atmosphere was nice-more of a restaurant feel bc it was a bigger space, had nice dim lighting. Service was awesome but we went in between lunch/dinner time so it was not busy. Their appetizers are better than most ayce sushi places and the rolls are decent. They have crab meat in a lot of the rolls, which I'm not a fan of so the choices weren't great for me but they had a couple rolls we really enjoyed! Overall it was great and we will be back!

tWl46dAoD2Sjxk49RVDvtA.text: I have been to this place for 5 times, and the recent one was just last week.  Got to give Umiya a 5-star because they never disappoint me. The fish is always fresh, service is great, and the orders always come correct (some places give you less/more than you actually order).  Their daily special is a plus. I tried lunch, dinner and late night supper there and always leaving with a full stomach and a big smile with my wife and kids. One of the best AYCE sushi place in Las Vegas.

7AE_cAAWwbvPXv-K5rjoZA.text: Overall the sushi was very good. Atmosphere was nice and busy and really comfy. Fish was fresh and tasted very good. The only real thing I can complain about is the speed of service. At times it was 15-20 minutes before a server would show up. Even after pressing the call button multiple times. Other than that every thing about this place is excellent. One thing to point out is the fresh oysters and the size of the rolls. Oysters were excellent and tasted very good. As for the rolls they were all nicely sized without huge amounts of rice being put into them.

Zog-9jYvaFBRA3LZCEn6Ng.text: Wow, no complaints here!  I can't count how many times I have had the pleasure of dining here!  They stay open late, and that works for me!  They actually have options on the menu for those who don't want all sushi.  I love the bacon wrapped scallops (to die for)!  They have great fried and baked rolls!  Who's Your Daddy is a big favorite of mine!  The service is ALWAYS on point!  Everyone is ALWAYS in a great mood and everyone is willing to assist with All of the Tables!!  Love this place can't get enough!

dbgZoWDbhAaeq8cHhuKNrw.text: This is the first AYCE sushi place I've tried in Vegas.  It's a bit off the strip but well worth it if you don't feel like pigging out on a buffet or spending $$$$ on a fancy meal.  There's a lot of variety on their menu.  Most AYCE places in So Cal have a few appetizer choices and then nigiri and rolls.  Umiya has a ton of appetizers, salad options and some yakitori as well.  The sushi is pretty fresh as well.  The only thing I didn't like was the nigiri had a bit too much rice. Also, if you check in on yelp, you get a free soda.

w9lGq9OJ3aWfh6agRtPDhQ.text: Excellent food and service!  We love the sushi here the best from any other places we have been!  For AYCE- this is the freshest and best! Great atmosphere and great service!   Owner Alex is always so nice! Along w all the other sushi men

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna naruto is so good and fresh!

vPBPpcJmbaEh2ErQg-iHQg.text: The quality and selection for AYCE at $25? Who knew there would be such a hidden gem right behind The Palms Hotel. I had it for the first time coming back from a 3 day camping/hiking trip to Zion, and let me tell you. We killed it. It was so good that I went again the very next week while I was in Vegas... But it's so good! And so close to the strip.  Honestly I would put it on same the level as Bacchanal. I know they're totally different, but on my scale of buffet/AYCE choices... Umiya is pretty up there with Bacchanal. Hands down better than Wicked Spoon.   The UNI... So good. But sadly its limited to one order.. So is the SWEET SHRIMP, AJ SAUCE TUNA. All the ones labeled 1D. But that just means you know it's bomb! So order all them 1Ds.   They have ramen too and it's pretty good. Pretty large selection in sushi, rolls, and appetizers. TUNA SALAD, SUNRISE ROLL, FIRST KISS ROLL, PORK BELLY, BAKED MUSSELS, ETC! They let you get half orders of rolls too so you can try as many as you want.  Oh and don't forget the green tea mochi icecream and green tea tempura for dessert. :)  They have a huge screen showing a mix of Kpop and top20s style music videos on one wall and then a TV with like some random news channel on the opposite wall. So just a warning, whichever side of the table you end up choosing on... You will have a very different scenery for the next 1.5hrs. Because that's the time limit; you'd think that's enough time, but it goes by pretty quickly!   Anyways, the people there are all really nice too. They'll tell you what's good if you don't know what to order too. Super helpful and friendly!

AdaAHy0E5bLkXXXyPHxbwQ.text: Very good. I'm not a sushi snob. I like almost all sushi, but this place knows what they're doing. The ambiance is a little loud and decor is nothing fancy, but the sushi and service were outstanding. That's what I care about. Highly recommend.

zCEwuJUd4CgPx4O781xFuQ.text: All you can eat sushi ! Lunch price was 20.95 per person until 3 PM. Nigiri sushi was great and filling. 90 minute time cap. Came here before and had a great experience, yet again.

ZUStQkmbw81ndj-SQSaX-w.text: I've found this gem for AYCE sushi in the past year and it's become my go-to place. I still have some free vouchers for the place I used to love but they got loud and too young for me. Umaya has a huge menu, seems to be no time limit, and includes dessert. Love it, love it, love it. I'm going there again tomorrow!

_soHdtIhnBX2LSmGSiIYqg.text: We just left there because I told the hostess that we just wanted drinks. She told me that we'd have to stand at the bar! There were plenty of seats in the restaurant, but because we only wanted drinks, I guess bar option was only option. She took the next party after us.   Should not matter what we are eating OR drinking - money is money! D U H....

UmyENmTeLFGBAaBMCl3Mig.text: Food was awesome but customer service was horrible. I ordered to rolls once I was done my plate was picked up. Everyone around me ordered 2-3 times while I was ignored. I wait 15 mins to get somebody's attention. I got up and went to pay. I explained to the lady at the register that I was ignored all she said sorry did you want to take your dessert to go. Very unhappy and frankly disappointed because I had a hard day and getting sushi was my "treat". It just made my day worse.

1N6dTzDhyihQMspypwRs1w.text: Came out here to visit family and we were craving for authentic Japanese food and a friend recommend us to this place. Surprisingly the food is great and our server Sebit is awesome. Definitely will be back. Thank you for the great service.

OW9I2J-CLf3oY_bskBZ_yg.text: Such a great deal for a delicious sushi spot! We were seated quickly, the service is fast & the waiters/waitresses are very attentive, and the food is all yummy!!! Visiting Vegas for the weekend & was recommended this place. I will definitely come back and recommend this place to others as well! Full menu including appetizers, sushi, soups, and dessert! Can't wait to come back hehe. :D. 26$ per person as of 06/11/2016.

eN0yYKdFFfMgY99_2BGkww.text: Found this sushi place on Yelp, went there with Uber and found the restaurant tastes like crap. I ordered a kings ocean roll and couple sushi. It turns out the bill is 38 dollars. Most importantly,  it tasted so bad.... I was amazed how bad and smelly the fish are(salmon and red snapper). Don't go, save your money.

RjxTmOGbxsaV2fhW_FwNWw.text: Go hungry and order AYCE!!!  Though the sushi is decent, this place is better suited for the cooked entrees.   I always get the squid appetizer; usually four portions. Great Korean dishes.  I do enjoy sushi, but confess there are a few places in LV that do it a little better.  No complaints on the service, but you do get better served when you sit at the sushi bar.   A good place for a date, and certainly, a good value to take visitors.

oTWo8ZlY5Sh7PDIEtjf1GQ.text: New favorite sushi restaurant!  Been here twice within a week. AYCE menu has a ton of options, obviously haven't tried all but the ones I have tried were all amazing. Servers were all friendly and knowledgeable and sushi chefs were very helpful with recommendations. Highly recommend!

DNssf8X-v69JvH2jEdSZmw.text: Really enjoyed their AYCE sushi dinner. This place is full of customers for a reason -- good food and great service! I recommend the dragon roll, salmon belly and save room for mochi.

X-y8WT3iQLflMJv1i0N26w.text: I decided to do all you can eat.. I ordered sake (salmon) and maguro (tuna) The quality was horrible it smelled like it was on the verge of being spoiled (fishy smell) ... The tuna looked dull and almost brownish yuck!!! Knowing I had "all you can eat" I decided I was going to order my money's worth  However everything I wanted that looked fresh from their picture menu was a la carte basically it made me think that the good quality fish was only for a la carte and "all you can eat" were the left overs "let's make some money on this before we throw it out" I was so disappointed because I found this place on yelp and the reviews looked great;(

nVAXmkxisVWCvx7nQ9Naww.text: Keep coming back here because it's the best.  Always have my date nights or girls night out here. You can always count on a good table without a wait and good service from everyone.  The food is fabulous, always fresh and tasty. Unfortunately they added some new rules that limit the AYCE but it's nothing big worth mentioning.   Always recommend this place to everyone. Will definitely be returning again and again.

mVFSxR5zudN8GofSQgl3qw.text: Had a work party of 22 people, took great care of our rowdy party, awesome food. Definitely will be back

Jf5xXjLXlXbm6bpqV-cO3Q.text: Very yummy! A lot.of options to pick from. Great price especially for all you can eat. And if you check up on yelp its 1 free soda! Also the tempura green tea ice cream was delicious!! Had so many rolls of sushi lost track of which was which. MUST TRY baked mussels. Only thing is if you dont eat all you'll get charged. (Told by a friend, havent experienced it yet.)

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our receipt

kE4Tk7HcJdmI-qTXTp8Pwg.text: The restaurant itself was really nice, they have wooden tables with benches which i thought was pretty neat. Luckily we went on a night it wasnt crazy busy, so service was pretty great. Very attentive and we were able to get our rolls pretty quick. The food itself was good but nothing special you cant find at any other AYCE sushi but no limit on some desserts!

XOiQL4f0UKixp9uc3RTGtQ.text: Staying in the Vegas strip, I was craving something more authentic and affordable and less touristy as the typical strip food. Went to Yelp and discovered this place, Went here for the lunch buffet. For around $20 I Was pleasantly surprised. They not only had sushi, but also pork belly, poke(one time order) salads, etc. another good thing is that the rolls are offered as half rolls. This made it easier to try various rolls. From rainbow rolls, to tempura rolls, to scallop rolls, if you can name it, it was probably there. One thing is They do charge for food that is uneaten/ wasted but I didn't have that problem. I plan to visit when I am in town. It was well worth the lyft ride there.

bwBFdQkdUT8pRNL7APjKBw.text: Great sushi and service! Was very pleasantly surprised by the quality and selection of the ayce menu. One of the best all you can eat sushi spots I've been to. Would definitely come back.

HRomYXljw6Poh75QTuwPyw.text: Umiya is a very nice Japanese restaurant!! Highly recommended!! I was there almost midnight, their open hour is until 2am, what a perfect place to go at late night after drinking or party!

5z6fUoRNGPBDeoJATyqU-A.text: Best sushi in town, this time I had the Rice cake and spicy salmon roll, it was very good as usual. The service is fast and pleasant, definitely I will visit again soon.

VOVGQWx74xnYanwYIC8XNQ.text: We stopped by with a party of 6 and was told it would be a rough 30-60 min wait, the employees worked fast and got us our table within 10mins! Their all you can eat sushi was great, True taste and elegance. Would I recommend you coming here? Absolutely!

dH6y7-qsrdbEnd6Qewf1GA.text: Amazing service, food, and value!  This has got to be one of the best AYCE sushi restaurant that we've tried in Vegas.  I was pleasantly surprised with how good the service was.  We didn't feel rushed at all and the servers kept offering to take more orders for us.  The food came to us so fast and we didn't have to wait more than 5 mins the whole night on a Saturday.  We will definitely come back!

p2HEStMLc8zcS1e9R1sQRw.text: Really enjoyed dining here... Last minute selection and glad the experience turned out great. Quick service, lively environment and good sushi. Came on a Friday night and had a good amount of people without a wait. Waitress was very attentive as she refilled food and drinks rather quickly once empty. Can't go wrong with AYCE! Overall, I would recommend this place!

aHrmrG3dxRkgKSkSPiAlFg.text: Tasty food. Friendly and timely service. Employees who actually speak Japanese (one was  speaking phrases in Korean too). And to top it off, they played K-Pop music videos (G-Dragon, WINNER and Pak Jae Beom -- aka Jay Park.) Definitely coming back each time we come to Vegas, which is once every quarter. ..

A5vf5236JfLv_Gn_g9shQA.text: My favorite sushi place in las vegas. ! Isnt it amazing that they are very new sushi reataurant has lots of compliments ! I love their appetizers and sushi.   All staffs are very friendly and nice. They are even humorous lol  I would love to go back to this place and eat sushi again.

DnCeZOtdB_vx4D8IWbYFGA.text: What can I say, the place was perfect. I was there for the all you can eat lunch. Unlike all the big buffets in town they make the sushi as you order it, it's not sitting out on a lunch line. Great spot!!

BZ05tLz7s2_mTArbmEW1fA.text: Finding a good sushi can a little difficult but when we got to this place we sat down right away the server acknowledged us right away. Some of the rice on some of the rolls were falling apart but other than that the taste was great I would definitely be coming back here not to mention the staff was great too!

B_skw3hCqyd_GUVoW2vEeQ.text: The food was good and consistent. We came a few days ago and it was just as yummy. For the price -you cannot beat.

3KpGj4i0uXYRhE7Bt9rxvw.text: A couple friends of mine came in on a slow afternoon for dinner a couple days ago. When going in, I thought it would be packed since a lot of the reviewers have said that it's a good place.  For us, our experience was just decent. Nothing amazing or great. Even though we were just the only table being served, these servers are still slow. When being asked for more food & serving them were extremely slow and they expect us to have that 90 minutes limit? No way. Unfair.   With that being said, I would rather go to some place else. Makino was the best one for us.

DeCnMAGU7hmO6-Idv713UA.text: Food is great. My fave is the sea urchin, tuna, poke and the yum yum roll. I love the deserts too.

TwlvlEj5AXJU3fEZ9oIBUw.text: Right when I walked in, it reminded me of another sushi place I've been to & it didn't click until we got the check that it is Kaizen (also in Vegas)!   My friends & I came here about a month ago because we were craving AYCE sushi & wanted to try someplace new. The reviews looked good on Yelp, so why not?   There were a couple of good things going for this place. It is a BIG space, which is nice compared to smaller sushi places like Goyemon or Sushi Koma. Another nice thing is that their nigiri is small, which we liked so we could have more of the other sushi.  Now, onto the bad. The biggest thing I did not like was their service. We ordered the first round of sushi & rolls - which was fine. Then a couple more. Then we decided to ask the waiter for recommendations. We ordered some of the special rolls since our first round of sushi was mainly nigiri. Well, the waiter who brought our rolls brought the wrong rolls! & the original waiter LEFT FOR THE DAY. Wait, what?! I'm used to places introducing the second waiter or at least letting us know if they are taking a break or leaving. So, of course, we're telling this new waiter that the rolls he brought us are NOT the ones we ordered. He kept saying one was the lobster roll & we had a shrimp tempura roll - which was the same thing! So we had these two baked rolls (that were the same!) which are heavy, so of course we got full faster. We didn't send one of those rolls back which was our fault, but in the end, they didn't charge us for what we didn't finish, so I guess we're even.

LDnwcqdX2Xu-JaChdor2nw.text: Umiya is one of my favorite all you can eat sushi restaurants. My family comes here all the time, and we love it. The food is delicious, and the sushi chefs make everything in a timely manner. All of the workers are very friendly and check up on us just enough.

MlKD7WQPanA0Rk-hoWyugA.text: The best susbi in  egas. The crew is AMAZIIING. They will treat you like a king. All you can eat. Ask for "oragen blossom" roll. If you go to Vegas, you must go to Umiya.

MF55LAU1WtDfYd_-LcuiVQ.text: I found my new favorite sushi restaurant!! (once again) Most of my previous experiences in sushi places in Vegas were pretty good, but the ones with really good sushi lacked in choices for appetizers or good appetizers with bad sushi. Sometimes it would be good sushi in a run down place.   Umiya has it all! Really good choices in appetizers, amazingly fresh sushi ( a la carte fresh!), trendy indoor decor, and friendly staff!   It seems like there is always one person in a large group does not like sushi. No worries! With so many choices in appetizers, and a lot of non-sushi items, your group can have a pleasant dinner without someone going hungry.   For all you sake lovers, chef Alex has many exotic sake from all over in Japan that will suffice your thirst. Chef Alex is very picky when it comes to purchasing his fish and you will be very pleased with the quality of your food.

049OtJkF6Q4UhPjkMWQfqA.text: On point staff and fast service. Food is great and will return if im craving sushi while in vegas.

kXQm4OAwC8X-28ug1ALx8Q.text: Food was good.  Service was good. Let me put it in terms in which California's governor would state it. "I'll be back".

99EUhEHC6J1OmTp1zevd_Q.text: We love sushi and for AYCE Umiya is the best.  They have a great selection of specialty rolls, fresh fish and a large number of appetizers.  The service is always fast and friendly.  BTW the restaurant is pretty large and so it can accommodate a lot of people, not like other AYCE places that have a small dining areas and make you wait in line for hours.

cCjIKiW7tiIT5cQ32-_Shw.text: For all you can eat sushi it's not bad at all, but I wouldn't say it's the best. There are other all you can eat sushi joints in Las Vegas that are just as good or even better. I came here Monday night around midnight, and it was dead. Service was very attentive since there wasn't anyone else there. We ordered some nigiri and the fish pieces were skimpy. It's okay since it's all you can eat I guess. Uni was actually good and not weird, goopy, and off colored. I've paid for uni that's far worst in quality from a regular sushi restaurant. Thumbs up for that.

B52R2WmiCcsJh_rAoVQ10g.text: not a really japanese food. its more like korean food. and the food are not fresh for all you can eat.

YYBd-RMJNqZiBzWmW7CFIA.text: Awesome place for sushi! Went here with my boyfriend for dinner and we did the AYCE sushi. This is to me a much better deal than ordering sushi dishes seperate. The price is good too, under $30! Our meal includes options of appetizers, salads, soups, sushi, hot meal and even desserts! Try the lynchee grapefruit drink its refreshing and delicious. Look forward to eating here again.

XYjI764sU6jkDCAeXsCpmA.text: This place deserves a five star rating. Everyone here functions at a super human level. And I love the call button - Quite efficient indeed!

gabkjODuIX2FyXZ2xBkp7g.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!!!! super service, had lunch with the family, sat at the sushi bar & the kids loved watching the chef do his magic.  they even made special kid friendly options for the kids!!!  super fresh, very creative presentation & cool atmosphere.   will be back for sure!!!

pOLl_h2Da6w8YB6trgb7hQ.text: Great food great service very friendly will definitely come back!! And so close to the Palms if you don't want casino food.

ppnnCWijDs7B6aW6Cg06YQ.text: Super fast service.  Someone always refilling your water and tea. Waiters and waitresses come by to check up on you all the time and to take your orders. And the food was very good!  Definitely be back!

4jMcNQqYUyv1IAZAIHgWlw.text: very good quality sushi. service was prompt and friendly from both servers and staff behind the bar. Ice cream (regular green tea and mango mochi) wasn't the greatest, but hey, we can't all be good at everything, right? all I all, a very good value and quality for AYCE.

saIwkXlH2EodSOLl3QWLEQ.text: I feel that it's only fair to factor in that this place is "all you can eat". Once you do that, there is only one reaction to this place: absolute delight at finding something that is off-the-charts better than anyone has a right to expect it to be.  The nigiri is pretty good (better than most AYCE places) but it's the endless stream of delicious goodies from the kitchen that you will never find at other AYCE places. The cheese salmon sticks, the pork belly, the soft-shell crab -- they nailed all of these, and kept them coming with great service and a friendly attitude.  Very, very impressive.

z0fBvM073zjdmg8bUivl6Q.text: Appetizers is the name of the game. I really like how many options you get and they all taste amazing--ribeye steak with the aju, great combinations of shrimp and meat skewers, and the one thing I always look forward to is the tuna poke. Most places give you that 10:1 ratio of seaweed to poke but Umiya likes to do things the other way around. It's pretty much all poke. And I love it.  Service. I can't rave enough about how phenomenal the service is. Their chefs and servers are on point. From the time we sat down and order, the food arrived in 4 minutes. The people here are machines and they do it all with the biggest smile. Coming here with just my girlfriend or with a large group of friends, this level of service has been consistent.  Quality of fish. Top of the charts. Uni is so fresh I felt like I caught it and cut the gonads off myself. And the oysters don't have that musky slimy texture that you'd often find at other places. It goes without saying that the ingredients in the rolls and sushi are the same high quality.   Overall, you will not be disappointed with choosing Umiya. As locals, we are always looking for the next and greatest sushi restaurant but Umiya is a timeless classic.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shellfish game is lit.

P95miimPGJbgtiyHat0cxA.text: I've been here so many times, I can't believe I haven't written a review yet. I'm not a local but come to Vegas several times a year. This is hands down my favorite AYCE sushi place in the world.. yes I said WORLD. The ambiance is great, service is fantastic, and the food is superb. You can order half rolls and they have oysters and squid. Their fish is always fresh. Their menu has a very good variety of foods. My kids always eat well here too with their selection of noodle soups and ice creams. I also never have to wait too long for a seat either. I can't say enough good things about here. I always leave with a smile. I recently took some friends here and they also left completely satisfied and impressed. If I could give more stars I would.

lvh4nubVH7EO_KUq-gla8A.text: This place has terrible managerial service. They do not know how to accommodate guests on a first come first serve basis. We called to put our names on their wait list at 9:00pm with a quoted 20-30 minute wait time but did not get seated until 9:55pm. They seated guests that came in after us simply because It benefited them more to do so to make more revenue rather than doing the right thing. This place does not care about doing the right thing. Instead of trying to arrange seating to your favor just get a bigger place. This is the last time I come to this place.

WZ04xlz8n8BSar938M4KNA.text: We actually went here twice only because it was close to the hotel and the Thai place next door reeked of deep fried food in a not so good way.  The first time in I went up to the bar to see the fish.  Well they don't display the fish here so no looking at what you're going to order like most sushi places.  One of the sushi chefs yells at me "What do you want sir?"  I asked him "What is fresh tonight"  Him, "EVERTHING IS FRESH!"  Me;  Okay, then what do you recommend? What is the freshest?"  Him:  "EVERTHING IS THE FRESHEST!"  I kind of knew right then that this was not an honest place.  The good:  Tempura, fish katsu, Tuna poke with seaweed salad (excellent!!).  We had this twice and I would get it again.  Salad was fresh and tasty.  Good rice too.  The bad:  the "no-rice" roll with crab was actually Krab (Pollack) and daikon radish and cucumber.  It tasted essentially like daikon radish and the 6 slices were no more than a 1/4 inch thick ($12.00???) We actually sent this back it tasted so bad.  The worst other bad:  Seafood Chirashi:  I've had this dish many many times at other establishments and I always get 10 to 11 different types of raw seafood over rice.    Here I got tomago, tuna, a light fish I could not identify, a single small cooked shrimp, salmon and tobiko.  The fish was sliced very thin to make it appear like more was there.  Half the bowl was covered with shredded radish as filler.  What a joke.  I could see straight away that the tuna was bad (dark and sagging), one sniff and I moved it to the side.  Next I smell the light colored fish and it seems okay so I try it and nope, its bad too.  Also warm!!  Had to spit it out type of bad.  I had to send the whole dish back and ordered the fish katsu again which was excellent.  They did not charge for the Chirashi but they did not own up to the fact that the fish was bad.  I know they will read this and think I am full of it but seriously guys I've been eating and MAKING sushi for 30 years.  Also, just read the reviews where people claim food poisoning from your fish.  I am sure it is True.  Lastly, quit bribing people to give you 5-star reviews.  It looks really bad.

nqNDpmVezUnbKzOR-xhQIg.text: I'm not a big fan of sushi buffets but this place isn't that. They just give you the option to do all you can eat. My girlfriend came here a few months ago so she wanted to bring me here on our trip. We went with a couple friends and did the all you can eat option. We got so much food and the food was definitely worth the all you can eat price. My favorite was the yum yum roll. It had delicious baked crab with yummy sauce on top of the sushi. We were in food coma after all the stuff we ordered. Come try this place if you love sushi as much as I do!
