nm1M5etUrTAArhnrUkQdMw.text: One of the best all you can eat sushi places!  2 stars off for spilling food on the customers.  Seriously, who passes dishes over people's heads?   Otherwise selection is great and the quality is not bad at all.  And plus they don't make you wait for a long time for the neXt order.

qwqJb6r_v1DepbdbsZUFcg.text: One of the largest menus I've ever seen. Everything I tried was excellent. I plan to return next week when I get into town.  So I just came back and ordered their No Money No Honey & Peter Pan Rolls. Both are excellent. So happy to be back. I highly reccommend eating here! Great food, great service, every came out super fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yqMGAxVDCUgPJtWy55rubQ.text: Finally, a good AYCE sushi in Las Vegas.  There seem to be countless really retched ayce sushi restaurants but this one, in the area was hands down the best.  Maybe it was the overwhelmingly bad competition, but this place was actually quite good, not just for an ayce.  This place has tons of special rolls, and non sushi choices all included, along with desserts.  Unfortunately, I found this late in my Las Vegas stay for the summer and only got to go once, but will definitely go back next trip out.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AYCE desserts
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AYCE

LGTnf6ZQxeSrqHl4eVqxKw.text: It's hard to find affordable, quality sushi places in Vegas. This place delivered. The roll cuts were thinner than I was used to, but they were neatly made and sooooo delicious. Our bill only came out to like $37 between the two of us. We got the miso soup and some other stuff too. We were way impressed. We're going to be coming back when we stay at the Palms Place again next year. It was packed here too, and we had to wait. That's another indication that this might be a favorite by people in the area.

aCL8ljfiRXAPC0pVtdcUvw.text: Hidden jewel just off the strip. Great selection on AYCE, will be back every time we're in town!

4vGS4o84LS7g3D-QwSKp9g.text: This place was great  staff very friendly service was fast, food is great they have an all you can eat menu and a lot of selection on it we ate our share and was stuffed!  Will send all our friends there if they are visiting Las Vegas.

Ibp4tTePBeNtsJGJn1eGnA.text: The place is clean the food is great everything is done fresh it's hidden away so you have to look for it what is one of the best eats in Las Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious

vFhcs0x067PJNBnxA_QK7Q.text: I am very picky with my seafood and I love Umiya's quality of fish and the variety of items they have for their All You Can Eat option.  Service: For me, service is something that I cannot reiterate enough. It is the break or make it factor for me and sadly, the service can do a little bit of cleaning. I have been here a handful of times and I get the same service... rudeness. I am not sure if the servers are being purposely rude, but the last three times I have been there (less than a month), they have been rude. I was trying to order something at the bar one time and the lady who was taking care of our orders rudely said that she will come back to us and take orders from her other tables. I understand that me and my party was not ready, but she did not have to be rude and impatient. I was baffled by how she reacted to the situation with me and my party. Unfortunately, this is not the first time that has happened. I am constantly getting rude service. Also, I happen to get new servers every time I go there. I do not know who is taking care of me at the end of my experience.  Quality: The food and quality of fish is amazing. Even though I do not get service how I am used to getting, the food can help balance it. The seared tuna AJ fish is to die for! I constantly crave it and come back for it. They also have special yuzu hamachi nigiri and salmon belly. it tastes so good and so fresh I cannot have enough of it! They also have an array of sushi rolls, appetizers and other stuff that they have on the menu. They have a lot of things on their menu that a lot of other sushi restaurants set them apart.  Overall, I am very impressed with their menu. It really sets them apart from other sushi restaurants and they have their own style. However, service can be so much better. If all the servers were willing to give their 100% everyday no matter how late is or early, then this place would be my favorite places in Vegas. If they didn't have good items on their menu, I wouldn't be back because of their service.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. filtered and unfiltered sake

HQEV1pTMdkUVYyc7umV-cw.text: Anytime I go out to eat sushi I definitely go here it's so delicious and the service there is amazing always making sure my table is good with refills and our orders.

2WtJC-cppA6GzyKFCqvP-A.text: Here I thought maybe there is some magic sauce to make  a quality sushi at a cheap price. But what you pay is really what you get. The sushi from this place is flavorless and paper thin. The sushi rice should be seasoned with sugar and vinegar, but these have no seasoning and no shine.   Come here for the quantity not quality.

_l4Ux2ln4qNO3wCoAgk52Q.text: This place is legit!!! I know my ayce sushi spots and this place is awesome. I used to go to Goyemon after sushi factory closed. This is my first time here and I have a wonderful experience. All the chefs I see are Asian, I don't know if that matters to you, but there you go. The nigiri rice to fish ratio is excellent. Try this place for real!   I would need to write more but experiencing a food coma at the moment.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CPauUz0gUOKhyQ-v4B2Aiw.text: Over-all experience I would rate 3.5~   Called ahead to see if Goyemon had a wait and they did so we ended up at Umiya~ I didn't know it was Korean owned until the server started speaking to us in Korean haha awesome~ The place is a nice size, looks modern & is clean with a few flat screens and k pop music playing in the backround.. reminds me of the Korean bars in LA with their wooden tables (some people might not like the bench seating but at least you're not forced to share a table with strangers..) but they also have a few regular tables towards the back..  Our server was friendly and fast..   We both did the AYCE dinner ($26.96)  and started off with: -tuna poke salad (1/pp)- good chunks of tuna, nice marinade and not too much salad -seared salmon salad (1/pp)- I liked the salmon quality and it came on a bed of greens & daikon -salmon skin salad- I wish the salmon skin was crispier -raw oyster (2pieces/pp)- wasn't the best quality but better than Hikari's  -seared tuna sashimi with AJ sauce (2pieces/pp)- good quality I liked the sauce it was creamy & tangy -agedashi tofu- yummy -softshell crab- these were HUGE  -monkey brain- spicy tuna stuffed avocado.. it's deep-fried but doesn't mention that on the menu -grilled yellowtail- was kind of dry and they were out of salmon & yellowtail collar  Then we got assorted nigiri: -quality- ok...it's not that it was bad but the fish quality was just not all there for me.. Some things like the ikura tasted SUPER fishy and the coloring on some of the fish like the tuna was dull and not appetizing.. Also they charge extra for quail egg and soy paper even when you do AYCE.. They don't have fresh scallops on the menu :( What I did LOVE was their fish to rice ratio.. they give you very little rice.. YAY ;]]]   I also noticed some things we ordered never made it to the table like baby octopus skewers, pork belly, fried shrimp heads.. So there must have been some miscommunication with the kitchen..   Like I said over-all experience was a 3.5... I think I will come back for a lunch bento box or back if they did some Happy Hour prices on their apps and rolls but maybe not for AYCE.. well not until they step up their fish quality game haha ~   HOT TIP: ask about their drink specials.. it seems they always have some sort of promotion going on!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nigiri~!!!
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster ~!!
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared tuna sashimi ~

oIhBirOY5VbeiXQ0amG0ng.text: The best place I've been to soo far i go here often with my boyfriend and we get the all you can eat and it's worth every penny

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PlfbztKfzC1into04UxmRA.text: Umiya is a great little gem of a sushi restaurant, and quite honestly my only major complaint here is that their wooden benches are super uncomfortable. It sounds like I'm being a diva, but it needs to be said! You can't happily eat your weight in AYCE sushi if your butt starts to hurt.  The food, though, is good. The sushi rice seemed to be lacking the vinegar, but it wasn't a huge deal considering this is an AYCE place. Service was quick and friendly. Nigiri is yummy but the rolls kind of all taste similar. There are a quite a few reviews on here stating that the seafood wasn't fresh, but I did not find that to be an issue on my visit.   I think I have really high standards when it comes to sushi places, but this is a solid sushi spot and I'd be willing to come back again if I was in the area.

JuoRb_9mnzVdqmNRn8P4AQ.text: Was going to give this place a really good review and five star. But they lost two stars due to the bad experience on my second visit. The first visit was perfect. A friend was at running a booth at CES so i took him to this place. Just the two of us. Perfect! Good was great. The waitresses was very attentive to our needs. Cool. So 7 days later when my friend's last day at CES. We decided to go here as a group with my family and his family plus a friend. Total 6 of us. Bad! Service was horrible. It seemed as though they wanted us to hurry up and eat and leave. The table next to us cam it after us and they were given more attention than our table. My friends wife ask for low sodium soy sauce. They charged us $1.50. Not a big deal but i dont recall regular soy sauce and low sodium soy sauce were much different in price at the market. After our dinner we were charged a service fee. Which most of the time i would give more. But this time I didn't the server deserve what any tip. Her service was horrible. So my suggestion is dont go here if you have a big group.  Food is good not going to lie. I will be back but not as a big group

fRN5dMysXpBQ5QV9CX3dvQ.text: Ayce make to order restaurant style Buffet much better than the neighboring casino style ones which are pricy and uninteresting. This buffet is top notch. Excellent food and service.  They might have several items which has a limit, like oysters, uni, sweet shrimp, rib eye beef, soft shell crab, but the quality are really good. Oysters are pacific oysters from Washington that are clean and fresh.  They do have a limit of 90 minutes for ayce so that you dont have to sit there and eat all day. What a great location too 7 minutes walk from the palms casino.  Ayce is only 25.99 for dinner. A tip is to order all the items that has a limit first so that you can have more room for the best stuff. Also the seating area might be a bit busy at the front, but the booths are better and more spacious. The servers are mostly Korean, but they have pretty good team work. The restaurant is located near Starbucks so free wifi.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu ayce

lL3FNK7hxte6D4iezSo7oQ.text: Best sushi place in town.   The food was excellent as well as the service we received from all the staff.   Tony was our server and he was so efficient taking our orders.    Must try items:  scallop skewer, seafood dynamite, Vegas Lasagna, rib eye steak, and many more.    There was nothing on the menu that we didn't like.  Dinner price is 25.95 per person well worth it.      Would definitely recommend and return to this all you can eat sushi.

HH-OTQExcFq_bI6m758OmQ.text: Ive came here a few times. I love sushi. But the sushi from here just had this weird taste to it. Customer servicd overall is great

SDy8n_hfTGGENcCf8r2jiQ.text: One of my favorite AYCE sushi places here in Las Vegas. I've never really had a bad experience here with both the food and service. It would be worthwhile to stop by if you're looking for good sushi, it's located near the Palms hotel and casino on Flamingo road.

SxcdeJK8ZqSsz1crgY0UUw.text: Love the all you can eat option for $25. The food is good and the service is impeccable. The atmosphere is comfortable.  I would come back here.

X1jEB5sB0u3JZYxoj5RONA.text: It's not too often I get to give 5 star reviews for excellent food and service, but this place topped it.  I ordered the Downtown California kimchi combination and all of it was excellent.  The soup was not too spicy and brothy with plenty of chunks of Tofo.  My main course was a salad, Teriyaki Chicken, and California roll sushi.  The California sushi roll had advocaco, crab meet, white rice, cheese, and cucumber for that extra crunch in your mouth!  Teriyaki chicken was served with mixed vegetables and a little too much onion, but hey I couldn't taste the onion so kudos for that!  For dessert had the green tea mochi ice cream...yummy!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Downtown California lunch combo, yum!!!

CCWcEYDCQnMrU6NvemD2Aw.text: The sushi is good and they offer other items with the ayce. The store is kept semi clean, they don't really clean underneath the tables. There were noodles and rice on the ground so I had to keep my feet up the whole time so my shoes wouldn't get dirty. The service is ok. Some of the servers are friendly and some are extremely rude. my experience with the server is that they never stopped by to ask if we were ready to order and then never checked up on us to order more after we finished our food we had to keep asking other servers to order. On top of that we had to hunt our server down to get our check. Overall the service was bad and the food was good. Guess you can't have both here.

e38pUY25Ut6fIs9aPmg0mg.text: Best Sushi spot I've ever tried. Nowhere else in Las Vegas is better. Thank you Umiya.

LghSbFdFKo62n1LoIkMwPg.text: TLDR: AYCE (90 minute time limit) and lunch specials available; yelp check-in deal; hit-or-miss service  My friend and I like to venture over to Umiya when we're looking for a decent meal. They have the standard AYCE prices with dinner specials available such as salmon kama or a specialty appetizer item. Their lunch specials are pretty decent and filling if you're looking for something to take home or if you just want an entree. We like to check-in and get a free soda or iced green tea (the real deal and not the Coca-Cola one).   One thing that this location offers is the super white tuna or ono. I've been noticing that some restaurants are choosing not to carry this item, due to a supplier issue, but I'm happy to enjoy it at this location. Is it True super white? Who knows, but it sure tastes like it. They have interesting dessert-style specialty rolls which contain fruit and eel sauce. If you're getting AYCE, you might as well split a half roll.  We've come here a couple of times and it's safe to say that service depends on the moon and the stars, the Dow Jones, or the shape of the clouds because I don't get it. Whether busy or slow, the service can be super quick or patiently long and I'm just talking about placing an order, not to receive the food. I often have to ask for refills and usually have to flag someone down to get something. Myabe this speaks for the lack of adequate staffing. Who knows? Either way the food is pretty good.  Note: They're offering free mugs for posting of reviews. Will this lead to an oversampling of 5-star reviews? Probably. Did I get a cup for this? Not yet, but who doesn't want a free cup?

NUjc3FHZszieSWPS39YsQw.text: BAD SERVICE. We called ahead to see what the waiting time was like. Woman was quick and snappy and hung up before we could ask another question. My boyfriend and I go anyways and it takes a while to get seated. Not bad, we expected as much.   We got waters and lay down our first round of orders. This was okay, but after this service slowed down. I was feeling a little sick soon after and this might've been because of the quality of food.   We'd be constantly overlooked and ignored and we were in the middle of the restaurant! I'd watch other tables get serviced except for us. Service is just bad. They let people wait up front when there are clearly tables empty and ready to go. They say AYCE can only last 90 minutes, but we can't help how long we stay when no one takes our orders!   This was our second time eating here and service was still just as poor(first time was a few months ago). Bathrooms were dirty as well. Food was good for the most part, just bad service.

yS1B6Q4puGUXZqyJ_bVh3w.text: When you arrive at a restaurant during prime lunchtime and see more staff then customers you should turn around and leave and that is what I wish I had done at Umiya Sushi yesterday!! What a major disappointment this place was. Service was terrible; we had to ask for someone to take our order because the staff was busy chatting. We had to ask for our drinks twice. The teriyaki beef was so tough that I couldn't chew it. I ordered scallop & bacon skewers and got shrimp and bacon instead. Several dishes ordered we didn't get and got tired of trying to wave somebody down to ask for them finally just giving up. Sauces are thick and mayo based with zero flavor. Spicy tuna is NOT spicy. My friend who loves AYCE sushi places said it was the worst one she had ever been to so I guess that says it all !!!

H5Pdtvl_HVRgWsNsrhGkRA.text: The dessert are all you can eat too!!! Had a great meal and great experience. Love the AYCE lunch and dinner here.

3vcbKW_xiWu88aRoUGUe7w.text: This place was good. They do have a 1 1/2 hour time limit on the AYCE but I was full way before that time hit.   I liked almost all the dishes that came out, but I wouldn't waste your time on the steak. It looked pretty, but tasted just ok.  My favorites were a Creamy shrimp fried appetizer and the First Kiss. Both delish!  Oh yeah, and a lobster dish which I tasted off someone else's plate. Yum!  Also, we came with a large group and had to sit at their bigger tables, which have horrible no-back bench seating.  If you come with up to 4 people, they have normal comfortable chairs at their smaller tables.  I would come again, but with a smaller group so I could sit comfortable.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First kiss
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and cream cheese fried!  Yum!

LJt0rYfdxLdKfbDCzrfEzA.text: The sushi was delicious but service was non attentive. Host was on the phone and pointed to our seats after a 10 min wait inside with a fairly light amount of guests in the restaurant. They left out a roll of sushi from my order and never came back for our bill. My guest and I walked to the front to pay. Due to lack of attention is why I'd recommend somewhere else. Time in Vegas is valuable and fast service is appreciated but the least any restaurant can do is be attentive. 3 stars for this Japanese crew. Good sushi but there are other places nearby just as good. So much for the bellman recommendation.

eWvlwdE1ujKG3lwOm8jfeg.text: Great appetizers!   Tuna poke salad super good!  Their rice less roles are also unique and I was apprehensive about the cucumber wrapping, but it complimented it well.     Lunch All you can eat is only $20.95 and is from 12- 3pm.  Service was prompt and they refilled or waters regularly.   I would come back again.

JZbUDmDP54_EWBwCbcn4OA.text: Best crispy rice with spicy tuna in town.  It's worth doing the AYCE just to order a few of these!

X9dk-OscEmP02VGShtcUAQ.text: We came here after trying another sushi place in the area that was busy and had a 45 minute wait (thank you because we would on never found Umiya). I called in and made sure there were seats available. When we walked in we were promptly greeted by whom I believe was the store owner, sat us down, and we were on our way.   The menu had a lot of different options. I can't remember any cause we tried so many. All I can say is that the food was fresh, the fish was of good quality, and the service was great. The food came fast and the servers were very attentive; our glasses never went empty. I liked the variety of music that was playing (along with the music videos). The were a variety of desserts on the menu that did not disappoint as well.   Would recommend this place to any of my friends and would 10/10 come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious mochi ice cream for dessert.
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their take on poke off the appetizers

VGPI3c1DH5iqftyY2gC73Q.text: If you want bad service, this place is for you. So many other choices within an one mile radius so why would you come here?

_xCRYk1fq5syWX4dGh-MPw.text: Great food and great atmosphere!!  The service was excellent and also servers were very attentive. Sushi presentation was phenomenal and also tasted really good. Will be back here again!!   All you can eat sushi price is perfect and includes appetizers and dessert.

cbC5lwHEyLYT7k_WmTSBWg.text: For an all you an eat sushi place for 25 (dinner) the quality and speed of service was amazing! Even the nigiri sashimi had only a little bit of rice, not like cheap places that try to fill your stomach up with rice, not fish.

DeFHlTwJr-UPFd-okiQ5gg.text: They have really bad service I asked to sit at the sushi bar and then they sat me at a table with four sits when it was just me and another person. They had multiple parties of 4 and personal I feel maybe they should of sat the one of the parties of 4 before they sat me.

vkco3zB8h5kPIzHD-mAKVQ.text: This is probably the worst customer service I've ever had from any restaurant. I was just there 1 hours ago to have AYCE with my family. And this is not the first time I eat at Umiya. First, when I walked in, the waitress who works on Tuesday day shift already seem not happy about her job. Then, she sat us at the front table nearest the front entrance and it is 105 degrees outside and they have so many table available. I asked her nicely if I can sit at other table instead. Do you know what she said to me? She said you have to sit here and you can't move to another tables . WTF! The problem I have with her is her fxxking attitude and her facial expression that make me sick. If she doesn't want to be a server, quit and do something else. Then I went to the Chef and let him know what's going on. All the Chef always been great to us when we go there. Then me and my family decided to walk out because I really don't want to see her face for another 45 minutes. I believe one bad server can easily ruin up the restaurant and other people hard work. MANAGER! Please do something about this young waitress. THANK YOU!

ZR51XI-ZexK2Ul2vjqCTtg.text: Husband and I decided to try Umiya for a lunch date before a movie. We don't live on that side of town so I googled sushi places in the zip code of the theater and Umiya came up with great reviews.   We were seated promptly after walking in however it took about 10 minutes before someone offered drinks or a menu. Once we had menus several people stopped in a 3 minute span to ask if we wanted to order.   They were prompt in getting rolls and nigiri out. As far as the nigiri it was reallllly good. They werent overly thick or large pieces. I also had a screaming O salad with tuna and it was delicious. The spicy garlic Edamame was cold and tasted like it was tossed in just sriracha with no garlic.  The rolls left a little to be desired.they tasted alright.  They were not very neat. What I mean is they were messy. One roll we ordered kept coming unrolled when we would use the chopstick to grab a piece. One roll had an excess of crunch on top. I'm all for crunch I really am but it went everywhere, I have never had crunch on a Japanese lasagna either. There wasn't anything special about the sauces on top (if any.) mostly just straight sriracha or eel sauce. One roll came out to us with no sauce but the description had a ponzu sauce and spicy mayo so we couldn't tell if it was even the right roll. Now I know you're thinking well did you tell someone. We tried. After several failed attempts we just ate it. One thing I really liked was they offer macarons! My husband loves mochi, I do not so when I saw chocolate macorons I was pretty excited and they were good! Another odd thing was our table was not level. It kept wobbling back and forth which is slightly irritating while eating.   Recap: nigiri was great (salmon,tuna, yellow tail and red snapper) the rolls were meh but they weren't awful. The wobbling table was irritating and it seemed either every waiter showed up in 2 minutes to ask if you wanted to order or they disappeared for 10 minutes all together.

xIoy5DBRXm3IJiIOxWKxeA.text: Went here with bf on a Monday night. Not a busy night for the restaurant. There were only about 5 to 6 tables occupied with just a couple per table.   I noticed immediately that the service was a little slow and was a little unorganized. We were seated though immediately but the orders were taken after 15 minutes. I mentioned it was kind of unorganized because after the male server took our orders, after 5 minutes the female server approached our table and asked if our orders were taken.  Now let's rate the food...  I can say the fish quality was good, fish was very fresh and firm (Nigiris).  Grilled seafood was so so... I've eaten better.  Deep fried items were also so so... The soft shell crab that I ordered was drenched in oil. Also they don't put the dipping sauce on the side but they just drizzle it and it makes the dish more wet rather than crispy and light on the outside and moist in the inside  Rolls were okay... I ordered the Tuna Tataki (Rating: 7 out of 10) and Snow White (4 out of 10).   I can say though that the Seared Tuna with AJ sauce was something different and it was really good. Too bad it's only 1 order per person.  Desserts... Also ordinary and it's one per person too. We tried the mango mochi and tempura ice cream.  Maybe we will be back, I say Goyemon is still the best AYCE in town!

9KM2vcxh6a4RCs_l-0y46g.text: First time here and I have to say it's one of the best AYCE sushi places in Vegas. The workers are friendly and attentive which is plus. Definitely plan on bringing friends here who are visiting out of state.

ZgUqxQIl5MJERpH16dYETg.text: Best AYCE sushi! Fresh fish and lots of variety for appetizers. I love that they have cucumber wrapped rolls on their AYCE menu ^_^

BMU6-NtFextSPLzFXA4k3g.text: What can I say but yummmmm.... :) Over all great place for AYCE.  No long waits for a table, service is quick and attentive, and food comes out fast. Everything on the menu is available for all you can eat, unlike some places that have a separate AYCE menu.  There are also the standard exceptions of a few items that you can only get one order per person.    I usually habit Goyemon, but wanted to try something different today. I dragged a few friends along, and this place really hit the spot for everyone. Fish was really fresh. We had giant clam, uni, sweet shrimp, oysters, baked mussel, yellow tail, salmon, soft shell crab, a bunch of rolls.... And much more. They were all delicious! Definitely would recommend the Snow White roll, the spicy tuna rice cracker and the Seared tuna with AJ sauce.  The spicy garlic edamame was great too.  Only complaints are that the agedashi tofu did not have much broth - basically fried tofu with a little sauce on it, and the ahi poke had too much sesame oil that you could barely taste the fish.  Also, drinks are not included.  I had to pay extra for hot tea ($1.75).   And they were out of a few dishes like yellow tail collar and scallops.  Also limited to one dessert per person and no stamp cards.  Despite my complaints, the menu is all encompassing and I will likely be back to try more dishes.

3Pph8iEBOFTtU_thmca4QQ.text: I can't wait til my next Vegas trip so that I can come back! I loved the variety and the fact that we can get oysters, uni, soft shell crab, and ribeye!  (One serving per person under the AYCE menu).  The fish was fresh and we left very satisfied. Forget the strip's buffets, I would rather come here. Such a great price for great variety!  Absolutely gem!  Did I tell you I love this place?

qVNI2iYTxWHx6xF3tWmU7A.text: Great place to meet up with friends or even for late night dinner. I went to a concert and even had time to go to this place afterwards. They close late and offer good quality sushi! I keep coming back when I'm in Vegas!

j-zeSy7e_TPo3ovtIUzjPw.text: One of the better AYCE sushi spots I've been to since I've been living in Vegas. Lacks variety in main components but overall enough options to get your money's worth. I can usually eat 4-5 rolls in a sitting plus small dishes so I've been able to try just about everything, also due to sharing with friends. Would recommend this spot to anyone who wants to play it safe and have a non-bland dining experience. Would give a 3 star but this place beats many other AYCE.

T-IExMx01b4i1ePLZ0N70A.text: my friend said their go to ayce sushi spot is Sushi House Goyemon. after more yelp research, i came across this place. first meal after everyone landed and we met up here around midnight. this was a good option because they are open until 2am. for the most part, every nigiri and sashimi were pretty good, i didn't like the rolls so i stayed away from those. they had a bunch of good appetizers and skewers too. some of our friends liked this place so much they came here as the last meal of their trip, unfortunately one of them got food poisoning.

RJwu65Wbn67HpMS1e7seiA.text: We did the AYCE and every single thing we ordered was amazing! I'm just upset we got full and couldn't try more things! Lol To start off with some recommendations; we started with the seared tuna with AJ sauce, it was very fresh and had great flavor. The baked muscles are probably the best I've ever had! We ordered monkey brains which is avocado and spicy tuna fried which was seriously AMAZING. All the rolls we ordered (first kiss, kiss of fire, Japanese lasagna, seafood volcano, & the  green chili one) the one that stood out the most was the seafood volcano. Although all rolls were very fresh and flavorful, this one was my favorite! Another cool thing is that you get dessert with the AYCE which is always a plus :) There are other items on the menu I wish we could of tried like the skewers and jalapeno poppers, but that's for next time! The staff was extremely friendly and the place looks very clean and such a nice vibe. Love the little button at your table where you can alert them if you need a refill, your check, or just to order more food. Highly recommend this place. My husband and I have been looking for a new sushi place with some quality fish & this place is just that and more!

8LQVMGCcnX2us7i5BZX67w.text: I came here last night for the AYCE and I am giving it 2.5 stars overall. The place was not even half full and had quite a few employees working. Maybe the kitchen was low in staffing since it took them about 15 minutes to get a few small plates out. The service was poor since they never filled our drinks and kept forgetting our dishes/giving it to another table. You have to be careful and remember what limited items you order. They are not organized with the orders at all and tried to tell me that I had ordered the limited items already. I know I've ordered it but it didn't go to my table. Once or twice I will understand but 4 times and telling me it was delivered, I really think it's their fault now. For example: When I ordered the uni and the sweet shrimp together they would bring out the sweet shrimp and not the uni. So I asked about the order and was told it's out already. Same thing with the single baby octopus, amaebi head, 2 rolls were not received but ordered. The food was 3.5 stars. Nothing I would crave or come back for. It's just an average sushi spot. The reason why I decided to try thid spot was the 4.5 stars on Yelp. I should've known better and just stick to the spot I prefer. (kaya).

Aq5DPzlVDJ2s3YEs6ppqkw.text: O man this place is amazing. Good food great service. Your order comes out quick and they even do half rolls.

gw43E2beKaeapjNqEZJJXg.text: Omg all you can eat sushi for $25.95!!  Some of the best sushi we've ever had!!  Not one bad thing on the menu & all made fresh!!!  Great servers & sushi chefs!!Highly recommend Umiya!!!!

1jE2YltyjQMfU4mRRRJlzg.text: Good until the end, owner rude.. Wouldn't recommend going, bad service. Not coming back.

zEomBpQBuUW29SEs5ipAKw.text: First time here and I love it. Food is fast, seating is fast and the waiters checked in on my tablet a good amount of time. I definitely recommend this place!!!

wm0vepQtVEG33YukBb4x8g.text: The all you can eat dinner was worth the price. They were able to take our large party fairly last minute on a Friday night, which was very nice. Our server Justin was absolutely great and he was very friendly and attentive. The special yuzu hamachi and salmon belly was really good. Wouldn't get the ikura again, it tasted like it was drenched in alcohol.  Overall good experience and would go again.

sZtPi0flpT8vkKKekO2dSQ.text: My father-in-law said this was the best all you can eat sushi restaurant in Las Vegas that he'd had.. The fish was fresh, especially the uni and the oysters. Nice ambiance too. The udon was great, nice and chewy. Also highly recommend the salmon skin salad; skip the baked salmon role. Otherwise, delicious.

jVorn1LRfZy3Om9Gnq1Rlg.text: This place was amazing!  Great food, prices, and got my daughter to try sushi for the first time. Yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everything thing was delicious!  Couldn&#39;t stop eating, great prices, great sushi!

Blu77X_cyldjij3NbzbbJw.text: Umiya is my current go-to spot for AYCE. Its pretty, modern looking and well-decorated. High ceilings, good lighting, and a screen playing music videos of everything from Rihanna to Girls Generation. Everything you want in a sushi spot! *kidding*  I usually only order nigiri + appetizers. They have nice cuts of fish which so far, have always been fresh. Rice is solid. However, if you're a roll person, my friend ordered a few which were pretty delicious. Their appetizer menu is larger than most. I would say it's comparable to that of OYSHI. My favorites being the spicy garlic edamame and spicy tuna crispy rice.   Service has always been up to par. The servers are generally friendly and attentive. It's never so crazy busy in there that you feel as though you're ignored and can't put an order in.  Note: Last call is at 1:30am. No AYCE after 1:00am, just a la carte. They also have a sushi chef which has a THUG LIFE tattoo. Because that is absolutely relevant.

OTGbWcRYf2Z8cAei7COKSA.text: Ordered the AYCE. The sushi was small and so so but the rolls and extras were good. Fresh Oysters were top notch!!!  Had several specialty items not on the regular AYCE menu which was nice.

83tPI9f6IDWlEe1mvFzfTg.text: Best sushi I've had by far.. The yum yum crab roll is fire!! Not bad for all you can eat, great service and great atmosphere, even my daughters loved it!

cxe6sE3lt2wwXoBCPspZtA.text: Really enjoyed the food. Everything was great and very fresh. I had my first taste of sea Trout my new fav. The menu was very similar to Sumo Sushi II even had some of the same rolls. I must say that it was better than Sumo but that was due to our sushi chef chatting with us and explaining the rolls. All in all it was Awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xPa58HaO_oclmfNna-wBdw.text: Umiya on Flamingo is an awesome AYCE sushi buffet.  Highly recommend.  Food was awesome.  Fast service. Huge menu! Yummy!

bNZgWif50eN0iuJNxFjuEw.text: Servers were very prompt and responsive. Quick to refill drinks, clear plates, and take orders. A far cry from the usual service you see at AYCE places. Sushi was pretty good, but the sushi rice tasted a bit odd and was denser than normal, like it had been very compressed. Was fairly quiet around 530PM on a Wednesday night, but quickly got busy with a wait around 6PM.

dawfRIX-5YuQsacwb89DGA.text: Chef Alex made my late night dinner an amazing experience.  I was lucky enough to go on a Monday night where it wasn't too busy and where i was able to sit alone at the sushi bar.  The fact that it wasn't busy allowed the chef to make me their favorite rolls.  I always asked for chef's choice for nigiri.  Since, it was my first time at this establishment, I asked the chef to just order me anything.  First order by the chef was Tuna Sashimi in special AJ sauce (WOW, sauce was freaking incredible!), baked mussells were good, crispy lobster roll was really good, and I couldn't forget the ocean  salmon nigiri which was so buttery.  The latter was probably the highlight of my meal. Don't forget to order the Soft shell crab appetizer, the batter was so good!  Service was excellent.  One of the best AYCE sushi I ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ocean trout salmon belly was amazing

1vcSRCBfR7m45raHaNhgSA.text: I'm such a seafood lover specially for sushi/tuna... This is my new fav AYCE sushi place ! Soon as you walk in, I love the Japanese theme decors..  The service is just outstanding... We had 3 different servers.. They really know how to please you and take care of you! FOOD IS AMAZING!

62ZxI80G7AxbEgXDR6jiGQ.text: Great atmosphere, fast service, DELICIOUS sushi- all very fresh. You definitely get your money's worth for the all you can eat sushi. I would a thousand percent come back here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Philadelphia Roll- Made in 3 minutes- fresh, and delicious

G6JK9nFYCYTF5KYSZGEDOw.text: It's great to find a place to come to when in town. Can't complain about the price and the speed of getting your order is awesome. Everyone helps bring orders and take orders so it's nice to not have to wait on one server.

HomuxjIP24vTBWow3hJl-Q.text: Came here 11:30pm on Friday night, and restaurant was pretty empty. Very good service and wide selection of food. ~$26 for AYCE. Would come again.

p_0uPikwwHXbDsMy2_VtsQ.text: My 1 at time here and the Food was ok for AYCE, but service super suckkkkkkkkk (at least my waiter with the red hair is suck) This place got like 5 tables when we walk in & still they're forget my order, 4 times !!!!  We might come back and give this place another chance !!!

9N23Xm6UQaoAaadbOIVpgg.text: Was on vacation with my family in Las Vegas and we wanted a good sushi place. This place was all you can eat so we gave it a shot. Lunch was only 20.95 and for the variety they offer it was a steal. The only thing that makes me not give it a full 5 stars is that they limit certain things to a quantity and dinner only for CERTAIN items probably 5/50 of the all you an ear menu to one order per person for these items but it was all delicious. 10/10 recommend and would go there right away if and when we go back to Vegas

Zu-kr_cdZAyW-waJMe2HDQ.text: Omg we ate soooooo much!  It was yummy. Defenately will be returning in the near future.

oi2YSOLTV0QW40U9EdTRdw.text: I like this place good food, great service off the strip.  Parking, fresh fish, festive. No smoking.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oAZcOhm0vUw-83OEczHuvA.text: Great selection of sushi and other Japanese food ;) great music and the service staff is attentive and courteous.

w2UyXPbfgxm5XmK1IAKELw.text: This was my first time come here. The restaurant looks nice, spacial and clean. The staffs are friendly. Be honestly, Here, the sushi is worst than anyplace! I ordered couple tuna, Salmon,   and yellowtail sushi, and  two of them are rot! It made me threw out! I told two of the staffs, and they just made excuses and even asked me why one piece of Tuna what you eat is alright, and the other one is bad! I never had this experience! Hope they can be more responsible for customers! No anyone want to spent money to get sick!

OwX4wBYOY3yh_mFRLBCsuQ.text: All you can eat sushi? Um yes please! This place was awesome and it was nice to get away from the strip for a little while. Service was great as well. We had an assortment of rolls, orange blossom, lobster crunch, and salmon killer. All of them very flavorful, excellent way to end our Vegas trip.  Thanks Umiya!

VxVf3BgtwCksQCTe9BrywQ.text: We had all you can eat for the 3 of us. This place is incredible. Honestly I was little apprehensive about sushi in Vegas, but, i can assure you everything was phenomenal.  We had seaweed salad, soft shelled crab, caterpillar roll, miso soup, hamachi, New Zealand mussels, nigori, steak, shrimp tempura, and dessert. Walked out for 110 dollars including tip. Service was impeccable. Different servers always checking in, it's basically all you can eat in 90 minutes for 26 bucks a person. All raw fish was super good. Excellent stuff.

GrUX0wIdZu9ELXNuvlP9uw.text: Staff is awesome everyone is on top of keeping food and drink on the table. Food is awesome I personally am not that much a seafood person so when I do eat it I'm very picky and this is my go to spot. Flavors are very clean and fresh. Love this place.

f7erCGYVQUtEg19idUEpBw.text: Nom nom nom! Officially my favorite AYCE sushi place...too bad it's all the way in Las Vegas :/  Let me start off by saying that the service was spectacular...stellar...mindblowingly good! Not only was the staff incredibly helpful and on point, but even the chef/owner came out to make our experience that much better. He personally recommended most of the dishes that we had that night and made quite a few of them himself, even throwing a few lessons on fish quality and freshness our way.  I wish I could remember what we had that night, but unfortunately I have no recollection of the names. I do suggest trying the dishes on their "Specials" board...they were all fantastic. I don't think you can go wrong with anything on their menu. Everything was fresh and had a unique twist to regular dishes.  Located a few minutes away from the Palms and like 10 minutes off the Strip, but it is 100% worth the drive. Very reasonably priced as well.

FvXue5WWYdSfeOZ2hx3hBQ.text: Great priced food. If you're looking for an upscale environment or high end fish, this is not the place. If you're looking fun a comfortable lunch type experience it's great.

BEcyLzZYiMUseleLoa1Zww.text: I think this place was great - came here for lunch on a Sunday afternoon and they let us order the dinner ayce so we could enjoy the salmon belly, trout, uni, amaebi, and other specials.  Generous portions, food is tasty, service was attentive, and everything came out quickly! Which oddly some reviewers on here said was a bad thing?  And again.... Yes they charge you if you don't finish items... But this is common policy among every single ayce sushi place I have ever been to over the last 15 years.

lP8vymzE2t2AgZuuACCIyQ.text: absolutely loved this place. all the rolls were great, the yum yum crab we had seconds. also loved the ahi tuna. personally I would avoid the Uni (sea urchin) not a fan of that one. staff friendly and attentive.

UELK5VQ-0pS4L2h5XRsl2A.text: Great food friendly service leaving happy and uncomfortably full lmao!!!! Order the kiss of fire & king of the ocean

XPnbzdM4hu899GZoFrKjnA.text: Typically, Umiya would be my go to spot if I know Goyemon will be crowded.  I attempted my usual Umiya trip a few nights ago and left after 15 minutes of there being open tables and not being sat down.  I realized the boys working were a bit new, as the ladies who sit people down and take their orders weren't working that night.    The ladies working know me already and the treatment that night by the males were pretty bad.  It looks like they were overwhelmed and I saw that people were waiting to order again but weren't being taken care of.  So instead of anticipating a bad night of sushi, I left to go to Sushi Bay instead, where I know there wouldn't be a wait to order.  Take notes from the female co-workers guys..only go when the ladies are working.

lYEtg5a4bmJplcBjcEXYwQ.text: The best spot I've found in Vegas for AYCE sushi! This place is always clean, good quality sushi, always fresh, and a price of $26.99 AYCE dinner is awesome! They give you so many options and very little restrictions as far the AYCE rules go. The servers are very friendly and quick with your order. I like that there's usually 2-3 different workers that'll assist with taking your order and refilling the drinks.   The shrimp lover roll, dragon roll, Lisa Lisa roll, shrimp skewers and mussels here are beyond amazing! Every roll I've had here I've loved, those were just to name a few and keep the list short. This is definitely my favorite sushi spot in Vegas!

H81UA5oSbFcDDXpjHWYroQ.text: I'll come back if I come to Vegas!!! Good restaurant and nice service I love their skewers so much.

BGZ6KuFMoGa3qIKRhByCpA.text: Pretty good deal for lunch $20.95. Came here w/ a party of 7 & they had no problem accommodating us. The nigiri& rolls were pretty good for all you can eat. Oysters, baked mussels, and other appetizers are worth it! So try them out! Definitely coming back next Vegas trip!

YsTwxjhPWn8_wBCmMGzNCg.text: Fastest sushi service with the best tasting sushi!! Hidden little gem! If you have not tried this place,you need to go. They have All You Can Eat and a great variety too. My husband loves the Orange Blossom Roll, Touchdown Roll, Fried Pork Belly, Poke, Fried Shrimp Heads, and Sashimi. I'm not one for raw foods so,I usually get the fully cooked ones like the Lisa Lisa Roll which Shrimp Tempura, Avocado,Cucumber,Philly Cheese topped with Crunch and Eel sauce. This place is usually busy round the clock on the major meal times so I would go in between meals in order to get faster service. This place has yet to let me down!!

AGOvVhEQmSC5Ltm7cuxFzA.text: Nice sized AYCE sushi. No padded seats, but seating was not uncomfortable. Our friend likes his beer in frozen mugs so was disappointed when one was not  offered.  Ladies room was untidy and out of seat covers.  Every bite, with the exception of the tuna poke, was amazingly delicious. We had cucumber salad (different from most), seaweed salad, nigiri, rolls, the tuna sashimi, soft shelled crab, Vegas lasagna roll, riceless rolls (my hubby loved both kinds), etc., etc. All delicious. The bacon wrapped scallop was delicious. I don't think you can go wrong here.  Service was amazingly fast and efficient. Nothing was forgotten. No request was refused with the exception of changing the ingredients in a roll. No substitutions.  Definitely worth a try!

8hcq6mYGjfmiCldpD8VG4Q.text: The best AYCE sushi I had in Vegas so far. Ron and Min provided us the best service we could ask for. 10 star service

nRKdNnzgUqoQ6i2f2MDP7Q.text: Our new go to spot.....Authentic Japanese with very fresh fish, numerous choices and excellent service. Interior is modern and clean. Highly recommend this place!

ehfxgI5szYHFqsaOc_miTQ.text: My boyfriend and I were craving sushi for lunch yesterday so I yelped this restaurant and saw a couple of pictures. Since we liked how clean the place looked, we decided to give it a try.   We sat down right away. The restaurant offers "all you can eat" sushi. My boyfriend obviously took the challenge.   We sat at the bar and we were able to order quickly. I was able to customize my roll. Chef Alex was extremely nice and suggested different rolls to my boyfriend. He liked every single one. He was extremely nice to us and very friendly. Made us feel like a valued regular customer even though it was our first time we ever visited that restaurant.   Chef Alex personally introduced himself as the owner of the restaurant and he invited us to try another of his signature rolls for the next time.   We recommend this restaurant and we're definitely going back since the service was outstanding and the prices were not bad either!

D2KmnPgUfgNhseOIP62kfg.text: My favorite sushi place hands down!! Their menu is so creative & delicious. Service is great & food comes right away. Always looking forward to eating there!!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California roll
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellow Tail

xNRdnaSlijQV-QZbOWmxIg.text: I like the varieties offered here, because 50% of the menu come from salads, skewers and other special appetizers, especially my favorite fresh oysters. Do come down and give them a try ! And remember to check in for free soda or green tea.

_CjHNn83fmnIHozlxCZKAA.text: Our favorite sushi place in Las Vegas. They keep improving and adding new items to their AYCE menu even though they have always been great. Their food is consistently fresh, tasty, comes out quickly. Their service is super fast. This restaurant has the most extensive and creative menu with oysters and many sashimi options. There is not a single thing I would want them to change. To us, no AYCE (and even many of a la carte) restaurants in town come even close. It's perfect as is.

yGYM_qzMoCibBA5YSYPouA.text: This place has a good idea of fun rolls but is super anal strict of sharing. Came with friends with hopes of a good meal, but it was hard to enjoy it with the servers watching us like hawks thinking we were sharing! They even threatened to charge us extra in the middle of our meal...and when I say threaten, I mean, they were mean in the way they informed us. Trust us, the joint was not that great for us to be lying about sharing. We couldn't get out of there quick enough.   If you're looking for all you can eat sushi, you're safer in going to Bacchanal for all you can eat sushi without the harassment of staff giving you the stank eye.

t_vB3myiLUPAV5nxz1ZfcQ.text: One of the best AYCE sushi places we've tried! The pork belly and calamari tempura were delicious, as were the specialty rolls, but my favorites by far were the ahi poke and the monkey brains (avocado stuffed with spicy tuna and fried tempura style) - to die for! Be warned that this place is pretty small and fills up quickly, so get there before 6 to avoid the crowd...

G7DZxdBFG8oJoUl6CqpugQ.text: Ever since my friend introduced me to this place, I have been coming here with knowing that I'd always leave happy and content! The staff always greets you, and the food is fast and delicious! I recommend my friends who ask "where is a great place for sushi?"

EE0XBmN6ZMDzb2rQygFGcA.text: First time eating AYCE sushi in Las Vegas. Foods here are very fresh especially the grilled mackerel and squid.  Service is very good and very friendly hostess. Will dine here when I come to Las Vegas. If you are a sushi lover, you will like the food here

NvytUzgWGNjzBDRXGhfL7g.text: Seriously the best sushi outside of Japan, the all you can eat menu is perfect for sampling. Highly recommend this place, the customer service is great, the food is exquisite, and the venue is relaxing.

gFNioNvZyZt8iHozFVzPNA.text: Delicious Sushi! We had the lunch all you can eat special and easily got our money's worth. Excellent service as well. Lunchtime is not very crowded, and the rolls come out very quickly. The all you can eat also includes foods other than sushi. We didn't try many of these options but they were also good. Dessert is even included. Will definitely be coming back next time we are in Vegas!

UC_FeCl1mraZlHZzUl1oKg.text: All you can eat sushi better than 90% of sushi restaurants I've been to. Highly recommended.

MpXovXCv0jDOQkdlx0v3nA.text: Good service good food! we did the AYCE and loved the riceless roll. Wine is expensive.

N52CH4lu50Mu44t3zGVfRw.text: Some of the best sushi I've ever had. Service was prompt, courteous, and attentive. Even when it got busy the chefs would still help and ask us if we needed anything. Can't wait to come back.  All you can eat for $25 is too good to be True. Thanks for the great night!

RAUwdFi87Bi2Pge4gn4vuA.text: First time here and everything was just spot on! The food was very delicious! The appetizer and small dish is just amazing! I need to try everything out! The marinated pork belly is just heavenly, oysters are just awesome pretty small but hey they are very flavorful. Now on to the rolls the tuna naruto aka the carb less roll haha, is a very tangy and just really zesty which I love. The sunset roll is just the best and a must have! The tonkotsu ramen is really tasty just not really rich. Oh I almost forgot if you guys have ever had the seafood salad from Yama sushi the spicy tuna salad is on par with that man! Customer service was just amazing! Our waitress was so sweet and nice! Overall it was a great night at umiya!

VrKvIHq8F5KV5FpBHOUxNQ.text: Great place for ACE sushi,they're fast,their nigiri are always fresh ,friendly staff,everything about these place is awesome

R_rSBUXaOoOjCTv2dauBMQ.text: This Japanese restaurant have really delicious food. This is my second time here and the food still remain delicious. The ambience feels like modern pop style culture. It feels like a good place to come and hang out with friends while eating Japanese food. Their all you can eat is at a reasonable price. Customer service is excellent. I like how all the staff have a welcoming attitude. I would definitely come back here again.

Fy_o2kf18iBiruGSMtCtZg.text: Conveniently located a ten minutes away from the strip. This place knows how to put out the sushi. The mackerel, smoked salmon,  red snaper and tatanaki was delicious. Will definitely be back. All you can eat.

6GiVC6lwXYoFHwQDtQVgJA.text: I was originally planning on going to jjanga with my boyfriend for lunch but they were closed so we headed to umiya. I didn't regret it one bit. The presentation is super neat and the rolls never fall apart. The sushi is also very fresh, which is always a part of my expectations for sushi. The tuna naruto is one of my go to's. It's clean, refreshing, and a great roll to start off the meal since it has no rice. I'm not sure how long these items will be on the specials, but the yuzu yellowtail, salmon belly, and ocean trout are some of the best nigiri I've ever had. I love their appetizer menu! The fried softshell crab is soooo good! It comes with some kind of dijon sauce. You can only order one though so enjoy it while it lasts. They also have green tea tempura ice cream. I usually ask them for a green tea tempura ice cream banana split or I do it with the vanilla. I just let you in on a secret, so you better order it lol. Try this place out! They easily have some of the freshest fish in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. When you&#39;re stoned and want to mix two desserts together.. I asked them to make me a green tea tempura banana split lol
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green tea tempura ice cream. I always have to save room so I can order two at the end lol
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ocean trout, salmon belly, and yuzu yellowtail. They are all so delicious but the yellowtail is my favorite.

r0wnd5y_h_fB3eP9IgLx7g.text: This is the BEST sushi in town. BEST fish I've had in all of Nevada for sure. For people who like good nigiri and good raw fish, this is the place to go. And its all you can eat which is great. The nigiri Albacore is amazing. It rivals sushi I've had in Japan, Cali, and Caribbean.  BUT... I gave it two stars because the service is TERRIBLE. I have been there three times now, and I never leave a bad review until its happened a few times, because some times stuff happens. But, this is bad, every time I go the service is terrible. I had to order my food multiple times, I received other peoples orders, I never received parts of my order, and even after ordering rolls and nigiri multiple times, the server came over 20 minutes later and asked "would you like to order anything more?". I HADN'T EVEN GOTTEN MY FOOD YET. WTF. so weird. They seem chaotic and unorganized. I ordered a total of 40 pieces of hamachi nigiri and ended up eating 8 pieces, my wife and I laughed about it. This place is amazing and has great potential but seriously needs work on their service. Get organized! I will definitely go back for the food but not if I am in a hurry or have anything else to do that day because who knows how long it will take to eat.

FommDXOnZFeNiQgVpd3EMg.text: I came here probably every other weekend when I lived by the palms and whenever I am on that side of town I deeply consider it for the AYCE sushi. Dragon rolls, Catarpillars, and yuzu are king! The environment is usually pretty quiet although they do like their pop music playing softly over the speakers. The chefs are very nice and will gladly explain each dish, although the last time I went the waiter was abit rude(hence not 5*) but it was not enough to ruin my day, and certainly will not stop me from coming back!!

1bUS3wKd_i71fgJu6mZk9A.text: My goto placenin Las Vegas. Hands down best ayce sushi place in Las Vegas. Fresh food in very good quality. Also therebare variety menu you can choose from the menum highly recommend this placento everyone.

jLryswZPLwbSZggDU_M5ZQ.text: Whenever we're in town, we love coming here to satisfy our sushi craving. This place is awesome. Everything taste so fresh and delicious. And the all you can eat sushi is a great deal. So much to choose from. And their service is great. All the servers are so nice  and they are fairly quick. Next time your in Vegas, stop by here. It's in a strip mall next to Palms Place. Highly recommend.

a5KPA7ekJS59E8UJ8bmAPA.text: Me and my friends were looking for a nice sushi place to and we ran across this restaurant on yelp . Our server Taylor was so sweet and friendly . Mad suggestions and had us try something new . The price was very reasonable for all you can eat and all of us enjoyed our food .

b7IBNFUYDGrVvtMYCAyv1w.text: This place used to be called Kaizen and they didn't have the AYCE sushi.  But one Friday night, my wife and I were looking for an AYCE sushi spot and we saw this place and everywhere else was a crazy 1-1.5 hr wait.  So we decided to try the place out.  We immediately took to it because of the atmosphere and it was spacious.  It wasn't crowded nor was the place like most sushi spots where it's small and compact and there's barely any room to walk on.   The staff was very friendly and warm.  The menu is very extensive! It actually has 4 whole pages of food, including a huge amount of foods that aren't seafood-ish.  I know many people would say, "why go to a sushi spot and not eat seafood or sushi?"  Well some people have something called "allergies" and we don't want them excluded, especially since I have a brother who is allergic to shellfish and a nephew who is allergic to freshwater fish.  So, it was really awesome that they had plenty of great choices for those who cannot enjoy certain aspect of sushi eating.  Including steak, teriyaki, noodles, beef, pork and chicken dishes.    My favorite is Snow White and the Ono nigiri.  But. their Tuna sashimi w/ AJ sauce is to die for.  My wife loves the oysters and she said that their uni is very fresh.  The food is just all around very good, fresh and well prepared.  We loved the place so much, we went back with our family the next evening.  AND we would definitely be going back again!

8sfTKzJDQV4ltf3ndbvMOg.text: Me and my wife love this sushi place! We really think this is best place around the city. Servants are rapidly quick, and you'll get the best sushi in just couple minutes! They brought my beer in 10 seconds I ordered it!!!! Thank you guys, so much, I wish you grow your business

KI6FW8YluiPu86jtl8s2kg.text: Amazing baked rolls!!! The staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is great also, right off the strip on flamingo. Perfect atmosphere for any occasion. I come here about once a month, and have never been disappointed at all!!! 100% perfect!!

V-2f0V307g4Jf-zHkVc48g.text: This is hands down the best Sushi Buffet place I have ever been to in my life.  My wife agrees.  They have a wide variety of different items on the menu, and their service is awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Poke

ry1mw7Gsnw9B4wcIeVrYFQ.text: We had the the 8 piece sushi combo with 1 role which was great. Place is just down the road from the Palm's casino and gets a good mix of locals and people dropping by. Friendly and great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E6AVgr9SDMdeKtenTALA5Q.text: I went in at 12:30am and was starving. I opted for the all you can eat. This was near by 5 minutes from the strip few blocks near the Palms casino. The fish to rice ratio was decent not the best I've had at a ayce sushi but not the worst. I tend to order mostly nigiri when I go and avoid mostly rolls. The freshness of the fish was pretty good and the appetizers were also good especially the fried soft shell crab, too bad it was limit one.   They're open till 2am but last call is 1am for all you can eat. It's a decent size restaurant and service was good. Time limit 1 1/2 hour.  My only complaint and the reason they didn't receive 5 stars is they limit certain appetizers and the black board specials to 1 per person. At some ayce sushi places in Vegas they do not limit you.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Finish off with some red bean ice cream
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared tuna in aj sauce, looks weird but good
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Screaming o tuna salad I dont  recommend globs of mayo no bueno

B1rtm57aVuB55B6aHNxxjA.text: We were greeted at the door by a tall, friendly man which I later learned was the owner.  We sat at the sushi bar and were given menus and he explained the AYCE menu to us.  There is a huge selection of cooked items like baked mussels, calamari, chicken or beef skewers, etc, edamame, soups, etc. They offer a fes salads, nigri and pages of rolls.  Some items, like Uni will be limited to 1 order pp.  We had a delicious roll wrapped in cucumber which is a rare find on an AYCE menu as is Uni. We had tuna, albacore, yellowtail, salmon, octopus, seared albacore and halibut sushi (like 4 pieces pp of each) the poke which is served with seaweed salad, the spicy tuna on crispy rice and a few other items.  Nice option is certain rolls can be made 1/2 order.  For me, the pieces of fish were very long and super thin, while fresh I do prefer a fuller piece of fish but with AYCE I guess they figure you will just order more pieces.  They do use very little rice which is so nice.  Large, open restaurant very friendly staff and a super clean restroom.

rOnYQtRwyjEqGXWxU7JBlg.text: This place is delicious, it has a wide selection of flavorful specialty sushirolls, with cucumber options, also their stuffed tuna jalapeno poppers are delicious! so many scrumptious appetizers and rolls it's hard to chose which to try! love that they have a cucumber wrapped roll option, and multiple salmon and tuna rolls which are my favorite. It is a bit pricier than other AYCE spots, however the rolls are usually worth it.

avwww0GyXp_E8saX6w0_iQ.text: Started off with the miso soup, edamame, mussels, and seaweed salad; these were all good in my opinion.  Sushi: Snow White Shrimp lover Yellowtail lover Firecracker  These rolls were alright, they overloaded on the sauce. I also had the octopus and surf clam nigiri, the rice on there was not what is expected of sushi rice it tasted rather old.  Coffee Mochi for dessert was yummy.   Service was great, very attentive.

xDB7FBMvIB954IaJ_hwYvw.text: First time here Taylor and Justin helped us great service. Alcohol was good very strong. Jack and Coke ordered like 10 rolls and they where all great. !   They have video music on ranging with hip hop to foreign music lol with football by the bar which is a win! Def cool place to hang out and eat with friends. Will be back! Kudos to the staff very helpful with my order when I was looking for something in specific.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good Food&amp; good Drink

pUz6dvy2FL-mGmf5ojUhkw.text: What a great place! The staff was very attentive! You taste the freshness of the food! they have an all you can eat option, for those that were looking for a spot near the strip, this is a great option!

eJ4ftI04YCkLvqkR6JG4mQ.text: I come here for celebrations because they can accommodate large parties. Why isn't this place more popular? It's so pretty inside and their sushi is not bad. The only complaint I have is that they pack their rice balls so tight for the nigiri. I think they do it to make it look like there is less rice but I'd rather them not because it makes it so much harder to chew each piece.   The appetizers and non sushi items are great here. My favorite is the crispy rice with spicy tuna! So good. Another favorite is the rib eye steak. Medium rare is the way to go. It's served as a thin slice on a wooden platter with some dipping sauce on the side.   Service is great here. We had a party of 17 so they were prepared and took our orders by table. It was pretty organized. They were able to split the bill a couple times for our convenience. The staff is very friendly and welcoming. No complaints on customer service!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni (sea urchin) nigiri

BxbLTG5uB2zeWeAiaBp5Rg.text: We had the ayce and I thought everything was decent but I still like sushi house goyemon's ayce as they have more of a selection to choose from.  The interior of this restaurant is beautiful and modern though.

otrGjjhvu3Ce5Wzn1Fu62w.text: After visiting local AYCE Sushi places in Vegas. I had to try as much around here as I can. I came here a week ago. The NBA finals and EDC weekend was around too. I sat at the bar. Order the available nigris they had. Ranging from classic tuna to sweet shrimp. I also had the rolls, which they can do half order. The waiting staff is very attentive. The busser do ask if you are satisfied or need any assistance.    As much I enjoyed eating from it. There are a few things that bothered me:  - I had ordered Uni and had a shell piece in. It was quite noticeable.  - I had a order that I waited longer than usual. Turns out it was given to the person next to me - One of the roll I received was cold. A tempura based one.   The service was exceptional fare for both ends of the house. I was very pleased with most of the items and selection and as well expectation. The only criticism I have if the chefs could be more wary of the food they produce and given to. I had the courtesy of sitting near the Expo/Lead cook. The available of items is exceptionally. If it weren't for the quality and the front of the house's good management, I would had a worse outlook on Umiya.  I would come back again. If I'm back in town.

BrS1LQuRzqCludUzsQ_MsA.text: This place was great .. Service was fast, food was great and they had a huge menu for ayce!!

QI_Kr0lWRqxFiYg0K5o_cw.text: I have never been a AYCE sushi joint that pumped out the sushi so fast.  I went on a Friday night where they were busy and they had 6 sushi chefs working and plenty of waiters.  I barely got the last piece of sushi off my plate before it was whisked away by a server.  Service was truly excellent.  Stand out items were the oysters and orgasm salad.  Cuts of fish were sloppy and a bit small for the nigiri, but the rolls were pretty good.  But damn, that bench seating is even more uncomfortable than it looks.

tvBQ0SgSiWaZop0Zq_jdLA.text: I come here for lunch a lot and I really appreciate the variety of lunch special options that make it easy to not spend too much and not get bored eating the same things all the time.  The sushi isn't always the best but it is still a good deal and I really like all the bento box options that they have.  The pick-2 and pick 3 roll options really keep it interesting.

uiLeDWIIj7a6x0737ky29g.text: Amaaazing AYCE Japanese food. Came with family and they have so many options ranging from salads to grilled seafood, meat, rolls, sushi, and tempuras. Had quite a spread on my table, wish I had taken a photo but was too busy chowing down. Good healthy buffet option for Vegas. Service is great too. Kids enjoyed it too!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura ice cream!

xPTESZLi9vRWjIFmkCCcjw.text: The second you step into the restaurant, you are greeted by everyone. Seating does not take long, and it's a great place for big groups to eat together. Food was brought out quickly, and they all tasted good. Overall it was a great experience. Special thanks to Ashley for helping us.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing

gUI4XqWj1_M2bnf3mSJMBg.text: First of all, I have heard this place have a great sushi.  Unfortunately, this was my first experience with Umiya. I was so disappointed of this place service.  We were seated right after came in, but it took 30mins for the sever asked us about ANY drink while any others, who came after us, were even eating the food already. We ordered only 3 TIMES with all you can eat. Between we were waiting for order. It look the ridiculous wait like 20mins each time to have their attention.   Food was great, came fast, and delightful.  But, too long to wait for sever and any attention! Nobody paid attention at ALL. I would rather spend 40$ on other sushi place.

1H7pBvz90ByptxNiE9asVg.text: Love this sushi spot! One of the best AYCE sushi places in the valley. The service is fast and the sushi is quite fresh. Personally I think it is better then some of the sushi spots on Las Vegas blvd. If prices are 20 dollars for lunch and lunch goes from 11-3 and dinner is 25 dollars and that goes from 3-2am!!!! Not too much difference in the food from lunch to dinner so if you can go for lunch to get the cheaper option I suggest it

M1d4gXH0wmD5RhGRIT6oNQ.text: If this was a review on just the food then I would give 5 stars.  My guest and I had AYCE dinner.  The oyster, baked squid, mussels and other were great, the saki was perfect, wish could order more of the oysters.  You are limited to one order per person for AYCE, but I understand.   However if I would rate the service I would give a 2 star.  The greeter was the best but once we sat down the server was pushy to get or our order in and then after placing 2 sets of order we felt that they were rushing us out.  We ordered desert and saki then after saki they brought our bill.  I paid it but stayed for 2 more hours catching up with an old friend.  We were going to order more saki but decided that since they pushed us to close our bill we wont.  Sorry but u could have had a 5 star and more of our money...

mizCXLqkXgI_tRdIOPF-NA.text: We came as a party of 7. Our trip was a result of a Grand Canyon aborted trip.The Google map to Umiya.Their eat all you can menu was so inviting, we all decided to do this. For 90 minutes , we did a marathon eating, round by round. My fave is the oyster, just the right size although this one is limited to oysters per person. That is why I am rating it 4 stars. I could eat only this. Luckily, 4 of my party did not eat oysters so I got their part. I like their style that  everything is in small plates except the sushi. This way we do not feel guilty leaving food unfinished.The tuna poke was very good. Over all the experience was satisfying including the service. I just wished I could have more oysters.   Sorry, the pork belly and the crispy chicharon wasnt theirs. We were in a road trip and got the pics mixed up

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy and sinful chicharon bulaklak.
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted pork belly! Food trip to the max!this is the specialty of the house.
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna poke and tuna salad! Tuna tuna lots of tuna!

Xh1Fha97IJyrU4Ovh0mg7w.text: Just come, you'll get it. ;)  We came on a Saturday night and even though it was a little busy the service was quick and nice and food was awesome. All-you-can-eat is $26 for dinner time and $21 for lunch time. You can order ANYTHING you want off of the expansive menu. We got plate after plate of Nigiri: salmon, Baby scallops (my fave), salmon eggs, yellowtail, eel, jalapeno poppers, naked mussels etc.  we are from the LA area here for the weekend and we are SO happy with our dinner choice here

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon eggs and baby scallop
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VZDIopy_YhOL4IvCWZXYhA.text: The rice was so dry and hard, it made all the sushi hard to eat. Rice lacks viniger flavor and didn't taste like sushi rice. The appetizer was good.

l3QS8iKZYAJ4t5vvQVRtiQ.text: I'm an out of town visitor traveling for work craving sushi. Service was friendly and prompt, prices are reasonable, and the place very cozy. I ordered three of my sushi favorites - rainbow roll, salmon roll, and shrimp tempura roll. The shrimp tempura roll was great, but the other two rolls were so bland I couldn't even tell what fish I was eating. I barely touched the salmon roll and couldn't finish the rainbow roll either - I have my limits with bland food.

4xj4Ip12eAiW_GoW9pFkSQ.text: This was my sushi place for the last ~2 years. I wrote "was" because I don't think I'll go back to this place.  In the last 3 times I've been there, I've noticed changes within the freshness/quality of the food, the amount of the fish went down so now you're eating more rice etc. Maybe they changed the owner? I have no clue but I was regular in this place and I'm sure there are changes. I think it's very hard to be consistent in this field, this is why I went there 3 times before I chose to stop going, just to make sure it wasn't a bad day or something.  I wish it wasn't like this because it was my "AYCE Sushi" go to place, no I just need to find another place - any suggestions?

CCvoBT3STbJJJK644l0UHg.text: This place is great. We came in to escape the Super Bowl crowds and had a wonderful meal. I got the shishito peppers, spicy tuna salad, and cucumber roll. Super keto friendly and very delicious.

CiJQaO9nE6FQzNHUX6m2ow.text: Still amazing, fresh sushi :) never disappointed!  The sushi and service is always great! Clean and friendly environment, we always feel welcomed and have a great eating experience. They even get festive during the holidays. The yum yum crab roll is where it's at!

QSuRA2eEmEWyNCy1sxtHNQ.text: This place went down hill really fast! I used to love this place and I would bring all my friends when they visited. Today I was embarrassed to suggest this place it was terrible since we walked on the door. Horrible service we were treated like crap they messed up our order constantly and burnt a few of our rolls and when we told them we couldn't eat it they acted like they were doing us a favor. I won't return and I will advise all my friends against it.

jxzAmYQPk3YiekGWnuHkPQ.text: Perfect customer service great people interactions, attention to details, and wonderful staff, they accommodate a party of 20 that ended with 36 and they did it without negative energy and a loving heart !  Would absolutely recommend and I have already in our Network.

4teSxPjlxVvvZRfhpSQFHQ.text: Visited this place a couple nights ago with some friends. Nothing too special and their sushi is not bad. Quality is what you would expect for an average ayce sushi place. Overall the experience was average and satisfying.

lRneueOUbijxHUgs9KrVug.text: I'm not sure why the reviews on this place is rated so highly...  I came here this past weekend after a long trafficy drive from LA. I called Umiya Sushi on the way there and ask how long the wait it would be for 2 people. They told me it was around 15-20 minutes. I didn't mind and I was hungry so we drove here anyway. It was about 3/4 full and we got seated fairly quickly (didn't end up waiting 15-20 min).   We decided to just go with AYCE and not the a la carte menu because we thought it would be around the same price. I do understand they have a 90 minute time limit for dining in. To be honest, I usually don't take that long to eat as long as the food comes out in a decent time period. They were very pushy and I felt very rushed while eating. I had not even been there for 30 minutes and at least 3 people came by and kept trying to get us to order more food. I see their tricks...order fast, fill up on rice, gtfo quicker. No thanks. Just wanted to enjoy my sushi.  Their fish was decent but man...they put so much rice on their rolls. Ive been to places back in LA where they aren't trying to rob you of your money by giving you 5:1 rice to fish ratio.   Also, one of the servers put down a half order of sunrise roll. The sunrise roll consisted  of:   Inside: spicy crab  Top: salmon, avocado, green onion Sauce: Spicy ponzu  As soon as he placed it down, he told his manager (might possibly be the owner too) and said the avocado looked a little off and brown... Manager came by, inspected the roll in front of us and told us the avocado looked bad and then said he would make us a new one. Why would you even place the sushi down in the first place if it looks bad? It made me feel more uneasy when he came over and inspected it and then told us it looked bad.   I guess.....Thanks for not letting us eat bad avocado, but no thanks for making me not want to eat it at all, even if it was a new one.  I think its safe to say I wont be returning here...

Y3YCfBncQYvPIFmpJ5Nglw.text: UMIYA has excellent food and a good... no... GREAT !!! diverse variety so it's not like "Todai" or a run of the mill AYCE Asian Buffet.   This features made to order QUALITY food.  The AYCE (all you can eat) Menu features so many specialty rolls, it would be best to come with a larger party of 4 or more people so you can try a little of everything.  They serve non-Sushi items too, which makes it a great place to eat!  Parking is easy (Vegas is always easy for a metropolitan city)   The price is around $25 for lunch.

vcayFWQ2Yg4P2AF9Fr4IVQ.text: Tried for the first tome. venue is spacious, ample parking and great service! wide selection of food they even have rib eye, pork belly which are gread addition to the menu. price for lunch is only $20.99.awesome deal!!! food is fresh. definitely, a must place to visit.

The service is as quick as a blink of an eye hahah.  I don't have anything bad to say about it, i just actually want smaller portions for the sushi because i want to try everything, but that's no big deal, I won't remove a star.
