4iLk0F9eSYBtTnLjOhGN0w.text: Very good ayce.  Small portions so you can try everything. Plus, the whole menu is on ayce not just some select list of rolls. Really great place!

8SsdJ5SGiJcEU0aYJM1ieg.text: This place is deals!!! AYCE and the prices for ala carte was just as cheap. The quality of the rolls and a few of the dishes were simple and tasty. They don't pack in a lot of rice for the nigiri which is good! 90 minute time limit goes up pretty fast, but they still offer you desserts in the end even though your time is up which I thought was nice.  -This place gets super packed, and there was a few tables filled up as soon as they opened. -There is a lot of large tables, great for large groups! *Fresh Oysters, and Grilled Octopus were great, fresh and tasty!  -Don't bother with the ribeye, it sucked. Dry, overcooked and puny.

zqJnJI99YZ3nqY6RaUHEzw.text: YESSSSS!! Bomb AYCE sushi in Las Vegas, and worth the wait! I love the baked rolls and salmon belly. Service is good, everyone works fast and food comes out right away.

rn6LQh6DgRKeJUDitl01lg.text: Best sushi in town, Alaskan roll, kiss of fire, Edamame , beer, tequila. All you can eat sushi is the bomb!  Excellent service, good atmosphere, can't wait to come back. The garlic edamame is amazing! You won't find a better spot!

VtJAvwj_2GwpUTo1BsiKIA.text: Best Sushi ever a most have while I  Vegas... wow it was a real treat!!! Found it by chance only .7 miles from the Rio and truly enjoy it, you can tell is a locals favorite... great service and menu amazing variety of food and excellent freshness and flavors

GR0MzmVI0KsiQEZvyChlzw.text: Excellent sushi bar. Fresh fish, frendly & great employees. I highly recommend this place.

VJ49bjSaQjZVtFkQqliLLw.text: This is the best A.Y.C.E. SUSHI I have ever eaten. anywhere.  in any country. The service is outstanding the quality is impeccable we felt so comfortable here. Never waited a minute for anything.  This is a must go!!!!! Thank you Umiya

P4dnbVfoHrUJo2212HrPbQ.text: Went there for lunch twice. Fantastic sushi. Very good service, close to the strip but far enough. Laid back.

wtZzuccTHmZeZK1f5Wv0KQ.text: The absolute BEST Sushi and Sashimi. We were greeted and seated immediately. The entire staff was super friendly and courteous. The entire staff was very attentive at all times. The atmosphere was excellent. I have traveled all over the United States and this was hands down the BEST that i have ever had. I am looking very forward to going back.

jvWpBVdsDLEPMEgDim0kWg.text: Love all of the sushi here!! Especially, the spicy tuna salad, it was so so good. and ya fish is fresh.

JWxFMpNG_uHzw4U9BdE_9g.text: Great AYCE menu for the same price as most of the sushi place in town. Great service. All the food we ordered taste great. Only thing I wish they had was some drink specials. Hot tea was a little expensive, paid $7.50 for it. Still wondering why it cost that much for 1 tea. Other than that we had a great time.

Ey9F-k8tK0cMVCz-F7sKlQ.text: Came in on a Sunday night and it was jam packed!!  Hostess was super friendly and said wait was about 20min so we asked to sit at the bar (5min wait).  Service was great from the moment we walked in and even tho they were packed everyone was really nice.  Got seated and got drink order right away(16oz draft & glass of white wine fo da wifey).  Sashimi??? for ayce...limited to 1 order but was still ba...bomb!!  Soft shell crab??? for ayce...limited to 1 order but devoured.  Uni, amaebi, salmon belly were all awesome.  Ayce menu was huge from appetizers to sushi to sashimi to custom rolls to hand rolls which were probably the best hand rolls (spicy hamachi, spicy tuna, spicy salmon & yes i ate them all & yes i like to eat)  i've eaten at an ayce or anywhere not ayce to steaks to noodles this place has it all.  There's sumthin' for everyone!  Definitely found a new place for ayce and the reviews are spot on this time.

YbxwjMnTVCkSGSCXU7bleQ.text: I have been to Umiya... probably about 10 times, sometimes even twice a week. For someone like my sister and I who work til 10 or 11pm, a spot that opens late into the night is perfect and apparently it's hard to find in a 24 hour city like this one.   I like Umiya for one thing and one thing only: their sushi and quality of fish. Most of the rolls that I've tried are pretty damn good. (Salmon killer; orange blossom, and although this roll was my absolute all time favorite, they must have tweaked something because it just doesn't taste the same; snow white; rattlesnake) The nigiri is composed well in terms of the ratio of rice to fish. The quality of their ingredients are fresh--with the exception of avocados perhaps being too fresh since it was nearing raw in my Monkey Brain. Oh man, with an abundance of ginger flowing with my nigiri and rolls, I'm a girl in heaven after a long day at work!  The only thing that holds me back from a 5 star rating is the service. To pick on the nitty gritty stuff, even though the servers know my sister and I their greeting is always the same. (I work in the service industry as a waitress and I can't say that I'm the best in my field but 8 out of 10 customers complement me on my service and I can say with confidence that 100% of the returning customers like to be recognized.) Whether they are busy or not, they rarely check up on my table and we always have to ask for attention. Even when they drop off our orders they never seem to ask if everything is alright and if we need something. I hope that they realize quickly that service is just as important as food for a business and regroup the way they serve customers.   Other than the service, a must try sushi joint! :)

h2Za5aadsRT6nELvs4BJpA.text: Service is great and not bad all you can eat for $25. Plenty of roll options and the seaweed salad is tasty. Plus they have coffee mochi for dessert.

3A8xXXOGEEV5xhSH-gGsUA.text: Service was great. The chicken teriyaki was perfect and the crunch lobster rolls were amazing. Glad we came in. Whenever I'm in Vegas again I will definitely be coming back.

AnKoCbX5HEAaNMhknGobdQ.text: Great sushi buffet! The sushi is fresh and the service is great. Nice ambience too. Love the spicy tuna salad-yum! The bacon wrapped scallop is so yummy too! All their rolls r fabulous! Would highly recommend it. This is now my regular spot whenever I'm in Vegas.

3vCsQJ2gaw28RNKJxEwCWg.text: Great food! Great service! Did all you can eat and ate a lot. Came with a big group of people and they had no problem accommodating us. Varied menu, fresh fish, great wine and beer selection. Recommended.

km-TL4u1i19APErYtZZPeg.text: I love that I can come here with my friends who love sushi and still enjoy the ayce! Katsu is the best, service is the best! Loved the experience!

0q3oqJHcVN04eg4r4IQ7Nw.text: I brought my dad here for his birthday.  It was my first time, but he has been two ones before and recommended it.  It was about 2pm on a Saturday and the place was packed.   I thought right away that our service wouldn't be as good because of how busy they were but that wasn't the case.  They were all working as a team together satisfying all of our needs and were on top of it all.  The food was amazing.  I will definitely be back.

AkjoQtodO3EdNbN3NDAuOg.text: Was going pretty good. I'm always looking for healthier choices. Ordered the chicken skewer that looked fantastic in the menu but I was brought a skewer that had been deep fried. It was so fried that the veggies were indistinguishable. It was enough to turn me off but the rest of the meal was super good.

0vneuIynB8bLfkaTIwC-tA.text: I love the food specially ramen.The staff are friendly. This is my 3rd time visiting this store.

JMujupTILSzW_ds9Gi83Lw.text: Ultra clean, great service, fresh fish, certainly in the top five best of vegas. They have a very comfortable seating arrangement and spacious tables. Plus their menu includes plenty of dishes for those friends that don't do sushi. It's a win for everyone.  One block up from  the Rio across from the from the palms. Easy to get to. They had 6 chefs working at 10pm. Awesome!

uaYK2dhE6VgcZ1eTu3MTVw.text: I used to go to sushi kaya but umiya has better customer service and better service means better sushi. One of my go to spots for sushi.

BlToX8kcuw3Kp1sjuNyvrA.text: It's very delicious. The best sushi in Vegas. Honestly the Nigiri here beats out the others. Like the fish is so good that you wouldn't need any sauce to go along with it. Don't miss out on one of the best in Vegas.

jBS-npOyq0XM7XimTciHew.text: Fist of all you have to finish everything at the all you can eat part or you have to pay for it...I mean what the heck is that...well I paid but never again!

wCXCrYmdpuAGTHmjGcWqsw.text: Went with three other sushi regulars and one newbie.  All enjoyed immensely.  $45 out the door despite several shared beers and sake.  I'll go back for sure.

CNGt3Wly5CqmBMTY3h9cTA.text: I was hesitant to try this place because I'm used to going to my regular spots..reason for, is because everytime I go out and try something new, it just never appeals to me, for example, bad service and terrible food even with awesome reviews about those places. So I took a risk and tried this joint out..the place was very subtle and the ambience was relaxing. The server was very attentive and always came to our table at the right time we needed him. Now to the food. The nigiri was super fresh, with the right amount of rice and the appetizers were incredible. The must have are the salmon cheese stick, sizzling pork belly on a skillet, and soft shell crab just to name a few..the rolls were very delicious, great texture and flavors..oh! And you can order half rolls as well so that really got me loving this place even more! So in conclusion, I highly recommend this place and I will definitely be back soon!! Peeeeace!!

Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Crunch Roll! Off the charts!!
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh! Fresh! Fresh!

v7XAchsSUeFg01XsBk9Xng.text: I've eaten here many times and this has to be my favorite All You Can Eat Sushi restaurant.  The sushi chefs are always super friendly and greet you when you walk in the door. The wait staff is always attentive and pays close attention to detail - and the FOOD. Omg the sushi is delicious. I tend to stick to cut rolls and nigiri - which are always FANTASTIC. But the rest of the menu is amazing as well. I keep coming back, again, and again, and again.  And, this certainly won't be my last time either.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail / scallion rolls. Yum!!
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious!! ;-)~

XxLN52x_6gR6DnR1-T6ZRw.text: My boyfriend and I found this gem one night while we were craving sushi. It's THE best sushi! They have a variety of rolls and they're open later than most places. The waiters and waitresses are super attentive and are always available if you have any questions and they very openly suggest rolls that they like if you're new to the place. We are definitely looking forward to becoming regulars!!

NXJVp_fuFCxUu2Gx2njdsA.text: You get what you paid for, with that being said, why would u come to an all you can eat sushi joint?  The good thing is, they have a very extensive menu, the place was well decorated and service was exceptional the night I came here.  Now the bad side, all the rolls/sushi is about 70% rice and 30% fish, fine I get that this is AYCE but the quality of the raw stuff is beyond bad, the sweet shrimp and oyster literally made me wanna puke, call me harsh but I'm from LA and my taste buds are spoiled.  The rice was hard and they give u plenty of that, I was also informed that if we left out any rice we would be charged, but after a few sushis I almost didn't give a shit cause it was so bad  My suggestions, stay away from the sushi or rolls, or anything with rice in them   For $26 per person u might as well suck it up and go to a real buffet.   If u must come, order yakitori, meat or the appetizer dishes, they're quite good.

nJX7M-87H1M3yKq5fcMjzw.text: This is a really great all you can set sushi bar. You have one hour for like under $30. I especially like the specialty rolls here. The atmosphere is casual and relaxed. The staff are very speedy and super professional. I have been here many times and always get great food and service and leave with a happy and full tummy. I have seen it get quite busy inside from time to time so you may want to call ahead and see if there is any wait time. Bon appetite!

9SLKsJMIybYqqScdXr6qZA.text: Hands down the best customer service I've ever received. Absolutely loved that they offered half rolls. And they have a fancy button that allowed me to summon the waiter as soon as I was ready to order more! Good for the whole family!

jiZ_TfFt73hboqX5WKgfow.text: Sooooo bomb. It's awesome that you can order half rolls to try all different sorts! Fried shrimp heads ftw!!! Definitely will be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Iv7ls-8YjCXZyOvdMuY5ag.text: Fresh sashimi, all you can eat. You can order almost anything you want. Too many things to eat and what a pity that I just couldn't afford to have them all--- my stomach is not big enough haha. If you have big stomach this is definitely a good place to try different kinds of Japanese foods. The taste is not the top, but yummy for sure. Be cautious to over-order sushi roll, cuz they come in dozen and the sushi is, to me, quite big size.

hXwzxqyoteEjVZvqPe61VQ.text: If you ever want a great all you can eat spot in Vegas check this place out... From the quick turn around on what you order to the staff... 10 out of 10 in my opinion.... Place gets packed to capacity pretty quick so if you want inside tip sit at the sushi bar and ask for Aaron, if your lucky he'll create a unique roll for ya...

EkdO_EBD2xa45sAVRRTTxw.text: $25 all you can eat sushi is pretty good deal. You can have 2 pieces of Amaebi which was pretty huge size and 2 pieces of Uni. Thats $15 if you order regular sushi already.  Fish are pretty good. Wish they could offer some sashimi because you just dont wanna eat nigiri all the time. Like my bro doesn't like to eat rice and wanna stay in shape, he only ate fish and waitress said he couldnt do that, but my bro just wanna pay extra because he really didnt wanna eat rice. Not that he wanted wasted food. Hope they could understand that.   They have very big menu, so there are a lot of options for you. You can have 2 pieces of fresh oyster too   Soft shell crab is available,  but it has too much tempura mix on it. not that crispy.   $25 is not expensive for that many options. Vegas just have so many good restaurants and good price. Wish they could open some in Bay Area

ex2wiFr3M-D2CFT0Y-WW8g.text: Love this place. Great food fun servers.  Fast clean. I'll be back for sure.  Thank you Taylor for the great service!

B_P-QmKS98oqs1F3lY7w-w.text: Simply amazing all around!  Service: Food gets out to you quickly, all servers were very attentive and friendly   Environment: Clean, nice moody atmosphere and large tables for bigger group  Food: The all you can eat deal for $25 (dinner) is the best deal!!!! Come hungry because you can have all types of sushi including traditional rolls, sashimi, specialty rolls and hand rolls. In addition, you can also get rib eye steak (1 time), pork belly, udon, skewers, salads, veggies, desserts, appetizer and entree type of meals. This is not a buffet, you order from a large ayce menu. All the food that my large group had was great and we are absolutely coming back for more!!!!!  I love this place!

URaBs5wq4JfChqQFwtorpg.text: Bang for your buck! Definitely try this one away from your hotel. You will be surprised. Especially the service of the staffs was stellar.

gJFvht4Qr9clfODXOVrTew.text: Been a little while since the last sushi exploration.  This place wasn't too far from home and had great reviews, so it was a no brainer.  Appetizers: Baby Octupus Skewer, Bacon Scallop Skewer, Tuna Poke, Mushroom boy, and Crispy Rice with Spicy Tuna.  All delicious. Highly suggest them all.  Mushroom boy is a deep fried mushroom filled with cream cheese and spicy tuna. No further explanation necessary.  On to the rolls.....  Philly Roll, Hawaiian Roll, Chicken Teriyaki Roll, and Vegas Lasagna.  Normally, there'd be another roll and 2-3 nigiri orders but. We tapped out. Today our bellies could not withstand AYCE as usual. But it's all good. We'll be back for sure to try everything else we missed!!  The service was very quick and on cue. Always ready to serve you and refill your drinks and take your plates.  Ambiance is laid back and cool. Love the bar and how big it is. Plenty of space for the 96 rolls you're gonna order.  They have some amazing sauces on their stuff, and just enough.  They have the news and sports on while playing top 40/EDM  Not my #1 place, but it's a great sushi option. And REALLY good for groups.

l65WZBmKVKZeK9rbPUGxoA.text: Excellent service dragon roll, orange blossom, spicy Tuna roll were the top best! Mochi is always the best...their bathroom though was gross

uO1E8R2462khBwN-dKUrIg.text: Best All-you-can-eat sushi place I've been to. Worths every dime of $25 dinner price. Just order all of the one-time only food items and you can't go wrong.

-Ymb17Im4HNqaHA5BFflwQ.text: We came here with a party of six and ordered a huge variety from all you can eat dinner menu.  Everything was fantastic.  The servers were fast and responsive.  We ordered plate after plate of sashimi and it all tasted fresh. There was absolutely nothing on the menu we didn't like besides the Uni (but we only ordered it to gross out our non sushi eating friends.  Seriously, it would be nasty anywhere).  The place was packed which is always a good sign for sushi.  The bench and table seating was very comfortable. This place is spot on across-the-board.  I would highly recommend it to anyone.

lRhgbO8rKm-Mw5csAQs3Aw.text: Great service and even better food!! I had a guy waitress and he was sooooo nice making sure we were okay at all times, with a great sense of humor. For dinner I had a fried Philadelphia roll and a Vegas lasagna.... Their fresh sushi is great too! Not bad for 26$ all you can eat.... Oh the only downfall were the 1$ skewers not so great  everything else was just lovely!

-pdeB9PXu-ItfC2leyHSGA.text: I've done the AYCE both times here. The service is okay. Half empty and wasn't on top of their game.  I would compare the food to the company I had while eating here. It's a tease. The apps, nigiri, and rolls look great. When you taste them, some are good while some are bad. The bad makes you want to stop but the good keeps you wanting more.  Real talk.

ybKLlxylIlO7CF5DlkGdbw.text: No better place to celebrate Mother's Day! Love the ambiance! And of course the sushi! Great and fresh sushi selection! One of the best ayce sushi resto inVegas. A definite must try!

kiFgMylxcSBlMU-6nfnZlQ.text: Visiting from Hawaii and was wary to try fish in Vegas (there's no ocean!!),  but this place is legit!  I had Uni, spicy ahi, soft shell crab and everything is super yummy.  I like that it has a very modern vibe and fast, attentive service from staff.   Highly recommend and will for sure come back.

tOA1SkM5OXXiarcw0ZsGgQ.text: This place is Tuna-tabulous!! But for real some of the best sushi I've ever had. Get the poke for sure. All of the rolls i tried were fantastic. Recommended for sure.

4G9CTsLWPLI005MC1TcDLQ.text: We had a going away / birthday get together last night at this place and i was overly impressed with the customer service, quality of food, prompt service, and cleanliness of the establishment. I have frequented many sushi restaurants around town and nationwide and have to say this is the best I've ever been to. We were seated as soon as our party arrived. The waitress was quick to take our drink order. As she was doing this, another server came to take our food order. I really need to become better at getting the servers names. There was just such a team effort and they were all moving so fast that it was difficult to pinpoint one.  The food began to present itself and they did not miss a beat. We had a table of 9 and not one item was missed. I have a habit of letting everyone order before me as a courtesy. That tends to get my order last and by that time, everyone has already eaten. It was a pleasant surprise to receive my food so that I could enjoy it with the rest of the party. The faster we ordered, the quicker the staff brought our food. The drinks never dried up and I was pleased with the overall experience. I will certainly become a regular here if they can keep this level of greatness. I will highly recommend this place to many other friends and family. I also work in a medical office where our patients constantly ask for new places to eat. Keep up the great work and i hope to see you all soon.

ac280xgwvR907yfq1tKIXw.text: Originally wanted Goyemon but didn't like 1 hr wait so came here instead.  I gota say I was not disappointed.   The specials of the day were ocean trout and salmon belly.  Both were pretty good but I wished they had a bit more specials.  What really earned them the 4 stars from me was the ama ebi.  They used some FAT ASS ebi and it was great.  Having some good quality and perfectly fried soft shell crab didn't hurt either.

8HR8fWZ0OlF9QCJjDeQXsw.text: 4 star food, 2 star service. Server did not speak good English and was able to take down our orders okay enough but certainly wasn't helpful with anything above the bare minimum. Also a busboy spilled soup all over my girlfriend's shoes and clothing due to mishandling of dishes. He did grab napkins and cloths and try to help but obviously the damage was already done.   Food was very good but there are still plenty of better sushi places in Vegas. Value is pretty good and I like the all you can eat concept but given the lacking service I can't see myself returning anytime soon.

DVAqAdLu8zueA1FzJt8BJg.text: Nice place with great rolls! Lots of options to choose from and nice decor. The manager came up for a table touch and the servers seem to all have each other's backs. They did forget a roll I ordered but everyone makes mistakes.

g8xzps0CnsjBqfzDiotpYQ.text: This place is very good they have good quality food and is better than goyemon. They open til 2 am so they are reliable and the service is good and very fast. I don't have to wait long for my food to come out and it's never always busy so you don't have to wait long to be seated. I really like this place, I'd come here before anywhere else I would definitely recommend. They also have a check in and you get one free soda or drink

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The mussels are really good

GK7q_E7vt1_Ep06PNojslw.text: They are awesome there food there service is unbelievable you order sushi in just couple minutes you get your food ready to go will come back again............................

YiJNKEX2ebCctVEPMA8evA.text: Not the best tasting or freshest sushi I've ever had. It is in Vegas and far away from the ocean so u can't expect the catch of the day. Wasn't too expensive. I checked in and was supposed to get a free drink but I still got charged. Whatever, prob won't be going back. Might just stay in my casino n hit up a buffet n avoid the detour.

GdNdpUwePdyZkBhetvzZBg.text: Came here for the 1st time with my father.  Service, price and atmosphere were all great.  I highly recommend the firecracker roll.   We also had Uni and some sashimi.  Everything was great.  #sushi #sashimi #lasvegas

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday dinner..

Aazb-DRwZJj_vr9enblOag.text: Great food! Great service!  The selection of fish and dishes are amazing.  I wanted to order everything off the menu but my stomach just couldn't take it. I will definitely be coming back here for more abuse to my stomach.

kYjZK3Hrum8oLeUiDjqcgQ.text: You get 90 minutes to eat as much sushi and other types types of Asian foods. The sushi you get to eat is SOOO fresh and made with lots of love. You can actually watch the sushi chefs going to town as they make all the sushi you ask for. This is the perfect place to try the expensive sushi you've been wanting to try but have not been able to. The sashimi was on point. The udon? Delicious. The samgyupsal (pork belly) was ridiculously good.   Literally one of or possibly the best AYCE sushi places I've had. Will def. be coming back!!!

XN04eCt1kww6-_f8P0d6-Q.text: I really wanted t like this place because the servers were working really hard but unfortunately this was our worst AYCE experience...  Food was really disappointing. Rice was not cooked well so that contributed to the poor quality of sushi. I stopped ordering nigiri after the first round because of the rice. I am sure it is probably this one time and hope other times they get the rice right. But it is quite unfortunate they didn't taste the rice...they would've stopped serving it.  Service was very very slow. There were only two waiters working there and we can see that they were really trying. But the restaurant was full and they couldn't keep up.   Overall very bad sushi experience. I liked the atmosphere but had to fill my belly with Udon at an AYCE sushi place :-(

CGZspX4tLGwvriXODd_6Xg.text: Awesome! All foods are so delicious. AYCE is pretty reasonable price. (21$ for lunch, 26$ for dinner). Servers are nice and fast.

AjB1CzZ1KJeG5QyomfyOvw.text: Great All You Can Eat Sushi place! Quick and friendly service with awesome food. Definitely coming back here again!

99wXUM1p_9Fv_E_9OmJEXQ.text: For all you can eat sushi, definitely the quality of the food over exceeded my expectations. The only downside to this whole experience was that they never told us (until we finished eating and asked for the check) that they charged extra for the plates we didn't eat! How convenient of them to tell their costumers by the end of the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. As you can see all we took advantage of all you can eat!

qmcq2zhO_vseXefA_MGaDQ.text: We came in for my mother's birthday for lunch time. We had 34 in our party with 9 loud kids. ...that's how my family rolls.  Anyhow the bill came out to $700 including tip.  Super worth the price.  The waitresses were super friendly and patient. Great food. We liked all the rolls, especially the baked items. Definitely will be coming back.

h7W3Md2yatCedifcJmilZg.text: Super stoked I discovered this place. My favorite sushi is Mizumi at the Wynn but sometimes its just such a hassle to get to the strip, Ive been needing a groovy lil local spot to love. So yeah visited this spot on like a Tuesday night I think? It was packed and there was a 15 min wait so my friends and I went to coffee bean to kill what little  time we had. One of my friends brought his coffee in with him and the staff told him no outside food allowed. Which is annoying, but understandable. My friend kind of threw a fit and the staff remained really calm and collected which I admired. My friend apologized later for his episode about the coffee, and to my amazement the staff was sweet and cordial with us throughout the night. Really groovy ambiance as well. Definitely a cool place to bring friends and I don't do AYCE sushi because that sounds horrifying and cheap to me but the sushi was actually good.

a6cWY6IlOGEWFiBdqwpUtw.text: I eat here no less than 3-4 times a week no joke. Great for a quick sushi role for $5 or their all you can eat is everything!

p2ReC3X4iak3dWTLqKXqJw.text: Food is good. This time the sushi had too much rice. Got the chocolate and strawberry mochi and it was dry. This is the second time. Funny thing is the waitress said it just came in....

C9N8RdcgrmJM124h17_7Wg.text: Wow impressed with this place!!!  You have to try the Seared Tuna Sashimi in AJ sauce and the seared tuna collar!!!  Melts in your mouth. The atmosphere is nice and seating area is huge.  Definitely recommend this joint to sushi lovers...   Gotta try the plum wine ice cream.  Amazing!!

Zo7cw-VlGQj05Wp1njBcWg.text: Wife had a craving so we looked up AYCE sushi joint during our stay here.  Came in on a Friday afternoon for their lunch special ($20.95/pp) and half off for our kids.  Totally worth it!!  The hostess, waiter, and entire crew was friendly and super attentative.  3-4 members constantly swarm our table taking empty plates away immediately and replacing them with more deliciousness.   So much to try and all came out perfect.  I felt a little guilty with the wife constantly ordering and requesting stuff, but the crew was quick and courteous. This is now our favorite AYCE sushi joint!!  Even beating out all our other favorites in the OC (CA).  Nice job guys!

Qhn14FumzUaFNoRyGqU81Q.text: While I had a good first meal at Umiya on my birthday, a return visit without all the hoopla was way more disappointing than anticipated. First, there was an unusual wait with others being seated before us without any explanation. After we were finally the last party seated, I realized that the AYCE did not apply to the salmon belly, which was a daily special (which is not the case at Goyemon).   Some of the dishes I enjoyed included the daily special yuzu hamachi, sweet shrimp, grilled mackerel, uni, and the AJ (seared tuna sashimi in sauce). Some of the many missteps include the service which forgot to place our initial orders and then failed to apologize or acknowledge it, the soft-shell crab, and the unforgivable spicy tuna nachos. There was no flow to the ordering and our server even tried to take a second order without us having received the first. The only special item that Umiya has over the other sushi buffets is the soft shell crab and perhaps the rib-eye steak. But, with the multitude of AYCE sushi buffets available in Vegas, I can't see myself coming back for another disappointing meal.

Jl0Hb8EeORzZzh80qBDgcw.text: This place had 30+ people standing outside waiting for it to open, that's a good sign. We walked in when they opened and sat down, the server said they were short staffed and that there would be an increased wait time, which I was fine with.  We ordered AYCE, only $20 at lunch.  We ordered mussels, oysters, ahi, yellow tail, albacore, a few rolls, steak, and a ton of other stuff.  The sushi was small but fresh and good. The rolls, you can order full or half rolls, were nice and really flavorful. The meat was cooked well, and the service, despite the longer wait, was really quite great.  We sat and chatted while we ate for about an hour, no rush, and our drinks were always full.  The place was packed for the duration but it still felt nice and open. Cool decor, and nice big wood tables for larger groups.  I would come back here 100%. Really had a fine time and enjoyed the heck out of my food.

i8nt4pTfvDZ1T67G9dIb0A.text: All you can eat sushi! This place is so good and so worth it! The price for the quality of the all you can eat sushi is MUST GO TO THIS PLACE TO EAT! All the sushi we ordered was fantastic, I didn't have one bad roll. The oysters were really good as well! I definitely love that they had unlimited seaweed salad! At first when we got here we were worried about the 90 minute time limit but we chowed down ALOT of food in like 30 mins and got full fast so don't worry about the time limit and really enjoy each dish you order! This is a must go to place if you are in Vegas and a huge fan of sushi! I will definitely be coming back my next trip to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kCtDVCnWKCDy3eNdxeNSjQ.text: Our party of 19 walked in here without knowing it's a AYCE restaurant! They have adequate space and tables that can be combined into one for big parties.  Having a party with the majority of them being visitor from Japan, I was really curious as to what they think of this place.  For about $26 per person, other than alcoholic beverages and specialty drinks, we got to order from a huge menu of all you can eat sushi rolls with certain dishes limited to a single serving per person. The caveat is that you must eat everything you order or get penalized.  Everyone was tired and quite famished so we happily ordered and consumed an assortment cold and hot sushi rolls along with certain specialties like grilled steak, uni, poke, etc.  "the quality is okay but you really can't beat the price for the amount of sushi you get." one of my Japanese cohorts commented.   I agree completely.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V29dwb6PauIVypkwH9emww.text: I cant even give this restaurant a 1 Star!!! PLEASE PLEASE don't waste your time driving over here unless you want diarrhea nausea headache body ache and hot flashes because their food! 5 of my family members went on Sunday for AYCE and that same night had horrible symptoms could NOT sleep from having diarrhea and vomiting at the same time! We don't know if it was their raw seafood or even worse there pork !!! Their customer service is horrible their servers don't even attend you well and when this situation was spoken about with the manager he said we needed all to go to the DRs and maybe MAYBE after that we could get a refund which we did not because we needed to ask for the refund right after our meal ? Who gets sick right after ? If it was parasites it takes time to take effect on a body !!! PLEASE do not waste your time and money on this DISGUSTING place!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Km_llJ2nFy2cXZhEuB5oCQ.text: I am giving this establishment a 5 Star rating because of the combination of excellent food, great value, and really nice employees. They were very helpful getting us started, made great suggestions, and the food came out quickly for a Saturday night. If I was strictly rating the food, I think it is a solid 4 stars. We really liked the assortment that was offered on an AYCE menu. Our favorite was the soft shell crab which is rarely seen on an AYCE menu. Another interesting item was the nacho pokie. I doubt I will be able to return to Vegas without hitting this place up several times. Our entire party was thrilled that we found this restaurant.

HZRPJUNqD6p1BI_38oJG3A.text: Quality of sushi was ok. I've been to very good sushi places like sushi oTa in San Diego and this place is like McDonald's compared to that.  We opted for their all you can eat option and the only thing worth it was the uni and amaebi. The other items were mediocre. They brought us yellow tail that was not fresh at all. I understand this is a desert but if fish looks like it's processed you shouldn't be serving it.  Although you can eat your hearts content the quality is sub par. If you don't care for quality then the AYCE is for you, but I wouldn't return even if I were from Vegas area.

b84XnC13MVoR8LhTv9qmig.text: Love the fish to rice ratio! You can order your sushi rolls as a half or a full. I love the atmosphere here & everything tasted great!

RNGJtUT1m1FDP8QNRZa3IA.text: It was July 4, I got off work and was craving Yaki Udon and was trying to find a place that was still open past 10pm and ran into this place which is 5 minutes from my apartment. I ordered a Yaki Udon to go with beef and it was really good! It came in a cute plastic bowl to go. There was plenty of beef and the Udon noodle was perfect. I would definitely try to come back here to try other dishes but I am so happy I found a Yaki Udon dish here and it's delicious !  :-) thanks. Umiya Sushi! Made my night.  I came back here to try the all you can eat for lunch and it was good. Fish could be fresher but the appetizers and other small dishes were great.

FA1oexvhCg5N_bjyUcefsA.text: It saddens me to give a low review to yet another of my favorite food that I'd choose as my last meal. Yet this time it isn't the food that's the problem. It's the staff. At first our server was very accommodating and then as the count down continued to the end of our AYCE endeavor she became less and less attentive.  I hate waving a person down for service as she isn't our servant but  I would like assume that in this specific industry you'd have to have customer service. I am a little person with a very big appetite who can pretty much out eat my husband any time sushi is involved and when I wanted what seemed like my 100th round of nigiri she didn't complete my order and I was starting to lose my appetite. Completely ignoring us for desserts, we had to ask another server to assist us. Super annoying. My husband is a bartender and believes in giving back he gets back... well, some people should work for the tips and not expect it like the girl who helped us. Thanks for another bad experience in yet another sushi restaurant.

m9ctQneScz4OVS1hNhZxcA.text: Went in today had the spicy garlic edamame and short ribs and it was all delicious. Service was great!

6hA82djWjOmpgOTJGu-ZLg.text: The rice  is really what bothers me the most. They need to learn to cook sushi rice better. It was way too soft/too much water when they cook it.   The fishes were overproduced. The kitchen helpers were seen cutting big chunk of salmons, put it on a cart, and from there cut into little strips. Not even a real chef is cutting these fishes carefully. Don't expect anything close of what you watch on Jiro.   I hate to say it but the best part of my ACYE was the appetizers. And that's sad because it's a sushi restaurant.   Their rolls were just ok. Nothing glorious.  There are definitely better sushi places in Vegas.   Probably will not come back here.

bosJ-S3Q6WR5jIAnya7iXw.text: Great food & excellent customer service! The AYCE menu & sushi are amazing!  Highly recommend this place when in Vegas!

RBEFJTd7Jiw9gJJ6ENOWUA.text: Visiting from California and didn't want to spend a fortune on good sushi. Also didn't want to deal with the chaos of going to the strip. So we decided to yelp a sushi place and give this place a try. Delicious is all we can say. Will definitely eat here over other sushi places from now on when in Vegas.   Give this place a try you won't be disappointed. All the food is fresh.

k7VJ_xqK-BkceIVLE7mDug.text: I would give them 0 star if I could. We waited over a hour and finally sat down at the bar.we come here all the time and give good tips.but when we trying to order and ask him could we order, that fker just ignored me and game us a blotch face.well,we are not coming back anymore and I'll tell all my friends and tell them to tell their friends don't come.

Wlw6-UrTSER7FWLIa-bgnw.text: Todays visit was really good. Service was prompt and the food came out quick. Order whats on the special board. Yuzu hamachi is ayce.  Check in for free soda :)

Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yuzu hamachi and amaebi

SojT9pR0-h-Y2MN0knA_XQ.text: Jessica, the hostess sat my party (there were 3 of us) with another party of 7 people while there were at least 5 other tables open. My aunt and I asked if we could sit at another table and the hostess and server seemed annoyed that we asked to move.   We asked if the other tables were reserved but they weren't. I was wondering why there were couples seated at tables for at least 4 people and even one guy had a table to himself and they wanted to put us with a group of strangers. I'd understand if the place were packed and that was the only place to sit was with another party and both parties would be fine sitting together. It was just so bewildering why they'd even have us sit with strangers when there are tables open.   I love the food here and their prices are really good but just having them try to make us sit with others is just so mind boggling.

2ZTNfTxn7Xq2Bw4q7EdMxw.text: UMIYA ROCKS!!!!!! I'm a Sushi Connoisseur & this is Absolutely Heaven on Earth...Perfection!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NwFnI_lRUIMCyYHXD-1JZA.text: Like $27.00 + tax for AYCE.  Tips: 1. Go with at least 3 friends if you can. That way you can share food as a table instead of trying to eat something all by yourself. You can try more this way. 2. Don't order rolls that have 8000 pounds of rice! You'll be full super fast like the rookies at our table. 3. Order everything on the limited menu/special. Make sure you order those things as they are limited for a reason!  4. Eat the fried shrimp heads!   Stay away from some things like: 1. The iced tea. It tastes weird and like it's from fountain concentrate, not fresh. 2. The fried calamari. It's fish cake-based, not actually squid. 3. Fried banana ice cream. Not tasty. 4. Green tea mochi. Tastes cheap and actually floral. 5. Ramen. It's a throw away of stomach space and not exactly a ramen shop.  No reservations unless it's a party of 6 or more, so time your trip appropriately. You get 90 minutes to eat. We were initially worried it would take forever to get food, but our server was the absolute shit! We slammed him with the world's largest order and then told him "we trust your judgment" about anything he wanted to add. Our food came out so fast at 8PM on a Sunday right after we ordered.   If you want the most chill, AWESOME server, get the guy with sideswept hair. I want to say he's Filipino or SE Asian. (Bro, I'm so sorry if you're not, but everyone there is Asian, so I don't know how to describe you. You deserve big money, and I hope people throw tons of it at you.)  Come eat when you are HUNGRY, and bring fun friends that bring good vibes.

n9zdhWlrtVLAteo1QXlcdQ.text: Great service and customer service. Fried rice is the best in town!!! Also, very aesthetically pleasing!

MfrWXmwtooqViQ8pofkxiA.text: Food was good.   Service was horrible.  Took our AYCE orders and some items never came. Happened twice in one seating.  Some items you can only order once and they accused us of having them already.  We explained they never came and they won't believe us. Pretty crappy attitude.  Never offered an apology.  The value is there with their AYCE but you have to put up with the service.

yVaTooepjAaNGuXZkLwdVg.text: It was not worth it.  We ordered Udon, Ramen noodles, Unagi Don, and pork cutlet for dinner.   The bowls of noodles took a long time to arrive, and the worst we ever had.  The meats and eels were dried.  We left feeling hungry and unhappy.

c--XXt-7CWhlBiR2mz_2FA.text: Discovered this place ten days ago and I've already been twice for AYCE as well as ordered to-go twice. Amazing food, awesome selection, and the customer service is on point. One of the best AYCE menus in Vegas. Absolutely no complaints.

i-9nvvNuzWyyrw2Pjz4Vww.text: Service is great and quick. Always a packed house which means the food is Amazing. Has many options to the menu. Some orders you can only get one per person which is the reason of giving 4 stars. But for the most part- portions are decent. I highly recommend the Banana Roll. & do ask for HALF ROLLs if you're doing All You Can Eat to get your tastes and money worth. Enjoy!

LuTLfbwhetScqIcKt8ICng.text: Awesome place. Sushi is fresh uni is also. Great service. Awesome sushi rows. Mussels are good also. The place is open till 2pm. Last all you can eat is at 130pm. Appetizers are good. I will recommend this place to anybody and it close to the strip to.

nH4wu_Io-rRQrgg4xYZb3Q.text: Servers were very attentive and helpful. Great atmosphere & great selections!  New fave sushi spot!

BiVIwnBUMWst-L0Ktl93Tw.text: I'm going to keep it brief: I'm a sushi/sashimi fanatic, and this is hands down one of the best places in Vegas!!! Super tasty, great prices (I do AYCE every time, only way to go), fantastic staff, great ambiance/restaurant design, and everything tastes fantastic.  I come here about 1-2 times a month and have never had a bad experience! Umiya rocks!!! They get pretty busy on the weekends, its best to make a reso for large parties.  It's a must try place!

nmdBjYBDqxTx0eq2s2rfUw.text: I don't have words to describe how bad the food was here. I have to ask one question, for those of you that gave this place more than 2 stars, have you ever eaten genuine sushi prepared by someone that spent years as a commis learning the craft? It's really a rhetorical question because the obvious answer is, "No, I've never eaten real sushi prepared by someone who had to work to learn his craft." Otherwise, you'd realize that the shit they serve here in NO WAY approximates real sushi, let alone real food. Four stars for the crap they plated for us? You must be joking. The food here isn't even worthy of a single star.

qhbAlV0uAjfv1SpG-uTrUA.text: I went to umiya sushi for lunch and was not let down. The selection was varied from rolls, nigiri, to ramen, and so many delicious ice creams. Wait staff was attentive and friendly. I'll be coming back!

YHUn4yOb4nJBXemyt_kMPA.text: Umiya Sushi is one of our go to sushi restaurants in Las Vegas.  This is an all you can eat sushi restaurant but there is a time limit of 90 minutes, which is more than enough time.  The wait time to be seated usually isn't that bad, and it depends on what time you get there. I like the fact that they won't seat anyone unless most if not all guest in your party are present. The sushi here is excellent.  The rolls as well all the other choices come in the perfect serving size.  The employees are also friendly and they work at quick pace, getting everything that we ordered in a timely manner.  Keep up up the good work.

DqKrhzPjGQ3Bc29ICt54Jw.text: Zaaamn.  I was looking for a late night AYCE spot, open past midnight and yelp navigated me eventually here. This place isn't far from me which was also a bonus. The only thing I was actually worried about was how busy it might be. Every review pointed out to longer wait times and unusually seating arrangements which means I have to wait an eternity for my food..and we're just so freaking hungry.  I did pick up on a tip to reserve on open table. Turns out we didn't have to worry 11:30p we rolled in, had a nice table to ourselves. Curtis was our server nice dude, he offered a late night special for $20.95 lunch special we declined we wanted the whole shebang.   Food: Awesome. The rice to sushi ratio was perfect. No heavy hands on sauce. Uni was yummy, soft shell crabs and oysters - delicious (all 1 per order). The Tuna Naruto roll bomb option for the no rice choice. Honestly we tried many nigiri and specialty rolls none disappointed. ****TIP: Order half orders if you can, theres sooo many to try***  Location: Ok. Considering it's proximity to The Palms and The Apothecary this area is aiiighht. There all sorts of characters walking around this plaza in the day but late a night it was just fine. Plenty of parking too.  Service: 5 star. They were so quick bringing out all the apps, sushi!! They replenished drinks often, and removed plates promptly. Curtis was polite, recommending popular options as well as his. Never far so we didn't have try to look for him if we needed anything..damn good at his job.  I think we got to experience the best of this place definitely because of the late hour. Setting the bar pretty high for a late night sushi option or perhaps in general.

Jqdb8bsOjNof9q2eG2uD_A.text: I've been craving sushi lately and those cravings didn't stop just because we were visiting Las Vegas haha My fiance and I visited the restaurant based on a recommendation from a friend. We came here for lunch but immediately wished we could have visited during dinner instead. A lot of their menu items were only available during dinner.   Despite not having the full menu available to us, everything was fresh and delicious! I'm still thinking about their salmon belly!! Yumm!!! It's not on their sushi menu but our waitress recommended it to us and let us know it was part of all you can eat! Amazing! It was so buttery and fatty... It's making my mouth water just writing about it! The highlights for me was their softshell crab appetizer and their sizzling pork belly appetizer. Unfortunately, the softshell carb was limit 1 order per person. Service was fast and friendly. Parking was not a problem since they have their own parking lot.   The only downside was you couldn't upgrade to their dinner menu for lunch and limited servings for certain items. Other than that, we would definitely visit again but for dinner!!

oA_KYKzsz55o80HdIVtexA.text: Hostess was rude. We were also told it would be an hour and half wait but there was no mince and open tables and seats at the bar. Per hostess also bar was entirely reserved which may be True but it doesn't seem like swarms or people coming in so I'm not sure if truth or not but if it's an HOUR AND HALF wait then I expect a line or full house. HyManfomlLjLlQWfRksq2w.text: This is my favorites sushi place in Las Vegas. Great food and customer service. Love the banana rolls and cucumber wrapped rolls. Sometimes it gets packed, so call to reserve whenever possible.

beQ4G8yqFYO1N9oavT1zyQ.text: Even we had a hefty brunch, late-night sushi run is always fun.   To end our night we want to have some sushi and we found out that this place close around 2 am in the morning, well that is a plus to us, so there we go.  This place is a combination of AYCE and regular menu, at that time they actually have a promo going on called "reverse happy hours" for $20.99 from 11-2am (double check the price and time, but I think it's around that price and time) you can get AYCE. Well, we arrived around 10:30 pm so we just got the normal AYCE price still a decent price.  So, the AYCE menu consists of a lot of things, you can get soup, appetizer, and of course the sushi, wait, I think you can also get dessert, well, the AYCE menu is huge and offers a lot of food so that's a plus.   What I like about this place is that the sushi is made to order, which means the rice is still fresh and not stale, and personally, I think that's way better than letting the made-sushi sitting for hours and no one will eat it, at least this time you can order what you really want, the will make it and you will eat, simple and less wasteful.   All in all, this is a great AYCE Sushi place, opens late, made to order, huge sushi selection and AYCE menu.

sguD9v2Tggt3XwLWqg7l6Q.text: Got the chance to come back to visit Las Vegas so you know I had to come back to eat at UMIYA!!!  My party came at a less busy time so all our food came out QUICK. Mostly ordered the limited rolls that were offer during dinner time and a few of the fried appetizers. Customer service was GREAT. Our table mostly consisted of nigiri( salmon,salmon belly, uni, sweet shrimp, konch, yuzu yellowtail). We also got the tuna carpaccio, garlic edamame (we asked for non spicy and they were able to accommodate), fried shrimp shumai, soft shell crab appetizer, marinated pork belly, seafood ceviche was pretty good! Oyster was delicious! The food quality here is really top notch for an AYCE sushi joint. I'm so glad the service and food was just as great as the first time I've came here alittle over a year ago. Don't forget, there's unlimited ice cream!( pistachio almond, vanilla, green tea) and limited mochi per person!! Keep up the great food and service!

ID9soMim323gY5lPiRaKOg.text: From time to time, I have this urge to go to AYCE sushi...and Umiya Sushi is my go to place. You can make a reservation by calling or making it through Open Table.  What I love about Umiya:  - Daily special items, found on the boards on the wall, are quite good and premium - You have the option to do a la cart...but why would you? - The ratio of fish and rice is spot on, with the fish hovering over a small ball of rice. - Quick and friendly service...before you put the last piece in your mouth, one of the staff members will come over and take your next order. - Because you can make a reservation in advance, you don't really have to wait for the table to open! Just be sure to make it in advance. - There are a lot of non-sushi items on the AYCE menu including noodles, tempura, chicken, and beef options...there are enough that someone that doesn't enjoy sushi could come in for a good meal, or join a party of AYCE sushi eaters and not feel left out.  - Most of all, the freshness of the fish and how tasty all the cooked items are. The quality at Umiya is certainly better than you will find at most AYCE spots in town.  You can have the dinner AYCE option during lunchtime...I often choose to do so, since you get more options to pick from, such as Ama Ebi and Uni.  So if your AYCE sushi spot isn't up to the standard, or doesn't take reservations, then make a reservation at Umiya Sushi and come on in.   -2019 review #5-

gYwtr5yV96i-PAJN-V_-1g.text: Not my favorite AYCE sushi place in Las Vegas, as the sashimi and nigiri didn't taste as fresh, but the strong suit of this place are their appetizers and the variety of them. The rolls were good but a little heavy for sushi. I would mostly recommend getting the salmon and yellowtail nigiri.

GmOApQSeCwWs5cxcF2AAwg.text: Umiya is my absolute favorite place to get sushi. Believe me, I put up quite an argument when my friends or family suggest going to any other sushi place. The sushi is amazing but my main love of Umiya comes from their massive selection of non sushi items in the ayce menu. I know that sounds insane, who goes to sushi restaurant to not eat sushi? But of course I eat it, I just like the option of having more variety on the side.   Occupancy is unpredictable at best so always set a reservation just to spare yourself a 30 minute wait, more so if you are arriving with a group. Service is quick both in the form of getting a waiters attention and getting your food which is great considering how busy this place can get.  I always order their udon soup and recommend you do the same. Their nabeyaki is full of veggies, tempura, kamboko  and even an egg. This comes as a sharp contrast to the udon at other ayce sushis where I'm usually just served a small bowl with noodles and broth.  Onto the rest of the menu, I've ordered everything they serve from chicken to sea urchin and I could not be anymore impressed by the quality and freshness of their meats. Even the oysters are incredibly fresh which is something I'm very partial about. 10/10 Umiya sets the gold standard for me.

_HDTK7krh96r0xdPzMadsw.text: Umiya is definitely in my top 5 ayce sushi spots here in Vegas! The quality of the sushi is great and I especially appreciate how they include just the right amount of rice in their nigiri's. I've been to sushi spots where the ratio of rice to fish is just too much. My go-to order at umiya is the salmon belly nigiri and spicy tuna nigiri. Go-to rolls include the orange blossom and the Snow White rolls! We also get the Vegas lasagna roll when we're craving it- it is on the heavier side as far as filling you up, so we try to save that for last. Overall, every time I come in the staff is very polite and service is pretty quick too. Definitely recommend if umiya if you're visiting Vegas and looking for a great sushi spot! The weekends get pretty busy, so I would keep that in mind as well.
