so6bhw3rhfg3R8pHrf8srA.text: Visited this place while in town.  Great all you can eat menu.  Food came out fast.  Lots of different types of sushi on the all you can eat menu.  I came with a large party and the staff treated us well.  I'd visit this place again if in Vegas.

QS40uvzu0VMluXor4aFfmw.text: Im speechless. This place is perfection. Im blown away. Quality, atmosphere and customer service are the best Ive seen in a long time. Thank you for an amazing first impression Umiya!

XFdHzfI6KdwZsh2vwGaKNg.text: Ok.... As a business owner I'm telling you up front to take my review with a grain of salt.  Here's why.    #1  It's a Wednesday that I'm writing this review.  I know many sushi restaurants don't carry their freshest stuff on Wednesday's but that it comes in for the weekends.  I get it.  #2 After coming here did I find out it's an "all you can eat" kinda place.  With that as a preamble here's my review.  At roughly $26 per person for all you can eat ... I mean ... what do you expect really?  Top shelf uni?  Top shelf ... anything?  In any case when I see 4.5 stars on Yelp where I come from (New York) I expect buttery toro, perfect texture uni ... so creamy, baby yellowtail, king salmon, kunomoto oyster, live scallop ... if  you've ever eaten top shelf YOU KNOW EXACTLY WHAT I'M TALKING ABOUT.  Apparently 4.5 stars in Las Vegas is NOT THE SAME as 4.5 stars in New York.  THAT'S FOR SURE.  Did they have uni? Yes. It was so mushy though and two of the four pieces were various colors ... :-/    The ikura (salmon roe) was rubbery. The True test of fresh salmon roe is that it POPS in your mouth.  That is 4.5-5 star quality.  Is it just me or do people in Las Vegas don't know great sushi?  Did I catch them on a bad night?  IDK... I've been here to Raku twice and both times during the week it was off the hook and met my expectations.  To it's credit ... the staff was very helpful and the service was FAST.  I love fast service.   With regards to the food ... large quantities at cheap prices always seems good but if you've ever really experienced top shelf sushi/sashimi and you're looking for that here... uh uh.  You've seen what I said regarding the uni and ikura.  To it's credit the yellow tail was very good as were the two special rolls we ordered which were the salmon everything kinda roll and the yellow tail lover roll.  See ... when you go to any sushi restaurant you'll always find the best "flavor" in special rolls where they can cover up the freshness that you would otherwise find in their sashimi dishes and when you order the "all you can eat" you are prevented from ordering sashimi.  :-/  THAT'S BECAUSE they want you to fill up on the rice.  As a business owner I get it ... it makes sense. ;)  But if you are a True sushi connoisseur ... homey don't play dat. By the waiters suggestion I did order the oysters and to their credit they were really good but were they "great"?  Sorry.  I like my oysters ice cold.  Call me a sushi snob but I like my raw fish fresh and cold.  So ... my recommendations for a person coming here.  If your sushi habits are to have all you can eat on a budget ... this is the place for you. $26 per person... you can't beat it.  If however you are a sushi snob like I am and you've been spoiled with the likes of top shelf raw fish ... don't bother coming here while in Vegas.  Face the facts ... you've going to have to bite the bullet and check out some of the higher end places.    I'm willing to come back here on a weekend and see if I'm wrong but ... we'll see. Till then ... no more than 2 stars.

rpOMFYf3arGZOghZh_8omQ.text: This place was good. The wait time and wait staff was also good. They seemed a little under staffed because when we went it was a little busy but it felt like the two servers that were there were constantly running around in circles and it was kind of hard to track them down at some points. They were very friendly though! As for the food, the fish was okay. It didn't taste very fresh and I tasted a sort of sweetness to the fish that threw me off, but it wasn't terrible, just not what I was expecting. Everything tasted sweet to me, especially the spicy tuna dishes that we ordered. Great price for all you can eat sushi though and lots of roll, appetizer, and nigiri choices which was nice! I'd give this place another shot if I came back to town.

jvsVda2GjSk3co1KRGfqyw.text: Had dinner w/  friends who live in the LV area. We all took the "All you can eat" option.   SERVICE: 5 stars. Service was crazy fast! Our waiter was nice and a great sense of humor.   FOOD: 4.5 stars. Full menu/plenty to choose from. Had a dozen different items (too many to list). I did enjoy 90% of them.  PRICE: 4 Stars. $30 p/ person. Not bad for the quality and selection. Time limit of 90min (plenty of time)  OVERALL: 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kxJKGtjt2Gg8qSq6Y2kiHA.text: There are days I find myself just west of the strip, and when I do, I've found a great place for sushi.  As with most of the AYCE sushi places I've tried, the chefs and staff are great here.  What makes it stand out is the flavors of their rolls and sauces to go with the rolls.  The fish is fresh and flavorful.  Umiya is priced right, in a great location, near the Palms, Rio, and Gold Coast, and when I'm in that area, craving sushi, this place is sure to be on the top of my list.    One of the best parts about Umiya is the selection.  They have a wide variety of rolls, and so many delicious options.  If only I had known about it sooner, when I used to stay at the Rio.  The price is typical of most of the other AYCE sushi places, and it's a great choice for tourists and locals alike.  I still have my favorite on the other side of town, but I'll be back here.

Nt3P68ymt6lhWvM4Yl1jXA.text: Every so often, yelp lets you down.  Today was one of those days.  Without the invention of mayonnaise, this place could not stay in business.  This place reminds me of dollar tree or any discount store.  The selection of items is overwhelming, but there's nothing really of quality or substance.    The rolls doused with mayo were fine; however, if you are used to fresh nigiri, this is definitely not the place for you.  There are many ayce sushi bars with much fresher fish.  I understand this is not fine dining, but at this price point, there are many other places to choose from.

NI3g0pmJx_cAo3jv68EACw.text: Umiya is not easy to find.  The neon signage says Kan Sushi.  They play K-pop videos.  AYCE price is typical - about $27/person.  The place was pretty empty on the Friday night we went...not a good sign.  The rolls we got were good: Sunrise, Sunset, Salsa Dancing and Snow White.  I also liked the pork belly, ribeye steak and the fact that they have skewers as part of AYCE.  What I didn't like and have had better in other sushi restaurants: lobster crunch, super white tuna and green tea ice cream.  The langoustine on the lobster crunch tasted too briny.  The super white tuna was rubbery and didn't taste fresh.  The green tea ice cream tasted like medicine.  It reminded me of the time I ate green tea ice cream I had in the freezer for a year.  This place is good for cooked food.  Sushi...not so much.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salsa dancing roll
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunrise roll

i49sxALv9giZqcc9XSvOtg.text: Place is open till 2am which is great for me I usually like a late snack    The service kind of sucks they run around with there heads cut off at times and I have had to ask For the check a few times!!!   The sushi guys are super nice and friendly  and they don't have a negative crowd in there like kaizen

NBF_MOiOZm8_xRF181xNmA.text: We ordered from the all you can eat menu: 4 different types of sushi rolls, baked mussels, miso soup, fresh oysters, and shrimp and veggie skewers.  The rolls, oysters, and mussels were fresh. I prefer hot oysters but they only serve them on ice. The shrimp and veggie skewer looked and tasty over cooked.  I think the all you can eat menu is worth it if you love sushi and can arrive early enough to catch the lunch prices.   The dining area was cafeteria styled with plenty of room for large groups.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and veggie skewer, baked mussels, fresh oysters
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi rolls

raM7YkObQjCmKWxk47799Q.text: Visiting Vegas with hubby and we decided to eat sushi here because or all the reviews. We are very picky when it comes to sushi. Amazing sushi rolls, excellent customer service and very clean! Would come here again.

cFu0oruZgR-AclsLn5M7gw.text: I am not usually a fan of all you can eat places since the quality and service usually suffer, but that is not the case here.  I was with a large group and they quickly got everything moving for us.  We had someone at the table doing all the ordering so we could sample a whole bunch of the sushi and just share.  It was very fresh and beautifully presented.  They have fresh wasabi and I will never be able to have the powdered stuff again.  The miso soup was perfect.  Some of the table saved room for the mochi ice cream, which they said was ok.  I would definitely come back here.

mDRNd3-WWX9D3U_GPGdGdw.text: Best deal in Vegas!!!! Amazing all u can eat, and the sushi is all very high quality and fresh. We ALWAYS hit this place when we're in town.   Spicy tuna over sticky rice FTW.   Love the music they play too. :)   off the strip, but worth the drive.

WwZ8BowSuGyRDFJDoGBIPg.text: Went to Umiya Monday night with a large group of people. Upon arrival we were seated very quickly and had a table by the kitchen in the back. I don't know why they sat us by the kitchen, because the room was only half full and there was plenty of seating available. Waitresses, servers, and bussers were constantly back and forth around our section which was bothersome. The food was great! Loved the all you can eat menu. And the prices were good as well...I'll definitely go back, just don't give us the table in the back by the kitchen!   -Joe

a02qJuxE6c99IEVMoyh6DQ.text: Always delicious, their food is always fresh and there is a wide variety for AYCE. Love the imitation crab salad, the fresh and easy roll, and so much more. They are perfect for people whom don't eat all sorts of raw fish, but want to go to sushi with friends.

K0cSTTWBUD7krIbgf11Xjg.text: The food is good, service was fast but I had found a hair in my food and I didn't even get an apology.. nothing. I work in the food industry and I know that's a big deal to us if this were to happen.   They do kind of hound you if you don't get all you can eat, and somebody else at your table does.. I wasn't going to share or anything, I just wasn't as hungry and wanted one roll.. they proceeded to tell me they're going to be keeping an eye on me to make sure I wasn't eating off of anybody plate, and that they will charge me if I do..

0Q5v02so-BwjPK_sDIGuBg.text: Usually when a place advertises AYCE, they're usually either sacrificing quality or service. This is not the case at Umiya.  I went there last night and the service was fantastic. The server was at our table at regular intervals to check on us and was extremely knowledgeable about the menu. She also made suggestions based on our tastes that were spot on.  The menu is incredible. Appetizers, salads, soups, ramen and steak (yes, steak) were all available on the $26 AYCE menu as well as sushi and nigiri. The food is high quality, fresh, and the chefs were willing to tweak their rolls according to my very picky (I prefer selective) taste.  We were there kind of later (12am-1:30am--they close at 2am) but not once felt a rush to leave or pressure from the staff.  The Umiya experience was amazing and I'll definitely be back. This is probably my new favorite sushi joint.

E8c0dv8M13jXLaiEt1FWZg.text: Everytime I come to Vegas I have to stop here , sushi is excellent and for the price all you can eat is best in town in my opinion. staff is always super busy but excellent service Everytime. I recommend coming here, and who knows you might catch someone famous! last time I was here we saw Herb Dean the referee from the UFC.

c4q6OA21jWcEyrobpLrbFA.text: I have been to Umiya a couple of times for dinner and a few times for lunch. I prefer going there for lunch since it's not as busy and the staff is a lot more attentive. The sushi and non-sushi items are always fantastic. The inside is cozy, well decorated and they have neat music videos playing which I enjoy watching. This a great place for AYCE sushi and a la carte.

qa6_HL9BRFoQTprdo7x4Ow.text: So it's valentines day the day we went & every where was crazy packed. But unmiya was the one sushi place that didn't have a waiting list. So we went for it.   We usually go to goyemon but it's always super busy and this place is just as good as goyemon !   The restaurant ambience is nice. Very chill and relaxing. Not to dark not to bright. We got seated at the bar. The servers are really friendly.   The sushi is all fresh. We did AYCE and ordered nigiri and other rolls which were all good and fresh.   The sushi chefs were friendly also and always asked us if we needed anything else.   5/5

_WwO-ckrJOEr5tP7RR8Ssw.text: Loved their sushis. We waited little bit long to have seated but it was worth it. Philadelphia sushi was my favorite. Very yummy!!!

u9joNJk9FnuKy3lOeYSyhw.text: Best sushi in Las Vegas! Favorite place to come to for a date night. We are here all the time. Friendly people, nice environment and AMAZING food!!!

CIgTcCFT0dXT7-YlioCXzw.text: Favorite Sushi place in Vegas, great staff, fresh fish and always something new and interesting on the menu.

EODkdUEUFPoP3Lm9VciTPw.text: When my Lyft driver told me the best Sushi in Vegas was no where on the strip and was all you can eat for under $30 I was kinda skeptical.  This place has awesome fresh sushi and everything I tried, which was a lot, was superb.  If you are looking for one hell of a bargain and to go into a sushi coma head here when you are in Vegas!

SSoO5D3NEEu98i6ngyR_5A.text: Tonight is our second visit in Umiya. We like their all you eat menu and our server Amy is a professional server . We will definitely come back in our next Las Vegas visiting.

QogEgX5zTclXxNhxekMuUA.text: This was my first time here and I definitely won't be coming here again. I went here for my friend's birthday party, expected it to be a good place because of the nice ambiance. I was wrong.  Almost everyone got AYCE. After the waiter took our order, we waited for a long time for our food to come out. Besides our table, there were about 4 other small tables. Not so busy. One of us ordered Chicken Katsu, he waited 40 minutes for it to come out while the rest of us ate our sushi. It should not take that long for them to make chicken katsu unless they had to hunt a chicken down, skin it, THEN cook it. The service was terrible, the quality of the sushi seemed like they pre cut it. I tend to stay within my usual ayce sushi places but since this was for my friend's 20th birthday we all tried it out.  The only reason why I'm not giving it a 1 star because of this one waiter, unfortunately I didn't get his name but he looked Korean and he had a cross necklace. He was the only waiter who provided us with good service. The other workers had attitude and one female worker with red hair accidentally hit my friend on the head with a plate and he did not get an apology. This place is NOT worth going to.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waited 40 minutes for chicken katsu.
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The salmon looks precut and old.

pWsOYZCKi_qC1MyYLr5tmg.text: What separates Umiya from other sushi/Japanese restaurants is that their "All You Can Eat" menu includes choices like (chicken or beef) yakisoba, udon, and small steaks if you'd like to take a break from your sushi marathon. I highly recommend the "Seared Tuna Sashimi in AJ Sauce" appetizer. You're only allowed one order per person for dinner, and I can taste why!   Desserts are included in AYCE, and the plum wine-flavored ice cream is a MUST. Totally different taste from what it sounds like.   The casual/cool atmosphere is great for families and parties, and it's convenient location by the strip is perfect before a night out on the town.

Ow_9ClrQ4S0cIXnrnwv70Q.text: The food here is great! Got the all you can eat for about 25 dollars and i was not disappointed with the selection.  The only thing i did not like was that the servers were a little pushy about us ordering fast and would stand there until we did.  Overall it was a good place to get sushi.  The place was not packed at all when we went (around 11 pm) so we got to eat as soon as we got there unlike the 40 minute to an hour wait at sushi kaya.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki rolls

QqZTFDX5gSs6yuAqOT7mGQ.text: Love this place it's truly a hidden gem everyone is on punt and the food is great! Would recommend to anyone!

3q-Xph5_Amq-uNTOjmmKfQ.text: Fresh seafood, great service and good ayce prices! We sat at the bar, stuffed ourselves and enjoyed every part of this place and the excellent service! If you are looking for a place with great ayce sushi, check this place out!

RDwuKfAJbAYVwD3F6hjsfw.text: I can start with saying that this is by far the place I have eaten out most times for dinner over the last few years. I wouldn't do that if I didn't love it! Giving it 5 stars is a bit nice of me, and it is to be honest close to 4 stars. But I'll go with the 5 stars for now :)  I would recommend going for the "all you can eat" option. Especially if you are at least two persons since you then can order different things and share (if you don't like sharing you suck). For me sharing the different rolls and talk about them as we eat is a good experience. I will recommend starting with a Screaming O(rgasme) and some Edamame. Of the rolls there are several good ones: Orange Blossom, Sexy Roll and the Baked Salmon Roll are among my favorites. And you have to get the tuna pieces in AJ sauce. They do have things that are not typical Japanese on their menu. I wouldn't recommend those to be honest. This is a sushi restaurant!  I will keep coming back here for sure!

W5R7sY_EOV_o8EEPGtXdCA.text: Down in Vegas for a family reunion and found this place.  It is now our goto sushi place!  Fast and friendly  (once you're seated).  Try everything it's great!  Love the tuna poke and unagi...  so yummy yummy

1KrBu6ZZaMVjzhZcu90wnw.text: The best sushi place!! I tell everyone to come down here when they ask for a sushi recommendation! They have got everything under the sun besides sushi on the menu. If you are with folks that don't really eat fish, there's plenty of other items like steaks, udon, and etc to satisfy their wants and needs! Easy place to find with awesome parking! Def a favorite sushi place! Try the pork belly and the ginkgo! Tuna naruto is awesome too!

tGFN5FMktFUzSAmUNMLJRw.text: Top notch service and top notch food and variety! We ate here for three nights in a row and wish they open one in our home city in Texas. This is awesome!!!!

QqMPElVSEFNeumzW6L5Prw.text: Well this is my first time trying this place and the food was good but the service was horrible. Sat at the bar and could not order any sushi from the chefs. Our servers were unorganized and rarely came to see if my girlfriend and i needed anything. Last thing i ordered was ramen to test it out, waited 25 min it never came so we left.

6Eo3B1P4-tkNcuLAIbUvqw.text: Surprisingly good for all-you-can-eat sushi.  I normally wouldn't even try it.  But a friend eats there often and swears by it.  He knew all the good things to order (monkey brains!) and we only got a couple of things that were bland or so-so.  Most was quite good.  Of course it's not the same amazingness as Nobu or anything.  But it's far and away above most mom and pop sushi, especially for all-you-can-eat.  I would go there again for sure.

8ODi93S2VFnc3ncqzJ1_Pg.text: First time here and I find it ok. The soft crab is really good but 1 order per person. The calamari tempura is hard. The yakisoba taste bland and oily.  We ordered fresh oyster, again 1 order per person but never served.

raCMecGwWsb2_1Yqi6VCYQ.text: My favorite AYCE sushi spot in Las Vegas.  Service is always great and the food can't be beat.  It's near the strip without the inflated strip prices. And they're open late night. This place RULES!

PngaP_lxg3eRpD4EmKK6sA.text: OMG ! ! ! The best sushi that I have ever had in my entire life!!!! All you can eat $35 :D No place in the world can bring you the entire ocean like this place can, everything is delicious and they're dessert "Mochi" will make any athlete forget there own figure when they taste just one... So good you'll forget your abbs!!! Everything was amazing, we laughed, we ate, we walked out like two happy Buddhas ;-)))

go4jjerLJuhRdrOfPCtgug.text: Best AYCE Japanese ever! Great sushi, fast service, gigantic selection. My favorite dishes were salmon egg sushi, masago egg sushi, uni sushi, ribeye steak, and grilled mackerel. Will come again!

q-8mkzAbB-i9WjAyPxRrog.text: Absolutely Amazing. I can't think of one thing that could possibly fault the impeccable meal my partner and myself had tonight. The staff were perfect; quick and super friendly, the food was the best I have had (Japanese) ever and the whole atmosphere was great!   If you are in Vegas and you want to have a perfect food experience then Umiya is the place for you. If I could, I would travel from Perth, Western Australia to Vegas more often just to have this sushi. DO NOT MISS.   *hint: have the all you can eat. Will not disappoint.

eGQs3Hm5NHtgmzfDpRciZA.text: Umiya is a real destination in Las Vegas.  Every time we are in Vegas this is one place we must go to, and so should you!  Super fresh fish, great staff and sexy sushi artists!  This place will amaze you time and time again.  Yummmm

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ona1wPHRQw2DRt21uyGegw.text: Quality was great. And food selection was awesome.  The only issue I would have is that they urge half price for a three year old whonomlyneats miso soup and rice.  Ridiculous.  Makes me not want to go back. Ugh.

tRYORi2fUXs6MJHSto9VVQ.text: Very good fresh sushi for " all you can eat sushi. " sushi are fresh , customer service is great, and price is reasonable. I would recommend to people when they come to Vegas. Five stars!!!!

FRj2kCmFEI0X3MLtLWxRDw.text: Highly recommended AYCE place in Las Vegas. The foods are fresh and delicious. Reasonable price and good service. Definitely come back again!

Hs10deGG9HpxwgcrNlMLIg.text: I decided to come here after a meeting at church with a few girlfriends.  They spoke highly of it and I can never turn down sushi so I obliged. Upon walking in we were greeted in a prompt manner and sat immediately.  Our server asked if we wanted the all you can eat option and neither of us girls wanted to grub too crazy so we just ordered a few rolls each. As a starter we got a miso soup and patiently waited for 2 rolls. One of them was a dragon roll and the other was a salmon salsa roll.  15 minutes later we finally got our rolls. And just as I was getting ready to get my chopsticks ready, I noticed something a little off about my roll. I took a closer look and guess what was in my roll? A hair. I immediately called for my server and told him there was something in my roll and that it looked like a hair. He then took my plate, took a quick look at it and said that he didn't notice anything. I then pointed out the hair that was protruding out of the baked eel dragon roll and he said... oh I see it now and quickly took it away. He then said he was making me a new one but by that time I was pretty over it.  And didn't want one to replace it all. I ate my other salmon salsa roll thing and when I finished they had brought me a new eel roll but I asked them to take it back because I was kind of grossed out.  Our server seemed sorry about it.  And he comped us a mochi that we had ordered towards the end of the meal. However, I was really thrown off. He also gave us a card that gives us 2 free drinks with the purchase of $35 or more but I highly doubt I would ever go back. With so many delicious options in vegas, this is a spot that is very forgettable.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guess which roll had the hair? Not happy.

5qDrgK5eJJT5OUK78g49Yw.text: All you can eat buffet. But be careful, you have to finish what you order! They will charge you for whatever is not finished.    We went with a group of 10. We had a whole table to ourselves and it wasn't very busy. We probably arrived there around 8pm.   We ordered a couple things at first so we can all share, but as we went along, we ordered more, which was perfect.  The different sushi rolls were really cool and really good! I got the Snow White, spicy octopus (2 pieces) and a number of others I can't remember. but Snow White was realllly good. The First Kiss sushi roll was also delicious.    I got the passion fruit saketini. It was good but it was really sweet and you can barely taste the alcohol. I would recommend getting the lychee saketini or ordering the buy 2 get 1 free beer (Asee, I think it was).   The udon noodle soup was a little sweet as well. But the soup was good to have with all the sushi. Jalepeno poppers was amazing and it wasn't spicy.   We also got the Japanese Lasagna sushi. it was odd, there was cheese, sauces, and panko (i think it was) on top. A whole mixture of flavors. it was kinda odd, weird, okay tasting. I'd say try it..but don't let it get too cold or else you won't want to finish it.   Unfortunately, they don't have sashimi. :(  I really wanted that with the spicy red pepper sauce (choh goh chi jang).  But they do have   I gave it 3 stars because they charge you for whatever is not finished.  :(  lol but the servers were really nice, really friendly and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy tuna salad.
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters. Highly recommended
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy rice cake () so good. Lightly fried and covered in a spicy &amp; slightly sweet hot red pepper sauce

h1GKudNxJuCtZ8g7fx6D-A.text: Awesome lunch spot. Enjoyed all the selections. The price can't be beat for fresh sushi. I will definitely come back.

V_LMLpCwjuOvxuAt7h0bjw.text: I absolutely love Umiya!!!! There are so many different dishes to satisfy all of the different people in your party. Personally My favorite dish is the Baked New Zealand mussel in dynamite sauce, I crave it!!! I cannot wait to come back!!

e4G2rkN1MZboUmFPn6uyAw.text: This place is great. Sushi is super fresh and portions are perfect. Excellent service.

-uSUM5lm5v7or5tK-Sc0VA.text: My experience here is my go to for sushi! I love this place  the staff always friendly and there saba sashimi amazing as always!!! If you haven't been here your missing out so come!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nigiri!!!!!

vYpUvBcyQZsMWFhVOW6ljw.text: Love this place! Fresh fish & sushi!  Both for dates with the husband & have brought my 3 kids here (all under 6!) to dine for lunch. Nice ambiance & staff. The middle of restaurant has picnic table style seating so great for large groups & family. I always get the salmon lover! The oysters were super fresh! We've been coming here since opening & will continue coming!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh oyster
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon lover! Orange blossom &amp; lobster roll

NKEf0PDdcGPKLJgoS4YSPA.text: RUDEST hostess ever!! With pleasure told us we could not be seated. That's fine if you're busy, but you do not need to treat customers like that. Will not return, sushi isn't that great.

gjv423DmH0T0P01lKnIngw.text: No impressed by the food or the service. Sat at the sushi bar but could only order from the server. There is much better choices for ayce in Las Vegas.

s-LBnmMXelE9optgix0ayw.text: Good for the price. The UFC  fights where on, so that's awesome! Clean and good customer service.

3nD_vLZa5Bfyx8esH9Ez7g.text: The ambiance was pretty nice. I like that it's an open picnic style seating.  First off, customer service was on point. The waiters/waitresses were on point with the water and checking back with you.  Went with a group and did the AYCE. The menu was really large and had a pretty good variety - even for non-sushi eaters like myself. My other half loves sushi so he was all over it. In his opinion the sushi was on point.  $26 is well worth it since you can order a variety of things.

Ze1HpJlS4FxR1UBAZBDSLA.text: Their servers are always really attentive, my orders are always out fast and are correct, and their sushi is the best in Las Vegas.

NJx2j_xlZvS59xyrj9Mcgg.text: The absolute best sushi I have ever eaten.  Many unique menu items.  The tuna steak style sashimi was incredible!  The fire roll, yellow tail jalapeno, salmon collar, and even the ginger salad were all so delicious.  Service was also wonderful- martinis were shaken & poured correctly.. no detail was missed.

AMRwfyz8k4T9HanJNxwsyQ.text: Walking in, the decor is appealing, lighting was the perfect not too dark and they sat us in tables off to the side kind of intimate little areas, leaving their long tables for large groups. BTW, I think this would be a good place if you have a big group of friends or family because of their farm tables.  Started w/ house salad- loved it. It had a great sweet/salty, & tangy dressing. Very good portion of fresh mixed greens, juicy tomatoes and avocado slices. Loved the sticks of marinated cucumber throughout.  On to some Grilled Skewers-  -baby tako (spicy, yummy BBQ like sauce) too bad it was tough, took a lot of chewing :/ -grilled chicken, had some soggy skin that didn't crisp up, unappetizing -bacon wrapped scallops were great, (crispy, sweet, succulent) of the ones we tried, I would have tripled our scallop order and scrapped the rest. Good to know.  Creamy shrimp comes with a little ketchup dipper and side house salad. Good concept with shrimp wrapped in wonton wrappers & cream cheese, then fried. Unfortunately, it seemed they used pre-cooked shrimp, drying out the shrimp; even cream cheese cannot save rubbery and tough shrimp. Dish has potential, though, if only the shrimp were succulent! I also think the ketchup was a weird sauce choice-  maybe a citrus ginger or one of the sushi sauces. Just not the ketchup.  On to sushi, we went basic. Sometimes when I'm not sure about a restaurant, I start with a spicy tuna roll. Gotta be able to make a great spicy tuna before earning my trust in rolls! Theirs was decent but low on the spice factor IMO and they had decent Philly California roll, as well. A nice bowl of tempura ice cream and that was it folks, we were stuffed. I'll say service was a rollercoaster as bigger groups came in and received more attention, understandable, but still we were sometimes hanging out there in space and sometimes our servers (there were 2 tag-teaming) were on top of it. That's kind of how our food went, too, solid 2.5 overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura Ice Cream
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Skewers
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamy Shrimp

mXZWQVyaaK2QJLwjikgdOA.text: Fantastic place for AYCE Sushi. Open late and they can serve big groups. Sometimes there's a bit of a wait but it is well worth it. They have TVs where they play K-Pop and various sports.   Caution: there are only two small bathrooms in the restaurant.

y7SS1TXV2q-Q4nVJbCgqJQ.text: I have been going to umiya for many years since it was kaizen which was also an ayce kaizen . I'm sad to say it's gone tragically downhill from the glory days . I still go back occasionally because I live a block away but it's definitely not in the top tier of ayce's in the city anymore . The standard garlic tuna is still good and my favorite roll is the orange blossom . I also have to get the spicy octopus nigiri which is tasty .   Overall they need a revamp and a refresh . They also need to get new physical menus for they are pretty dirty and falling apart .   I wish for the day where they were like they used to be .

LzmY5yZFQzdn_sl-I0eEZw.text: our first time here today. We had the AYCE, lunch is $20.95 and the one thing that really stands out is the variety of their menu. It is rare that you will see an AYCE place lets you order shucked oysters, pork belly dishes, rib eye, and ramen/udon in addition to everything else on the menu.  They also have a large selection of beers but their house sake is tasty! oh not to forget they also had no rice sushi rolls wrapped in cucumber which I love.  Some of the items on an ayce sushi list are sweet shrimp, white tuna!! oysters, ramen, Kalbi, and pork belly dishes. Some of the desserts are Mochi, ice cream, banana splits, all included in the ayce.   My favorite are Salmon Skin, tempura shrimp, soft shell crab and Snow white rolls and the sushi wrapped with cucumber instead of rice, I forgot the name.   The staff were nice and the service was great and the food was so fresh and delicious!!  one of my favorite place to add to my list, we will definitely be back.

B9KZsp6oBv58J90-GnoCgQ.text: Food quality has gone to down dramatically. Additionally, shitty customer service. 2 of 3 of us did AYCE and a 3rd did a la carte. They were having a shit about our 3rd eating seaweed. I said charge us for it, I don't care. We order 5 orders of sashimi, a la carte and you are going to charge for a 3rd AYCE for sharing seaweed? Give me a break!!! Gave 20% tip not realizing it until after I left. NEVER setting foot in there again.

ObGg42NceBQWLLS9V-E7Zw.text: This place certainly beats the AYCE where I'm from. Everything is made to order and I love how you can get the rolls in half. I'm not so crazy about the sushi but I love how we can get a taste of what's in their menu.  The portions given are perfect and me and my friend love their cute poke salad. Very well marinated and with a cute side of seaweed salad it's the one thing she craves about and she doesn't even like raw sushi.   Customer service was quick and attentive. The atmosphere was a dim setting reminds me of a sports bar. This place does get crowded in the evening.  If you're looking for a place for all you can eat with a large selection of appetizers (what I mostly order), yakatoris, ramen/udon, Japanese entree dishes, nigiri, or sushi. This is your place. I love how it's different from a buffet. You get a variety of Japanese cuisine all made to order.  However, their are certain items in the menu that are only one order per person. And it's usually my favorites. I can understand why it's only allowed 1 per order.

H-eqHLOQMxI4ctbXo1R8tg.text: Great service , fast and friendly,   Sushi rolls were all excellent, my favorite was Touchdown, but the Dragon roll was very tasty as well as the Sunrise, the rolls were Firm and a pleasure to eat , none of them fell apart when picked up with the chop sticks. This was a birthday treat for me , and I am sure we will be back.

5EErtrm3eSx9AjmjNat4-w.text: I was visiting Vegas and craved for Sushi, my friend who moved to Vegas had been going to this other place but I had seen ok reviews. This place had an overall of 4 stars so we decided to go here.   This is an AYCE Sushi place, you order off the menu and some items like UNI can only be ordered once per person. Sad face. They have daily special items that you can also order in the AYCE. Other then that, I thought most of the items were pretty good. The last items we ordered were crab and I didn't like it, took a bite gave it to my friend. He didn't like it but finished it. (The best thing about dining with my friend is he'll finish everything.. yay to me for sampling everything. Makes me enjoy eating out way more.)   If you order tea they charge you for it but comes in this clear mug with their logo. The service here is wonderful. They communicate with each other over mics/walkie talkies and if one checked on a table stating they are good on water, they will announce that so you don't get checked again and again with repeating yourself. Good job on that!

YaEWRh4i3JMqHN8n3dOUQQ.text: I came here @ 2:30pm on a Sunday word of a mouth from California. Watch the time you come because they serve dinner @ 3pm , which I didn't know , so I wanted uni but the manager said I would have to pay an additional $6.00 because uni is in the dinner section, but it wasn't my fault that I was here at the lunch hour , food wise it's so so save your money and stay in the strip and don't deal with the bad service and the rudeness. They don't appreciate customers .

Uq6BxCkl_j2uWoMIbsn8bw.text: Amazeballz!!!! All you can eat high quality sushi. I wish I lived in vegas to continue to visit this place. Staff was friendly, food was out rapidly, and food tastes fresh. A repeat for me when I pass through again

JTg29vk3BxgeqN6Ove77gg.text: My number 1 favorite AYCE Sushi restaurant. I came here for my mom's Birthday last year, and last month for my Birthday. I was tired of trying all of the AYCE restaurant, because of poor services, and bad qualities. My parents love Japanese food, but they dislike eating raw. This restaurant is perfect for them.There are so many cook dishes for my parents, and they are delicious. I also invited my friends and their family. They all had a blast, and enjoy every moment of it.

Z6xmidaz8Vnf20TRspjoqg.text: This place came highly recommended via word of mouth. All you can eat sushi, good value for the dollar, great tasting food and attentive staff. Food arrived to table in a timely manner. Went  there around 2pm after the lunch rush hour and wasn't crowded which was a plus. Highly recommend when in Vegas.

w8HSaDfxN4L2cEFvAYXQzw.text: AYCE spot in Vegas, family wanted some sushi on Christmas day. Found this place online and away we went.  Place had a modern, cozy feel with wooden decor that was like benches and not seats. We were told an hour wait, but got in at 30 in a 6 seater when we had 7. They made it work for us and we got to eating. Everything came quickly even though it was packed house, and service was great. The sushi quality was a B+ with most things fresh for an AYCE. There was  one HUGE red flag in the sushi. The Uni (sea urchin) was complete garbage. It was fishy, smelled like it was old and tasted awful. They limit certain things to one per person, and the uni was one of them. But it was thw worst thing I have ever tasted. It was the only reason this place did not get a 5 star. Other tha  that, great place.

oi9Vt7SyvTh9QZchQggwig.text: We were in Las Vegas for one night and searched for sushi and decided on this place based off my fellow Yelpers giving it a high rating.  This place is a very good value for $25.99 AYCE dinner- it includes an extensive menu of sushi, sides, small entrees, rolls and even dessert!  Drinks are not included.  Some items are only available during dinner and limited to one order per person.   I really enjoyed the Orange Blossom roll, King of the Ocean roll, Sashimi with AJ sauce, poke salad, Naruto roll (cucumber wrapped and limited to one order per person), yellowtail collar, and salmon belly sushi.  Those were my favs.  They also had a special board for items not offered in their regular menu.  I was concerned about their previous C rating that a yelper left and it is now an A rating.  We asked.  I used to run a sushi business with my mom and brother and I'm very particular about sushi restaurants having no less than an A rating because food temperature and cleanliness is paramount to serving food safely.   Service was very quick on an early Friday night- orders taken very often, friendly servers, refills given frequently because my husband is a thirsty camel that needs upwards of 4-5 refills on average.    Dishes were cleared away quickly.  Food came out quickly as well.  Plenty of parking.  They text you when you're table is ready.  Half orders are rolls are available.

tZMTvrqEOO0CEz1A-bOKtw.text: The service here is incredible. They are so quick and sooo attentive (thanks to the fancy headphones everyone is wearing). If you need a quick, affordable, tasty meal this is a great spot. The ambiance is also very nice and it's clean.   I wasn't crazy about the rolls I got. Nothing wrong with the quality or anything like that, just my taste preferences. The caterpillar was too sweet for my liking and the Tokyo roll was really big in size which made it hard to manage and it was not super flavorful. The miso soup was great and so was the seaweed salad. We also got green tea and great green tea ice cream and both were delicious.   Overall this place is affordable and yummy and I would recommend trying it out if you're sick of the strip. I didn't give them the full 5 stars because as a sushi place I feel like you really have to bring it on the rolls and your taste buds should be dancing and leaping with joy, this place is good but not at that level.

DkxJSmhtsrHa7FvU0kaBDg.text: In my review I'm going to compare Umiya Sushi to other AYCE sushi I've had instead of to sushi restaurants in general. It's All You Can Eat ($20 for lunch and $25 for dinner) , so I was going here with the expectation that the sushi was going to be OK and that I was determined to get my money's worth of food (AKA eat as much raw fish as I physically can). I was SO pleasantly surprised at the selection, service, and the quality of some of the menu items!   I've only eaten AYCE sushi in California (mostly LA) and I think that Umiya is some of the best AYCE sushi I've ever had. Of course, the sushi is not going to be as quality as an omakase or a restaurant that sells individual rolls (and it's unfair to compare AYCE quality to that). But I think it's pretty darn good for what it is and fresh for AYCE. Some of the rolls I ordered came with really generous slices of fish and minimal rice.  What really impresses me is the extensive menu! It's huge and covers everything from fried appetizers to unique rolls to desserts (yes, the dessert is AYCE too). Some of the pricier items are "one serving per person" and are definitely worth ordering. There are also daily specials on the board that you can order from.   A few delicious items that I recommend:  Hamachi Kama (yellowtail collar) Fried soft shell crab Sea urchin (Uni) nigiri Salmon belly nigiri Sweet shrimp (Amaebi) nigiri Fried shrimp head Baby octopus skewer Spicy rice cake skewers (fried) Rice-free (cucumber wrapped) rolls  Tempura green tea ice cream Mochi ice cream  There was also stuff I didn't get to try like ramen, katsu, gyoza, agedashi tofu, and various yakitori (will probably try these next time). You usually don't see items of this quality on a typical AYCE sushi menu. I will say that some of the fried items and rolls were hit or miss but, hey, it's AYCE so if you don't like it just order something else!   One more huge pro to this place: it's super well staffed! There were about six tables in the restaurant at 4PM and there were six sushi chefs making sushi. All our food came out really fast. Also, I love that there was no limit to how much you can order at a time and the amount of orders you can put in ( I see these restrictions a lot at other AYCE sushi! )

1uXjNA-bAE9Wxk-M0-p49w.text: The best sushi in the universe. Including Mars.  They have an all you can eat for lunch ($20) and dinner ($25) but we have always ordered our sushi a la carte... we've tried something different each time and never have had fresher, tastier sushi ANYwhere.

MYJ76McRZZWIqHDi-nf-oQ.text: It's always funny to say that my favorite sushi place is in the dessert but this is favorite AYCE sushi buffet. Every time I visit Vegas I always try to make an attempt to come here. I'd recommend making a reservation through Open Table or calling in. We did this and got seated pretty much right when we got there. The whole menu minus the drinks are AYCE. There are items on the menu that you can only get ONE of like the sweet shrimp and the sea urchin. Take a quick look at the menu and start ordering away. I'd normally order an appetizer and go straight for the nigiri. I'll follow up with some grilled items then a soup like udon and miso. The food comes out really quick, well within 5 minutes of ordering and that's one thing I love about this place.   There will be times when they forget an item or two or maybe our order just went to a different table. Mistakenly this past time we got an order of the salmon belly that wasn't even on the menu. Quite the serendipity. It was actually on the special's menu that's on small blacklight board at the back of the restaurant. Thanks to this mistake we got to try some delicious specials. Always a pleasure coming here and I always leave filling I got my money's worth. Great value for about $30 after tax and tip.  SERVICE: It's great, the servers comes by every 5ish minutes to take order or take our empty plates away.  PARKING: No problem there. Plenty of space in the parking lot.

XIJyel0LxOEAMQRTmbKpnQ.text: Really fresh ingredients and quick and friendly service from staff. My husband and I come here for lunch. Everything is delicious and we never have to send anything back.

JiqkAHc8UUuHcnNwn-bChQ.text: This place my have just became my favorite AYCE spot! This is Kaizen sushi on steroids! The service was impeccable! Me and my guest never had an empty glass and all our plates cleared out within minutes! All of our questions were answered thoroughly and in depth. I wish our waitress would have told me her name so I could have everyone ask for her because she made the dinner flow. They also have a FULL bar.. how you could not love this place. I ended up trying an oyster shooter and it's not my thing however all the rolls were phenomenal  Kiss of Fire  Orange blossom King Of the ocean Octopus Banana Roll Shrimp lover  Lobster Roll And to accompany the meal I had ordered a Lychee Drink with Gin and it's was phenomenal ! Will be returning this week!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baby Baby Tako (Octopus) Skewer
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster shooters

69b4X7YRNGLqmcem279aRQ.text: I'm very pleased that Yelp suggested that this was one of the best sushi restaurant off the strip. I was a little hesitant because it's AYCE but it has the option for ala carte. The waitress was super friendly and the team of them worked very well together, helping each other with drink refills, cleaning off after each serving and the service was prompt and efficient. She explained that the AYCE menu is very similar but the portions are usually smaller so you're able to try more variety and that was perfect for me.   I usually will order 2 rolls and that alone would cost more than the AYCE price of $25 (dinner). Desserts are included but not drinks. In Chicago we have 1 AYCE but they give so much rice and they don't offer premium nigiri and offer mainly rolls.   Here they offered over a dozen appetizers and thankfully the portions were just the right amount so I was able to enjoy 2 maki rolls (1/2 orders), Miso soup, agadashi tofu, and nigiri. The uni and sweet shrimp were limited to one order but I couldn't eat more anyway. The yellowtail, unagi, sweet shrimp and uni were so good and fresh!   My husband enjoyed his Japanese steak, shrimp tempura, Kiss of Fire, Fresh and Easy roll (which had no rice), and Rattlesnake roll.   The bathroom was tidy and clean.   I'm definitely giving this place a 5 stars rating not only for the great service but fresh and tasty AYCE deliciousness.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cx7tSSX1qHIsKut1pgXzbQ.text: On our way back to LA, we decided to have dinner before hitting the road. I pulled the Yelp app and was led here. I didn't have time to do my research because I didn't know they have sushi Ayce for only $25 diner and $20 lunch. If I knew beforehand, we would have opted for this deal instead. Oh well, I'll make sure to have that option on my next visit.   We were greeted as soon as we came in and was seated in one of the booths. I liked that you can eat privately in these booths. We were served with water instantly and handed with the menu.  We ordered salmon sashimi, vegetable tempura, rainbow roll, California roll and miso ramen. Everything was great. I liked that they were all fresh, a must when it comes to sushi and rolls. However, ramen was just okay. I had better ramen somewhere else.  Service wasn't the friendliest because the server was a bit shy but she tried her best in taking care of us. She was attentive and constantly checked on us.

KAUdg77uydRhyomtMPW_uA.text: Where do I even start???? I'm not the person write bad reviews at all, but for this sushi restaurant I need to.    So we did have an hour wait until we got seated.   But, the hostess did place in the wrong phone number so they could not contact us.  We had to double check with them .  So we ended up waiting longer.   We then sat down on a very big table which we did like.  The service here is not the best.... I felt like every encounter we had, the person was annoyed.  We also decided to order alcohol.  I particularly ordered pineapple juice and vodka.... It tasted like rotten pineapples!! I thought I was going crazy.  I made everyone on my table take a sip to confirm.  Do they not double check their products?! It was disgusting.  I ended up getting a cranberry juice and vodka but It was just watered down.    The wait for the food was about 10-15 min which is not that bad for ayce.  The hard part was trying to order again.  I felt that servers never really knew when to come and check up on the table.    After experiencing what I did last night,  I don't think I'd like to come back.  The service and the lack of quality justified It all.  Please taste all your drinks or foods before sending them out.

-1bAjDu8E8QCxKm66x94ZA.text: ULTIMATE BEST SUSHI PLACE!  I live 45 mins away and still drive here when I want my sushi fix the staff is amazing, the sushi is fresh, and I just adore this place! Especially being from Hawaii, good sushi is hard to find. But not anymore

fZ6T3RHM4SX_JBwXt7ds4Q.text: Big mistake!!!!! Never again!! This place doesn't deserve a single star, I just stopped to get some combo fry rice togo, they make me wait around 35 minutes for a single fry rice, after 15 minutes waiting the hostess comeback and apologize for the delay, after 30 minutes again the bartender or manager who knows, about to walk out they finally come with my order and guess what? xggiylFBzu5WP6tWhB6Iew.text: Everytime when me and/or my family want to eat AYCE sushi, we always eat at Umiya Sushi. This place is the best Japanese AYCE restaurant in Vegas! They make the food fresh and tasty flavors from their kitchen. I ate here many times here and it's VERY DELICIOUS!  They have many different variety of foods from appetizers, sushi, chicken, beef, desserts, soups, seafood, and much more. This place also have sodas, teas, beer, and wine. Just a heads up, some of the portions are limited to one per person.   So far, I tried:  Appetizers - Baked Mussels (MY FAVORITE!) (Now limited one entree per person) - Salmon Cheesesticks - Jalapeno Poppers  Salad - Seaweed Salad  Tempura - Large Shrimp Tempura  Entree - Teriyaki Chicken - Chicken Katsu - BBQ Short Ribs - Fresh Oysters - Fried Oysters - Fried Squid  Noodles - Tempura Udon  Sushi - Smoked Salmon Sashimi - Spicy Tuna Roll - Spicy Salmon Roll - King of Ocean Roll - Fire Cracker Roll - Sexy Roll - Rainbow Roll - Salsa Dancing Roll - Sunrise Roll - Baked Salmon Roll - Dragon Roll - Rattle Snake Roll - Creamy Eel Roll - Orange Blossom Roll - Energy Roll - Banana Roll - Snow White Roll - Shrimp Tempura Roll - Flamingo Roll - Snow Corn Roll - First Kiss Sushi - Salmon Lovers Roll  Dessert - Ice Cream   - Vanilla   - Green Tea - Banana Split - Vanilla Tempura Ice Cream (Delicious!) - Mochi Ice Cream   - Green Tea   - Coffee   - Red Bean   - Strawberry  If you are around this area, I recommend to try this restaurant! This place may be pricey but worth to try! Don't go to the Japanese buffet around the corner, its the almost the same price as here as well. $26 for each adult isn't bad, as long as you come in and you have a large appetite, it's worth the price. They also have price per item menu if your not that hungry or if you want to take out.   All the food here are made to order and much fresher here also. All the staff here are friendlier and making sure if your happy. They also get your orders correctly! I recommend to make reservation because this place is very busy and walk ins takes a long time to get in. They also have a text message system to let you know when your table is ready as well!

KI93Wqtdq3qdjSIRje5Xyw.text: I just wasn't impressed with this place. The food wasn't bad, but it also wasn't great, and the service was just okay. It definitely has room for improvement.   The decor of the restaurant was very modernized and I really liked the ambience the place brought. What really brought my rating down for me was the service. Our waitress came and got our order the first time and came and checked on us once after, but after that she didn't check on us again for a while. The table next to us who sat down 20 minutes after us was getting their food ordered faster than us. I just didn't really feel welcomed.  Most of the sushi was very good and the amaebi, uni, mussels and tempura udon were on point. The rolls we ordered were also very good. The problem I had with the food was the salmon. I love salmon and this was a huge disappointment for me. It was really fishy tasting, and it was a little warm. It was definitely an area of concern.  It wasn't too busy tonight, so hopefully they can be more attentive with their customers, but I am willing to try it again as most of the sushi except the salmon was very good, maybe sit at the bar next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k8Ueq_k-IYPIpnuc9KEXwQ.text: Amazing all you can eat sushi restaurant. Luckily came here due to another restaurant being closed. And just like that this place turned into my must-go-to when visiting Vegas. It is definitely like a bar typed sushi restaurant since there are TVs showing sports and the ambiance being dark and mind of loud as if you were in a bar. The seating is also on benches with the tables and the bar having bar seats. But this is not a bad thing.  As for the food I certainly ate more than what I had to pay for the all you can eat. The fish was cut well (bigger portion compared to rice) and seemed fresh. The cooked food was also very good. I enjoyed eating everything I ate from various nigiris to tempura to the marinated meat to the ice cream. The food was just amazing.  Not only was the food excellent but the service was amazing. They made sure our waters were always full, whenever we looked at the menu they came by asking If we wanted more, they took empty plates immediately, and served our food very quickly. It was honestly the fastest service I've had at any all you can eat place and usually they take their time since they always have a time limit. I noticed that all of the servers and waiters helped each other which made things smoother and satisfied customers.   Overall I cant say enough good things about this restaurant. I will definitely be back and bring my friends and family. Keep up the good work.

cRVwwdDOkviQcOTpHIi8nA.text: I met a friend here and doesn't live here, but knows the local sushi restaurants in town. The atmosphere is open and lively. There are wooden benches in the dining area. So, if there are 2 people in your group. You may be seated with other people. How fun is that. I did the all up can eat which is quite reasonable for $20.95 before 3pm and $25.95 from 3p-closing 2am. The marinated Pork Belly is quite flavorful (3 pieces). Order the baked mussels when you get there, because it takes a lil bit longer to cook. I also ordered Salmon Collar which is on the dinner menu...yummy!!! 1 piece is perfect for 1 person. I topped with a tempura green tea ice cream. Overall a good place to meet for sushi off and by the strip.

h0oglZ5dIgG9EncSlotg1w.text: Delicious. I had a great time at Umiya. Sitting at the bar around 2pm on a Friday, the place was full! Good sign. Good quality nigiri and tasty rolls. Not 5stars cause the bar was a little unorganized in the back but I'm picky working in F&B industry. Will return with joy  Shootout to the Umiya team

Y-tNqCykuZeK6O6E8vlUSA.text: One of the best sushi spots in Vegas. We were staying at the Rio hotel and it was down the street which made it great! The service was great and the food was even better!! Such a good selection of all you can eat sushi so that's good too! They even had mochi balls and ice cream on the all you can eat menu too which made it even better! Haha. Fish was very fresh and the flavors were amazing too! The price for dinner was great, only $25 for AYCE! Next time I'm in Vegas again I will DEFINITELY come back! No ifs, ands, or buts!!!

N8KJD-e2b61-nOajltGcBQ.text: First, I am inexperienced with sushi. I had the waiter and chef pick a sampling of things that they recommended. Every items was amazing and an adventure in itself. I usually don't like raw fish. Though, this one didn't taste fishy at all. So, I fully enjoyed it.  I went on a Wednesday evening. There was only one other couple. The staff severely outnumbered us. I've been to other places where the wait time is 45+ minutes but this place always treats you like family. Highly recommend!

e2XErHJDAnX7J0hRTczGfg.text: BEST SUSHI PLACE IN LAS VEGAS. Amazing variety of every cravings you'll ever need!!! Also you can substitute  everything in brown rice!!! Always fresh and my favorite oysters are included in their all you can eat menu!!!! Definitely a MUST GO place!!!

Sy_oFZenGDLVjEtn95EP7A.text: Pretty shocking that I'm giving this place a 2 stars rating. I've been told by several people that this AYCE sushi joint is amazing and better than a lot of other AYCE sushi restaurant. I came here with my family on a Saturday night a little over an hour before they closed. We got menus and started going through it then a server (male) came over to our table and said "what would you guys want to drink, I'm only taking drinks order!". At that moment I felt we were being rushed and probably had pissed off that server for the fact that we came in 1 hour before they were closed. An hour is actually plenty of time to give your customers a full service dining experience without rushing them, I know because I'm a long time server myself at a full service sushi restaurant. I get it when customers come in late but thats a con when you work in this restaurant industry. After that server took our drinks order a new server came and took care of us the rest of the time. Overall, food was definitely better than all the AYCE sushi joints i've been too. But service left me feeling like I was not welcomed. I would probably recommend not coming here 1.5 hours before they close.

nLXKVs32kwxFa_Lzl2DswQ.text: Umiya is such a great place for some sushi loving time! The fish is so good and fresh! The service is so good and the waiters are so nice! Honestly I am going to come here again whemever I visit Vegas. Totally worth it!

zHKnDbuazToGzlyEITQJPQ.text: It was my first time at this place, and I have to say that I'd definitely come back!  My friends and I went here for an all-you-can-eat lunch. sFalPT3VH_2LyFoTgQy9GQ.text: Made a reservation on Monday to eat her on Wednesday with a party of 12.  Found this place on Yelp while looking for places to eat while traveling to Vegas with a bunch of friends.  Upon arriving, our table was ready for us and we were able to start ordering as soon as we sat down (we were all very hungry from our flight and a day of walking the strip waiting for our rooms to be ready).  If you're coming here to expect a sushi meal from Tsukiji Fish Market, you'll definitely be disappointed.. but if you come expecting to be full, have decent AYCE sushi for an amazing price.. you'll be very pleased.  All of us left with full and satisfied stomachs.  You can't beat it for the price and I love that they take reservations.  I will definitely be back when traveling back to Vegas.  **Get the oysters & the uni.. and take your friend's order if they pass on it ;)

He then demanded angrily that I show him the order confirmation, which I did (which somehow annoyed him more). They then found the order and prepared it. Got back to the hotel and was super disappointed with the sushi. Fish did not taste fresh at all, and all my rolls were overpowered by imitation crab. 5yK626HZucSqtu_ZL7HUgQ.text: I have eaten at this sushi restaurant which is Formaly Kaizen It's located across the street from the palms I even found an episode of wife swap in this restaurant actually wasn't me it was my nanny bringing the other wife into it and I know that the restaurant owners and staff were very helpful with the producers I have eaten here so many times with my friends that I can't even count this particular sushi bar offers or you can eat lunch for I think $22 for lunch and 25 for dinner and it comes with a special menu if you don't finish your food they charge you but that's never happened to me ever always had good service here places  Cleanliness  I've never seen it as busy as the other Kaizen  on flamingo and Hyndman I believe that ones open much later definitely try the Japanese lasagna is a must and so is the snow corn roll but you must order it with sway paper and get the garlic out of mummy so great I do not eat a lot of raw fish but I've seen my friends order 10 to 15 different roles in front of me that presentation wise they look amazing but I'm very picky with sushi I like mine cooked and fattening My son will even eat here because he loves their Bento box Out of all the times that I have been here I've never been disappointed If you are a tourist looking for sushi and you are staying either at the Rio or the palms this is a nice little local spot it even in walking distance if you must but it's in a shady little strip mall.

q7t6B5pGS2-FyMGyeSMnRw.text: I really don't get all of the great reviews for this place - this wasn't the worst sushi I've ever had, but it comes pretty close to the bottom of the list. If it matters to you, this is a very Korean sushi place, not Japanese run - complete with K-pop videos and a particularly cute flower boy (pretty) waiter who looked straight out of my Korean dramas.   Service was very friendly and since it was empty, the food came out ridiculously fast. This is normally a positive, except that in this case, speed meant careless and sloppy sushi. I got mostly nigiri and everything seemed pretty fresh, but the rice was borderline hard, and the nori was coming off nigiri and hand rolls. My friend's fancy rolls were ok, but drowned in way too much sauce.   One of the daily specials was ocean trout, which I've never tried before, but now LOVE - it's really similar to salmon, but better somehow... Spicy tuna on crispy rice was the only other thing I'd say was good. They didn't have a few of the sides pictured on yelp like the fish collar, and nothing that we tried was really above mediocre.   Rib eye was half well done, half rare. Japanese hamburg steak (like salisbury steak) was ok, but weird to serve it without rice. Ika yaki grilled squid was rubbery but not bad. Poor grilled baby octopus skewer was just cooked to hell, but I liked the kochujang sauce. Teri chicken was a big bowl of chicken w/ lots of stir fried veggies, friend said it was ok. Soft shell crab tasted like old oil. Pork belly was soft, but not much flavor. Seared tuna with AJ sauce (whatever that is) was a mess, but tasted ok. Uni was sweet and better than some other ayce places. Spicy scallop wasn't spicy at all, and was barely even scallop - it was mostly mildly spicy imitation crab.   We mostly came here because of positive yelp reviews, along with some miscommunication on which sushi place a friend had recommended (we found out later that she wasn't talking about Umiya). Unless I came to stalk the cute Korean waiter, I won't be back. I always forget to abide by the rule where if a sushi place has majority non-Asian customers, you should just leave. Every single crappy sushi place I've been to, I look around before we leave and it's a lot of non-Asians enjoying an awesome california roll. Racist to say...sure, but it's been True so far at least in my experience.

5aKCL_wXNWkLYiR3tYgg5g.text: So bad , so bad. Saw the high review and brought my team here and decided to go for AYCE. The moment we stared ordering, the waitress reminded us twice about how we must finish every grain of rice or we will be charged. Fine, we got it. Then she came back five minutes later, warned us one more time how we must finish every grain of rice or we will be charged. We were like... Huh? Really? We barely started eating. Then food started coming, and other older Korean waitress started coming to us to SERIOUSLY remind us of NOT leaving any rice on the table OR they will CHARGE US!! She literally stayed at the table for 30 seconds to advocate this rule. At this point, we were very irritated and we actually tried eating as much rice as we could as they put so much rice on every roll :((    Food was very good, service overall was attentive.   But, BE AWARE OF the two Korean ladies that will NOT stop harassing you if you are the only table there. Don't go too early.   Be rice lover too !!

EAvHCcjAllw429AdQmlRXA.text: Amazing AYCE sushi and Izakaya buffet a few minutes off the strip. You get 90 minutes to chow down. I recommend prioritizing the daily specials, dinner only items, and the 1-per-person items.   My favorites were uni (then uni blew away my expectations for buffet uni, which were admittedly very low), salmon belly, raw oysters, seared tuna sashimi, baby octopus, fried crab, and ginko nuts. The hamachi and white tuna nigiri were also great.   Avoid the poke or anything in the salad section. I would also avoid the ikura (not fresh).   If you check in on yelp you get a free soda!

UuFChy51FOfVSXvsuqVYDQ.text: Previously Kan Sushi, Umiya is a new sushi joint out here that's actually close to the strip.    This was Chad S's UYE and I couldn't resist the combination of meeting new Yelpers and eating sushi.  When it comes to this place, it's all about AYCE.  I'm one of those guys that can eat a ton, so AYCE is never a bad choice.  As for the food, I got so much of it that it's tough for me to remember, but I'll try.  -Yellowtail and Tuna Nigiri:  Small, but since it's AYCE it wasn't an issue. Tasty, fresh, and the texture was just right. Believe me, I've had some stale dry nigiri before.  My favorite Yellowtail is still at Kaizen off Paradise.  -Katsu Chicken:  Not bad, just a little greasy.  Still fresh and crunchy.  Tasted perfect with their chicken fried rice.  -Chicken Fried Rice:  Thick pieces of chicken mixed with their fried rice.  If it's not sushi to come here for, then it's their fried rice.  -Ramen (miso):  Just okay, but it's also one of my first ramens.  Not much to compare against. I didn't think it was bad, but others have stated that Chinatown has better.  -Tempura Shrimp Hand Roll:  I use to be a western roll type of person. Now it's all about Nigiri, Shashimi, and Hand Rolls.  Still got a yum yum type hand roll and it didn't disappoint.  Again, small but it's ACYE.  -Tempura Ice Cream:  Not a dessert person, but couldn't resist on this visit.  This was pretty good too.   Service wasn't bad considering that our group was fairly big.  Between all the food request from other Yelpers, the fact it was Friday night, and because this location was close to the strip..I felt that the service was decent.   Overall, I will be back.  There's a ton of other sushi joints out here in Vegas.  But this one is little closer to the strip, which makes it a good stop when out of town friends/family are in the sushi mood.   Thanks to Chad S. for setting this up.  Got to meet some Yelp friends that I've never met in person.  Also was able to hang out with some Yelpers that still are the coolest peeps around. New Yelper Alicia R (Terri R's twin) was in attendance. She ended up being my run/walk buddy for the next day's Color Run 5K.  Good thing because I thought I would be the only walker at this event.

Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fries Rice
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katsu

L2Ye40LHapXqF4uqnuPWDg.text: Disappointed. I followed the recommendation of fellow Yelpers to this spot in search of great sushi in Vegas - after going here I am 100% certain that anyone who says this is good sushi has 100% never had good sushi.   While we were settling in, one of the sushi rollers dropped off a salmon sashimi salad in front of us which we thought was complementary, as in our past experience at sushi joints sitting at the bar sometimes yields tasting plates on the house. Well, apparently this was not meant for us. When our server came back to take our order, a man whom I can only assume to be the owner or manager started yelling, asking if we ordered the tiny salad in front of us. I said no. And he began to yell at the workers behind the counter. It was very strange and uncomfortable. I finished the rest of the salad, which ended up being the best thing we ate.   Our plate of sashimi was made and given to us by the same man, who dropped the plate and then quickly picked something off a piece of tuna before saying, "ok it's good." Not very reassuring... All the fish - salmon, tuna, and super white tuna, left a strange after taste that was off putting. Doesn't need to be said, but not a good sign when eating raw fish.   Lychee martini tasted of straight lychee juice with a splash of saki and had whole ice cubes floating in it. Rolls were reasonably priced and large in size, but again, I just didn't feel the fish tasted all that fresh, and even the avocado on them looked past its prime.   Service is a mess and food nor drinks make up for it. Would not go back or recommend. Shout out to the sushi roller though. He was really friendly and cool.

42w6NhiWDprjVcqBeE27vw.text: Trying another AUCE sushi joint cuz damnit, I'm hungry and this spot is right by my credit union that I stopped at and because SOMETHING is going on with Woo Che! Second day I've rolled by there and they've been closed! AND I almost went to go try Korean Garden BBQ cuz they have a pretty cheap AUCE BBQ price but I quickly pulled up some reviews and they were weird. ANYHOO. This is what I stuffed into the fat girl stuck inside of my body:  Spicy Garlic Edamame - a little overcooked, some of the shells were downright MUSHY. The flavor was OK. A little spicy, but not much and the garlic flavor was rather mild. I LOVE garlic.  Marinated Pork Belly - I have been CRAVING pork belly lately! This didnt necessarily satisfy my craving either. The pork belly itself was melt in your mouth tender and the marination was aiight. Not bad at all - I am just personally craving some samgyupsol!  Grilled Shishito Peppers - served with Bonito flakes on the side. I always love shishito peppers but these could have use some togarashi!  Crispy SS Crab - I highly DON'T recommend this. Too much breading and not enough flavor. I even tried dipping it in some spicy mayo but ended up just leaving the other half, untouched.   Baked New Zealand Mussel in Dynamite Sauce - these were good. Nothing stuck out about them but they werent bad at all.  Seafood Dynamite - good as well. Typically these taste the same wherever I get them. Not bad at all.  Tuna Poke - this was REALLY good! A little seaweed salad on the side and just enough seasoning and spiciness to leave me wanting more!  Jalapeno Popper - spicy tuna and cream cheese inside the jalapeno and deep fried. Um. No. I ate one out of the four. Just not a good combination and really not much flavor. They probably deseeded the jalapeno taking all of it's delicious spiciness with and the half way cooked spicy tuna inside wasn't cuttin it. Besides, COOKED spicy tuna is NOT something I EVER look forward to.  The Nigiri I tried was:  Tuna, Albacore, Super White Tuna, Salmon and Yellowtail. ALL of it was VERY good. Very fresh tasting and fatty and melt in your mouth. The Albacore was kind of fishy but that just might be how the fish is suppose to be. I'm not a fan of really fishy tasting fish, but some people are!   Anyway I finished off my meal with a salmon and avocado hand roll and a banana split!!!! I love handrolls and this one did not disappoint! Really good quality fish!  And my banana split was a nice small personal size - just a scoop of vanilla with a banana and some chocolate syrup. Simple and tasty.   Four stars for the NIGIRI. Three stars for the rest of the menu.

HQOSRtpPcxMJjrOjEBwcQQ.text: If this place was judged solely on the value of their $25 all you can eat lunch offering, it would receive 5 stars.  The portions and choices are all ample and solid flavors abound.  None of the dishes I tried knocked my socks off and that's the only reason I wear socks to restaurants but I would go back.  They have a local cult following as this restaurant was recommended by a die hard "Umiyaer" that visits weekly.  There's a hashtag so I believe they exist.  I have never heard of this restaurant prior to last week but I'm glad I got to enjoy their offerings.  If I lived or worked closer to their location (right by the Palms Casino) I would go back as it's priced well but since I don't engorge myself during lunch (2 rolls are filling) I would feel that I'm not getting the full experience.  I guess that just means I will have to visit on numerous occasions which my belly would be OK with.
