myoRHYaTVx3O6eUor2sD1w.text: Best sushi in town , coming from a sushi guru!! Best prices and most of all customer services .

jCmOVF5vGfivegpJWZMHag.text: By far the best AYCE sushi place for $20 lunch/$25 dinner and service is great! Quality taste and lovely presentation. Three of us completely devoured 6 specialty rolls and 3 more plates of nigiri... Even the staff were impressed, and it was amazing. Super satisfying but not to the point you're super stuffed, it was just perfect.  Our go-to place for AYCE sushi lunch now. Love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dz_y0evps8gEswXG997Opg.text: The best selling point of this AYCE sushi spot is the addition $10 cost for all you can drink draft beers and house sake.  But other than that, this is a really solid spot.    Another thing Umiya did right being "new" is adopting what's good and getting rid of what didn't work.  Umiya is not totally new, it was the former Kaizen Fusion.  But with the name change it severs any affiliation with the other Kaizen.. except the sushi names have been kept the same.    The only times I come in is during their slow hours and before dinner service.  Because it's slow, service has been great.  I sit up right at the bar and get even better/faster service.  Any time you can order straight to the Chef, that's how you should do it.  Trust me it works, I've done it at Honey Salt.  If you come in during lunch like me it's not worth upgrading to dinner price for the Uni/Ama ebi/Seared tuna sashimi.    There were some good items and some AYCE grade sushi, neither is bad.  If you know what to look for then ask for it, more likely than not they'll have it or he'll lie and say he doesn't.  Some of the few items I asked for was salmon belly, fresh wasabi, yellowtail belly, etc.  They had some of these items but not advertised anywhere, so ask.   When you come in, order everything you can order one item of which includes:  Baby Octopus, Gingko (if you know herbal medical properties or take vitamins then order it, if not, don't), pork belly, oysters.  Ask for specialty fishes, every time I have come in there hasn't been one but keep asking.  Uni was good, ama ebi I was a little disappointed in especially the pre-prepped head/deep fried antennas.    The ice cream was good and I confirmed it by ordering a second but different flavor.  The waitress gave me a hard time about getting another even though I told her I'd pay for another, separate it on a different check if she needed, there was no language barrier here and I knew I only get one per AYCE.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared albacore, please don&#39;t ask for Cajun albacore.
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped cheap scallops.
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You can have an order of Oysters with AYCE.

h55BbaKMnG8YfxLMqBja3g.text: I would actually rate this place with three stars but the service actually made me add another.  I've dined here on several occasions and each time was because I was REALLY HUNGRY and wasn't feeling the wait at either Goyemon or Sushi Koma during prime times (around 7pm) of the night. This place can really turn and burn- and for an AYCE restaurant? I'm quite impressed.  The quality of the food wasn't there for me. The first couple of bites after coping with starvation is good but it's sad to realize that you're judgement will drastically change once you're 30% full. The menu is more extensive than most AYCE restaurants but I guess that's why you're getting mediocre quality dealing with the amount of overhead this place carries. The fresh oysters? Probably my favorite part of the place but it limits one time order per diner. Bummer, really.  The service really stood out for me. The staff didn't mind how busy it was and was heavily focused on attending to our every need. Water refills, clearing empty plates off the table, letting our server know that we wanted to order more; their teamwork have earned their high tip since working at an AYCE restaurant can seem annoying.  The best part? Food will literally come out the minute after you order. I'm not sure if this is a good or bad thing but it was definitely good since we were hungry. If I'm ever on a time restraint, I'll come back. If I'm looking for quality vs. quantity, I won't. This place has its perks though.

k97su8Wh3UJU7bLPwH21eg.text: Their AYCE price was just right and service was fast. I really enjoyed their salmon belly. I wish I could order more than two peices but I get it. I will definitely come again.

Z9WxBVj1f3WdOP0HDZn1ag.text: This place has great taste and great portions! All you can eat available!!! Although it was mildy busy and there was a line for tables we were seated immediately at the bar :) The food came quickly and the fish was super fresh! Waiters were attentive and happy. My teriyaki chicken roll was and entire entree in a bowl with veggies; unexpected and DELICIOUS! Being well accustomed to Koreatown Ramen, Las Vegas tonkatsu Ramen did not meet our standards but not so say someone else won't love it!

zy95HsRfuswon5OG9DzxVA.text: I'm in love with their oysters it's so good and fresh must try them if you're a seafood person they add some kind of sauce with a bit of siracha which made the oyster flavorful also their teriyaki beef is delicious the sauce is just right it's not too sweet or bland the plate comes with salad and miso soup. Pricing is not bad at all.   The place looks pretty hip and modern all the servers seems to always be occupied or so it looks. But servicing wise could be better since I don't know who was serving us the ones that did assist us were helpful.   They have an all you can eat special which I have yet to try but definitely will next time.  Overall my experience here has been good so far until next time !!

nqm7kSTzFfrjSXpM6QkmdQ.text: I've been to Umiya a few times. The first time was outstanding. The fish was fresh and flavorful, the service attentive, and there's a decent menu selection for AYCE. Excited to have found a great new sushi place, I went back to try the lunch specials, which were also great. However, over the last few months the quality and service have taken a nosedive.   A friend and I were in on a Sat night for AYCE dinner. We were seated promptly even though it was somewhat busy, but we hadn't even got our coats off before someone came to take our order. Clearly not ready yet. Then, when we were ready, despite the army of staff, no one came. I'll spare the extensive list of service fails throughout the evening, but it's really the service that is earning the 2 star rating here. Basically, we didn't get what we ordered the first time, were unable to get someone to take a follow up order, had food thrown down on the table by servers on their way to somewhere else, and were overcharged. To top it off, the fish was bland and the portion sizes had shrunk from previous visits. I'd rate the food about 2.5 stars. Time to scratch this one off the list. There's just so many better places in town.

EbCARLinQNdHa7T71klPRA.text: this place is amazing!! this is the best all you can eat sushi restaurant I've ever been to. The fish is surprisingly so fresh given that it's in the middle of Nevada. Even the uni and unagi were delicious (two dishes that come to mind that tend to be underwhelming for all you can eat sushi). The selection is HUGE and the rolls are really original. Highly recommend the banana roll, Alaska roll, bacon and scallop skewers, orange blossom roll. would come again when I'm in town. YAY!!!!!!!!!!

jhf-uRNfGGodZ22mN47q6w.text: fresh sushi and great service! pricing $21 for lunch, not bad! I also love their sushi rolls and grilled items. great AYCE sushi place. We've been there twice already!

BpAvprsOBokdWT-gsbQKsQ.text: Although on the expensive side, the sushi here is nice and has pretty good flavour but nothing blows me out of the water. Fan of the French kiss sushi because the mango was an interesting twist and the seared tuna steak with veges was lovely.

u8-IRNlGQ1Syn3yTY8PMAA.text: Best AYCE and it's not crowded like other places that have a 45min wait all the time!!!

966XERC1r4BLSCNI-ypDzw.text: Delicious and fresh. Friendly environment and staff. The sushi, rolls and teppanyaki are top. Highly recommend.

FmcYTZ-aq08YoAsbv6smbg.text: Food was great especially their spicy garlic edamame and service was excellent. Highly recommended if you are in Vegas.

QaCcyw8xtLczgpA-vhULCg.text: Remember the scene in When Harry Met Sally where Meg Ryan is in the restaurant and she acts out the orgasm? Thats how my friends and I felt when we opened up and saw the all you can eat menu at Umiya in Las Vegas!! The price is amazing and the food  exquisite!  Creamy agedashi tofu that melts in your mouth and tuna poke that make me want to poke you (hahaha)! Where else can you find a roll with high self esteem ("I love my ass roll")? Bottom line: skip the strip and eat here for good quality Japanese food that will make you feel like you are sitting at a Tokyo table.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skewer Baby Octopus

w7QBzFo708APD5O4uLXnCQ.text: This place is awesome blossom!  I really liked the variety they had to offer.  Most decent AYCE sushi places I have been to only have a few non sushi items.  This is a place that I can take friends who do not enjoy sushi.  They can still eat a lot of food and get their money's worth too while I gorge on sushi.  It has something for everyone.  I would have given it 5 stars if the service was not so slow toward the middle/end.  I feel like they purposely slowed down on making our orders at the end because we were eating so much.  The slow service was in reference to the cooks/sushi chefs only.  The waiter and waitresses were all sweet and attentive.

wQyHEd07VLxNdgDH--_Y-g.text: I have been to almost every sushi restaurant in Las Vegas and this one wins the worst restaurant award. I initially said I wanted to get the all you can eat and then asked leaned that most of what I wanted to order was on the a la cart menu. They wouldn't allow me to switch over because they claimed they would have to pay tax on a voided transaction(which is incorrect). So I had to pay the all you can eat price plus everything else I wanted to order.  The service was terrible, food was mediocre. Never going back.

SsNT1mx3zpfTrMYFpC9B_A.text: It was good grade of sushi as all you can eat.  Most of nigiri were flesh and sauce on roll was yummy that my friend said.  Sever were very friendly and nice, we sat fancy booth, we all enjoyed.

JXq08v90A73KXIdQ5vgTCw.text: I've wanted to try Umiya for a while now. What a great spot for sushi. The Uni was amazing!!  Your unagi was tasty and we loved the seared tuna sashimi. We will definitely be back.

HiUKGf1XkAzuJKVQDRp15w.text: This place is delish. Got the sashimi lunch special. Great food for a good price. Service is great, too. Nice presentation. Love the inside decor as well.

7cCA_J3ODuHZvQdnbsPC8A.text: Fish didn't taste fresh. Service from waitress was awful, but the waitstaff that filled waters and ran the food was very good. Won't be returning or recommending.

dUYqhQEOGc9P5SmEt5rlHQ.text: I found this place by yelping, and all these good reviews made me believe they serve good sushi. However, to be honest, I had one of the worst AYCE sushi experiences here. Their rice is not right, fish is not so fresh and over flavored with lots of sauce. They didn't tell me until I sit and placed  my order that they had run out of oyster, uni, and halibut. I was very disappointed by the quality of their food although the service was not bad...There are so many better AYCE sushi places out there. Don't choose this one!!

P0W0-Yy3hprimyS0BtBOhQ.text: Plain and simple tasty sushi, good service, reasonable price and good atmosphere. Do yourself a favor, adventure off the Strip and get to Umiya!

QW1Ig17yOQW35jWid8v7pw.text: Food was interdasting... Very interdasting.. Me likey Chinese food. Yum yum in my Tum Tum

RRRHHGPE4e4CbXTGhfIRGQ.text: Came here for Mother's Day expecting it's gonna  be packed but the wait wasn't that bad. Had a good time with friends, service was really good and fast too. Looove the "mixed karai!" Also really like the idea of the "tech buzzer" on the table. Thank you for for the wonderful food.

PVqcqUqk-qLX_MRp3ap9kw.text: Just tried this place out last night. Sushi here is really good, but the menu is pretty simple for what it is. A lot of the rolls are renditions of the previous roll, just with the addition or removal of one ingredient.  BUT, if I asked them to change a roll to make it more interesting they did it without hesitation. AYCE pricing is the same as everywhere else in town, so I wasn't surprised at all by the price. The environment is really nice and open, doesn't feel crowded or busy like many of the other sushi restaurants, so that was a definite plus. The staff here was ON POINT, they tended to all of our needs and we're very helpful. I couldn't even finish my glass of water before the waitress came around to fill it up again haha.  I will definitely return to this place.

ItXxtfzuVxdioFsVKhpNHg.text: Great selection of food. All you can eat has a great selection of delicious rolls and other type of dishes you can order from. Courteous  servers it was a great place to eat sushi

Jys051pgsJXI0CC8eV7a7g.text: This place is awesome!! Great price for AYCE and the sushi is delicious! Really nice staff, perfect late night joint for people who work near the strip

WerQLL9ZkRdMuPbIcTz48A.text: Great food, sushi and decor was good.  Skewers and appetizers were kind of small, but the sushi was appetizing.  Service was ok, but the sushi was good regardless. I would return for more.

wKtJfQIJlCj8VL3Wp55rQw.text: This is an updated review. I remember this place to be so good. So my family was in town and we decided to go there. What a mistake. First of all the place was dead and now I know why the quality of fish is not what it used to be. The rolls weren't as good as I remember it. The service was horrible and the waitress had an attitude so did the waiter. With so many other sushi places to choose from sorry to say I won't be back!

Xmf-mjbxm2o7JsA2570v0Q.text: Umiya was great. The all-you-can-eat menu was killer and the fish tasted fresh, nothing was "fishy."  The Teriyaki Chicken was also delicious. The music was a little loud at the bar, but it was great other than that.

OhweeNpaAr4LG6ACkybBfQ.text: My star rating is not due to the food. We had AYCE sushi and it was very good. Fish tasted fresh and there was a lot of choices. Price was reasonable. Restaurant was clean and the ambiance was enjoyable. The problem was the service was painfully slow. It took 45 mins after ordering to get our first roll. There is a 90 min time limit on AYCE. Getting our check dropped off and picked up also took WAY too long. I might come back if I have a lot of time to kill.

U2KvJaWv3wTaEwlifH78LA.text: Visiting Vegas for a vacation. We were trying to find a good AYCE place and umiya came up. It got the best reviews and it did not disappoint! We are a good amount and everything was good quality. Sean and Ron were both very attentive servers!

yDR8jpay-V-Np6zZFrJqkg.text: This is my second time dining here for the all you can eat sushi, AMAZING! The food is amazing, the service is fantastic, place to be for the best sushi and same bombs! :) the wait isn't too bad, but when you're hungry...come here on a weekday.

L51cnUwgWYkXRe_6-aTqTg.text: AYCE! Every time I go out for sushi I make sure the restaurant has all you can eat. This place was actually pretty darn good. Everything I tried was amazing and the service is awesome as well. Very nice employees. Even the dessert is AYCE! Can't get any better than that. Many options from green tea tempura to mochi balls! I will definitely be a regular.

dGFEfLp1eQEJ2hxnG0Oezg.text: best ayce i have been so far.  love the grilled mackerel.     usually an after work go to hang out.  staff here is awesome and service is always on point!

ghiwZJJuuhM5I1Eu3f6F4w.text: Jackpot!  Accidently found this place as we stopped off in Vegas .  It's an all you can eat place where you order off the menu - not buffet.  For an AYCE it's great. Great variety!  Food is fresh and service very friendly and prompt.

8lsTGGBFHmfSVaFxEYBM3g.text: Horrible, rude waiters. Especially Danny. I'm in awe. Rolling his eyes at customers and arguing with them to no end. Will not come back

shRXHqy0-AOpfb2_xw11Pg.text: Another great sitting and food at this location. Sushi is fresh and service is great! Been here many times the past 3 years and never have had a problem! Great prices for AYCE

Gql47pSelJzQMyujIWjtZw.text: Got to admit I am big fan of this place, good sushi and probably one of the best AYCE places in Vegas, can't beat it. We usually go to the other AYCE places prior to finding this jem,  when visiting Vegas, but not any more this will be our go to place from now on! Solid food, not bad freshness level at all, you are not going to get Jiro quality but pretty decent for a AYCE place.

p90uoJMNlho_ChVSiXSh2g.text: Yummy to my tummy!!!  Everything that we ordered was very good. If you don't like sushi you'll have to order lots of teriyaki and skewers to fill up.

aQhmkVlBJXCVgeiOZnpwCw.text: Taylor is the best host the food is very good go ever once a week for lunch and some times on the weekend

If it is a packed house you will still get your orders in a timely manner. The Passion Fruit Iced Tea is delicious too. This raises the bar on AYCE Sushi and it is my Go To place for AYCE. Highest Recommendation.

NzTu8GVe8mUNAzBlnKrV2A.text: The food is amazing here! I always come here and the food never fails to be non amazing. Screaming Orgasam is phenomenal and the tuna poke is great. Service is always on point. Waiters are all very attentive.

CfNwqqyCxGT7zTOQVLTT-Q.text: I've been coming here for 3 years. Hands down best service best sushi in Vegas. Both ref menu and ayce are sick menus. Love that it's close to home and love that they treat me more like a friend than a customer. Quick delicious and a great atmosphere.  yassssssss

BYl5odKkPwySb4ijDS8gVA.text: Amazing selection and lunch special was 20.95. A great deal!  So many choices of hot entrees and rolls.

fxQRbDjhQojAxNx9EfyvMg.text: So we go back to Umiya one more time after our bad experience last time. We mostly went back because of our favorite waitress (Jeanie) who always provides the best service and knows our order before we go.  We were going go stop coming here after the issues we had but we literally stayed for now because of Jeanie and the relationship we built with her. She makes us feel at home.   I told her about our issue last time with not being able to get our favorite roll that we have gotten for the past year. She was very surprised and went up to the chefs and they made us two of them on the spot. Hopefully our bad experience last time was just a new waitress in a bad mood or some kind of confusion (although I dont see how it could have been confusion) Hopefully we dont run into another weird situation.

2PUXz1urDv0fFlY-U-t-cg.text: Ate here for the first time a week ago. They have all you can eat sushi and their rolls are very good. It's probably my favorite all you can eat sushi spot now.

cvkR3jYLP6aiW92Ou7vf3g.text: Wow. Thank you yelpers! After your recommendations we ventured off the strip and tried this place! Never had AYCE sushi before, and now Im wondering if we have these in Texas.  They explain the rules up front: 90 minutes, items with a 1 you can only order once per person, if there's a D it's dinner only, and if you leave too much behind you will pay extra! Knowing that...we started! Major pro: for the sushi rolls you can do a half order! This is awesome! It allowed us to experience so much more! So here is what we ordered: Tuna poke- tender, favorable, delicious  Miso ramen- eh. Not the star of the party. Tasted like packaged ramen.  Pork belly- YUMMY! Flavorable, crisp, delicious!  Yum yum roll- this was my favorite! So much flavor! Vegas lasagna- again delicious! Excellent blend of flavors Shrimp lover roll- basic but good  Rattlesnake roll- this was my least favorite roll. It wasn't bad, but I could do without it  Banana roll- this was surprisingly good. The sweet of the banana and the savary of the crab inside was a good pairing  Green chili tempura roll- I didn't taste green chili. This is another roll I could do without. It wasn't bad, it was just ok Fresh n easy roll- wrapped in cucumber and no rice, it was good! I liked it!   I'm leaving here about 10 lbs heavier but it was worth it! If you're visiting Vegas come here. You won't be disappointed!

XuUMrLw4nMJ4nX4gWHtPcw.text: One of the only ayce restaurants that has earned a spot on my short list. Great variety, some unique rolls, and the fish was solid. Service was fast and friendly.   I hate to leave such a short and vague review, but this place is really good and nobody wants to read my waxing poetic about hamachi.   Go. Enjoy. Go back. Enjoy again.

95moWEiBkd2VXKl6XAUdzA.text: I've eaten at many a sushi places, and umiya is just not one of my favorites. For me, it just wasn't good and it wasn't appetizing whatsoever!   Ambiance: 3 - nice looking place with a fun atmosphere and giant tables to fill with sushi. So basically umiya is really nice for group dinners and sushi dates, etc.   Service: 2 - They were really great people with nice personalities, but our service was pretty terrible. They had a big group walk in on them and they couldn't really handle the rest of the restaurant. Food came really slow, and we were still pretty hungry afterwards.   Food: 1 - If you would like to dine here, I suggest the garlic tuna nigiri and the soft shell crab appetizer. Those were the only 2 things out of the menu that I liked.   Food took a long time to come to our table, so dishes that were supposed to be warm were cold and cold dishes were warm. But even then it didn't really taste great for me, so I still stick by to my 2 recommendations above. Have a good time dining, but I probably won't come back!

kkWuz4vN8gziaddJGXXxzg.text: Stopped in for all you can eat sushi for lunch. Food was amazing, and the specialty rolls were pretty inventive. Unfortunately, it took about 30 minutes after we finished eating to get and pay the check (not an exaggeration). We had to ask for the check multiple times, and it was particularly frustrating to see our waitress checking in with other customers (mid-meal) after we had asked for the check. Don't go here in any sort of rush!

MmO3iAjDL0BYuR7rzZ7UaA.text: Fried ice cream is on point !  Sushi was eh. Another place that packs the rolls with 87% rice.  Sushi was almost tasteless. I wouldn't be able to rave about anything other than the fried ice cream

0ENaczt25JvN-_JOG2h5kw.text: This place is the $%#!  Where do I even start? The prices are right, the food is great, the waiters and waitresses do work; what more can I say?  At around 25 dollars per person, you can get unlimited sushi (Hand rolls, nigiri, special rolls, appetizers, and even dessert! The tempura and the fried soft shell crab was amazing! I just kept it coming. The only thing I didn't really liek was their rib-eye (which you can only get one time) but hey, it's a sushi restaurant; If you want good steak, you wouldn't choose to eat here anyways. I loved the garlic tuna nigiri, and and the salmon belly nigiri. I also loved the pork belly appetizer.   I will definitely be coming back to this restaurant during future visits to vegas.

PgSDmjSW-3M9_izIulUiFA.text: Overall this was a great ayce sushi experience as I am a avid sushi eater along with my girlfriend. Its the little things that count and Umiya acomplished those on my checklist. The main dish that was really different and outsanding to me was their monkey brain, the deep fried avocado is so rich and fatty. Having oysters on your ayce is always a plus. I enjoyed most of the garnishes along side the sushi.   Thumbs up definitively.

Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really love the atmoshere in here. I am so ready for some sushi.

The quality of the sashimi was not good at all. This was my last meal in Las Vegas and I regretted going here like crazy. The sushi was not good. I would rather pay full price for good sushi than go to this bad AYCE sushi place. Also, they charge for hot tea? oPmAwj-LgCBH_WB0znrDdQ.text: They don't have the option for baked salmon roll , They say it won't be cooked if the fish will be inside the roll, Only on top of the roll. What the hell? So bake the salmon before and put it in the sushi before you roll it!  So unprofessional.

EJ4-anOxo8YmAwzzpLcu0g.text: This is now.....after one time....my new favorite sushi joint in Vegas. ACYE sushi at a great price. Flavors kick our previous favorite  sushi place out of the water.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nigiri!!!

XfTYu86g9Hb8EQNIA-lk2A.text: Umiya sushi was a great find for AYCE sushi. It's a little outside of the strip, but definitely worth the trip out there. My partner and I walked from the Excalibur thinking it wasn't too far -- we wouldn't recommend doing this, as we walked for over an hour and had to cross the freeway.  Umiya had a great selection of items, and all of their staff are super attentive and friendly. The neat thing is that Umiya lets you do "half-orders" so that you can try a lot of different things. We didn't see any sashimi on the menu, but this was fine for us since we had poke.  Great price point for AYCE -- we really didn't feel like paying premium prices that you'd typically find I the strip. The restaurant itself is quite large, and unfortunately there wasn't a lot of people there when we went on a Tuesday night (unfortunate because it's quite a cool spot). Those that were there -- we think -- are locals, so it's nice to dine where locals dine.

FAXPRAA7K8Qcd2qfjBsTdg.text: The service is very fast and friendly. Sushi is okay but it will not be one of my go to's. the rice is a lot. The fish is ok but not as fresh as the ones I am accustomed to. For the area it's prob among the better ones. I tried to try a bit of everything but it's just not enough to get me back. The fried shrimp heads were harder than I wanted.

TfoOFdC4OSPXL9A_wN7pPw.text: Atmosphere: 4.5/5 Seemed extremely lively.  Open sushi bar with an almost interactive feel.   Service: 5/5 Servers were very attentive and quick to place orders. Friendly staff.   Food: 3.5/5 Overall quality of sushi was pretty decent.  Highlights were tuna,  uni,  amaebi, and hamachi. Majority of rolls were variations using imitation crab and random sauces.

2FALtmEyVPksIyqSGh_nTA.text: For the price and proximity to the strip I probably should give this place 5 stars, but I'll hold that last star until they add more beers to their menu and/or soften up a bit on the "if you don't eat it, we will charge you for it"... note: this restaurant was a recommendation from our Uber driver.   Pros:  - All you can eat dinner for $26! We had (for apps): fried oysters, soft shell crab, pork belly and gyoza. All delicious! We ordered 4 half rolls and 1 full roll (all great!). Then 2 mochi (awesome!) and 2 tempura ice cream. Walked away pretty full and very satisfied (not stuffed and uncomfortable). In summary, the food was great as expected.  - Food arrived timely - Service was good  - Noise level = good! Not too quiet but great for conversation  - We didn't have to wait for a table at 6:30pm on a Friday in December  Cons:  - The waitress literally warned us that they would charge us for food not eaten even if we said we "didn't like the roll" :-X I understand what they are trying to do here, but it was maybe too stern of a warning. I think instituting a "no more than x rolls every x minutes per person unless the food is gone/eaten" is perhaps a better way of getting people to not order a ton of food just because it's all you can eat. - I'm nitpicking here, but I would like to see a larger selection of alcohol, especially beer. But this is an overall complaint of mine for most Asian cuisine restaurants so take it with a grain of salt   Overall a great value and delicious food for Vegas. I always complain that it's hard to use Yelp in Vegas because everything is rated 3.5 stars or higher. I've been to Vegas 5 times and this place, in my opinion, is above average! Check it out if you don't mind going off the strip!

bSKfNE8fsv4n4NIe4z5UGw.text: I've been looking for a good sushi place lately in Las Vegas, but Umiya Sushi satisfied my cravings for so many weeks. This place has all my favorites (including Uni/Sea Urchin).

_Xz9m5th4hwaAhokiOzToQ.text: My new favorite sushi spot! Came in with a group of people and we all enjoyed the AYCE option. I believe it was $28 or so a person. One roll in particular that stood out was the Banana Roll. It was a basic California roll with a caramelized banana on top. It was absolutely amazing. They have a large selection of beers as well which was awesome.   They also had no rice sushi rolls wrapped in cucumber. That was delish! The first kiss roll was great as well.  To end the dinner we had the tempura green ice cream. I can't even deal with how good that was. Can't wait to go back!

WVHEKs-yVEShRZy0ChXYDg.text: Never fails to impress and satisfy. Good mix of menu items from rolls, nigiri, grilled items, cold items, meat, fish, chicken.  Big parties are okay. Servers are the nicest, most attentive and friendly. Food quality is always the best. Good moves fast.  Hands down the best AYCE in Vegas.

ZAQTPo1Ff7xj6dFXOQt_FQ.text: Umiya was a sushi spot that we found over yelp. All the other places we've been to were recommended by friends or family, but it doesn't compare to this awesome restaurant. The service is quick, the food is awesome...what more could you ask for?  Umiya is without a doubt one of the food places we always consider eating at whenever we're in town.

o3t8xLSB0jHDd6WlQL-k5A.text: Third time here :) the presentation and service is awesome!!!Our server is very attentive :) The food is great! Love the rib-eye steak. Uni is so fresh and also the oyster!! If you check in you get a free drink!!! I need to come back here more often :)

QSOnpPJ4wgr9pwvGVUF1Uw.text: Solid AYCE (All You Can Eat) sushi restaurant. Two of us shared spicy tuna roll, tempura roll, salmon nigiri, and orange blossom roll. Also ordered seaweed salad, edamame, and miso ramen. Finished off with red bean ice cream. Fast, attentive service. Portions were reasonable and balanced (decent sized pieces of sushi that weren't overwhelmed by gigantic portions of rice).   Best sushi I ever had? No. But the food was good and overall excellent value compared to the overhyped overpriced establishments on the strip. Definitely worth the trek for a $20 lunch/$25 dinner. Uber from Umiya to The Wynn was $9.

8qlsiLiTsUwSBGIAwdcMqA.text: One of the best sushi places in town with great workers and staff. Really good selection and lots to try.

2FxU1OrvTd6aR0ksXw3fjw.text: Umiya! Umm yeah!!  This is my favorite AYCE sushi place. Whenever I'm in Vegas we have to make our stop at Umiya.  My usual order starts out by avoiding the rice rolls and get: *All the specials  *tuna poke  *agadashi tofu  *oyster (one per person) *$15 Asahi pitcher *$7 large Cole sake  *Everything else after that is actually really good too.   Also good: *Orange blossom roll  Don't worry about the rolls, you can order Half rolls++  *****always 5 stars for service!

E0jqQjyBb99cMUli5N3vXg.text: One of the best AYCE experiences in Vegas. They have great service despite the fact they operate as an AYCE place. Their drinks were delicious and would definitely take the wait staff's recommendations for their most popular rolls.

2IhVlso3tboEAprklV5uGA.text: We came here for AYCE sushi. It was a good decision! First, I liked the vibe. The place is spacious and hip.  You order what you want from the AYCE menu. I would highly recommend the tuna poke and the seared tuna. Each person is only limited to one, but it was delicious! The nigiri was also pretty good. I personally liked the scallops one. It was definitely a great deal for everyone at the table, and I was really impressed by the quality of sushi for AYCE. It's not the most amazing fish that I've ever tried, but given that it's AYCE, it was pretty good.  The things I would not recommend are the oyster and ice cream. My friends said the oysters did not taste fresh, and I didn't even try because it didn't seem particularly appetizing. My ice cream had freezer burn, so that was disappointing as well.  Overall, we had a good experience, and it was so worth it!

bcl4CktCcJDzUBDhN5Z-7g.text: The Skinny: came on a Tuesday... after having a 2 star meal experienced the bathroom Olympics with the hubs. Avoid! (1) service: slightly zealous server who wanted to know what we wanted right away(3) Value: there is no real positive value when your head is in the toilet (0)  Okay, it was my fault. After being without sushi for 3 months, I had a big craving. So after looking at the reviews online we settled at this place for lunch.  We came for lunch to check things out. We were kind of leery about making a huge commitment to ordering the AYCE option. First of all, we weren't that hungry and we had a Yelp event planned later in the evening. Secondly, the AYCE menu is $21 for lunch, consisted largely of carb heavy rolls and cooked items which didn't really appeal to us (there is no sashimi on the AYCE menu).  Our server was slightly overly attentive to the point where she was checking every 2-3 minutes of us getting seated to put in our order.  We ended up ordering 2 lunch specials. I got the sushi combo which comes with 4 pieces of nigiri and a choice of spicy tuna or California roll plus miso soup. ($10.95)The hubs got the bento box with a spicy tuna roll, tempura, salad and miso soup.($9.95)  Our food came out suspiciously fast - like definitely not in a good way kind of fast. Like literally within 5 minutes of getting our soup.   The miso soup tasted like bilge water. The little tofu swimming in there looked like the dehydrated stuff you reconstitute from the small miso soup packets.  My sushi combo was supposed to be salmon, red snapper, tuna. The fish tasted very ummm...fishy in an unpleasant way with a slightly mushier texture than expected for sushi grade product. The rice was not seasoned well and was too firm. The maki spicy tuna roll incorporated way too much hot sauce so it suspiciously masked whatever flavor of fish that was in there. More on that later.  The hubs experience with his spicy tuna roll was the same as mine above. His tempura was overly battered and thick. The salad was a tad sweet but was otherwise okay.  Overall, at that point we were thinking 2 starred joint. Nothing too offensive, but not great either. Definitely not a repeat experience. We figured hey! it was only like a $10 meal per person and didn't set us back too much.  That is until we got home and the vomiting began.   How I heaved into my toilet! Betwixt me and my beloved hubby, we were out for the count. We were totally bummed that we had to miss out on a Yelp event due to the the food poisoning.  At the time of writing this review, the bile is still rising in my throat from the thought of what I ate for lunch. Deep down, I think perhaps the spicy tuna is the culprit as it was the only common denominator for my hubs and I.  So for that, Umiya, you've joined my +1club.

s_Kkz9lTsMfiCCGOmfEi3A.text: I eat sushi allllll the time. And for ALL YOU CAN EAT, Umiya is the best! I go here at least once a month after trying so many sushi restaurants. My favorite thing about sushi is the nigiri. Umiya's nigiri is very fresh and so worth the cost of ayce. My favorite nigiri here are unagi, salmon, giant clam, yellowtail, halibut, garlic tuna, and sweet shrimp. I'm not much of a roll eater, but I highly recommend the Rattle Snake Roll and the Touchdown Roll. Best of all, mochi ice cream is included in ayce, so many sushi restaurants don't. Overall, this is my favorite sushi restaurant for ayce!  I also threw a birthday party here once and they brought out a plate with ice cream and mochi decorated with whipped cream and caramel syrup and it was so nice of them. The waiter passed around sake and beer throughout my table and all the waiters and sushi chefs joined us as well. It was just one fun experience!

-53SdiTjcY_zxajjIoA0fQ.text: Sorry, I usually give easy 4 and 5 stars, but the rice was really hard and tasted like the sushi in the market refrigerator. Either I was really unlucky today or they bought their yelp reviews. :/

nbiEP7wimpzA6UEMhLGqeg.text: I will not be returning to this restaurant. I came in with a friend after his date ditched him. I said lets go to where his date wanted to go. We tried the all you can eat dinner menu.  First off, their menu is highly incorrect. I asked for seared salmon. Both times it was taken out and guess what...???? It wasn't even seared. Seared salmon is torched and becomes a light pink. Each time the "seared salmon" came out it was raw. After explaining to the waiter that this is not seared for the third time, he never returned to the table. I don't believe that's how the customer service industry works. It took over 30 mins for someone to bring us our bill. My date had to get up 2x to ask for the check. If he didn't get up, how long would it have taken? Hmmm.... The food was so so. Tempura calamari, I would not recommend. Crispy rice with spicy tuna was alright, not the best. Chicken skewer tasted like a McDonald's chicken nugget. Enjoyed my miso soup, and cucumber salad, which explains the sushi was not good or fresh tasting.  I was so hungry after leaving this place I went to another restaurant to get to-go. I highly regret going here. 1 star!!!

bMah8QXHu6SJVCWyAWBBNA.text: Best all you can eat sushi in Vegas BY FAR! Service was great, rolls were amazing and for $20.95 for lunch you can't beat it! Our newest favorite hidden gem in Vegas! Can't believe we hadn't heard of this place before! definitely recommending to everyone I know!

nJ96CCfpDDhvZvSERICVHA.text: I have lived in Vegas about a year and a half and this is a wonderful AYCE sushi joint.  Huge selection and everything is fresh and served how you want it and nicely displayed by expert sushi artist chefs. I have been to this place like every couple months for a treat and to bring company visiting town.  Everyone is friendly and the price is about $25 for AYCE per person which is very reasonable.  They also seem to have a full bar and some fancy non alcoholic drinks.  With so many sushi places in Las Vegas we keep coming back here.  I won't give names but it is much better than a sushi place on the strip that if you ordered what you ate their it would be five times the price and not close to as good.  This place is close to the strip but maybe a half hour from where I live however it is well worth the trip!

zb4NwnYvMhzDpI-t8lJueg.text: We wanted all you can eat sushi at 3:00 p.m. and this was the only place open on a Saturday afternoon. We took a taxi from our hotel and it was the best food we had all weekend. Off the strip but well worth the trouble. Highly recommend.

The food was great, the atmosphere was good, it started to get crowded by 6pm on a Wednesday. They need to somehow accommodate the customers who are already there and were not ready to leave.  I wanted to give this place 1 star but the food was good and staff did hustle. Wish we were not asked to leave.

4xWOaS0EYy92F-AW13alzg.text: While waiting on my massage appointment I found Umiya Sushi; they have a great variety of rolls including baked rolls for the people that do not like raw. To my surprise they offer an all you can eat option for a very reasonable price, and you can eat as much as you can for 90 mins. Be mindful that they will charge you for anything you do not consume but if you're a foodie like me you know how to pace yourself lol. No pics were taken just because I ate everything before I could capture it.

yrCEpNZ2IWEITC52L-Olpw.text: They have an all you can eat option that is truly worth going there for. This place is a local favorite and I am so glad we have friends in LV that showed us this place.  The all you can eat option isn't mass produced sushi that circulates on a conveyor belt or train.  It's all made on demand when you order it.  I really love the place for this.  The sushi is good but not phenomenal.  I have had better sushi but for the price and being in America and not being just crazy expensive this place is a place I do go out of the way to go to when I'm in LV.

4zJ-_U66DvWdqPaN4yLmuA.text: My family was coming in to town for Christmas, and we decided to have dinner here on Christmas Day. We made a reservation a few weeks in advance.  The interior was very modern, with bench-style seating and pop music videos playing from screens on the wall. It was also definitely on the noisier (but lively) side in terms of atmosphere.  The restaurant was VERY busy that night, and they almost gave up our table (they will only hold for 15 minutes after your reservation time, and your whole party must be present to be seated). Service was friendly, but I don't think food came quite as fast as some other Yelpers have been mentioning in their reviews. In particular, any hot kitchen items (e.g. that required deep-frying or baking) seemed to take a particularly long time to prepare. They also ran out of some "dinner only" items such as uni and even agedashi tofu at one point, which is kind of silly since it was only 7PM and the restaurant is open until 2AM. In addition, the lunch and dinner menus are essentially the same, so to charge several dollars more per person for dinner without having all the dinner items in stock is a bit unfair.  Overall, the food was very tasty, and the menu is extensive. Like another Yelper mentioned, I think they shine more in the appetizer/non-rolls area, as the sushi rolls were not particularly special/memorable.   They didn't strictly enforce the 90-minute time limit, but did start trying to nudge us along after that time passed (given that there were people waiting for tables). One of the managers wanted to give us the check, but we said we were still waiting for some dessert items. In addition, my mom's boyfriend ended up proposing to her during this meal. That same manager was very honest though, as he came back to explain that they had already added an 18% gratuity since we were a large group and the payer had inadvertently tipped based on the post-gratuity amount.  My aunt and uncle were griping about how this was a Korean-owned Japanese restaurant, but at this point, I'm used to it. There are a ton of Korean-owned Japanese restaurants in many different states, and while they are usually not 100% authentic, they still serve up decent food.  Oh, and if you don't want to opt for all-you-can-eat, there is a regular menu too/you can always order a la carte. However, it is really easy to spend the same amount as AYCE, so you might as well choose AYCE unless you just aren't that hungry.  P.S. Don't forget to utilize the call buttons on the table! We forget they were there.

ea0gprSphLrUuBmaOO0A3Q.text: I was in the process of trying (please note, TRYING) to find something I actually liked at this restaurant (chewy nigiri, stinky old-smelling fish, rice that was hard from sitting out too long) when I saw a lady, who turned out to be the manager, walk over to a customer who was DISCREETLY breastfeeding her baby and drape a black napkin over his face...without even saying a word to the mother or indicating what she was about to do!! Seriously, WTF???? She was WHOLLY unapologetic and displayed an absolutely despicable attitude saying it was the policy of the restaurant that allowed her to do that. We immediately got up and left after paying entirely too much money for crappy food. I will not be back here....the food was horrible enough without being made worse by unacceptable bullsh*t like that!

lXh_UbdoOGDHGxDZUF0O7w.text: OMG THE GRILLED SQUID!!!  Ok so I came here again but this time to try their entrees and appetizers since I already know that their sushi is extremely fresh and yummy! I ordered grilled squid because I've been looking for a place that has it and cooks it's well. I also ordered their beef teriyaki entree! THE GRILLED SQUID WAS GRILLED TO PERFECTION I swear, it was soooo good and it's pretty big! The beef teriyaki was delicious too!!! I know I sound like I'm exaggerating but it's not my fault that it's so good?! It's actually really really good. I like my beef teriyaki super sweet so it hit the spot for me.   I got all of this to go so the fact that I'm raving about this at home even after it sat in the car on the way home a bit should tell you guys that it's just perfect. I loooooveee this place man! The consistency of ordering anything here and all of it being so good is what makes this place 100/10!

O53KYAKCcWDKr5pGYzfYDw.text: Lots of places to choose from but we ended up here to the "all you can eat" sushi in LV.    This place had a lot of highs and a lot of lows.   After everything was said and done, we left with mixed reviews.      The good:   The fried soft shell crab.  Excellent!  Get it! The oysters.  Fresh shucked and tasty!  Ordered as many as we could.     The ok: Udon noodles.  Meh.    The bad: The fish......  Ugh.   Metallic tasting and not fresh.  Bad after taste.  The onions were not fresh, dried and dehydrated in the rolls.    The really bad: The soups.  Tonkatsu ramen was terrible.   Tasted nothing like tonkatsu and didn't eat it.   The miso soup was even worse.  Watered down to the point it was not edible.  Almost refused it but decided to just not eat it.     Overall the highs and lows will prove to be enough to not eat here.   It was not quality at all as far as fish goes.     Customer service was fast, courteous and friendly.    Eat at your own risk.    Not recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tonkatsu ramen.... Did not eat it.  Did not taste like pork tonkatsu.
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso... Not edible
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork belly.   Nothing special

7TK-iJ_ayALNrkNYQCLmrg.text: One of the best all you can eat sushi buffet I've been luvittt!!Definitely I will come back and recommend this place. The place is clean and staff very friendly, nice and attentive. Serving size can be order in half or full which no waste of food and money. I love pretty much what I've order from the appetizers to the main course. They have a variety of selections and so overwhelming didn't get to try a lot what's in the menu . I tried some bake mussels and it's pretty darn good. I can't even remember all the sushi roll I've order aside from the classic one's like dragon rolls. This is one of my best place to go!!

egH9Mer7Dgi6a65m7f-MFA.text: How this place could have any less than 5 stars is beyond me. The food was absolutely amazing, it shifted my whole perspective on sushi. They used warm rice with their nigiri which was revolutionary for me. The speed of service was unbeatable being that we sat at the bar and the workers behind the counter were tentative. 6 stars.

MirxW-qFZxD920b0IY0_Hw.text: The goto sushi spot for me!  If you haven't gone here it's great!  Went for my birthday as well which was a huge group and they were easily able to fit us!

rkJQOkxAsKm9nFNpFiRLjw.text: Just ate here for dinner and felt like the least I could do for this place was give them a 5 star rating as I'm sure they couldn't have possibly made any money off of us from the all you can eat that I just demolished for $26 per person. Ordered pretty much one of every item that was designated as limit of 1 per person for dinner rate which was a little over a dozen dishes including the daily specials. Ate all of it and then some. Tried to avoid the rolls and nigiri that have a lot of rice. Was highly impressed at the speed and quality of all the food. It probably helped that we came around 4:30 pm for dinner. Definitely on my list to hit up whenever I'm back in Vegas. Make sure to leave a generous tip if you're a fat pig that eats a lot like me.

H6PgaQZ-_fidt3oSSgcD6A.text: Soooo good and great service. The all you can eat is definitely worth it and wont disappoint. Probably had about 10+orders of the pork belly. It was so delicious! Will probably come here every time I'm in Vegas.

uFXvtcCCdSYvEz-jbC51JA.text: This is the most amazing AYCE Japanese restaurant I've ever been to! The menu includes fancy items such as soft shell crabs, uni, oyster and etc. There is a limit on 1 per person which is reasonable. The quality and plating of the food was also super nice.  Will definitely come back the next time I am in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Nv6NqezjOWg7-BYpF5gKWw.text: I just found a hair in my crab salad after eating so much. I instantly felt sick to my stomach and want to throw up. These waitresses carrying the food to the tables are not wearing their hair securely just whippin all over the place. Kitchen workers in the back as well al in "messy buns" very unprofessional and not to mention I'm pregnant and was very cautious of ordering raw stuff to only find out I could of possibly consumed human hair. Won't be coming back here again. First and last time.

Aix14vB6OK218_r4d6_AXQ.text: Make sure you book a reservation during the weekends! Everything is so fresh and the way everyone works together is so professional. This is my regular sushi place to go to. Best place I've been so far. Love you Umiya!!

riOxeuM-pQLidz7lY6zpkQ.text: Great sushi, great prices, great service what else could you ask for. Definitely should try the orange blossom roll and the crazy boy roll.

3zFfRVANcL5ks7BPRYWFzg.text: LOVE this AYCE sushi place! Just went with my best friend & it was our first time. We love nigiri & theirs is pretty fresh. Very attentive waiters/waitresses & they actually wait until you're somewhat finished before serving your other dishes.   Overall very good! I highly recommend them for all those AYCE lovers out there.

72kzCYvuARMBFdK5yd0R1w.text: My friends and I came here one night when the AYCE sushi place we used to go had a wait, so we decided there was no shortage of sushi places to try and yelped and found this one.  AND I'M SO GLAD WE DID!!   This is one of the best AYCE sushi places in Vegas with great prices.  The fish here is always fresh and the service is not bad.  Also, the variety that you get on the menu is unbeatable.  Although there are some items that are only one per person, it is still worth it.  I don't go to Vegas often, but when I do, I'll be sure to return here!

NctwyImtLOR7G1Sm6w1ROw.text: I honestly just want to say that this is our new GO TO spot when we are in town. Our server was Ron and he did and amazing job. Food was fast and thought it was fast, the food was GOOOD! I hope you stop by to eat here. Enjoy! Our fave plate was the seared tuna!!!

B_RtDEtJFwTGDFy4FxPfWA.text: This may be the worst sushi I've ever had.  We stupidly decided to stop here to get a small amount of sushi to hold us over until a late dinner.  The California rolls were hot and gooey, the avocado was dark brown, it smelled horrible.  The tuna had a metallic, terrible taste.  I didn't venture any further after eating those two pieces.

56upp1wppJHCC_V_tCD3Uw.text: amazing.   the rolls and the nigri come out fast and are delicious  they have other offerings on their AYCE menu such as bacon-scallop skewers, small cuts of ribeye, oysters (2 per person) udon noode soup, miso soup among many others  they do have an obscure waiting list.. they tell you much more time than you actually have to wait.   it's worth it.. i consider this place much better than its competition of goyemon, kaya and jjanga  this is an elite ayce experience

Z0NRRa8dDRWMrvaFB1Ctig.text: I like this AYCE   It is now our must stop place in Vegas.  Service has been good every time.

yl3Xf69QYYGK6Zc9zl42RA.text: Had the spicy edamame, the screamo salad, and the katsu roll washed down with a Sapporo. Everything was delicious! This is a great place to bring a group of people. They do an all u can eat sushi deal for $25! It's open til 2am so it's perfect for parties or a nightcap.

hjjNSfw3L4ZCGnwf-LLfSw.text: Yelped sushi restaurants and found this awesome place. Went there thinking we were going to spend at least a bill for lunch but to my husband and my surprise it was all you can eat. Coming from Hawaii but currently living in Utah, we were craving fresh fish and usually all you can eat sushi isn't never good but Umiya is phenomenal. Fresh and wide variety of rolls and nigiri, appetizers and cooked dishes for a super deal of less than $21 per person at lunch. We leave tomorrow back to Utah and we are dining there again for lunch tomorrow. Service was good and fast even when it was packed with a line out the door.

s0XwuSK0GjVOX_RrJ8wcgg.text: Best sushi in town. We  keep coming back here. The sushi nigiri are the best. Highly recommended for all sushi lover very friendly and fast service.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh nigiri.

6E7yt0sADMkKdBTf95na8Q.text: I decided to try this place on the suggestion of my boyfriend. We've both never been, but he wanted to try it after a somewhat disappointing sushi experience on The Strip. This place is delicious! They have all you can eat for $25 for dinner and the menu didn't disappoint. It was a little busy, but we just sat at the bar and still got great service.   I recommend the salsa dancing roll. They're nigiri is real good too.

qF3zLm7TYF3iLfHkKrR2Fg.text: What an awesome place. Everything g we ordered was delicious. Th e service was crazy fast. At one point our table was totally full of plates. A great experience. Don't miss out!

n0Yeh95691SFbf7O--zX_A.text: I would have to crown Umiya as the AYCE sushi joint in Vegas.  Why?  Sushi Nigri is excellent, sweet shrimp included, oysters, sea urchin, fresh sushi, soft shell crab and shrimp tempura.  The only negative is that the rolls are very average. There strength is in there nigiri and sashimi and soft shell crab.

NwT3FQJ8IRc_tnbIS9H0WA.text: Learned now I am allergic to soy, so it makes sushi difficult and not as fun! Soy & gluten allergies together makes for eating cardboard!, however Alex & Ryan are making me a special roll based on my allergies and some ingredients I would love to have! These guys are just amazing!!!! AMAZING! Been having them roll sushi for me for almost ten years now, and SOOOOO FITTING they have their own place!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King crab, tuna/salmon, asparagus, Japanese veggie Oba, Kiyate (lettuce bean sprout), white radish, &amp; orange lemon mango caviar.

-zUsHqN7CzIWf5uWIy0rVA.text: Best sushi place in town! And the prices are not too bad. If you are a fan of oysters and nigiri, try their lunch or dinner buffet. I love everything in this restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s always a feast when you are at Umiya. Dinner buffet all you can eat nigiri, appetizers, rolls and many more only for $30!

lNmt_C5iDIsVNyc6S-fmvg.text: Rice was cold and hard. Like my overall experience last night. I have eaten at this restaurant many times, yet last night they were trying to rush you through. I will never go back

76WhybFXqHswL5lAZ-ERlA.text: Great staff!  Super attentive.  Awesome selection.  I let them order for me on the AYCE menu, food was prompt and the selection was SWEET!  I'll be back every night while I'm here at he Palms hotel.  If you are in the area don't miss this gem.

O4ni7KCuFLPNaY30dXP07A.text: Pretty happy with this place. We went with a friend that knows one of the chef so they asked us what types of fish we like & they made us special dishes with our favorite fishes.  Food came out quickly & service was great too. Have been back here a few times & can't say too much bad about this place.

cl90Yy1I09lHgUSLHG40NQ.text: Couldn't stay away. Third time here and I'm even more impressed than the first time.   The service was impeccable. Both the servers were attentive, prompt, and didn't miss a thing. Food was out quickly and no mistakes!  Do not miss getting the Screaming O or the AJ seared tuna. It's amazing. The AYCE menu can hurt you, so pace yourself and save room for dessert.

1gFl076IBVDYe5HXeaYNdw.text: Great food! AYCE  Japanese for $20 is unbeatable! This includes sushi rolls. Free parking outside too. If you do a Yelp check in, you can get a free soda. Crab salad with jalapeno and avocado was my favorite. Another favorite is the soft shell crab and oysters.

APTNq6va7IHcPi35ifeE5Q.text: So I came here with my friend over the weekend. After looking at their menu, I proceeded to ask if they were affiliated with Sumo Sushi and the waitress said yes.   The environment was lovely and just love all the bench seating. The service was great until after we got our desserts. No refilling of water and they weren't anywhere to be found.   The food was okay, nothing great. They made their rolls really weird is all I can say. For instance, philly roll, instead of putting everything inside the roll like its suppose to be, the salmon was on top and it just made it taste a bit off. Their poke tasted pretty horrible. It didn't seem like nice big chunk of smooth tuna, instead it was grainy like. The hand roll was just filled with rice, just way too much.  Overall, I didn't enjoy myself. I definitely would not be coming back at all. I prefer Sumo Sushi I/II instead.

p_QQBvvIn7dhCQhMbG8vfg.text: Great food and service!  Can't believe all you can get on the ayce menu.  And everything is made on the spot, not pre-made.

7lTkOMKBFs3OoEpeoNjmWQ.text: This place is so awesome! The service is great and the food is so on point! I truly recommend this spot it's delish!

XKkxKfPSYxy4B-PdOiNhQg.text: My favorite sushi place to come to while in Vegas! Everyone is constantly checking on you and asking if you want to order anything else. It's open late night and it's all you can eat sushi for a really cheap price! The workers their are all friendly and nice, definitely someplace everyone should go to!

OcXRXpq8bgZdk5GUYogMxg.text: I've been to about 10 (give or take) different sushi places around Las Vegas and this is my favorite AYCE so far.  Sushi chefs are good and they are very friendly and fun to joke around with.   They have sports playing on the tv's at the bar and on the larger screen they have asian music videos playing.  I think if this place was on Spring Mtn., they would be packed. Umiya is a hidden gem!

1jE04ul3qQH3sbjiwV1cJw.text: My favorite sushi place in Vegas. Why? Excellent food, service and kick A$$ music videos playing!!

Z-Xgyi72xcLrorokxXLKww.text: Wonderfully deliciously awesome!!!!! Dropped in for lunch and coworking, and got in before the lunch rush in case there's one of those on a weekday.   I had the most excellent and memorable bento box special that I've ever had - the pre-meal miso soup was well paced, like a minute after I ordered, a dramatic pause, then the main course bento box came rolling out. There are actually 8 types of bento boxes, and I got the 4-piece sushi & chicken teriyaki.   What made this bento box the bestest was the chicken teriyaki specially prepared with artfully cut carrots, zucchini, mushroom, broccoli, onions, in a savory sauce. And the tempura had 5 or 6 pieces, usual fare plus a bonus gyoza! Salad and sushi were very good, no extra descriptive words necessary. Very enjoyable all around, and the waitress checked on how I was doing 5 or 6 times, very kind and attentive.   The decor and ambiance neatly minimalistic with wooden tables and benches, sushi bar, and 2 side box rooms for a little more privacy. And with a Starbucks next door, the wifi signal is strong enough for me to hangout here a bit longer and cowork. Sweetness!

gYGsuTVKascSyeap-q0Lcw.text: Food was amazing! I'm from California and I've yet to find a great ayce around my area in oc. So I got excited when a friend recommended this place to me. It didn't disappoint.

C_tQbDX12zVcpYbfaKiwWA.text: This place is so busy yet we got our food on time. The customer service here is awesome! We didn't get ignored and all workers made sure we enjoyed our food and that everything's okay. Thank you Umiya for having such great, happy and fast workers!

YIe_Fa8ms4qsHC0u1bqlaQ.text: Love this place! It's is really yummy and perfect service here! Great time for a huge group too!

fKgSIku0cKj_bI97NcgQNg.text: My husband and I have been here so much they essentially know our order. Almost every single person on the staff has been so kind to us every visit. Their food is phenomenal and quick. There is nothing bad we could say about this place.

EEWTPPusqL3nF3Y3ogdIoA.text: Great sushi place if you're in Vegas. Good price and all you can eat for a reasonable price. A must see place to go. The sushi is excellent and so is the steak. Great service as well. Great ambience and waitresses.

vR16nQfV-2USDnKWbkaYYA.text: Our umiya experience was delightful. I had the vegetarian options and couldn't have been happier. The place is located off the strip across from Palms Place. But don't be fooled, it's worth dropping in on if your in the neighborhood. Prices are fair, and the staff is super nice. Clean inside and always busy. We will be back again!

jRB4aYoUpc5CPD7qJ56kMQ.text: All you can eat sushi 20.95 great deal!  Varied AYCE menu including lots of rolls.  Rury was very attentive and the service was excellent from the entire staff.  Will definitely be back!!

bnVqcBtuyhK8rVV3d1pmaw.text: All you can eat sushi $20.95 for lunch. Everything we ordered was fresh and tasty. Delicious! Definitely coming back again!

gmxdYxDMn86wvsm5KI7--w.text: This is the first time to come here. My friend very recommended. Good place for Sushi in Las Vegas. Fresh food~ nice service. No doubt. Highly recommended.

j5f6WWH7hsfBTEoSrc92-g.text: I love this place. I've been coming here a while because they have a diverse AYCE selection, fairly affordable for AYCE and is always fresh! I've never gotten food poisoning from here and I've eaten here a lot of times. Every time has been consistently delicious and inviting and the staff is great.  One reason to come: Tuna sashimi in AJ sauce! The only complaint is you can only order it once and only during dinner, but it's definitely the reason I come back and I savor each bite! Also they have really fresh oysters!

9tFIeD5nbEiK5l2FasEhnQ.text: great variety on the menu. Service was quick and friendly. Brought our friends here for their first time and they love it!! Hint: Check in on Yelp for a free soda.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea urchin sushi
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our awesome friends w their cute daughters
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi!

8NJqt1X8RjAsKb2DH65fag.text: This place is so awesome! We found it on Yelp and decided to try something off the strip, since we always find food on the strip is too expensive for what it is. Just ignore the a la carte menu and go straight for the all you can eat deal. It's really cool because you can order small plates of anything on that menu - we had like 12 different kinds of sushi and many different appetizers and it was only $50 for two people. We could have easily spent that on a couple of rolls and apps. The service was great. All of the servers and guys at the sushi bar were attentive and fulfilled our requests quickly. We'll be back the next time we're in Vegas!!

FF1iCEy4Md30urWYl1KlUA.text: Although I don't consider myself an absolute expert on sushi, I do appreciate variety & quality coupled with decent prices. My wife and I greatly enjoyed this place. The variety of offerings in the AYCE menu was good and the freshness of the seafood was outstanding on the day we went there. My wife, not being a fan of sushi, had the the gyoza & BBQ'd short ribs and she raved about them. The servers were attentive w/o being overbearing. The only criticisms (very minor) that I have were: the lame looking wooden picnic-styled benches and the 90 minute time limit for the AYCE, but then I was easily able to eat my fill in one hour anyway. Finally, the fact that we saw many happy Japanese patrons during our time at Umiya was quite comforting.  I can't wait to return!

MsI5ytS0WTdD8FacQw6J9Q.text: Wow! I haven't been here in awhile but the all the staff is friendly!! The meal was amazing and Ashley was a great hostess, thank you UMIYA for a great dinner experience ... :)

1pZrIZV3aBgg8qSs08HT5g.text: Another sushi restaurant in a city of plenty.  Umiya is located right next to Starbucks in a plaza off of Flamingo and Arville. It's a very nicely decorated sushi spot definitely the nicest, 5 star for just that.   They offer a large AYCE menu of sushi and non-sushi items with a few items that you can only order one order of, as many other sushi restaurants do. Order the items that you can only order one order of and on chef's special menu first, just to get them out of the way.  They have a pork belly that could maybe rival Goyemon, maybe, I don't remember how Goyemon pork belly taste like again I need to go again soon. It's 3 delicious thinly sliced pieces of pork belly in a sauce that just melts in your mouth.  I made the mistake of sharing once, never again all mine.  They serve a fried soft shelled crab which was heavily battered which wasn't my favorite but it could be with less batter. Their baby octopus are very delicious. Their nigiris and hand rolls aren't that bad too.  Their beef was very good.  Oysters fried and not fried, poke salad, specialty rolls, deep fried tempura rolls, shrimp tempura, uni, everything you usually expect from a sushi spot they probably had it.  Drinks aren't included in the AYCE sushi price you pay extra, soft drinks were extra $2 but refill are included.  Also they no longer have AYCD on for extra $10 its something like buy 2 get the 3rd free for certain drinks. Know you limits when drinking they probably won't kick you out for being a drunken mess but it annoys everyone elses who are trying to have a nice meal with family and friends, especially if there in another party.  As always when going to a sushi restaurant sit at the bar right infront of the sushi chefs, you'll get food faster and chefs are usually pretty cool guys. Customer service was great but once if got busy they had a hard time keeping up with food and drink orders. Try not going when busy but if your patient enough like I am go whenever you feel like sushi.   Their prices are average, sushi quality and selection good, but probably won't replace any of my top 5 but top 10 in Vegas sure.

FRV8UGd0ceFsQrwSBV5EFQ.text: Great tasting food. Their menu is also much better compared to most AYCE sushi places because there are more to select besides sushi. With their menu, I think they have the price to beat for AYCE sushi.   The service, however, is very very bad (hence, just 4 stars). Their female servers would just place all of your orders in all table while whispering what they are in a way that almost no one can hear and do not even bother to place them close to the person who actually ordered that particular food.

NUXifzkFZ94Dfxb6NAiMvg.text: I will NEVER recommend this place to anyone.  The only thing good about this restaurant is the service and the speed of it.  The food on the other hand is the WORST sushi I have ever had.  I read the reviews and thought it would be nice to try a new spot, what an awful waste of a day off.  I'm sorry to rip into this place, but I hope they read this. The oysters (which are my favorite thing to eat) were so bad I couldn't eat more than one.  It tasted so fishy and awful compared to the number of oysters I've had in my life.  The yellowfin tuna was like dull brown yellow with a fishy taste as well.  We were told if we didn't finish food from our all you can eat that we would be charged. Never have I ever left food because I didn't like it, until last night.  Soho blows this place away on a whole new level.  If you want a descent priced all you can eat sushi, I recommend GOYMON, and it's not that far.  Goymon's service sucks but the food at least taste better. If you want sushi that actually taste like SUSHI and FRESH fish go to SOHO, the M, Naked FISH, anywhere but this place.

dSsa5lc0DJsc6Hlj2_CfsA.text: ****DO NOT EVER GO HERE**** I don't care how good the pictures look or how many good reviews it has. We ate here Friday night, April 24, 2015 and I am extremely SICK. I've been in the bathroom expelling for 2 days. The fish was old and under temperature. This restaurant is FILTHY AND NEEDS TO BE SHUT DOWN.  I've read some other reviewers who've experienced the same as me!!! STAY AWAY!!!!!!!

4iHALZdLd9jD1Q0NIeQwHA.text: love love this place, great and fresh sushi, great Service. Never disappointed at thud restaurant!!!

KAcNn09HZESPuq7JIhDWPQ.text: Can't express how impressed I was with the tiny amount of rice, amazing service and the quality of fish. I was expecting just another sushi restaurant but boy, was I wrong. The chef gave us some special sushi that wasn't on the menu, which was simply amazing. We were the few people there so I think the chef felt trigger-happy to shoot us a few special dishes. I'm not complaining.  Also, I'm not a huge roll fan but I have to say they use very little sauce and it actually compliments the sushi nicely. The ribeye steak was great. The nigiri is fresh and served with very little rice. I would like to revisit Umiya again and focus more on the nigiri but the rolls and special dishes were simply too good for me to leave room for anything else. But from the tuna, yellowtail and shrimp nigiri I ate I could say it was great. Cheers that Kaizen is out and Umiya is in. Looking forward to my next visit.

FWpaUqVOYy8Rcf_zVMYn7Q.text: The sushi quality was decent but the service was TRASH. I had AYCE and paid the full amount - so I expected to eat all I could eat. Although it seemed like every time I wanted to order another round, the waitresses were PISSED. As if they wanted us to stop eating. Definitely NOT coming back here again because I'm a huge fan of great customer service. It really ruins the mood of the night.

w5Z7UMM33bLnYLotQiHrBA.text: Orange Blossom was a taste of heaven! The service is super attentive and extremely friendly. Price matches quality. Love this place!

qbP6cOnJHTpqe0PIhcDziA.text: This place gave me the worst food poisoning I have ever experienced. So much so that I spent the next day vomiting and making repeated trips to the bathroom and the next night at the ER with body aches and a 103 degree fever. I eat sushi often and this was the first time I got sick from it, something is not right with their fish...

PLkAPaRgorwlUbGlygsL0Q.text: No more All You Can Drink offered. Sadness!!!  The selection was slightly limited for AYCE. There was an extra charge for fresh wasabi. They were out of scallops and oysters. The quality was decent for all you can eat. The nigiri was on smaller side but proportional in terms of fish to rice.  Dynamite was overpowered with cheese.  Service was decent. It was an average experience, at most. Goyemon still the AYCE of choice in Vegas.

RTvZpiodqw-eaZ3ZbCzyLQ.text: The quality of sushi you get for all you can eat at a $25 dinner price tag is superb. To say the service is prompt would be an understatement. Sushi chefs are all really cool guys. The entire menu is included in all you can eat. The atmosphere and decor is modern and has a great vibe. I honestly don't what else you could ask for. Love this place!

jawvjzq4kWFXBmGsywoY5A.text: Very tasty food, some items are very unique compare to the other sushi buffet I have been too. Some items are limited to one per person, but I would prefer this then they lower the quality to match the cost. Definitely worth a visit.

3SC1aBu3WX7ER2D8tZRblw.text: Had a great dinner there with some sweetest people. Fresh sushi, good service, could have been better if rolls were less rice. We left happy, and glad that we tried this restaurant out.

neLMiZF05uwiciN8GQym2g.text: Love this place! Friendly service and yummy sushi every single time I come here! Try the Tuna Naruto :)

-KNM21uVtd_Y4L18FM3XuQ.text: Excellent sushi. We had the all you can eat and it was great to have a wide variety on one seat.

sP49TimD2gPfoXpUxlnX9w.text: Excellent.  Bathroom is pretty gross; no glory holes.  Sushi is delicious...very fresh, all-you-can eat for $25.99, free pint glasses.  Definitely worth stopping-in!!!!   Free ice cream too!

zg-ubx522GeE8IATS-tPVQ.text: Great atmosphere with fantastic all you can eat sushi. Enjoyable staff bring humor and efficiency to a great dinner. Greatly recommend for good sushi and fair prices.

4fGcEAJ2MoAim5YI0GmvWA.text: This is one of the best sushi places I've been to. The service is excellent, dirty dishes and trash were whisked away promptly. My daughter loved the shrimp tempura roll. I had the Korean BBQ bento box. The short rib was cooked to perfection and full of flavor. The salad dressing was tasty and the presentation perfect. I loved the decor  and the music gave the place an extra touch.

7HxQq--GfkZcoco29zdsTw.text: Dishes came pretty slow but the taste and service were great! best value in Vegas.

gWlD2GrcJeRkMFl52d-y-g.text: I lived in California for my entire life up until about 18 months ago. It was difficult to find bad sushi in California so I was a bit spoiled when I came to Nevada. I'd try new sushi restaurants with friends who raved about the sushi and I found it to be mediocre. Not bad but not as good as the sushi I was used to in California.  I went through about 7 sushi restaurants before trying Umiya and was thrilled when I finally found it because I knew I had finally found my sushi spot in Vegas. This is the only place I go now. Staff is pretty friendly and the service is good.

5URnKEmuiK-uKwWnK-cFJg.text: Delicious date spot for lunch. We each had the "two roll lunch specials. " Tried the "snow corn roll" as well as the "orange blossom" yum!

NWJuFkiuUL5ebVV3101_kA.text: Really fast service with a great ayce menu. Dinner is $26 which is really reasonable for the quality. The fresh oysters are amazing and so are the jalapeno poppers. Will come again:)

SfrO1B-SZm4irFRFUyPAEg.text: Used to be my favorite place but not anymore , The people work there is so rude when you eat they  stand around and glance  at you check on you see if you waste the rice , when we left me and my wife have to find the restroom, you can find better food somewhere else , don't come there if you have a baby and you try to bring a baby food or doesn't matter any kind of food for the baby they won't let you in , doesn't matter if you tell them your baby have to eat if the baby not eating you guy can't eat. They say sorry you have to go cant stay there with outside food baby

rgKPPogcgcsclJT3oTjyCA.text: Great place for "all you can eat"!  Fast service.  Everything I've gotten was yummy.  Check this place out!
