p78ppA2QQA-InyN5fzPQmg.text: I have been here twice the first time was kind of rush because I only had less than an hour to eat (lunch break) therefore all four of us were rushing to eat.  The service wasn't there to help us meet the time.  Missing a lot of kitchen items we ordered.  The second time last Thursday 10/15 I returned I loved it.  The variety of sushi and many items on the dinner menu I loved for AYCE.  I don't eat much but I love their AYCE.  Anyone loves AYCE.  Or don't love AYCE try it too because the price isn't bad at all.  Give them a try!! The rolls options are there! Kitchen food and sashimi options, yum yum yum!! Uni and oyster are part of dinner deal too.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi platter, my friend  ordered.

ZCsTLas5X1A1u51Wl6ynhw.text: Best AYCE sushi in Vegas so far. Highly recommended. Great service, spacious, and clean.

LSRw1j4ZHebInnM858vdDA.text: I went here with my family for lunch and it was awesome! My reason for coming here was for their "all you can eat" sushi.  My favorites were "rattle snake" and "shrimp killer".  We ended lunch with dessert. I love their tempura vanilla ice-cream.  It was interesting because it's different.  Service was excellent! They were very quick with bringing out our order. Also, this place is kid friendly.  There was free wifi so I was able to play a show for my daughter on her iPad.  They had small cups with lids available for toddlers.

J7C9nM3D--gXOTAdfFqG-A.text: This is always one of my go-to dinner spots when I come to Las Vegas. I always order from their all-you-can-eat menu and I always leave 100% satisfied. Everyone always welcomes you when you arrive and when you leave and the service is up to par. I would definitely recommend this place if you have a big appetite and are craving a variety of sushis and Japanese foods.

-RsbS_yDgvWUmkhM136sZg.text: Terrible customer service, they do not know how to handle busy nights. Very very bad and rude customer service, employees do not know how to handle busy nights , quoted 30 min wait time waited over an hour, no problem I get it they are busy mistakes happen, but very upsetting when they seat other parties who arrived way after us and say that " it's more convenient if we seat the smaller parties first and wait for a bigger table to open instead of combining the smaller tables ". There so called "manager " aka "jay Kim " came up and started mocking my group because we where upset. There solution was to seat a group of 7 on a table that seats 4 people until we started to complain about that, then eventually after waiting and waiting where seated on a table a table that seats 7 . ( after over an hour of waiting). So sad that there food is good but the employees are terrible and very rude !!!!! Just save yourself the headache and hassle and just go to OYSHI SUSHI OR I LOVE SUSHI INSTEAD OF THIS SHITTY AS PLACE. Trust me this place has gone down the drain, and be careful of there "manager" jay Kim what a complete asshole.

2k4gVyoQq3ANvcccPPVigw.text: If you love spicy mayo and a shitton of sauce all over your sushi, this place is for you.  The special "rolls" (and I say rolls in quotes because it comes out in two pieces) all pretty much taste the same.  Also, don't bother ordering the steak, unless you need to strength train your jaws.  The plain ol sushi is decent. But considering that this is the only thing worth eating, I'd consider this place a bit on the pricier side for what you get.  Sushi samurai says no, thank you!

VnOfcOLoJZqpU3eBfBnBTA.text: This place is seriously so AMAZING!!! I live 25 minutes away & I drive all the way over here all the time!! Best all you can eat sushi staff is so friendly & fast. Friday & Saturday's do get busy but the longest I've ever waited was like 10 Minutes!

j_HvRjiZvng3peXedMETIw.text: Competition is tough if you're looking to open a sushi joint in Vegas, not to mention an AYCE one. I've been to great places and to pretty unsatisfying ones; Umiya sits somewhere in the awkward middle, dangling towards the unsatisfying.  I'll be brief because this place was not very memorable.  The Good: Decor (Very nicely decorated, lots of space and table room) Salmon nigiri Ika Nigiri Yelp check-in = free drink  The Bad: Service (No one even looked me in the eye, let alone acted friendly, aside from the lone waitress) Yellowtail (Not horrible, but probably one of the worst I've had in Vegas) Ikura (Noticeably small and tasted kind of funky) Charge for hot tea  The Okay: Everything else we ate (all nigiri, mochi ice cream) Presentation (ex: tuna poke was haphazardly piled onto the place with seaweed salad, looked unappealing, bad cuts of fish)  Fresh oysters offered only for dinner even though it's not indicated on the menu like other dinner-only items. All specials only for dinner as well.

3pvu0Bep2lxuWUrIPwsXwQ.text: Great service from the waiters every time something most sushi places lack. The sushi is fresh , the poke and baked muscles were better than most places.  AYCE lunch $20.95 dinner $25.95

ZDvYX4VqyI6v-Db499IqUA.text: The sushi place is in sane! I think it was $25 and you got all you can eat sushi, about 30 different kinds of sushi, appetizers dessert entrees. Pretty much anything you could want

r2huo4l0ROZ_Ph8NUIreLg.text: Love this place. Does get crowded nut its worth the wait. One of the best sushis in town.

uqCZk3INNs8A2SaXLTt62Q.text: Always good sushi! Friendly service. A great selection and fair price too. I love this place!

oX2bRrUZcaH_VentPuKRoQ.text: Best place for sushi ever! Great prices (it was 20.95 for lunch and 25.95 per person for dinner), vast menu, delicious food, and great service! Our waitress was amazing! She patiently answered all our questions and was quick to serve and come back so we could order again. Full five stars and my new favorite place to eat!

n4sfDQUloGQW7gXG9gkZhA.text: Busy place around dinner. Suggestion is to make a reservation and even then the wait time can be horribly long. They have so muvh going on that orders are wrong. Servers dropping and spilling things. But for the buck.. Good sushi, good service.

JiTnmZWWwdaQVHkzC7Vrxg.text: Came here for AYCE sushi on a Sunday afternoon after finding it on Yelp, and was more than pleased with my meal.   The tables are big wooden picnic style tables, so not the most comfortable, but they fit the atmosphere of the restaurant. There were a lot of servers and sushi chefs working so service was quick and efficient. Everything we ordered came out so quick it was great!   The fish was fresh and the presentation great. Everything we ordered was fantastic. My only gripe is that we came shortly after 3pm so I assumed it was lunch and did not order any dinner only items. Then realized after ordering dessert that their dinner pricing starts at 3pm! What a bummer because there were specials and items that I really wanted too. Also I fee like 3pm is so early to be considered dinner :/

fH2Mvr7hiGGPBpp6L665Ig.text: Just try to bring the point that the fish/rice ratio is way off. As others said, there are places with only 1/3 of rice portion. Also, their rice is horrible. Maybe just bad luck for me. Fish are decent fresh. Service is good.  Price is decent. Rolls and izakaya is good.

i2kvKiuqkJKWusoqYdvFLA.text: Only reason this got 3 stars was because the food was good. Customer service was disappointing. Was there for about 2 hours and for one drink refill, took 20 minutes to bring out each dish. If looking for great food I would recommended but if u want the service, I would hit elsewhere

NIA4CdAM6cpJsjT4EoiXIQ.text: Goyemon has been my favorite AYCE sushi joint in town for quite a while and I've been very hesitant to try other places because I'm always disappointed when I do. However, I was really craving uni and Goyemon was all out so we decided to give Umiya a try based on all the great reviews. Now I see what I've been missing out on.   Pros: Oysters, uni, amaebi A lot of items on AYCE menu Half rolls available Dinner starts at 3pm  Cons: No salmon skin Extra 50 for quail egg Only ice cream desserts Dinner starts at 3pm  Firstly, they have quite a selection of items to order, which is great because you're likely to find a few rolls that float your boat. They also let you order half rolls, so you can try more rolls.  I mean the whole point of going to AYCE places is so you can order a lot of different things.   I love that the dinner menu starts at 3pm, because uni and the seared tuna sashimi in AJ sauce is only available for dinner. It's totally worth the extra $5 for me, but if you don't like uni, amaebi, or seared tuna sashimi, this wouldn't be a pro for you as those three items are basically the only difference between lunch and dinner. (The seared tuna sashimi in AJ sauce is so good though! I'd definitely recommend everybody to try it)  The sushi chefs and serve staff are rock stars. It was packed during my first visit and everybody was hard at work. The chefs banged out orders and didn't let a plate sit for more than a few seconds before yelling out the table number again for the servers to pick it up. We came back just a few days later (this time during the day when it was super slow) and the chefs were all busy prepping for the night. We never saw any of the employees just standing around not doing anything.

LNKf-GzNDjm4N96nkWAgSA.text: AMAZING! We came here on a Saturday night & we did have to wait 30 minutes but the hostess took my phone number and called when my table was ready. The rolls were delicious! We had the king of the ocean, kiss of fire, first kiss and red rock roll. We really could not pick which one was the best because they all tasted amazing! the service was great and everyone was super friendly. I would recommend to call and make a reservation to avoid waiting.

-AeV4ca_FDVMAWTX8TdOHg.text: High quality, delicious sushi. Easily among the best in town, plus an optional all you can eat menu that doesn't sacrifice quality means this place cannot be beaten, in my opinion.

IlNxWm0n3RS97v4aV7OtQg.text: #1 on my list when it comes to AYCE sushi!  Menu includes Udon and Ramen soup as well.

7cE_mkFGAEZwKxczjFHciw.text: Amazzzing ! My mom & i got the all you can eat sushi and it was so good and fast. It was pretty packed on a Saturday at 5:30 ish pm!

NjqNm5jMOloVp-z1ttA1WQ.text: This place is stressful. Yes, you heard that right... STRESSFUL! Read on for more...  I was really looking forward to visiting this place due to its high ratings. So, when my sushi-loving brother came to town, I decided to take  him there. Big mistake. The staff was rude, the food was rushed, and good flavors were nowhere to be found.  There was no greeting when we walked in, and all the person at the check-in desk said was "you are going to have to wait, ok?" After waiting for about 10 minutes (mind you, we had reservations), the same rude server walked us over to our table and sat us down. No interest in knowing if it was our first time, nothing... he just left. Once our waiter knew some of us were not doing AYCE, every server became obsessed wanting to know why that was the case. They repeated the AYCE no-sharing rules several times, despite everyone understanding we could not share the food.  Most dishes were wrong and bland, with the servers dropping off dishes we hadn't ordered and then running off to waiting other tables. We then had to flag down any of the servers running by to take the unwanted food away. I get they were busy, but the way the staff was literally running around and essentially plopping food on the table and leaving, made for an unnecessarily awful ambiance.  I will not be coming to back to this place. Ever.

ZjLKFdDWIPPJm3mM7Fbnag.text: This is an all-you-can-eat place not that far off the strip and is super busy. The wait staff were quite attentive however, and brought our orders quickly. The seating is somewhat uncomfortable, with rustic picnic style tables and benches. Being so busy, the noise level is also quite high. Lots of items to choose from on the all you can eat menu and it is reasonably priced. Be sure you make a reservation as we had a group of six on Wednesday night and there was a wait for those who did not have reservations. If you're in the mood for all you can eat sushi, this is a good selection, but I recommend you bring your own seat cushion.

TEbNKF6Vv6XUIjA8N3Wq1w.text: This place was a great place to.go   Recently for my last three visit for dinner, servers are now got faul mouth on them disturbing customer with their inappropriate jokes, orders are missing and taking to.long   And the worst part serving old fish specially tuna, tuna is now oxidize and not red any more like has a slimmy feel to the mouth   Its a shame restaurant like this so good doesnt hold its standard ! Spimple standards

8UtPyHDRkty_FD2IESf-Cw.text: My friend and I went here for lunch. Their all you can eat menu is extremely large with many options.   The sushi was very fresh and everything we had was up to par. I would recommend the all you can eat because it's worth your money, just don't order more then you can eat because they will charge you for what you do not finish.   Service was a little slow but I think that is to make you eat less, very nice people though.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nigiri... You must try the white tuna

xsVT3RiqLF6ZuiYwynEmIQ.text: Super bummed about this place. We got here around 530pm - not super busy and the wait staff was super attentive. We put in our order for the first round of food and it's now 701pm and we will haven't received items from the first round. About 45 minutes ago, we put in an order for a second round, and we haven't received any of that order. We've called different wait staff over during the whole time to ask where our food was and nothing ever came. Not quite sure what happened... If I had the luck of carrying cash, I would have dropped some on the table and walked out. Not sure our absence would have even been noticed.   My husband and I were so hopeful for this place. The food is to die for - if you don't mind waiting an hour an a half to get it. Unfortunately, my husband and I will never be returning. I don't even think we got our ACYE money's worth either, because we filled up on our beer while waiting for food. What a shame.

3qG6lpjwoO54g0NDNxjZHQ.text: Driving around at 3 yesterday a little hangry next to the strip, my girlfriend recommended her go to sushi place, Umiya.  Now this being the second day in a row for raw seafood, I was a little hesitant, but boy I was not disappointed.  I ordered tuna, super white tuna, fresh water eel well done, and the spicy tataki roll (inside is spicy tuna, with seared tuna, avocado, green onion and pickled onion on the outside. Dressed in hot sauce and ponzu sauce)   I have to say for ayce the rice attached to the sushi was very small compared to most ayce sushi places in Las Vegas.  The fish was very fresh and flavorful.  And with as busy as this restaurant was the food was served very quickly.  Plenty of restaurant staff to ensure speedy delivery and quick refills.  Also when you check in you get a free soda.   A must go to when on this side of town.

PLhr2_5x86GBFKDcPzXYvQ.text: For an AYCE spot for sushi this is my go to spot. For the usual price of around $21 for lunch and $26 a person for dinner that gives you access to almost their entire menu. This place gives you quality hand rolled to order sushi, with a casual yet elegant ambience with soft lighting and modern decor, topped off with one of the best customer service in the industry! Fast premium service paired with quality fresh sushi is a perfect combination for a nice date night. $66 including tip for a date night with my lady is awesome! Highly recommended!

D8E2D9UYOkIk5oXFS0AX6A.text: ****WARNING food POISONING****  December 31st, 2015 at 4pm I walked in for all you can eat and absolutely did not appreciate my waitress's sassy attitude... After being seated she left us with the menus not asking if we wanted hot tea or water... 5 minutes later I wanted to leave once another customer opened the entrance door directly behind me I felt a cool breeze. I was at discomfort first the terrible greeting, no beverages, uncomfortable wooden chairs and negative feng shui.   As I was waiting patiently and browsing through their menu my waitress came back asking if we were ready to order. Um sure how about I start off with my free drink please. I asked for green tea she said" cold "I said "hot" she said "how about cold "so I said "okay cold" assuming that the hot green tea is free refills...   She then took down our order I got done with the first stage, went to the restroom and started throwing up. They forgot a couple of things I asked for and waited as I was receiving my second stage of order, I started to get very sore stomach ache after eating their hamachi and orange flower. I absolutely did not enjoy their sushi with any fish on it because it was NOT fresh... I should have stopped ordering knowing the fact my stomach was sore. Went to the restroom again then came back to my table and I'm not even half way done with my cold green tea she asked "would you like a refill" I said "actually may I get hot green tea I'm not feeling very well" she said "it's extra charge but I can give to you this time because you didn't know." I said "thank you".  I Drank my hot green tea as my stomach felt alittle at ease.... I finished my third stage of order because if you don't finish all of your food it is extra charge. I just felt even worse! Very sick... I spent my New Years in the hospital the entire day and night vomiting   We all got FOOD POISONING!!!!! I am still very sick and highly do not recommend this Resturant.

They offer an large all you can eat menu but we decide to do a la carte since we weren't that hungry and we didn't want to eat too much that late. Everything we had were pretty good. Would definitely come back during our next trip to Vegas when we want some sushi

0HW3d8zlAB9NvjKYQZVslg.text: Everything we had was great, and we ate a lot! We sat and the bar and the chef even made us special sushi without ordering from the menu. I definitely recommend this place.

nPI207UwZ62uXqcMT8pnmA.text: They are trying hard. And I wish them well. Fish needs to be fresher. Guess I'm spoiled living in Hawaii...

My boyfriend was really happy that we got to try Uni for the first time here (included on the AYCE menu).  The service was very nice too.  I would definitely recommend to a friend.

All she did is watch us if we are eating the rice. Well if you guys cut the fish a little thicker, I maybe can eat the entire rice of nigiri. They ruined our TGIF dinner .

eidKRh4e8x36jqBDem-Z3w.text: Best AYCE Sushi in Las Vegas. High quality and mostly everything on the menu is AYCE. Wide variety of food such as oysters, appetizers, ramen, udon, nigiri, and sushi rolls. Food comes out quickly. Ice cream including tempura ice cream included.

a-OIquvZTkfBFmRfr043Gw.text: Was told about this place from the most reliable food connoisseur I know in this town... Brad B. (his review is below).  Once he told me that he thought that this was better than the place that we normally endulge, the hubby and I knew that we had to check it out. Both times that we've been the sushi has been amazing, the staff has been extremely friendly, and most impressive, **high** quality AYCE sushi bar, which didn't exist until now. Has definitely become a top pick on our list for sushi night choices.

zeHGT0HyKezQ41IL6-VgNg.text: Excellent quality sushi for an unbelievable price. Bring your appetite because you will want to have one of everything. I felt like a regular by the time I left! A must go if in Vegas.

NakHNg8jprHUfjV9pXyFKQ.text: I liked the salmon alot, and service was really fast, the food was really tasty, and this is the best sushi place ever!!!

a0XaUt6AJADlKGer2fsybw.text: It was my first time here. I like how big the restaurant is and the unique tables. I was excited to try a new place. I heard this place was good, read some of the reviews, and was drooling over the photos! The restaurant was not that busy, our rolls came out pretty fast, and they were delicious! I usually stick with ordering the nigiri but I wanted to try some new rolls! I loved how the menu had pictures and the descriptions. The food was great but the experience....not so much...we had to ask several times to get our waters refilled and then when we ordered dessert, the one that we would think took longest to make (tempura ice cream) came out first and all others were forgotten (ice cream and mochi). I would definitely go back because the food was great and people deserve second chances! Maybe the service will be better next time!  Oh, and please take out the stupid Harlem shake music video off the loop! It is so annoying! :)

Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet shrimp

nspvlcJ9WIVMi733q0mcDA.text: Best AYCE sushi in town! Must visit. Rolls are on point and service is amazing. For a 16 party group the service has been excellent. Must visit when in town!

cCx1IVXcothGmVHXKnhKUA.text: Vegas is known for AYCE (all you can eat) sushi joints. They are a dime a dozen so finding a decent one is always a challenge. I find that Umiya has great quality fish for the price. You can't expect strip quality fish when it come AYCE but I really enjoy the salmon belly, Yuzu hamachi, and all the yummy appetizers. If you come here, make sure to get the Seared Tuna In AJ sauce. The sauce is awesome! Also, the service is always on par. The staff is friendly and always checking us on you; something I find other places lack. Keep it up Umiya!

Aa92QDIb8Zf1t2Q9crMtpw.text: The food here is great, but the service is a little slower than I'd like.  With that said, I really like the way they decorated the interior of the restaurant.  There are cool lights that decorate the walls and a big screen that cycles through music videos while you enjoy some fresh sushi.  I'd definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura vanilla ice cream
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic tuna nigiri
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna poke

JycV9_-w38FcP7Z25sh0uA.text: Great service and awesome food!! One of the best all you can eat I have been to here in vegas!

TKwU1QpvMoo_NtDd_xYg4g.text: I had a good experience here; nothing to complain about! Good food and good service. AND a free sake when you check in on Yelp.. that won me over. I was with a large group of 10 and the waiters/waitresses were very patient and accommodating. It was a Saturday afternoon and was not busy so the food came out shortly.   I thought the AYCE menu had a great variety (ribeye steak, chicken katsu, and fresh oysters all included). Only the uni is offered for dinner price/upgrade for +$2.

YtykWr-xghRlkK0uf7S1wg.text: Umiya Sushi is one of many AYCE sushi places in the Las Vegas Valley. Like many of these restaurants, the customer-facing employees are actually primarily Korean. The thing that sets this place apart for me is that wide variety of non-sushi/non-roll items that are available, including small portions of grilled beef and skewers, izakaya-style, and a great selection of side dishes and appetizers. The fish was generally pretty good (by AYCE sushi standards) and if you get their rolls, be careful because many are drowning in sauce. Overall, we had a great tasty meal and we will be back again!

y4jTjm3sdwUZILUWlv7cNQ.text: Went for lunch buffet around 1pm with hubby $21 each.  Food is not bad.  We got 2 orders of monkey brain, one order of fresh oyster (fresh and yump), one seared salmon salad, one rib eye steak, one chicken skewer, and one shrimp skewer, rolls ordered: salmon killer, first kiss, tuna naruto, Alaska, orange blossom, and crunchy lobster.  I know we ate 8 rolls, I cannot remember what were the other 2 now.   It's 4 star as they all taste similar, I cannot taste what were wrapped inside.  Nothing really woow me.    And I really don't like the waitress that much.  I asked "is tuna naruto good?"  She answered: it's not cooked.  Really?  I think I got that part from the ingredient already... She is cold and not friendly.  I wonder why they hire someone who is not friendly and does not know how to smile.

yJ0zYHg5-XW0dwyxvyNyRA.text: Good Ayce in Vegas. Service is fantastic . I would stay away from the grilled stuff and go straight for the sushi. Soft shell crab, mussels and the nigiri are good choices

MztxRKCpgIhaqCx8hBVMsw.text: Best sushi in town!  I absolutely recommend going with the all you can eat deal. You get your monies worth

gWWRBeu7CSgVqSmC1hgqYw.text: Awesome sushi! From out of town. They really take pride in their customer service and you can totally tell. Deff recommend it to anyone that loves Sushi!!!

DorCxiiVYMiqFLH19J225Q.text: Great food Good Service. Food comes quick. Ill eat here again when I come back from Cali. I wish they branch out in Norcal.

HdpjQfK2NyWyIQ_E55kl6g.text: This is our favorite place love it the waitress are friendly. We are here almost every week.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BmJb_ygn0g7CZGBQb3TSug.text: This place is not like your traditional AYCE sushi Resturant it not a place where you mark sushi on a paper and wait for your food. You basically order everything off a menu and anything in the menu is available. They have a lot appetizer and other options besides sushi that where great only critique about this place is the amount of rice they put on the nigiri is kind of crazy! Overall most of food was grea

qML69pSP7WZyWBTRIJjmAw.text: AYCE sushi! It's been a few years since we've been back to Vegas, and we wanted to find a good sushi spot, and I think we may have. For us the sushi rolls were good, but not great. The nigiri however was actually perfect! The ratio of rice to fish was perfect. The rice was perfect, not too dry or wet. The fish tasted fresh and not too small or large. The cut of fish was great. I'm a sucker for sushi spots with "super white" and was not disappointed! The appetizers were really good for us. I had the Monkey brains and was very impressed. Dessert was on spot too. We had the deep fried ice cream, which was prefect and the mochi ice cream. The mochi wasn't  your normal mochi you can pick up at Trader Joe's either. My only complaint was you could only have one order  of mochi per person. :(  The service was good. We were the only ones there at first because we came in pretty early for dinner. We had one incident where they sent our deep fried ice cream to another table, but overall we would come back!

EfVeVnAe9lSJu8X0hIhZyA.text: Perfect place to eat with family and friends. We had the perfect service and the best Japanese food in town of Las Vegas. We will be back very soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_m0txCCMTiKkVaE47OjT0g.text: Great food and efficient service! Our server was super nice. We will definitely keep on coming back. Must try in Vegas!!!! One of the best ayce sishi! Will surely come back for the lobster roll and salmon cheesestick.

63yQKFUJp_9lKUn-DrIdwQ.text: Probably one of the best sushi places in Las Vegas. Great quality of food and good service. Absolutely recommend. All you can it 20$ lunch and 25$ dinner. Sushi is amazing. The roll "kiss of fire" is the best roll I've ever had. All food was ready really fast and taste good.

8-mIt5ccOon3g37wX50M-Q.text: This is definitely one of my favorite sushi places. If you've never had a roll with banana, you MUST try the Banana Roll! Get a Red Rock Roll and an order of pork belly with some yellowtail nigiri, and you're good to go! The happy hour is amazing... Only $20.95 for all you can eat... What?!! Can't beat that. :-)

0IRVeTnLKotbCM2QSYIL-A.text: Came in with a couple of friends and it was super busy! We had to wait a little while for our entire party to get there but the wait wasn't bad at all! Once seated it did take awhile for the server to come to our table but once we did it was fine! I tried to ramen I wasn't a fan of it. Everyone else at the table loved their sushi! I  would definitely come back and try something else!

GTtq8rD0-4ok56xvbI0rSg.text: Awesome food for lunch or dinner. This is one place I definitely wouldn't miss every time I come to Vegas. Great food good prices

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gAy3MxH1gHvQixD54tMvVg.text: Best service hands down! I've ate at almost every mainstream sushi spot in vegas and normally they're kinda rude. This place is incredible. The employees literally run for you everywhere. Your drink stays topped off and every server helps you regardless who your waiter is. The sushi is at your table before you can even remember what you've ordered. This place rocks!

Pnd7a4WcfAbQqJr7U6M-8A.text: Found this place on recommendations from friends. Went here a couple times and loved it. The customer service is on point and the food taste great! Worth a try!

cGQ-u0nhf8zlSDunJWEWYw.text: **Food was... just okay.   - Soft shell crab was... not great.   - Fish size: small  - Fish freshness: good.  **Money:   - Cheap  - $25 all you can eat...   - Comes out to $80 for 2 persons with a 1L beer, martini, and tea.   **Service  - Awesome.   - We went at night (10.30pm), and had 3 people running around serving and helping.   Will be coming back in I'm in the hood and am starving.

w-uBHjd_lHEID0AquWuJBQ.text: Umiya is absolutely wonderful!! Hands down the best AYCE Japanese place in Vegas, coming from an SF foodie veteran. Their nigiri is fresh, the service is speedy and delightful, the ambiance is both charming and clean, and the pricing is lower than I would expect from the quality of the experience. Try this new gem before sampling  their pricer and more reviewed competition, you won't regret it!  Update: visited again almost a year later, the food is just as good as I remember! The porkbelly is delicious and they have tempura ice cream. Yumm!!!

oxQizGKerVKuBg1v4aOJqw.text: Super disappointed.  The food is really good, but we went for All-You-Can-Eat dinner.  There were 4 of us, and we ordered 5 rolls, but in the hour and 15 minutes after that, the waitress never came back to take our order.  We had to leave, so we paid $25.00 each for a total of 5 sushi rolls and 2 bowls of miso soup.  Very disappointing!  We could have gone elsewhere and paid half that ($114 plus tip) for 5 sushi rolls.  It's a shame, because I enjoyed the food, but I was extremely frustrated to pay so much for so little.

p9aNdEbC8_dd0mveOYIdZQ.text: Wonderful! The service is very good here. They are very attentive and are very accommodating. The food is pretty good but not the greatest. The fish could be fresher and prepared better, but for the price, it's very good.  It's a little loud here but the atmosphere is good. It gets busy but you can also make reservations.

4_lTcZAu0SRbq5VIprnCFA.text: This review is for the food only. It's nice to be off of the strip, and some of the fish was excellent, but I found myself wishing I had spent a little more money and gone somewhere with an excellent offering. The place is clean and the staff are very nice. I did the AYCE lunch special but did not like some of the rolls. When I didn't finish them rolls I was told I would be charged extra to leave them. I ate a few more pieces but really didn't enjoy them. What I did like was their yellowtail sushi and their spicy yellowtail roll. Other than that, I won't be visiting back. :(

c6MlRHT3HPBgEMwzMBOfiQ.text: They serve with fresh material, fast service, small portion that I can try many dish.

0INPZzf8RKlygznauMpmmg.text: I really liked this sushi restaurant. My friend and i were so happy to see a sushi restaurant open on a sunday so late so we decided to give it a try and i'm glad we did! the nigiri sushi had barely any rice which is so rare to find at an all you can eat location. Fish was fresh, rolls were great and the dessert was fab.

GKT0B8FL9w8kZ8fU2UQ-aw.text: The lunch AYCE is amazing! For only like $20 they have such a wide variety from appetizers, ramen, nigiri, rolls, and so much more! The sushi came very fast and the service was great. Some of the "non-sushi" items we tried were rib-eye steak, bacon and scallop, oysters, soft-shell crab...amazing!

HjWz_ixBFa677C7n1_xoBg.text: Here for the third time, my favorite all-you-can-eat sushi spot in Vegas.  I highly recommend the monkey brain, the poke salad, and anything else with tuna!

HXN5vMn5aH9bwE0nD1l0iw.text: Banana Rolls are my favorite! Service is good! Four stars coz they messed up with our orders!

wJXtsH8dS1OOtk1mOv9SpQ.text: I have been here multiple times now and it's always the same amazing quality. I bring people for all you can eat for lunch and also have been here for dinner. My favorite appetizer is the monkey brains. Avocado stuffed with spicy tuna then tempura fried. Amazing!! Every roll I have tried is amazing and I'm slowly trying every one on the menu!! This is now my favorite sushi spot in town!

szrtYfc3M5FWyKopwG4c0g.text: This has been one of the best all you can eat sushi places i have been too. Not only they have sushi but you can also order steak, chicken teriyaki, soup, noodles and also dessert all included in the all you can eat price.

oeXwTXlgmFSnK-nbEoxbPA.text: I love eating japanese food and this place is super delicious. I had the japanese lasagna, edamame, and beef yakisoba. All you can eat is a great deal for both dinner and lunch! I also love the ice cream here, it is really yummy.  The servers are always attentive and quick to order and serve your food. 5 stars!

MNGF6yddvJDzlvxi3lfx-g.text: I still love this little place. Tonight they get 5 stars because of the adorable Halloween decor and the fact that they were incredibly fast bringing the food, no order mix ups, the food tasted great (as usual), and for the first time the place was packed!   They're super efficient. No waving down servers anymore and they have a cool mug promotion going on.   We came here tonight because we're moving tomorrow so we wanted to stop by one last time. Totally worth it, just like every time before. Everyone is friendly and expedient, and the sushi rocks.

y8SqYyQcvkZKdC3-4Nn4Qg.text: A coworker came here at the beginning of the week and recommended it- I'm so glad, it was delicious!  The sushi at our hotel so overpriced- $18-21 for one roll, which isn't even that good.  Umiya's all you can eat sushi is only $26 and you can even order normally expensive things like uni (only once though) and they're fresh and delicious. The waiters are nice and responsive. This is a really great all you can eat sushi place, definitely worth a trip from wherever you're staying on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious!

yPvj9bqKhT5EQ7XnXxNYJw.text: I will NEVER return to this place. The service was bad and I got sick and ended up in the hospital for 3 days.  I ordered the seared tuna. It tasted funny. About 30 hours later, in the hospital.

D0BODhF2MTanhBlh1Qq5Uw.text: GREAT atmosphere!! service is very good! love how they show music videos ! the screaming O was my favorite. tho, i found that the nirigi's rice was a little tough and too much. salmon was kind of dry. Amazing options for appetizers !!! this was my first time and definitely will not be my last !

NQw45ZGJFDhmUYdPALgKpw.text: Love love love Umiya. It's always busy, but if you have a party of 6 or more you can make a reservation. We come here regularly for the AYCE sushi even though we live in Henderson. The seating is spread out, long picnic tables and some smaller tables in the back. Not as cramped as some of the other sushi spots in town.   Sometimes it can be a little slow to get your first order in, but once it's in they are good about coming around often to ask if you need anything. Sometimes we have the same wait person and sometimes several come around. They are always pleasant no matter how busy it is.   Good menu, favorites are the green valley roll and kiss of fire. If you don't like the crab with mayo like us you can say no crab and they are very good about that.   For dessert ask to hear the sorbet flavors, these are new and not on the menu. Raspberry is my favorite!

xeCWa7BaEEj3dWrVI8u0Xw.text: Best bang for your buck here!! Only $25 for all you can eat, which includes items that are not usually on an ayce sushi list, such as sweet shrimp (limited to one order per person, but that's still pretty darn good, in my opinion). They even have ramen, Kalbi, oysters, and pork belly dishes too! The servers were nice and quick, so that's also a plus. They also don't leave out any of your orders like some ayce places do either. Top your meal off with some dessert (Mochi, ice cream, banana splits, included in the ayce), and you're set.  +fresh sushi  +includes items not normally on an ayce sushi menu +nice, quick, and attentive staff  -a little far from the strip. If you taxi'd there, you would have to walk to the Palms(about a 5min walk)to catch a ride back.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AYCE dinner for 10 people
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni

FirshtvsITYWb-NdxVbNnw.text: I  always go here whenever I'm in town. The sushi is fresh, the prices are standard, the customer service is good, and the atmosphere Is great! Come check it out. Random yet delicious dish was the gingko. Definitely try that one! All sushi rolls were delicious so...get em all!

jMg7LJA0JCTLxmkntHdnzA.text: Normally, I love this place but the last time I went it took FOREVER for our food to come out and not only that, but the service was very rude as well. Not sure what happened, but we won't be returning.

Sb-TP5euvv8m76QMrDAC6A.text: Went for dinner Wednesday night. Seated pretty quick, everyone was attentitive and polite. The fish was fresh and good quality. AYCE was definitely worth it and there was a wide variety of rolls and appetizers to choose from. All in all, I would definitely go again!

z38E0rs8vFTuS3VSL3W_kA.text: Right when you step in you will notice lots of picnic style seating. Personally I thought it was pretty cool looking but once you're seated with people around it is hard to get out  to use restroom. The place has some pretty dim lighting which didn't bother me so much just a bit dark. Our server was cool recommend us what to try which I thought was great being a first timer..  Food overall GREAT! As you can see in a photo I posted after I ate with the family and friends, that we enjoy our ayce. We ate everything and it was all great. It's pretty late at night now while typing this so I'll update this when I can.   Do I recommend this place? YES I DO RECOMMEND ALL OF YOU READING THIS TO CHECK THIS PLACE OUT AND TRY THREE TIMES IF YOU'RE ONE OF THE NEGATIVE PEOPLE.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I say 5 stars worthy

OU5RrQXOhvA2DTn0cPQV9A.text: Living in Dayton, OH, sushi, for the wife and me, is a definite no-go.  As a result, we decided to try to get our fill of sushi while in town.  Everyone likely has opinions on the merits of AYCE sushi concept.  However, for us, the tastebuds want what the tastebuds want.  Looking for a place we hadn't previously tried, we went to Umiya Sushi for its AYCE lunch on a Friday.  Located in a strip mall on W. Flamingo just past the Palms, Umiya Sushi offered a decent price ($20.95/person for lunch) for its AYCE sushi.  We sat at the sushi bar in the dimly lit restaurant.  I found the selection offered to be merely average and of seeming lesser quality/freshness (the poke comes immediately to mind) compared to other AYCE sushi places we've been to in Las Vegas.  Service was hit or miss, too, as items that we ordered were forgotten and only delivered after we asked about them or were simply forgotten and we didn't feel the need to inquire about the forgotten item since we had other places to be and things to do.  Umiya Sushi was merely average, at best, and easily the most forgettable meal we had while we were in town.  Call it 2.5 stars, rounded up to 3.

mfje-8LtFPAuYJHAhMoYYA.text: After a day of exploring the strip we decided to come here for dinner. It was about 9 or 10pm and the resturant was still packed, since we had a big group we had to wait about 10-15 minutes for  a table which wasn't a big deal. We did the AYCE for $25/person. There were so many option we decided to stick to the nigiris appetizers and etc. stayed away from the rolls because we knew it was gonna make us full faster. My absolute favorite thing from here was the oysters, grilled squid and seared tuna sashimi in AJ sauce! I will come back whenever I'm back in town!   The only thing that grossed me out was when they brought me my water there were chunks of rice I my cup.... And when we tried to pay with a debit card they said that it didn't work and we had to pay with cash..

biFPSfELPdB7NHJf3DB4vg.text: Umiya is pretty good. I would say there is definitely some items on the menu I would stay away from, but there are plenty of things to eat for plenty of palates.   The service was a little slow and I was annoyed the the service buttons don't work, but otherwise it was a very positive experience and would return to this location.

lJZeMnT0mC2QeGezwnmjFw.text: There are a lot of other AYCE options in the area so next time I'm definitely going to try another place out to see how it is. I'm iffy about coming back here mainly because the service just wasn't good. I know that service can be of less quality when a restaurant is busy but in my case I came at an off hour and only a few tables were full.   The food is good enough for me to come back - the nigiri is of good quality but it can be a hit or miss sometimes you'll get a good cut of fish and other times it won't be as good as another. The tuna poke is also good.   One thing a server said with a sort of attitude when I ordered 10 orders of a nigiri was "it's 20 pieces, are you sure you're going to eat all that?" I don't think he realized it was going to be split between my friend and I so he thought I was going to eat it on my own and that's kind of rude to say??? I mean I can read the menu so I know what I'm getting myself into and if I can't eat it all then I'm going to pay for it lol   Another thing is that when you try to flag down a server it seems like they either can't see you or they ignore you. Now I work as a server in the food industry as well and if I were to not be paying more attention to the restaurant patrons my boss would be so pissed and yet these servers are walking around not aware of things half the time.   I think an experience here is a hit or miss for the most part since I've read several other reviews that say negatory things about the service here as well. Come with caution.

75zkwS9UQ5FkRyWUw-u6Dg.text: Came here for all you can eat sushi after just driving around looking for a place to eat. Left here hoping they are still in business everytime we come back to vegas. Whenever we make the trip to vegas, we always plan on eating here at least twice. The rice to fish ratio is good and the fish is fresh. They also have side orders without rice which is a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OgpeNV9_TTNEcPve2NcYhg.text: Service and quality is as good as it gets! The wait time for out party of 2 was little to none. Also, unlike most sushi joints Umiya had more than enough servers on shift to full assist everyone dining. Our orders were taken and delivered so quickly it was unbelievable for an all you can eat.  MY FAVORITE AYCE SUSHI JOINT IN TOWN HANDS DOWN.

0ZhEmhyuire8ueC7t-Noxw.text: My friends and I were in Vegas for the week and were craving sushi. We didn't want to pay a ridiculous amount of money like you I would on the strip, so our friend told us about this place and said it was BOMB! It was pretty packed when we got there so I'm guessing everyone had the same idea as us.   All you can eat sushi?... but lets just all take a minute to appreciate those 5 words  I feel like sometimes when I eat raw seafood, I get a little picky and concerned if the quality is gonna be good... but OMG the food was so good! The fish looked fresh and everything came out in a timely matter. I didn't think we could eat so much sushi!!   They give you a time limit of an hour and a half, which is more than enough time to eat as much as you want. They also have desserts! Alcohol and tea cost extra. Some items on the menu are limited to one per customer. + The menu has a lot of pictures and tells you exactly what's in it.  I suggest going with a group of people so that way you can eat a little bit of everything. Or if you're super hungry, you can just go by yourself. Either way, it's so worth it! Another suggestion is to order as you go. If you don't end up eating everything, they will charge you extra. So it's better to just order a few things at a time so you know you can finish everything. Think I ended up paying only ~$30 (take in mind I ate like 4 rolls, an udon, steak, 3 appetizers, and dessert). I usually pay that much, if not more, for like 3 sushi rolls at other places.   Definitely a must eat place if you love sushi and are super hungry! I was very impressed by how much food my friends and I consumed! I left feeling so food drunk  I will be back next time I'm in Vegas

_UG_n6n9YRtOOkVNabr9vQ.text: Husband and I wanted sushi before heading out to a show. This place was close to the theater. We  fairly early in the evening and were seated immediately. We did not realize it was an AYCE restaurant. Hubby took advantage of that while I just got one roll a la carte. Rolls came out surprisingly fast. I had the Sweet Roll which was satisfactory. I'd prob have it again if I were in the mood. Hubby had four different rolls, oysters, and dessert. Service was so so. Ambience was not anything too special. We walked out paying less than $50 including tip. Not bad.  We're not local, so can't say I'd return. But we would tell people to give it a shot.

nrUeWW17NEG-F79XdGptZA.text: This place has such delicious and really unique specialty rolls! It is all you can eat sushi and for dinner it costs around $26 which is pretty standard.    My favorite roll I had was the Hawaiian roll. It has garlic albacore which I couldn't recommend more! It's amazing but it's sadly the only specialty roll with it and I wanted more! They also had delicious tempura ice cream for dessert. I also had the green valley roll which was ok.   The reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because even though the food was really good, the service wasn't. We were there for 2.5 hours total and they completely forgot about 2 of the rolls that i ordered and the rest of the food took an extremely long time to hit the table. It was busy and I'm a server so I understand but they were so hard to track down to order from or ask for anything that I just said forget it. I didn't really feel like I got my $26 worth but I'm not so full that I hate myself so it's a partial win lol  Overall I'd probably come back for lunch when it's (hopefully) not so busy and a little cheaper.

YIQJ5FW-pYO_u4LNNZNHyA.text: An average AYCE (all you can eat) sushi restaurant, but I fear that we won't be returning any time soon. The price for AYCE dinner is competitive, at $25.95, but we just weren't satisfied with their appetizer selection and quality of their nigiri.   My boyfriend and I enjoy eating fresh fish, nigiri and trying a few appetizers when we dine at AYCE sushi restaurants, unfortunately the nigiri and appetizers here do not shine. The fish to rice ratio is inconsistent. The sushi rice was undercooked and compacted under paper thin slivers of raw fish. After a couple nigiri my stomach felt dense and full. That's not a good feeling or a good value.   There were a few fish we tried that were extremely enjoyable and sweet such as the albacore and salmon; but the paper thin sliver made it difficult to really enjoy the quality of fish. We actually sent back the salmon belly because it was offensively fishy and old.    I also felt very limited with the appetizer selection, some items were sized too large for us to feel comfortable ordering and the others were just not desirable.   Here are some appetizers that were enjoyable:  Miso Soup Baked Mussels Tuna poke ...that's it?  Pass on these: Jalapeno popper (super dense and crazy filling with ok flavor) Fried soft shell crab (all soggy batter) Most nigiri...  I suggest going to Sakana (on Maryland) for fresh fatty cuts of fish on their nigiri with a generous fish to rice ratio, a big flavorful selection of appetizers and also creative, juicy rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño popper (super dense and crazy stuffed with fillers, ok flavor)

mDv0OgDRzESavMvwj6K6gA.text: Had pink lady..really tasty roll...little bummed they were out of king crab..guess have to try next time...rolls.were fresh and tasty.

Htfjo4yYUlSL6ApHdbN7gA.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE AYCE SUSHI!  Every time I come to Vegas I have to try a AYCE place. This place is kinda small and the wait can take a while but it is worth it.   The service is exceptional as well. I had a check in on yelp for a free soda so I took advantage of that.  I love uni and I am glad that they include that as part of the AYCE dinner. They limit you to 2 orders per person. BUT in each order is 2 pieces not one!! Their fresh fish such as tuna, salmon and yellow tail nigiri is soo good as well!  They say they have a 90 minute time limit, but they do not really enforce it.   They have such a huge selection and i was not dissapointed. The ambiance was lit as well! they have music videos and hip hop playing. Such a good vibe.  I will definitely come back here again!

AavwRuD2uSMXtIq2ZLB-pg.text: I haven't been here recently so my review will be based on my experienced when I brought my grand daughter and niece. I always recommend to seat at the sushi bar, because that's where all the magic happens.  Sushi chefs who assisted us before are no longer on this location which is a bummer. I've heard that they went to another location or the sister company I'm not really sure. But they are amazing and provides you an excellent service.  I will be biased because I love AYCE sushi and Umiya is one of my favorite. The quality of their food, the service and the place are great. So, if you like AYCE try this place and you will like it.

7L_CrsnNXUOvEEAuHUVY_A.text: This place was awesome! All the sushi was so fresh. The best is they have soft shells and fresh oyster.  It was my favorite! They give you big pieces sashimi! One of my favorite AYCE place. They will take reservation too if you have a big party.

NWF6pMO510mou1xk7O60Mw.text: just walked in on a saturday night for 2 and the restaurant was half empty with open tables and bar and they said hr and a half wait for a table and hr wait for bar because ppl made reservations? this is an ayce sushi place not a 5 star reservation restaurant, it should be first come first serve. this has never happened to us as we've been here many times, very annoyed, taking my business somewhere else.

hdWYkwOWwNQqruDGxazMRA.text: We've been coming to this place three years in a row. We come to Vegas once a year for work. This is (was) our favorite Japanese place here. The food is good. We had the bad luck to sit at the sushi bar aa usual but being served by a really mean Mexican guy (we are Mexican by the way). Rude. It ruined all our experience. We will try to eat there next time, but if this guy is around we will skip the place forever. A whole year waiting to eat here and it was a really bad experience.   Update: We returned this year. The mean guy was in his day off. Lucky us! Once again a truly wonderful experience and great fresh and tasty Japanese food.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L1IqQR7lxMTwcU3tnDPs9g.text: From just a combination of underwhelming service and mediocre sushi, I feel like this place deserves 3 stars.  The moment my sister and I entered the restaurant, it was quite busy so none of the servers greeted us. We only got a half hearted greeting from one sushi chef. Then we waited around 5 minutes for a server to get us seated, but we stood at the front counter awkwardly because one server was busy dealing with checks and talking on the walkie. For the ayce, we didn't even get to look at the menu for 1 minute before the same server came back. He honestly seemed bothered with our presence and all the other servers kept eyeballing our table at first. (??) Throughout our dinner, they didn't come to check up on us to really see how we were doing but it was more like to pick up our empty plates. We were rushed to order more and rushed to finish fast. Not too enjoyable.   When we got to ordering, the rolls came out very quick and there was one nice server who was good with refilling our water.  On to the food... the only ones that stuck out to me were the Who's Your Daddy appetizer and the First Kiss roll. The other rolls tasted similar and was quite lacking on the eel sauce for those that we ordered with eel sauce. But then halfway through our dinner, my sister noticed a hair in our soft shell crab roll.... uhh I know damn well that it is not mine nor hers because our hair is pretty long while that one was significantly short.  Such an inane experience, I won't give this place another chance.

bfi2mXRuTmkNx6ruauTePw.text: Amazing food, excellent service, and great Sake flavors and specials!  Very friendly and accommodating, even great options for people who do not like typical sushi and seafood.

81PUgQe00Yin1I0F8pyHFg.text: This place was yummy even after it was delivered to our hotel room on the strip! The tempura udon was still warm and yummy! The salmon skin salad was not soggy at all (which was something I was worried about). The rolls were delish! Our son inhaled his two salmon hand rolls. Loved the fact that we were able to have sushi without having to drive or walk out on the Strip.  Thanks for delivering!!!!

w6bbSisDuZxE2XgAGnozAg.text: An AYCE restaurant that triumphs in serving sushi with rice that is not overburdening.  I also liked the selection of half rolls so that you can sample different varieties without feeling full with just a couple.

y4szdw9TvkcLXVBnAKX2cg.text: Been here twice during my visit to Vegas.  My brother got the All You Can Eat, I got California roll with brown rice, and chicken teriyaki, and hubby got the beef teriyaki. Chicken teriyaki was mediocre at best. Dark meat and SUPER fatty chicken. I will pass next time. Hubby said beef teriyaki was good. Brother's pieces of sushi came in two pieces, the shrimp option looked pathetic.   There is a good chance I will come back since it's pretty close to the strip, and prices are good for it being Vegas. But I'll stick with just sushi next time.

1w2F0nrU8MRXeq_cHL0Xdw.text: Food was good! Staff was friendly and attentive! Restaurant was clean and neat! Enjoyed our sushi and box lunches!! Will be back for sure!!

pSWUnn7F7D5EnLPrI8lveQ.text: This place was absolutely amazing! Hands down best AYCE sushi in Vegas! I was absolutely in love with the Salmon Belly Nigiri! So fresh. Don't forget to try the Mochi! I loved the green tea one!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qptIJJKN9b_0xW1iDCQQ-g.text: This is truly the BEST SUSHI in Las Vegas! We live across town and will drive just to have lunch or dinner here.  We have found that most sushi places in Vegas are very bland and doesn't have that wow factor.  This is the place to go if you want amazingly delicious sushi and much more!

mJJAioG5NxzYi2MvOHR1Qg.text: There is no all you can eat!  Our table just looked like it.  Plus we had a special birthday celebrant who can eat for 5 people and still not look pregnant :P.  Dudes our inside joke - high tens twinny!   Make sure you come hungry and ask how many pieces for the sushi; so as not to over order cuz they will charge you.  Warning: You will get hawk eyed.  Also, half orders are available!  I dont think they post it.  But this is a great option.  The menu is great.  Nice selections.  It is here I learned I will never have uni again; ever - not even by accident.  Sorry, it wasn't my thing.  Give me the inside of a steamed crab shell well cooked instead, with lemon and tabasco please.  Their main dining area is set up with several large tables, then some along the wall.  There is a sushi bar and liquor bar.  Nothing fancy and no art to admire... except the edible art!  Maybe that's the point?    Service is good, quick, attentive (don't forget you will be hawk eyed).  Sushi is fresh, some are unique.  There is raw and cooked sushi.  Pricing is $$ - in the range of what to expect for the area.  Yeah, they seem popular.  Just watch the dinner crowd.  You can tell.  A good meal is to be enjoyed here.

zH1UFNCBAgbkM0_JVqNi1Q.text: Umiya Sushi  Food was really good, and Curtis made our experience so much better. He had such great customer service "par excellence".

OBOtFoWeIiwDdoFnj9mC8g.text: I've had an incurable craving for all you can eat sushi on a Vegas trip and this might be the best  place to go.  Affordable, high quality and fun. Umiya sushi ended up being a double visit the last time I visited Las Vegas.  The fish was fresh, the rice was nicely prepared, and the value for money left a great impression.  I will be back on my next visit... I might just fly down for a sushi and casino party!

vMYiAt5AQdy6mP3Qn8DdHg.text: Couple day ago we going to all you can eat sushi on flamingo. The price in my pictures and also some foods pic. The foods served very fast and all delicious. About the drink I'm really wanna recommend lychee Sage (sweet and easy for drink) Also about service the restaurant is great. I'm recommend if your guy fine some all you can eat outside Hotel in Las Vegas.

JCLZbJN-RLAD_sZRFwLHHg.text: I'm in love!! AYCE sushi for $25?! I'm there! Their selection is huge as well, couldn't believe it when I saw that I could get uni and fresh oysters as part of the AYCE. However, it is limited to one order per person. Totally fine. Back home in Hawai'i, uni is super expensive. Two orders of uni would've probably costed $15 or more. The rest of the dishes were delicious as well! The fish was so unexpectedly fresh!   Service was on point too. They were very attentive! When I called to ask for the check, the Asian male server reminded me about dessert! I totally forgot that it was also included in the AYCE!! I really appreciated that he reminded me about it.   Overall, the food is 5/5 and the service is 5/5 too. Would definitely come back again during my stay in Vegas.

goKpDVtcIvE0FVtpPlu1iQ.text: I've been here 4 times and every time was good. Waitresses and waiters are nice and respectable, they're all far from rude. The food is good, but if they added more to their menu, that would be great. I'm also not the biggest fan of dark lighting, but I can ignore it for this place.

YU4ad0BHmBLVgL5I_F0Pvw.text: All you can eat quality sushi!  Good place for the family. . . We took the kids and they loved it.  Service was fast and very good. The best service I've had anywhere in a while.    Food tasted great. A few recommendations: crispy rice, yellow tail, Alaskan roll, salmon skin hand roll, strawberry sake, and pineapple ice cream. Overall, good experience.

mgW8J-sFjdRbkL7X1ZqOLQ.text: The sushi was ok (hence the 2 star), the service was horrible (hence the 2 star). It wasn't busy and after getting our initial order, the waitress was no where to be found. We had to asked a couple of different servers to get water and when we finally got her attention she look like she did not want to be there.  We will definitely not come back. There are other ayce sushi places out there with similar quality sushi and better service!

16deNgZ2aQgslj_sDGt1mg.text: love all you can eat, you order then they prepared, the  portion is small so you can try different dishes, it's very good.

HUQMPDICntuqa5k3cPabig.text: Seating was prompt. Sat at the bar. Fish quality is fresh, chewy, and fatty. The chefs were friendly and gave suggestions on selection. Their beer is good.

q80gJ6x0rWl5tgxNF0Frjw.text: This is seriously my favorite place in town for sushi.  The all you can eat lunch is $20 and has fresh oysters, mussels, and scallops on the menu.  They also have ramen and a variety of other options for those looking for something other than fish.  My personal favorites are garlic tuna nigri, orange blossom roll, and the crispy rice with spicy tuna.  I wonder how they make money providing such good ingredients.

mThQNe5EwTrk6cJzJcmx7g.text: Food: Fantastic! Never had to wait too long. Food is plated beautifully; sometimes almost too pretty to eat - ALMOST HAHA. All ingredients are fresh. Nothing tastes fishy.   Ambiance: Lots of seating. Fairly dimly lit restaurant for a more mellow vibe. Very relaxed. You don't feel rushed to turn tables or anything.   Overall: Visited my family and ended up eating at this AYCE establishment. We were served and cared for by a kind and charismatic guy named Curtis. He's the type of person to welcome you and have a sincere chat; instead of doing the minimum by simply taking your order. He takes the time to ask you what you like and make recommendations accordingly.   He walked over to the head chef and came back with a plethora of new entrees to try. We thought it was going to be just one or two dishes, but we were delightfully wrong. He came back with so many dishes that we didn't have to order anymore LOL  Basically, I trust Curtis and his tastebuds. He definitely gives wonderful suggestions. This may sound stalker-esque, but I'll only go if he's working. Please keep him forever hahaha jkidding-ish. :P  Tip: If possible, go eat when CURTIS is serving. He will undoubtedly take great care of you. Your water/tea will always be refilled and he may even help you discover new food outside of your go-to orders. Please allow him to expand your sushi repertoire. Hehe.

EfA6Ct7xgnxHmOGykgkQqg.text: It's a great Japanese restaurant.  It's Sunday noon and just 30 minutes after they opened, the restaurant is already half full. Service was great. Our server was very accommodating but a little impatient. She keeps asking if we want to order more from the AYCE menu even if we still have food on table. Overall, food was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eMRrhG7JY5W7T3VGPcvK3Q.text: Sushi was so delicious and the ratio of rice to fish was spot on. I don't care for the rolls so I never order any at restaurants. So I can't comment on those. The other foods such as the appetizers,skewers, salads , etc were all excellent! Loved the salmon collar, too. For the price, it is so worth it for AYCE! Make your reservations though!

V-OzCW1ljoqh4Urfd-hJPA.text: This was the best sushi place I've ever had! For all you can eat it's an amazing price ($25.95) and all the food was top quality. Everyone there was so nice and the waiters/waitresses were very attentive to us. This is my new Las Vegas go to!

Y6eP_HD_QPTITTEctuSULQ.text: I came here in August and have been thinking about this place ever since. Usually my go to ayce place is Sakana but figured I'd give a couple others a try. Well this one definitely exceeded my expectations. Service was quick and friendly.... I sat right at the sushi bar. I suggest the pork belly to start off with as an appetizer. I tried several types of nigiri, and all of them were prepared nicely with a decent fish to rice ratio. For $20 lunch price, it is definitely a deal, and very easy to eat your money's worth of good quality sushi.

1gBa0Z46WIJidgkCUN7o_g.text: My fav ACYE spot! A lot of AYCE places are quantity and not quality, this place is both!

Q_T0Xut06MwqbMzrcxYfgw.text: Amazing place for an all you can eat sushi joint! Was not disappointed one bit.  Arrived a bit early around 6pm on a Saturday. We were rolling deep with about 25 guys (bachelor party). They were very accommodating to that fact and I think they had extra people on shift to help us. Service was on point. Food came out no more than five minutes after ordering. As soon as plates were cleaned, they were picked up and our next orders were taken!   Food was fantastic as well. The tuna tataki is a must. Although it is listed as a one time item, I think I had about three rounds. I tried staying away from rolls as I didn't want to fill myself up too fast. I went straight for the one order items. The poke was also pretty damn fresh. Comes with a little side of seaweed salad. All in all I would definitely come back here again when I'm in town. Good choice before the turn up.

khpfKT50Ft6rpl2VpTKxhw.text: Umiya continues to be our go to sushi place when in Vegas. Amazing service at the bar and fresh ingredients make the all you can eat the best deal in Vegas. The House Saki is good as well. The sushi chefs are incredible and friendly. Definitely come here over any casino sushi bar if you are looking for great food and amazing prices.

rmOiHxBv_gMmVxqiYxM_Ag.text: I was able to check this place off my bucket list on my recent trip to Vegas.  While the interior of the restaurant isn't very appealing or inviting.  Overall it was a pleasurable experience and staff was friendly.    In the beginning everything tasted fresh.   Towards the end of my meal however the fish started to taste spoiled/old.   I ate mainly nigiri as I'm not big into rolls.   I did try a half of roll of soft shell crab.   All I could taste was greasy fried batter and nothing else.    The tomago was too sweet n mushy.  I'm guessing it's not made in house.  One big thing that would up the quality is the rice.  It didn't have the proper texture sushi rice should have.   Rice is just as important as fresh fish.   If they took the time to make the best quality rice they can, the overall quality would go up just from that single ingredient.    I was impressed by how fast everything came out and how well coordinated the staff is.   I truly respect that as it's not easy to pull off what they are doing. While there was a few items I ate that were disappointing, I would return again.   Definitely a must try if you're a sushi lover.

TEbEA7IZuw3JIKfDnFX-hQ.text: Whenever we are in LV we always try to make it a point to visit Umiya Sushi.   We have been to many AYCE places and for the price this place can't be beat.  The food is tasty and clean, and the service was great. Our group basically ate almost every item on the menu, and there were no complaints.  Their menu is pretty extensive, so rather than me pointing out what items we enjoyed, I would recommend trying it once and you will be hooked.

9d0ydxD0caqQhQQSf-RpxA.text: The all you can eat menu is wide ranging with lots of hot items, nigiri, and rolls. They have several house specials on their menu that are often very good and well presented. These interesting options as well as the daily specials and the huge number of rolls make this place stand out above other ayce places in town. Since their menu is so large it makes it a great place to come back to visit to try other things that you couldn't try last time. Service is also extremely good, friendly and fast even during the busy times. They take reservations which helps alot compared to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soft shell crab
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hand rolls
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U8g39POZDb6-WCc4KwmNWA.text: Restaurant is located near flamingo and arville. All you can eat or a la carte. they open from 11am till 2am i believe $20 per person for all you can eat lunch time and $30 or less per person for dinner time if you come for dinner time you might have to wait a little... here are my favorite dish the salmon screaming salad, the mini octopus skewer (1 per person), philadelphia roll, soft shell crab (so crunchy), jalapeno poppers, Nigiri sushi, monkey brain and the list goes on staff is friendly, the orders are coming quite fast. they have large table so sometime they sit you with some other guests, it's fun! when the restaurant is crowded it happens that it could be very noisy. dessert is included in the all you can eat pricing bon appetit sorry we ate it all before i realized i had to take pics lol

OermI5TxhBaW0lufZIipxg.text: Amazing sushi and staff!! They were so nice and welcoming and they surprised me with a dessert!! Great prices and super fresh!! go alittle off the main strip and you will be happy you did!!!! Will be back and highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3lbSjS0LMercUciQf4Qr1w.text: Fish to rice ratio is decent. Small fish small rice. I've been to so many AYCE sushi restaurants, not a one really stands out in my mind. Their baked green mussels are very good as is their Uni & sweet shrimp with their fried fish heads. Salmon hand roll was very good too. This place doesn't add any sesame seeds to most of their rolls. I happen to love sesame seeds. There is only about 4 tables with a chair back. Otherwise it's a picnic table & bench. We sat at the sushi bar with 1/2 a back. It was ok. But I was uncomfortable so glad my fiance was ready to leave. We need to try some new AYCE Sushi Restaurants in the Vegas area.

_oez5_9v4tm-PDUfi5rFDg.text: The food was good but not the freshest fish in town. Staff was friendly. Prices are fair.  The Bento box was a healthy portion. Probably won't be back simply because there are other choices in town.

TUlVv-gDe07gnqFnK61B7g.text: All You Can Eat Sushi on the pricier side but good quality. I always order the yellow fin nigiri sushi and their baked muscles. Delicious! Service is quick and friendly. Check out this place!

zuikoxQQ9wLOQJn3fcVHyA.text: I don't write reviews often. It either has to be really amazing or really bad lol. I have been coming to Umiya for several years and have had excellent service by Jay. He has always been SO attentive and accommodating. He greets me with a smile and a warm hello every single time I come in. He remembers my order and the little things about me that come up in random conversations. It's not just him. The rest of the staff do the same and I thank you guys for being incredible! I don't know why I haven't written a review sooner. The food and the service is always a treat. Thank you so much for making this place my local spot! Working at Yellowtail in the Bellagio I see excellent service and food quality on the daily but coming here I def feel home. Cheers you guys and thank you

73EZkHMpS1WOt_bPUyDWHg.text: My second time here within the past month.  We just love it here!!!  The atmosphere and people are great!  Curtis one of the servers, he was awesome, he suggested us items on the menu and everything we ate was delicious!  Our all time favorite is the garlic tuna, seared ahi, and soft shell crab.

qLoyEiZwaf38xVWLEi862g.text: I've some visits that have been 5/5 and others that have been 3/5, so i went in between with 4/5. Really hit and miss here. Sometimes fish quality is good (for a AYCE place) and other times its just meh.

IPfDjl-sMTYueoMUK-K_lA.text: Simple the best. Awesome rolls. We had lunch special 1 normal roll & 1 special roll & soup for $12.95!  Also all you can eat for like $23 here Great food

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura lobster! The best roll my wife says she ever eaten
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Scallop &amp; spicy tuna

s9rTZHe_Z8DIDMePr8iOwA.text: Great A.Y.C.E. sushi in a strip mall not far from the strip. Everything's included but there are some items you can only get one per person. The Snow White was excellent. Ask the server for suggestions. They were well versed on the menu and made great suggestions. We also likes that they were open at 3 for a late lunch. A lot of sushi places close between lunch and dinner, not this one. Cucumber salad was bland. Sushi chefs didn't make a lot of eye contact even with us sitting at the sushi bar. But all and all great really good.

Rwa1N8JsuZPfL-tK91fxuQ.text: This place was probably my favorite sushi restaurant in vegas. They had such great unlimited sushi for great prices. Salmon belly and uni were so fresh! Never been to a place with such a good food and fast service. The servers were really nice too. We got full within 20 minutes of entering the restaurant since the food were served so quick. My boyfriend and I were really satisfied.

hUdbG6Ptl0F_GO4LAb9b4A.text: The fried soft shell crab was super tasty and the oysters were nice and fresh. However, their sushi rolls left a lot to be desired. This will hit the spot if you have a sushi craving, but don't expect amazing food.

5-Sl_7ZbQAL845fiWKfvRw.text: Lunch with my sis. She had All You Can Eat and that she did While I had some of the best sashimi sampler plate and an Eel Hand Roll - amazing! Service was great. Simple decor with wide roomy wood tables with long benches.  I would go there again!

disWg6RDMp314RJGa6dlVw.text: You better come here and eat!! I fucking work here, our food and service is always on point  We are outta this world with food and service, yes it always tends to be busy, but please be patient take a seat and wait we will be right with you, it's worth the wait... Trust me buckaroo

GOc1766fZm16npPgq-QX5A.text: Service and cleanliness is a thumbs up on this place, food i could rate as perfect for a ayce sushi. Price is fair and square! Will definitely come back for more! Hate comparison but this is my new place for ayce sushi in replacement for hikari!

IDalhQ9pC0IoM9veUYiGfg.text: Thursday night I went back to the restaurant around 7:30 and brought a friend for his first time and it was busy inside. We were greeted immediately and given our menus. Our server's name was Daniel and he let us know in the grinning that it was going to be a little slow because it was busy. Other then the little wait for our food it was a great experience. The sushi was amazing as always and the server was very kind and attentive. As soon as people started to leave we received our food much quicker. So if you do go in and it is busy you might expect a decent delay with your sushi since I believe it Kirby just be the one sushi chef so order appetizers and other things to pass the time.

2uQRy1srPZAv26pnghETIw.text: I came here with my brother, my son and niece last week some time. Me and my brother have different preferences in places to go for sushi. He named this one and Oyshi. I picked this place because it had a higher rating. Of course he likes to be opposite than me, he thinks Oyshi is better and doesn't believe in ratings lol. I personally love Sushi Hero and their ratings reflect it. I started at Yama on Flamingo, then to Sakana. Anyway, let's talk about Umiya... I tend to get more of the kitchen stuff now rather than the rolls, and I love the kitchen food here. I always need my fresh oysters, shrimp tempura, seafood salad or some sort, baked mussels and Tako. This place has Fish Katsu and I was like o_O OMG, it was heaven to just have it on the  menu and even a higher place in heaven was the taste. Their Sashimi that you can get in the AYCE was delicious as well. Too bad it was only 1 order per person.  Now to the "negatives".  1.They seem to focus too much on making sure you only ordered the "1 order per person" once, that when my brother ordered the 2 sashimi orders (for him and his daughter, I went to order it and she said we already had two orders. I said "we have 4 people". And when my brother ordered the fresh oysters for me, because he doesn't like it, he was worried they would see me eat it. I hope they don't trip about that because we paid for 4 AYCE so no matter who eats the 1 order per person stuff, we can get 4 orders. So don't trip on little things like that for the price we're paying.  2. I know it was a little busy but if you're gonna put a time limit, you should make sure you're  fully staffed enough so people can get their orders in. There was a point in time neither of us 4 had any food to eat LOL. First world problems, I know..but still...Time is money.  All in all, I'd go again. I'd probably just sit at a table next time, since I really just like sitting at the bar if we can order directly from the chef. You don't really do that here. Okay bye.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummayyyy
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceviche. YUM!
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish Katsu. Bomb!

qLilF3VDP_1l3SNdMXmBjg.text: ITS AYCE - so one must withhold their usual sushi quality expectations.   But with that said - I haven't been this disappointed with an AYCE sushi restaurant in a long, long time.  The sashimi just was NOT fresh. Whether it was the salmon, tuna, ono, yellowtail, uni, or the sweet shrimp - all you can taste is the FISHINESS of everything. The rice was huge, the quality was poor, and to top it off wreak of fishiness.  After my first round of sashimi, I was so turned off by their nigiri I ended up ordering hot food instead in fear of food poisoning.  The only thing Umiya has going for them is that their service was very attentive.   But even that was then undid when I had to experience the horrendousness of sitting at the bar and watching their kitchen staff grounding up raw salmon and tuna like it was ground beef. No reputable sushi restaurant should be treating precious sashimi that way.

ynFxbO-xVxePh2IQZjW-LQ.text: Covered all the essential elements for me, good space (I hate being cramped with other tables), nice menu selection -something for everyone, good prices and pleasant, attentive service. Had the tempura, it was fresh and wasn't greasy. Also had the spicy salmon roll and chicken teriyaki which was a pleasant suprise, Chicken teriyaki roll was a meal in itself accompanied with a side of chicken teriyaki and vegetables. Not the best ive had but certainly good enough to visit again.

8koye-p7aA4SLf7PkJc-Rw.text: Amazing sushi and fast service. This is the only place I go for my AYCE sushi fix. The screaming O with tuna is always a good choice as is the sunrise roll. They are usually busy so we try and go on a week day.

giO_wL3yNBj6G8vahiwMPA.text: I have been to a couple of ayce sushi in Vegas.  But hands down this is the best place to go.  The wait time wasn't too bad. $25 was the dinner price!  The place had a fun atmosphere. And the table they had was a good size for ayce.  The menu had a variety and not just sushi and sashimi. They had filet mignon, oyster shooters, ramen, udon, miso soup, and of course all the other sushi you would find at a sushi joint! The fish were fresh and the rolls they made are a good size. They also have a full bar.  Last but not least, they had ice cream and mochi ice cream! I'm a dessert person, so I always make room for dessert! You gotta check out the green tea mochi ice cream!   The waiters were very friendly and always checked in on you. They always come back to fill up your water.  I would come back again the next time I'm in Vegas. This is my new spot and I'll definitely come by and bring some friends for good times and good eats!
