A3lo2WzvVvw4aHBF_UZsvw.text: Great value for the AYCE buck, especially for dinner!  Even those in our party who aren't sushi fans had enough menu options to have a great dinner as well.  Rolls and other AYCE items were all prepped well and served quickly.  Be forewarned, however, about the limits on the luncheon AYCE menu.

yNridzBAyWFC_UCjUPvktA.text: This place is fantastic. Great choices. All you can eat the the sushi bar is highly recommended. The chefs are fantastic and very hospitable and friendly.   The sauces and the flavor is authentic.   Saw the food inspector give an A+ rating while I was dining.   Great place. Definitely visiting again

8RJO6SGA44-ewZaJtT_9tg.text: Average sushi place. Nothing fancy. Ambiance is ok but we don't come here to eat the ambiance right

pT_JvRGgcGRNJ8HMedPSNQ.text: It was my first time visiting this restaurant and I left with a smile. My friends and I decided to check this place out and ordered all-you-can eat lunch buffet. Restaurant is quite spacious and tables can fit up to 8 people. Service is good and staff is attentive to refill our drinks before it runs out.   Tips: The sushi roll comes in a half portion, give yourself an opportunity to try other things in the menu. If you couldn't finish it, they are very strict on charging you for what you did not finish.

Ikz8L4nz14vKoZGhZA4wjw.text: In this review tried some new items that never had before because really the menu is that extensive never going too fit all in. Why would you? Each visit can be all its own going with more little side dishes plus sushi, all sushi, some ramen or udon and sushi. Endlesssss. I wanted too try the ramen on the menu. It on point tasty and delicious like everything else on the menu! The broth such nice depth of flavor unique taste unlike other True ramen restaurants. It little less salty then other places, the noodles solid, and AYCE just the right size portion have room for other stuff.   Sushi Chef Alex is awesome. I was able too try some stuff not even on the AYCE menu. I had the black sea bass nigiri style, fresh eel (he showed me fresh eel; ever since my experience at Yummy feel sushi chef presents the fish see that quality adds personal touch) that never had before amazing, and even more AMAZING thing was the fresh Umi. Unfortunately again not on the AYCE but presented fresh UMI then he literally cut it open served order a la carte another table but kind enough make me one nigiri. Wow! If could get that kind of fresh Umi I would kill the whole population of Umi. Lol! Lunch is never that crowded really one of the best times too go. Truly one of my best sushi experience one that not only truly feel sushi chef Alex passion for sushi, the attention too service is on point (never have empty glass of soda or water), and all sushi chefs are easy too talk stories with just makes it that much more enjoyable. I can not give Chef Alex enough stars because every time I have gone in he shows passion for sushi, bringing in different fish, and makes sure you have the best sushi experience. On my last visit I took my brother and his family Umiya first time. Chef Alex came around the sushi bar say Hello, check up, and if anything else we needed or wanted too try. It that kind of service that almost lost art in this day and age of culinary scene or big names. The only bummer is they no longer do all you can drink. It buy two get the third one free. I go Umiya for the food not so much drinking. It not missed too much.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso ramen for AYCE

jBAjedBdHP5d28hio2xO2g.text: This restaurant is the reason that I want to go back to Las Vegas.  I discovered this gem while staying at The Palms a few years ago and have come back during every stay.  I've eaten in some of the best sushi restaurants in New York and this place takes them on nearly every level.    The staff is amazing.  The prices are great.  The food is outstanding.  This is what, in my mind, a sushi restaurant should be.  Pro-Tip: They have an all you can eat lunch special.  I forget the price, but it's worth it.

P25oZEhtfoRw0jDyiSpC0Q.text: It's pretty close to 3.75 stars.    They offer a few dishes most AYCE sushi joints don't like ribeye Big Wong style, fresh oysters,  and kushiyaki (meat on a stick) options like bacon wrapped scallops.  It's actually a good place to bring that one friend who dislikes sushi.  I also like the all you can drink beer/wine/sake option for $10 more but they said they're going to change it next month.  Ummm....why??    This location used to be Kaizen and you can definitely tell from the look of the place.  Interesting mix of old and modern and the long tables definitely encourage groups to stay a while.  We sat at the bar to pick the chefs brain on recommendations.  The whole staff was Korean.  Not too much of a big deal for me.    Sushi standouts were the halibut and super white tuna nigiri.  The chef, Alex, said it was the freshest fish they had and it was great.  There were a ton of great options if you like cream cheese, rolls deep fried or something in unagi sauce.  I am not one of those people but knock yourself out a la Drago vs Creed if you are.  Basic rolls were fine and the freshness was acceptable.      I was really intrigued that they offered both miso and tonkotsu ramen.  I just HAD to try half a bowl of tonkotsu made by Koreans.  The noodles, broth and 2 big pieces of pork belly were pretty good but it wasn't exactly Japanese ramen.  Koramen?  Alex took pride in the fact he made the broth from scratch as he should..it was tasty but not Japanese by any means.    Service was definitely on top of things.  There were 3 waiters checking on us throughout the meal and earned their gratuity.

PfqgpMc-gCKU42eS-0J2aA.text: I didn't like the second experiencie in this place. The server looked miserable. And it was very hard to make a small order.

Yiq9GdIX64EnZ4x4abJUeg.text: Loved it, fresh food, great service and amazing atmosphere will reccend this to others who love fresh sushi!!

_vf3RLm7bvdlSWyBaWdRFg.text: Super hungry in Vegas. Took a chance and stopped by the UMIYA Modern Japanese restaurant. Absolutely amazing! Great atmosphere, great food, friendly service and reasonable prices. Has the all you could eat. Winning!!! All the way!

qTL-OOmWClk8_FfIElRlrQ.text: Excellent service, very attentive staff and the food is excellent.  I come here at least 3 times a month and they never fail to impress. This is the spot where my girlfriend and I call "our place".

abBUmQ413BgpIFDctoItOw.text: This place is amazing you have been to over 20 sushi restaurants in Vegas and Umiya sushi is the best in the city! Their 25 dollar all you can eat is so worth in, appetizers, sushi, and ice cream! Truly amazing! The service is crazy fast and right on point, and always correct even with those party's of 6 or more! 9n3RjMss-4PM-HzaIdlJ5g.text: Las Vegas, you've spoiled me. AYCE everywhere. Why I haven't gained any pounds since I've been here beats me.  The interior is large, dark and earthy. Sitting at the bar, you get a feel for the chefs and their sushi-styling. I mainly ordered nigiri and side dishes from the kitchen. The ratio of fish-to-rice was decent enough, however I felt that the rice was over seasoned to the point that it hindered the delicate nature of some of the fish. My friend seemed to like it though. For the side dishes, the servers helped us as best as they could. I went through most items, requesting gluten-free if possible so that my friend could try.  The chefs were very accommodating for my gluten-free friend. They even checked all their ingredients / packaging for hidden wheat. It was then that we all found out that the masago unfortunately had wheat in it.

vC2jpEuApoXp9enjJfbjGQ.text: Quality sushi and great variety. Menu is much more than just sushi i like the variety that they have. Price is definitely reasonable for AYCE.

76AmDDL3lOCDXyqm6dgFaQ.text: The best sushi AYCE in Las Vegas! As a photographer I do a lot of meeting and this is has always been the first place to go with my future clients :)  Service is great, all the food is fresh and the restaurant has a amazing atmosphere! ENJOY!

Yha34t7tK4ngdyk9RB-3_Q.text: I love sushi ! And after trying lots and lots of sushi places this is my favorite  ! Everything is delicious and fresh . And their menu has so many different rolls , it's amazing . The atmosphere is always energetic and they are always busy . The servers are always nice and professional , every time I was there I liked how I was served . I like their bar also, it's something original from other sushi places. So give it a try , I promise you will love it !

OVXB7bNbdjJUG36EZypfbQ.text: Loved the variety on their menu and the decor...service could've been better but overall, my tummy was happy. :)

qsAp3HlLqquvlbxL3pk_CA.text: You gotta get here just to see the Alex/Pete/Eric Show, it's crazy! The sushi chefs are just one amazing thing about this place. You will love all of the reasons, though, I promise!  First, the menu is EX-TEN-SIVE. For an AYCE place to have this many choices (granted, some are 1X only) is mind-blowing. From the nigiri, to the appetizers, right on down to the mochi, you will be hoping for a second stomach by the time all is said and done. I certainly needed one!  I made the mistake of filling up on rolls instead of the fresh fish, I won't do that again. The albacore, salmon, oysters, filet, pork, octopus, whatever you want, it's delicious! The rolls were awesome too, but with such a huge selection you'll do better to keep those to a minimum.   I did happen to ask for their hottest roll and they made one up that is now named after me (yeah, right). It was hot, spicy and delicious. I'm sorry, I ate so much last night I forgot what was in it, but I'm pretty sure it was basically seafood and avocado dipped in hot ass sauce. Whew!  The service was superb. I didn't wait for drinks or food for very long at all. I loved it! The place is also beautiful and big so bring a party, you'll enjoy the heck out of it!  I'm headed back in a few months once all this sushi is digested. Wow, ate so much. Enjoy!

gbljO-24uHrW89MKjG23yg.text: My husband and I love this place! We come pretty regularly because the food is delicious and reasonably priced. We typically order a la carte, but the all you can eat menu is definitely worth a try if you're coming with a big appetite.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Teriyaki Role with veggie tempura and bacon wrapped scallops (my fave!!)

iU1rl4vuqP5hTIzLWaHEKg.text: First time trying an AYCE sushi spot in Vegas and definitely gals we found this spot! Rolls are tasty, large selection BC they do have a FULL menu to choose from unlike other places that have limited Options. Staff was friendly an of Def coming back!!!

3zAunvmRHYLGzzYB37Z7Dw.text: During my time in Vegas, I came here after finding this as the closest yelp listing for buffets to where we were staying at. I believe it was $22 per person for AYCE. Service was good and the hosts were very attentive to us.   When the first 5 rolls we ordered came out, I immediately stuffed my face with food as fast as I could. I think that wasn't a good idea because by the time we got to the last 3-4 plates, I was just eating the rolls in avoidance of getting charged, and everything just started to not taste pleasant anymore. But at least we managed to try 16 different rolls off the menu.  Word of advice: Order half rolls!!!! Gives you the opportunity to taste different things off the menu and knit pick which ones are your favorites. I think my favorite rolls had to be the sunset roll, shrimp tempura roll, and Snow White roll. on the other hand, I really liked the chicken katsu roll. Next time I'm in Vegas I'll definitely hit this place up again if I'm ever craving for sushi.

QcknpU3ZZ-MBbKocIRvZ8Q.text: This place was really good.  Great food. Good price. Trust the reviews. Place fills up quick so hurry over.

4kmm_IPlmLwKD3k9eGtwNA.text: Too much rice :( made it harder to enjoy the sushi.  But overall a great experience. Not surprising everything they serve is frozen but I prefer that for food safety reasons. Tried nearly every raw fish but only thing I would avoid is the mackerel. It needed more acid, it's a very oily fish.   My biggest problem was the warm oysters. Not feeling sick yet.   Also try the yuzu! Ceviche is a nice touch

fwh1u0BeUwws_SIfyXAC-g.text: I'm still fairly new to the Las Vegas are so I am still trying to get aware of all the AYCE sushi bars around here.  This one is at the top of my list so far.  I had gone with a group of my boys from college, trying to satisfy our late night sushi cravings!  We were sat right away and started off ordering the load of nigiri. I think our first order was 10 Hamachi, 5 sake, 5 maguro.  When I go out for sushi I don't mess around! The thing I loved most about this place was that the nigiri came with small portions of the rice and a good sized slice of sashimi on top.  The sake (salmon) was oh so good! melt in your mouth kind of fish.  They also had many great appetizers to choose from my favorite had to be the either the fried soft shell crab and baked mussels, literally heaven!  The staff was great, our waitress was funny and even cracked jokes with us during the night which I always like seeing.  The only con I have about this place is that when i ordered my uni is tasted a little frozen not as fresh as the other places I have around Vegas.    But for the most part I enjoyed this place very much and will definitely be back for another round at Umiya :)

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Mussels!!!

_iTaaX9rGNwrV5ntsdZOEw.text: Glad I found this place on Instagram! Me and my friends came here after cruising around Fremont St. after midnight. They open until 2am, so my first impression would be that the food won't be fresh and that they would be rushing us to get out of there, lack of service. I was totally wrong!! We came and opt for the AYCE and the owner (I think) said they stopped taking orders around 1:20am so we were okay with that. We were seated and I ordered whatever that caught my attention to ensure I got to try everything before the cut off time. Everything was made to order and served in little platters one by one and everything was delicious!! They limit certain dishes to one at a time which is good because I would've just ordered probably 3 plates of everything because my eyes are bigger than my stomach! They have ramen, steak, teriyaki, nigiri, tempura, appetizers, dessert, grilled fish, etc! It's about $27 per person after tax and it is definitely worth it. Also, free soda with Yelp check in. Everything was nice, hot and fresh except for the uni, which was so bad you can see it in the color but it was okay because it was near closing so I skipped it. I especially like the fresh oysters and the spicy tuna over crispy rice! Felt bad I couldn't finish some items because I was so full and I read that if you don't finish your food, you will be charged for it! I got scared so I forced myself to it but the owner was really nice, she brought out the check and didn't charge us for it and not only did her and her employees didn't make us feel rushed or bad we came in late but they were really friendly! I definitely recommend this place to my friends and I will of course be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled squid
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye steak
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soft shell crab

r8zUt_LicEPBJZh344zvVw.text: I wanted to try a new sushi spot for AYCE sushi and this place popped it. Boy did I strike gold! I am so glad that I came across this place. I usually frequent Sushi House Goyemon whenever I have that sushi craving but this one is up there with it. There are somethings that are done better here than over there and vice versa but Umiya was a pleasant surprise. They have a huge selection and have a 90 minute time limit.  Highlights: Crispy Rice with Spicy Tuna - OMG can I say that this was one of the best crispy rice and spicy tuna combos I have ever had. The rice was perfectly crispy and didn't overwhelm the spicy tuna. The Spicy tuna was perfect and had the right taste - I could taste the freshness of the fish.  I had two orders of these because they were THAT good.  Nigiri, Salmon and albacore - the fish was super fresh and exactly what I expected. They didn't overdo the rice like they do at other places so I am thankful for that.   Agedashi Tofu - THE BEST AGEDASHI TOFU I'VE EVER HAD. Yes, I had to put that in all caps to emphasize how good it was. I had 4 orders. You heard that correctly. I know this is a sushi place but they do all of their other non-sushi dishes so well! The broth was delicious and the batter was light and crispy while the tofu was silken and melted in my mouth.  Spicy Tuna Salad - large chunks of tuna in a spicy sauce mix. Delicious! Too bad you can only order 1 of these per person.  The only negative thing I would have to say about this place is that they have more dishes that are only 1 per person (desserts, some sushi items, etc) than Goyemon and that they don't do half rolls (so I can't try as many rolls as I would if I were to go to Goyemon). Other than that, they are on par with other AYCE sushi places and I will definitely be coming back!

ntTZF05lqdhE1PbG3R5QnQ.text: Cheap prices for Amazing Menu selection. Foodelicous!!! If you're in Vegas u should definitely visit this restaurant. It's a must ^_^

xa7K3RHNtB85x5cOIsqz4A.text: The food at Umiya is good . I like the sushi rolls, seafood, and more. I would like to go back with my family anytime when I go to Las Vegas.

2_rY36soU5rO8McUlGa5Fg.text: This place was good.  Sushi quality was good and their menu was huge including rib eye steak and banana splits. Ayce

XK-up6BLK9QY3nqsGlzaig.text: I really enjoyed their sushi. When i went there at 9:00 PM, this place was packed.. But still they brought sushi really fast.. All the sushi i ordered tasted really good and fresh..

fEPFe_ObUIShykcdjTLVkQ.text: There's many AYCE in town and you gotta standout to get noticed. A few things going for them off the bat - right by the strip ( off Flamingo in the strip mall by the Palms casino) so easy for industry folks and tourist to hit up, it's nicely decorated, open late until 2am daily and the menu selection is large and offering unique items other spots do not in terms of appetizers. Probably a good place to take folks who aren't sushi people when you want to eat sushi yet try to still meet them halfway.   Appetizers  Screaming O Salad - seared salmon (or tuna - your choice) with spicy ponzu, mayo, shredded daikon, mixed greens - decent but I think I prefer without the greens which is how most places do it. Oysters - it was a  briny varietal probably from SoCal waters so I'm not a fan. Tuna sashimi w/ AJ sauce - good but only 2pcs  Grilled Yellowtail collar - awesome! one of my favorite things, but most places you can only order one whereas there isn't a order limit here!  Soft Shell Crab - another favorite and theirs were lightly battered but crisp and with a tiny bit of Japanese mustard sauce on top.  Bacon wrapped scallop skewer - reminds me of bacon wrapped dates as the sauce had that similar sweet flavor about it  spicy rice cake skewer - crisp outside and chewy inside, the way I prefer my dokbokki Crispy rice with spicy tuna - these were large compared to other places and came 4 to a order!  Pork belly - pretty good and base. It's thin slices and grilled like KBBQ, not roasted in a big hunk and then sliced.  Nigiri  There are daily specials so ask a server or look at the small glowing board on the left wall of the sushi bar. The specials today were sea bream which was fresh and really good, spanish mackerel which was decent though I thought maybe the sauce was slightly too sweet for it, giant clam which was crunchy in a surprising way and I like the thin slice of nori on it. Super white - pretty fresh here!  Seared Salmon - more like peppered style than a fresh torch like some bars do. I liked it and enjoyed the flavor of the pepper and ponzu sauce.  Peppered Albacore - this was good, but thought the seared salmon was better. Yellowtail - this was just OK, had a different flavor about it. Don't know how to describe, just different and the BF didn't like it.  Tuna - acceptable level of freshness, but nothing outstanding.  Masago - good, but I don't know when masago is ever bad.  Uni - pretty fresh and was sweet so I was pleased. Mackerel - not a salty nor vinegary brine to this so I wonder if it was cured at all? It was fresh though, but not what I'm accustomed to.   Sushi  Snow White - this is the BFs favorite roll elsewhere and I think it's better made here. It's spicy diced up soft shell crab, avocado topped with super white tuna that's been torched and then Japanese mustard sauce.  Salmon Skin Hand Roll - it wasn't crispy enough so it wasn't too pleasing to have a few bites with chewy skin bits.   Rice to fish ratio here was very good, more fish than there is rice for sure. No roll half orders except for one per person here. Like always, stuff like uni and specials are one per person as well.   Dessert is included. and we got a mochi and a tempura green ice cream.  Service  The service was very nice. We had a male server that checked on us and was super friendly explaining everything. We also had a female server that took our initial orders and also often brought us plates. The sushi bar was also friendly and asked if everything was tasting right and how was our experience at the end of the meal. It's evident that they do care about the customer, which is hugely appreciated by me.   I don't think they have a stamp card, at least non was offered to us.  Overall, this was a solid inaugural visit. I think it has a lot of good things going for it so I'm sure I'll be back. I don't think it tops my favorite spot, but I think it's good to put into the rotation.

roVMJB50-K2-ak0irlp7Mg.text: This sushi restaurant has such good quality food I mean it's open late and it's never that busy so you can be seated right away and get your food fast! Unlike goyemon ugh literally I'd have to wait like 30-40 mins every single time I go to goyemon and honestly their food isn't that great of quality I mean their mussels are kinda nasty. This is the first sushi restaurant in Vegas where their mussels were so delicious I finished the whole thing. Their rolls are pretty dang good too. They even have a check in that gives you one free soda and they allowed us to get lemonade for it so that was pretty amazing too. I came here just because goyemons wait was like 30-40 mins and umiya was not busy at all, their price for all you can eat is $25 and a few rolls can fill you up quickly plus their fish was so fresh so good. Plus the portions are a bit bigger too. I loved it. I mean next time I'm coming here to eat I don't know why goyemons so hyped this place is the place you should go. definitely coming back here again

She quickly and kindly answered our questions about the menu. I am willing to make another visit to this restaurant. The food is very fresh and high quality. Food comes quickly! Awesome service once again! Will come back for future business meetings.

DnKy9EicYLhmOolwdnwyKQ.text: First off this is a great AYCE sushi spot after hours. I get off at 11pm and this is the spot me and my co workers go to when we are craving delicious sushi. I haven't found many late night spots like this with amazing food. The staff are awesome and the food comes within 5-10 minutes of ordering. This is the go to place for late night sushi.

C6YgazFvabIKiFKtUYByrA.text: Great sevice and great food keep me comming back again and again.   The roll king of the ocean is my favorite roll I order every time.   I have even turned my family and friends onto this place.      Now I am also having buinsess lunches here when I can

WdY77RdnRciVeI5MKWb_WQ.text: The only other time I've cried at a restaurant was when I hit my foot on a barstool at Hooter's - I fractured two toes and ended up with a deformed foot because I neglected to follow up with the proper medical precessional. The second time, I had Umiya's phenomenally varied and scrumptious AYCE menu, priced well within the range of a pillow, assuming that the only pillows you buy cost $20.99.

3Qus8oFc8hccVfBgt8PEYA.text: First attempted to come on weekend for dinner and no reservation. Big mistake restaurant was packed with a 2 hour wait.  Came back on a weekday about 2pm. Perfect time not so busy and was seated in about 5 mins. We ordered all u can eat. Great selections and very tasty. Skewers was very small but lucky it's all you you can eat. Shrimp tempura BOMB!! Sushi big portions! Definitely will be back.

HorsZfps3EfxCQlm63-nuw.text: The best all you can eat sushi in town!!! Fast service and everyone is very friendly!

PrQXe7qXMxfnCnBJ4I4_cQ.text: Fast and friendly staff. Food is amazing and very fresh. I plan on coming back. The Salmon Killer is one of the best and so is the Orange Blossom. I also had the prime rib that was pretty good. It was a 30min wait period and they got us in in 15min

Kffa8erOhWbukjLchvEOpw.text: Fast serving. Fresh ingredients. Great taste. Wide menu. Undoubtedly the best in town.

BsFDvJyQctsXGjgFehOcxA.text: Went in for lunch on a Monday afternoon and got the All You Can Eat special for $20.95. Service was fast and polite and the sushi chefs were especially nice. They allow you to order multiple orders of nigiri at once and their Miso Ramen soup was perfect. Would definitely return.

PP2NpyExYN5gpMSPpr3T0A.text: I absolutely love this place. The food and service is amazing. The staff is some of the best in town!!!

zbG-XOOk1uyz7T8WoUKqVQ.text: OMG, SO GOOD!  That's how I would describe the service and food at Umiya Sushi.  I've been there twice and the second time I brought a friend with me to enjoy the "All You Can Eat" menu!  I will continue to bring friends and family to experience this restaurant.  The food is very fresh and delicious!  And the servers are attentive and helpful.  I've lived in Las Vegas 23 years, I wish I would have found them sooner!  Highly Recommend this place!

SwKFmA0ZZ-oejjZ49LhCPQ.text: I've come here several times always with large groups. There's a ton of options, and everything is really delicious, so each person always gets what they want. The service is really fast as well. Highly recommend it!

j-vAPpaEF1wSaM24k2S5YQ.text: exceptional sushi and service!! lots of delicious veggie options. a must visit in sin city.

73otqPqGv103DloVI_s-Ow.text: Went here with the hubby and a couple of friends. Not the best that we have had but not the worst either. Service was mediocre, we had several different people come to our table, it was not like when you have 1 person designated to you so they know what you ordered, food came out very slowly, we had to ask 3 times about the fried shrimp heads to the sweet shrimp sushi that was long gone. 3 different people told us it is coming, when it came it was cold, like it was sitting. Oh well, on to the rest of the food.....if it is on the specials board, you need to try the salmon belly nigiri and yuzu hamachi. The rolls were ok, and the hot and cold apps are the norm of what you get at other AYCE suchi places. We may give this place another chance but there are other AYCE sushi places out there that are better.

ANHkh4XrqrfM4OdoIWOaCw.text: First time trying this Restaurant and the food is lovely, the atmosphere is great but the staff did not seem to know who was doing what! We sat down and a waiter took our drinks order and then maybe 2 minutes later a waitress came over and asked what we wanted. This happened several times over the course of the evening. Not to mention we had to order something's over again because the food never arrived. From what did arrive the cali rolls and the shrimp tempura are to die for! But the Japanese steak looks, smells and tastes like a bad hamburger... So I guess it's hit or miss!

4gHlsjxKUbqgo-_bkcdG-g.text: Arrived with a party of 13 during a weekend lunch- Staff handled flawlessly even though all other tables full as well.   Nice job!

Yd5npKhinS2nONT4eyc0Gw.text: Great food ! Eric the chef was amazing ! He answered all of our questions with a smile and was more than happy to help us! Also my cup was never empty, bussers did an amazing job refilling my cup ! (That helps with spicy sushi) this cali native that just moved to vegas will continue to come to umiya for my sushi needs!

yddRZV3VsLAgw6rrQinp9A.text: Very Good Sushi & I highly recommend the All You Can Eat for $25.95 (Dinner), best Sushi in Town!!!

gnqornMtx5erbuR2t6MFng.text: Excellent food, friendly staff, overall impressed!  Maybe just don't charge for the use of gluten-free soy sauce... besides that I loved it!  Will definitely visit again.  The Bamboo Roll is absolutely incredible, must try.

oDJBhn4iHcjeqsdi_lPShg.text: I usually am very picky with sushi restaurants but boy is this place the best in town! None of the other places iv been to compare to Umiya. Sushi always taste fresh and the size of rice underneath the fish is perfect! Not huge so you can enjoy eating the fish. So glad we tried this restaurant especially because i was hesitant! I will say that the mochi ice cream they served me wasn't good I'm pretty sure it was old or something because I grew up eating it and never has it tasted that horrible.

sMbE7bNiD8phMNikmObtOg.text: the "all you can eat" at umiya is superb!!!... a lot of great tasting selections at a very reasonable price... I've been loyal to another sushi place for the last 5 years and I think now I've got a new all you can eat sushi spot... service was very accomodating and friendly, food was great and ambiance was relaxing... will definitely recommend this place to family and friends!!!

V0uiVvMf7_ZdKfAYwlvGiw.text: UMIYA is the best place for a low key lunch or dinner after a long day on the strip everything I ordered, myself and  the wifey had over 9 dishes each better than the next. I recommend the screaming o salad and the dumplings a must for every visit to Las Vegas

UZr2QTswydBZE1Po3U9UOg.text: used to love this place...they changed the crab they used...which is more like a crab stick...makes the roll taste dry and flavorless. got a shrimp tempura roll not even sure if Shrimp was in it. will not return....

CUzkOrChLP_1puR9KPuLOQ.text: Loved everything! Amazing food and value for all you can eat. Not your normal all you can eat - even had blue fin tuna. Great meal!

AehRA2OwsK0YEsHsg5uj9g.text: Food was delicious! Highly recommend eating here. Service was great as well! The all you can eat menu is delicious and not to mention a great deal. If you're in the mood for sushi, Umiya is the place to go!

jj9RSl0IrDJDOVjjzxF8Qg.text: It was so great experience at umiya sushi! I was surprised by their fresh fish and quality. I will definitely come back!

2QGLtlcw4ye4IBicMrcdDA.text: The most amazing sushi I have ever had. The all you can eat is reasonable and not limited. You can chose from so many things for all you can eat. Service was great, they accommodated for my boyfriend and I even though we were a little difficult. We thought friends were coming so we moved from the bar to a table and they never came. The server didn't make it a big deal at all. Everyone was very nice.

gQONY4sjxd89gCxQ-pxeSw.text: every chefs are awesome and fun. they made beautiful and tasty rolls for me and my wife. the services are sooo good also servers are kind. It was really nice sushi place. I  had a best sushi ever in vegas. I love this place!!

69UetnvuEGnq12paqk_2DQ.text: Amazing deal for the lunch all-you-can-eat.  They don't overdue it on the fillers.  Tuna, ribeye and tempura were excellent

yevkAkK2spjwOe5cmkESHw.text: Sushi is decent.  Service could calm down a little.  As soon as I am done with a dish, a waiter jumps out of nowhere to ask if I am done with the dish.  The constant interruption of a waiter asking to take an empty plate really kills the mood.  No kidding...as I am "finishing" a plate of food, three waiters with 2 minutes asked if I was finished with my plate. NO, I am not.  Was there a shortage of plates?  Jeez.

W2-bY7KBhlVuSZt2BOo-mw.text: This is my second time here, and I was even more impressed than the first time!! The service was EXCELLENT, everyone was incredibly helpful and attentive, but not intrusive!! The chefs and the waitstaff were all very knowledgeable with questions, and Ginny, our server was really sweet and made great suggestions!  The quality of the fish is top notch, and I have never seen such an extensive AYCE menu, for $25.95 for dinner, it is an INCREDIBLE deal! They don't pile on the rice for filler, we were each able to try several dishes, including three unique specials! All three were fish I had never tried, and were delicious! I usually base my opinion of the quality of a place on their saba, uni and fresh oysters- these all taste bad when improperly handled, or not fresh, but Umiya nailed all three, they were perfect!!  This is definitely my new spot for sushi, and it is more centrally located than my previous faves too! Parking is really easy, and even though the place looked fairly packed the food came out FAST with no mistakes! All three of us were incredibly impressed, and would recommend Umiya to anyone!!

l3itaMY_UNn3_YQTR_yx9A.text: I absolutely love this place.. there is a small amount of AYCE in town that never disappoint and this is definitely one of them. I started coming here few years back, and it wasn't busy and now they are always packed,but still the wait is never too long and customer service is great. The food is absolutely amazing, always fresh and comes out fairly fast. I highly recommend this place.

Vk-luPPLW_CKgNyKRG6Exg.text: The sushi here tastes fresh! One of my favorite things about coming to this sushi spot is that they don't drench their sushi (nigiri) with sauces. The fish tastes fresh and not fishy. A small dab into your soy sauce with wasabi and it's good to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wBF1wfWDmhBhW3sDF3vgOg.text: This place is booming with regulars. $25 for AYCE sushi , rolls and cooked stuff. Well it's not 100% AYCE, some items you can only order once and those are the good items. Each sushi is thinly cut but at least the rice isn't overly too much. I wish the rice had more vinegar in it and softer. The sushi rice was cold and tasteless.   Service was pretty much on top of things and orders were made quite fast. There were like six Korean guys behind the counter making every sushi order.   The place had TV's so you can be in there watching the game. They give you 90 minutes to eat as much as possible.   For the bang for the buck it's cheaper than the casinos and they have a good variety of items to eat.

TF6xsCoMMMxvGZ0lZZ242g.text: Best AYCE sushi restaurant I've been to and really a great price point.   We feared the long lines and wait we had read about in other reviews and when we called they warned of a 1-2 hour wait. However, when we arrived we were seated in mere minutes.  The fish quality and really food quality overall is pretty surprisingly good for AYCE. One thing that really stands out is the variety of their menu. It is rare that an AYCE place lets you order shucked oysters, rib eye, and ramen/udon in addition to everything else on the menu.  Service is also tremendous here. They gave us a wrong order or an extra portion but quickly remedied the issue. They are also constantly available to take your orders and the food comes out so fast.   The Yelp-check-in deals gets you a free drink which is always nice. Overall, I remember the yellowtail and albacore being especially impressive. The rice to fish ratio is definitely in the customer's favor. Easily my new favorite AYCE place in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots of food!

v-UpMfWuV9xFBcOonjRsOA.text: The set up to this restaurant is pretty cool. I like how the decor is and how there's TVs set up around the place. I like how to the left when you enter theres a bunch of lights draping. It gives the place a romantic vibe.   I came on a Friday around 4:00pm and it was dead. Which I liked because from the reviews I really thought it was going to be a busy.   I ordered a few of the popular rolls such as: King of the ocean, Kiss of fire, First kiss, sunset, sunrise, rainbow, firecracker, etc. also ordered a bunch of nigiri.   I honestly wasn't too impressed with the fish. It wasn't as fresh as I would have hoped. And the flavors didn't go as well either. There was one roll I got called Seafood Volcano Roll and it was a bit of a mess. There was a lot of things going on with it. It had mushrooms which I thought was a bit out of the ordinary but didn't go very well with the fish.   I ordered a spicy seafood salad, which I thought was really good. It had a lot of fish in it and the dressing was just right. They have a variety of mochi ice cream flavors which was appreciated but of course it is just 1 order per person. I tried their plum wine flavored ice cream which I really thought was delicious!   Service was great. Staff was nice and attentive. Goyemon is still my #1 AYCE.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First kiss
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green chili tempura roll

nWkN0OhNsNySPcrh5XWTvQ.text: Came here a few weeks back, had great sushi. i tried the jalapeno poppers and they were excellent. Although the service wasn't very friendly..

9_NuD3RX2prPwcgFwcmHuQ.text: We have been here for around 3 years, it was super busy for each time we came, but we have never had disappointed, the service was good of course we tip good also, highly recommend.

-sGmvfGWG1KnSmlYSBgBVQ.text: Still my favorite AYCE sushi place in Vegas. My partner is from the Bay Area, CA and was blown away by the quality of meat from this place and the abundant selection of sushi rolls to choose from. We came around 7pm and waited about 15 minutes, we had a huge table to ourselves so that was a plus!  Tip- they no longer offer their Yelp offer of free soda with a Checkin, wish they would make note of that on here.

1bmA-5hd9zrGA0Ex-uzC5w.text: I recently found another GEM!  UMIYA SUSHI has a very welcoming atmosphere.  The staff works in tandum to unsure excellent customer service..   The food was fresh, scrumptious and well-prepared!    If you are a sushi enthusiast I would definatley recommend eating here be it lunch or dinner you will be happy you did.    Thank you for commitment to quality food and exceptional service!

AISSEBIcaHyhrkHz_LSK_Q.text: AYCE sushi! Dinner start at 1500. Close by the strip. Our favs Uni, hamachi, super white, soft shell crab, yuzu cerviche, yellowtail, Masago, ikura. Fresh! Friendly and prompt!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AYCE Sushi! Dinner starts at 3pm! Our favs Uni, Hamaci, Ono, Yuzu Cerviche, soft shell crab. Fresh! Friendly! Prompt!

a1Vz9JXh7Oj5JRsjdmA-uA.text: All you can eat sushi!? That sounded awesome ! When we got there , we got seated immediately with our reservations for 14 people. It was right before it got crowded too.  We ordered a bunch of stuff and they came out relatively quick. However, the fish didn't seem to taste that fresh and it was alright... The fried appetizers weren't very appealing either. It seemed soggy almost.  They also ran out of tea cups for some of us .. So we couldn't get tea .. Not til the end .   I don't recommend the tempura ice cream.. It tasted so odd... And the ice cream was so bitter.. Not in a good way either.

PCcgvFG6qIfXm1rF01mNYA.text: In this city of sushi bars galore, finding a good one can be tough. In the past, I had two favorites. One of which (whose name I can't even remember) was in The Lakes area and closed many years ago. The other one, Kobe, I have since moved too far away from to justify making the hike for AYCE lunch. For all I know, it could end up being dinner by the time I get there from where I currently live.   So, the hunt began for me to find a new sushi joint. I've heard many sing the praises of Yama. I wasn't impressed. Sushi-Mon? Overrated. Ra Sushi? Decent rolls, obnoxiously clubby and trendy atmosphere coupled with high prices and the lack of AYCE. I learned that many of the no-name joints where the main sign literally just says "sushi" are like that for a reason. Sushi 21 was my main go-to for a while, and it was pretty decent, but that's it. Nothing mind-blowing. Eager to have sushi but wanting something mind-blowing, I was led to try this place.  Yes. This place is pretty mind-blowing indeed. It actually blows my prior two faves out of the water.  Located in a strip mall that appears to be slowly becoming Little Tokyo due to all the Japanese-related businesses popping up, it is a space that is fairly large but still maintains a degree of intimacy. The music is noticeable, but not TOO noticeable. The servers are attentive and friendly.   As for the menu? Probably the most extensive AYCE menu I've ever seen. For starters (no pun intended), the list of appetizers is so long that it takes up a whole page. I've never seen that before. There's also some very creative rolls indeed. A chicken katsu roll? Again: Mind. Blown.  Everything came out quite fast, with the pork belly being sizzling hot and the right balance of tough and tender. The chicken katsu being tiny in the most satisfying way possible. Their eel sauce was off the chain. The lobster roll was a bit messy, but that's easily forgiven. I mean, it's chunk lobster meat after all.   The Final Verdict:  Pros: Great ambiance and dining setting. Large AYCE menu at a decent price (20.95 for Lunch) Copious amounts of appetizers on the AYCE menu. Fresh, flavorful and creative rolls.  Cons: Messy lobster roll....but this is minor.  Yum-yum sauce and japanese-style mayo seemed to be everywhere.  Suggestions: Lay off the Japanese mayo please.  Return Factor: 10/10. Already planning on it.

c7Rr8juw-L8HqE7_Skcs3Q.text: I was thinking 2-3 stars. California roll was ok. Tuna and Salmon were ok. Everything else was off. I'd like my money back. 33 bucks for a bad lunch. I would like lunch on you guys.

2rLFnYKq4n8kx6efyYHEmQ.text: 1st of all the price for lunch was not outrageous considering we opted to pay for the all you can eat sushi.. love the no rice sushi, me & hubby are a big fan of that and definitely will order it again.. the service was awesome, made us feel welcome on our 1st try of this place.. we give it a  for the overall rating..

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Nvf4fL2guIqfCEd7vy_FSQ.text: Umiya Sushi was a great dining experience. Umiya is a fairly good size sushi restaurant with beautiful decorations. We were greeted warmly and with a smile which is always a good start to your meal. They have picnic tables in the larger eating areas for those large groups coming for good sushi. With smaller tables scattered about the main dining floor is not to cluttered. We were lucky we got to sit towards the back in one of there rooms that was portioned off by curtains. Our section had two tables it was perfect. We arrived at 6:30 and it was not crazy busy on Saturday, but it got busier when we left at 8. Our waitress was a very polite young lady who took care of us really well. My apologies I for got her name.   The sushi was delicious, period! AYCE for $26 was a great deal. You are always kinda skeptical when you see AYCE sushi for such a great price. We were happily surprised with the quality and portions. Most of our meal we did the half portions which is a good option if you want to try a little bit of everything. After our waitress took our drink orders it was on. Mom & Steph ordered the yuzu drink and loved it so much. We started our first round off with 2 orders of monkey brains, 2 orders of Japanese lasagne, 4 orders yellow tail, 2 orders unagi, 1 order spicy scallop. All was amazing! Portions and sushi on the smaller side but good cause you can eat all kinds of different types of sushi. Second round was more Japanese lasagne 2, 4 yellow tail, 2 maguro, one order each of the rice-less sushi which was different but good, crunchy scallop roll 1. Third round was more yellowtail, maguro, mom got an udon and that was it. We threw in the towel. An amazing meal and a wonderful dining experience. Thank you to the staff at Umiya Sushi on flamingo! We will definitely be back.

LpPUaB1i6eqi28KZsYDvUQ.text: Best sushi in town.Period... Long list of sushi and nagiri too choose from.Always delicious and fresh. The bad thing there always a long waiting line.In weekends evenings it could be an hour.Place is popular.

aEUIaSw9IXJAfh37G7-4-Q.text: Went to Vegas for my birthday and lucked up on this wonderful cuisine. My friends and I decided on the all you can eat and boy it did not fail us. They have a wide variety of things to choose from and to this day my friends and I talk about going back to Vegas just to eat here.

uKqguiMeEarTO-aGy2F_rQ.text: I didn't think I would find THE BEST sushi restaurant I've ever ate at. I'm usually super picky about sushi but oh man has this place have me hooked! They have such unique sushi combinations that really amazed me. I've tried so many different restaurants in Vegas and this is by far THE best place.       To start off the pricing is just like other AYCE sushi places - $25.00 using yelp you also get a free soda!        The staffs gotta be the best as well since you basically don't get one specific server and all the servers work together which isn't something you'll see everyday. They had a really large number of staff which makes it so much more efficient! All the staffs are super super friendly and surprisingly knows the menu by heart and knows what they have in the sushi and what not (really trained). I still can't wrap my head around at the fact that the sushi was so fresh and extraordinarily and that the staffs service was amazing.      The banana roll was my favorite - a great example Of whacky unique flavors that works so well together. You also get ramen/udon to choose from and some yummy appetizers! Mushroom boy was really strange and good too! I'll def be coming back here this is such a good professional place and the food is literally to die for! Thank you!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The most delicious and unique sushi options in Las Vegas!

4Oc3enDUbBZtpHompBdEAg.text: I'll make a bullet list for quick reading:  - excellent, attentive, friendly service (This is what stood out the most) - half rolls readily available - allowance of several appetizers with all-you-can-eat - non-cramped seating - FULL POURS for wine and beer (house wine only $5); amazing Sake - extensive menu  I have never had such incredible service at ANY kind of establishment in my life--and it was busy busy busy. FRIENDLY people constantly refilled our drinks (alcoholic and otherwise), cleared dishes, asked us (at appropriate and non-annoying times) if we needed anything, etc. The sushi chefs were also incredibly diligent; we never had to wait or catch their eye to order, and the rolls came out consistently quickly.   Additionally, they are the only sushi restaurant I've visited in both Vegas and Reno (places in which I've lived for 14 years now, so I've visited quite a few) that allows you to order a huge selection of rolls as half rolls. This may seem like a minor point, but it's a HUGE deal when you've never been to a restaurant before and want to try out several different rolls before your "sushi coma" begins.  They ALSO allowed you to order more than one appetizer with an all-you-can-eat meal! I'm almost certain I've NEVER seen this before at the 20+ sushi restaurants I've visited in Nevada. Fantastic.   The restaurant was clean and spacious, and they actually space people out at the bar in spite of the restaurant being busy. Well done, Umiya!   Check out the Green Chili Tempura roll, as it was excellent!

aLC5yQZNewe5YHIPy-TRPw.text: OMG!! So my man and I came in last night and let me tell you... Amazing!! We had AYCE dinner and came in around 9pm, the room was packed with a single table in the middle, and  we were sat down immediately, and given menus. We ordered water and got right into ordering.   For AYCE dinner you cannot beat the price, 50$ for two and we ordered way more than 50 dollars worth!! The service 10/5 all dirty plates were picked up as soon as we got done, our table was cleared all night long and we were there for two hours!   The servers work as a team (we think) since they were all so helpful and working together it was for sure a well oiled machine! the sushi was great size, perfect amount of rice, and cut nice we loved every thing we ordered!! My man has said it's now his new favorite spot!   Keep this service up!! Its a rarity!

6Txt4OdYVFxmJuooLLzB8A.text: Horrible service. There were 7 of us and they let 3 parties cut in front of us. They were very rude and did not give us an explanation why they didn't sit us, even though there were seats available.

_VrLMCaVxSyoZ9uCZpFNJA.text: The All-U-Can-Eat deal is well worth the price. Food quality and service was great.

E5RV8jD-WaqpWuYeqKzT4Q.text: My husband and I decided to eat here on a Saturday for lunch before I went to work, huge mistake. We were greeted and seated quickly, but getting service wasn't happening. Two people asked us if we wanted anything to drink and that was it. A chef took notice of us and personally took our order. It took about 30 minutes for one of our orders to finally come, and at this point my husband wants to leave because I had work in a few hours. Our appetizers came last and it was difficult to get another order in. The chef was now super busy and he's the one who took our order to begin with. My husband wasn't happy so we asked for the check and that took another 15 minutes. It wasn't worth the money we paid. The food wasn't that great, we've had way better. Not looking forward to giving this place another try.  If you're tight on time, this isn't the place. As a server myself I felt like this place didn't really care if their customers were unhappy. I still left a $15 tip, and my husband said I shouldn't because we didn't even get to finish eating. But I didn't want to stiff them, I know how that feels. They need to be more organized. Other tables had multiple servers asking them if they needed anything and they were told that the other server already helped them. I've taken a liking to Sakana. Busy, but we're always taken care of.

nzTsaL96BohwDDbY5_CP7w.text: So my boyfriend and i came to here the other night. It wasn't too busy, probably because it was a Wednesday. The hostess greeted us, she was very nice and friendly. The food was delicious! I loved everything I had ! And the best part was the service. Everyone helps each other out so you're constantly getting attention. They were all so nice and friendly. I will definitely be coming back !!

u1Od8exiRb3HJtzYkTyBrw.text: One out of my 3 places favorite sushi places. It has cool tables that in American culture kind of look like picnic tables and a screen projector on the wall that projects music videos of popular songs. The food itself is good, all you can eat sushi, my personal favorites include king of the ocean and candy cane. Go give it a try.

p-pZ9sb3jXMKtPkofPKJpg.text: Went into umiya last night and had the worst server ever! He was so rude! Asked if I can have a side of yuzu (because I get it every time I go there) and rudely says "no you can't." I'm a server myself and I was always trained to say I'm sorry but we don't have that available. Asked we could have our edamame seared a little extra and again he said no you can't because we cook it in large batches not just for one table at a time. The food has always been great but this guy was just so rude that he really ruined our meal. Won't be coming back unfortunately.

0lIEnJ5SlKvrV_s8FBVy9Q.text: Service and the food are super good!  Open at 3pm which is very convenient when you want to have a early dinner.  I like the nigiri sushi since the fish are fresh.  I love the uni and salmon!  You have to try their Yuzu soda sparkling water!  So fresh so good!  And... Can I say the do have cute servers!? Lol

qL3PKfeYz-0wSnw5Oc-dvw.text: Down side ... wait time for a larger party. .. we called in but was told no ... waited over 30 min when was told it was going to 15 min ... the 3 smaller parties behind us got in before our group.  Food was good ... OK choices ... good service

PqbOGhcQb16t1d9QrUMM2w.text: This place is probably the worst sushi spot Ive ever been to. The rice is old, and so is their fish. I felt terrible after eating here.  We got several rolls, appetizers and stuff the only thing that was good was the monkey brain deep fried appetizer.  This is the reason why I stay away from uyce spots and buffets, you pretty much get what you pay for!

K8vG3hcQR16-fJN3pCzJuQ.text: Great sushi find! I was staying at the palms and it was right across the street   Perfect way to start my day off with a lot of energy. The rattle snake roll and baby lobster roll is the bomb diggity!!!  Great service and quickly serviced.

GoxQQEQaIgCEJ8mwHPGUSg.text: In Vegas for a vacation with family and friends. We were trying to find a good buffet and saw the reviews for umiya. It did not disappoint. We Had a great meal! Fast service from both Sean and Ron and good quality for an all you can eat! They're awesome!

twBb-GCTgcptIsehTCuhKw.text: I visit from Los Angeles periodically and have been to sushi places that friends recommended. It was till recently, in the last year, that I've tried umiya sushi. Today marks my second time and it did not disappoint. Although there are many AYCE sushi spots around Las Vegas, Umiya really has the upper hand.  I highly recommend you to try this place if you haven't yet! Umiya is our go to Sushi spot when visiting Las Vegas!

vNUdUUUKpOH59z72w532Kw.text: A place for tasty sushi under the all you can eat option. Most of the sushi that I tried was delicious. There are some rather bland options my girlfriend chose, but the rolls that I got for myself (Spicy Tuna Roll, King of the Sea, Firecracker Roll) were pretty good. I also sampled my girlfriend's Hawaiian Rolls which is definitely interesting, and that's what I'm a fan of: interesting experiences. The staff was eager to take care of us, and our seating area was totally fine. I'll be back to try some more of the non-sushi items.

xpYqEpFRMOKJJSfwAXWGHQ.text: Came here for a birthday dinner... This got so ridiculous that I wondered if they were trying to upset us. First they said we didn't have a reservation. Then they found it and apologized that it was accidentally made at 6am instead of 6pm. Then there was drama about chairs and how we weren't allowed to have as many as we needed? And the whole time the host is being so aggressive and yelling at us... this was my first time here and it will be my last.

enC4QLVCgpof1Zx5DWIM0Q.text: I tried Umiya during my recent visit to Vegas since it was close to my hotel. The restaurant is about a mile off the strip, across the street from Palms Place.  Upon entering, the sushi chefs shout out 'Hello' and 'Welcome' greetings in Korean. In the background, there are TVs with PSY music videos playing on repeat (Gangnam style and Gentleman). Kind of strange to be in a Korean environment while eating Japanese sushi, but if you focus on the food, the awkwardness can be filtered out.  Umiya carries a similar menu to other Vegas AYCE sushi restaurants. For example, tuna, albacore, super white tuna, salmon, yellowtail, halibut, red snapper, shrimp, eel, mackerel, etc are on the sushi list. However, Umiya distinguishes itself from the pack by offering premium sushi. There are 3 daily specials of high quality fish. During my visit, they were spanish mackerel, giant clam, and striped bass. Sometimes, the specials may include sea bream and giant scallop. These varieties are rarely found in common AYCE sushi lists. On top of that, there were oysters, uni, and ama-ebi. All of the premium and special items have a limit of 1 order, but it was not really enforced since order forms and records were not used.   The oysters, uni, spanish mackerel, and halibut were my favorites. The quality and freshness of the fish were invariably excellent. Fish were cut thick, characteristic of the Korean preference. Unfortunately, the presentation was sometimes poor. Sauces were overapplied to the fish at times, resulting in sauce overflowing onto the plate and rice. A carefully-crafted piece of nigiri should not have ponzu or soy sauce staining the rice before it reaches the consumer. This is a common occurrence in Korean sushi restaurants.  Organization was another issue that I encountered. Umiya did not utilize order forms at the bar. Each customer is expected to order in front of a chef. Unfortunately, the chefs could not handle large orders. I tried making 10 orders at once but he was overwhelmed and could only remember 4 to 6 at a time. When the restaurant filled up halfway during our meal, I was neglected for over 30 minutes in favor of the new diners. An order form might be useful for Umiya to implement in the future.  Aside from the aforementioned issues, Umiya is still phenomenal for the price. $25 for unlimited decent seafood with premium options is an exceptional deal. This is perfect for those who are hungry, seeking a budget sushi restaurant in Vegas, and can sacrifice a little bit of quality. I am already anticipating a visit to Umiya during my next visit to Vegas.

gRD2EmbB4ghYuvXi7FNYmg.text: This place is amazing. I've been here at least 10 times. Always have great service and AMAZING FOOD. Out of the 15 or so places I've been in Vegas. This place has the best Sushi! I recommend the Orange Blossom, Salmon Killer, the seared Tuna in AJ sauce, and the salmon belly.

9n7Qtnb3eBcNRJqUpyNU9w.text: I am very impressed with the quality and selections for the ALL You can eat menu.  So far for the Law Vegas area, this is by far the best.  The service is fantastic...     Advice:  They will not sit your party unless everyone is present and I don't blame them....

Zcqjw_pwZcEoCITNdsHI8Q.text: Loved the Ono and yellowtail. Reasonably priced for the quality. Friendly and efficient staff. Recommended!

FoH0XhmtqLUwzMBxtRV0ww.text: Wow the all-you-can-eat is unreal. The chef would give us half rolls and we were able to try a lot of different kinds. And we just let the chef choose which ones to give us and we were happy with all of them and eight to tell our bellies were full full full.   It was fun sitting at the bar and when we got the best chef I think.  They are super fast and very good at staying on top of your beverages and clearing away your plates.   I think we're going to come back tomorrow.

photos.caption: Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eating up to the bar!

u-yLMSTSFNpdJ0yswIgUAQ.text: 2 stars for the simple fact that I have eaten here a couple times and the sushi is always really good, however when i ordered takeout that was not the case as the sushi got me sick. I've experienced better and won't be back for a while. disappointed.

AJnk1HmUKkMe1LH-ZZpmmA.text: During our Strip stay-cation, we were on the hunt for sushi, but didn't want our eardrums blown at the same time (ahem, RA). We decided on Umiya since it was close to our hotel and very reasonably priced for AYCE.  We got there at 6 pm and the restaurant was nearly empty. The space itself is really pretty and open. We got drinks and our first orders in within a couple of minutes of being seated. Our rolls came super quickly, which continued throughout our meal, despite the restaurant getting much busier. Those familiar with AYCE know how important superfast ordering and delivery are!  The food was completely decent. The rolls themselves are on the small side, but very light on rice. I really liked the size, since each one takes up less belly real estate, so you can try more tasty things! The fish quality is average, depending on the roll (the salmon and ahi were great; the super white tuna was meh). As with a lot of sushi places with huge menus, the sauces on the rolls can be their downfall. There are many that come with spicy mayo, but they're easily avoided.   The AYCE menu is enormous. There are lots of fresh, fried and baked rolls, plus nigiri, various non-fish items and dessert. It's $27 per person for dinner, with a HUGE 90 minute time limit. Umiya is definitely our new go-to on this side of town!

JlrD7SK4swcVt5QVMafoZQ.text: This is the first review I've ever written, my gf and I wanted to try something different than the usual sushi place we go eat and we just left from this place and it was a huge disappointment. Nigiri was more rice than fish, worst Japanese lasagna I've ever had they over added cream cheese and who knows what else. The service was HORRIBLE the whole time we were there my gf and I shared one napkin, we had to ask the busser twice to get someone to take our order and still did not show up until 10min later. The girl serving table 18 was rude and brought us the wrong order several times. Never going there again and I recommend you don't either.

Uo5amz9LczJ6BZvsiSkR5A.text: Best sushi i ever had, this place really set the bar for my future sushi endavours! They use some really good ingredients, including lobsters, scallops, and oyster. Everything was sooo tasty, ice cream is also included with the buffet, its a must try. Get the volanic roll as well, its awesome.

03jwOw3YmAb88cmwpaztGA.text: My old AYCE sushi house fave was Sushi Mon, but they have gone downhill since 2005.  I was referred here by my lawyer friend, and we all know about our lawyer friends..they eat well.  He basically said it was comparable to Kabuto, but less expensive. Boy, was he right. The AYCE selection is better than any other place in town and the dinner was $26.95 a person. The service was happy, and not snooty or too busy, even when it was. The seating was a bit more BBQ house type, but in all honesty, this did not matter to me. The sushi was fresh, the oysters were soooo good. It made me rethink Shuck's oysters and their quality.  The bill was not split correctly, so double check as you should anywhere else, and head to this sushi house. The orange blossom and other rolls are good to try, but the nigiri is so good. Especially for being in the desert. Reason for the 4 stars? We had to remind them 3 times about our oysters and uni. Sorry Umiya!

2g7IF9c8OwvuuuJCTzXPdA.text: A great sushi spot with reasonable price, you can't beat all-you-can-eat for $21....the food came fast and servers were nice and friendly :)

izRON4AKsi0ZdRQEMDwmYg.text: We did the All You Can Eat, which was a super good deal for dinner! They had options like uni, soft shell crab, sweet shrimp, hamachi (it was out), and was all super fresh! Very fast service and a great place to hang out with a group of friends!

bYVKanhN76jK1G5nvoU1hA.text: Favorite place to go with out coworkers after work, servers are fun and fast with our order. Have a great time and great food.

h1b6TS2JlFSJZZNsNOtbyQ.text: We stumbled upon this location tucked in a shopping plaza off of Flamingo and Arville, across from Palms Hotel and Casino.   Is there anything better than taking a chance on a restaurant and finding a hidden gem that could become an absolutely favorite?!?!  By far one of the largest AYCE menu selections. Although some of the selections are a 1x order only it's an absolute must try!   The staff was friendly and attentive. When my gf and I ordered the food came out rather quickly. The seafood salad was absolutely yummy!  The decor is beautifully understated. Long tables with wooden benches. Not the average sushi spot with tables. Great place for groups!   $25.99 for an AYCE. After dinner for two and two drinks we walked out completely stuffed with sushi and mochi ice cream about an hour and a half later bringing our total to $62.59.

hzmlHNGoMDspmOTwSKh0cw.text: We stumbled across this GEM last night!I am usually do not like to step out of my comfort zone to try new sushi places but I am so glad I did.  My boyfriend and I  certainly walked into quite a gem!    The wait staff warmly greeted us, great customer service!  We ordered 28 different items from the AYCE menu and EVERYTHING was absolutely quality, great tasting, and fresh, fresh, fresh!  Wow!!!!!!  We savored every bite!  The wide selection from the AYCE menu was amazing.  What a great variety.    Great atmosphere, staff, food, experience!!!! THANK YOU UMIYA!  Definitely,  our new hot spot when we come to town.

HZ5ZwUFf3_QSGavCGpZ5Zw.text: It was little hard to find this place we were at the right parking lot but we couldn't see the sign(Actually there's no sign yet only little banner saying UMIYA all you can eat sushi coming soon) so we used my navigation on my smartphone. But we ended up at the same parking lot as first time??? This time we paid more attention, UMIYA is right next door of Starbucks. It looks small from outside but inside is very modern and upscale looking. I was very surprised by the quality of foods for AYCE sushi place. Food was fantastic, me and my husband was so busy to eat to take any pictures. When we realized we were only able to take two pictures. We really liked everything we ordered. Orange blossom roll, The bacon wrapped scallop skewer, Marinated Pork Belly, Baby Octopus skewer, Fresh Oyster, Crunch lobster Roll( plenty of real lobster)....I can't remember any more but all was so good.  I highly recommend this place to anyone love sushi but don't eat AYCE sushi because the poor quality of food @most of AYCE sushi places.  UMIYA is Only High Quality AYCE sushi place in Las Vegas.  I can't wait for next time.

Photo of Umiya Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunch Lobster roll with Plenty of Real Lobster.

ZlqC3tI2_9oQRg7xenjssw.text: I'm too lazy to write this review, so I'm gonna ask my wife what she thinks. She said, "I'd give it a 3. It's toooo mayonnaiseEEE!  It's a little too expensive. It's aiiiiight."

olHEKKdtfv0CgUTMzneDIw.text: The food was good but service was terrible. Not once did they check on my table, the servers did refill our drinks but, they didn't even ask if we wanted a refill. Our server was rude and uninformative. When I was done and ready to leave I had to ask for the check three times. Then instead of having one charge for left overs they charged every single roll that had left overs.  I waited at lest 20 minutes just for my check. Everything was very slow and the atmosphere wasn't enjoyable.

QyykVcP7jnIlOgVlHEQ_MA.text: I've never been much of a sushi eater, but my brother loves it, and the last couple times he's been in Vegas we've gone here for lunch. I prefer the cooked tempura, and he prefers the raw stuff. During our last visit I had the lobster crunch roll, the Lisa Lisa, and something that I think was called an Orange Crush. (It was with salmon, I think). All three were good, especially the lobster roll. It was topped with a cream sauce that was irresistible, and my brother was equally impressed with his choices. (I can't remember what they were, but I know one was topped with raw tuna.) Both times we've come here the service has been excellent, and the atmosphere nice. (They play a music video channel on their big screen TV, and it's piped through the restaurant's sound system. It's loud but not loud enough that you can't have a nice quiet conversation at your table.)

qbdaEMIbgx-0TnwZ5r6J-g.text: All you can eat is the best deal in Vegas. For $26, you get your own menu and pick whatever you want. Lots of people working so the waitress was very attentive and the orders came in fast. All you can eat is not a buffet but instead you order as you wish a couple of things at a time, even 1/2 rolls if you want to try lots of stuff. Awesome. Would come back again.

xzzjUarO4TlzVlpnEEPgPA.text: This place use to be KAIZEN... changed owners and one of the chefs from kaizen took over. He goes by AJ. this is my first time trying AYCE sushi at this place, i usually dont like AYCE, but this place was outstanding! the quality of the fish and presentation was EXCEPTIONAL compared to most AYCE sushi..  i ordered almost everything on the AYCE menu. LOL jk. just about tho.. my favorite rolls were the SALMON KILLER, SNOW WHITE,  and u must try the seared ahi tuna with AJ special sauce... that was bomb!  there wasnt one thing that i ordered that wasnt good.... i give this place an A+!! so far... AYCE restaurants usually start off REALLY good then they start to get cheap on you... so i hope this place stays good and doesnt crash..

nc2XRf23PMdjifzU66nlpA.text: I have gone to almost all sushi spots. When it comes to a la carts and also AYCE sushi. This is by far my favorite. From the taste, presentation and overall service of the food. Amazing! Always come here, and I recommend the lobster roll. I love the speedy service, the friendliness and attentiveness of the staff. The sushi is even better! Come here when your in Vegas for the best sushi in town.

FK95JOp5-vfVXdzekoeOuA.text: Wow. Had AYCE lunch today with 3 friends. We ordered a lot of food. Hard to beat this bargain. I enjoyed every single item. Delightfully delicious. Nigiri was very good quality, melt in your mouth. Service was spot-on. We were ordering like a machine gun and they didn't miss a beat. This place is a must. Incredible variety. I cannot see how anyone who enjoys Sushi would be disappointed here.

TfhS46hvVoXxFQBfAPvv7Q.text: Sushi is really good here but the reason for 2 stars is because I had to wait almost 20 min to take my order then another 20 min for my food not to mention almost half an hour for ice cream really? I really wanted to give them 2 stars but gave them 3  because my gf felt bad  I understand they were busy but super slow .....waiter hardly checked on us as well and they kept forgeting our order

ss0MkfcLYpfDi8c1TGljOA.text: Love the place. Salmon lover roll is soooooo good here - a must try. The service is good too - fast and welcoming. We get there at least once in 2 weeks and never disappointed.

k5CXVrOKMl4hHHfnSYQDZA.text: Great late night all u can eat! Loved the garlic tuna. Also the seaweed salad. Finished it off with a banana split.
